Policy: Ley Nº 1.306 – Ley de trashumancia.
Policy_Content: El objeto de la presente Ley es garantizar el derecho de las familias trashumantes de la Provincia del Neuquén a transitar con su ganado por las huellas de arreo, para trasladarse de las zonas de invernada a las de veranada y viceversa, en trashumancia, conservando el ambiente y respetando el patrimonio natural y cultural de la zona. La Ley introduce normas para establecer los criterios de creación, delimitación, modificación, gestión y protección administrativa de las huellas de arreo, y además define el ejercicio de los usos compatibles y complementarios a las huellas de arreo, articulando derechos y obligaciones de los usufructuarios. La Ley crea la Comisión de Huellas de Arreo (CHA), que será responsable, entre otros aspectos, de: proponer, a la autoridad de aplicación, programas, proyectos o normativas relacionadas con las familias trashumantes y las huellas de arreo; colaborar con la autoridad de aplicación en la elaboración y difusión de campañas de promoción de las actividades de trashumancia; asesorar a los distintos organismos vinculados con la seguridad vial, en materia de señalización y operativos; intervenir en las modificaciones de las huellas de arreo. Los artículos 28-33 establecen el régimen sancionatorio.
Subject: Livestock, Land & soil
Keyword: Pastoralism,Land tenure,Servitude,Traditional rights/customary rights,Right of use,Grazing,Institution,Offences/penalties,Smallholders/peasants,Family farming,Cultural heritage
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Ordonnance concernant Suisse Tourisme
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance concerne Suisse Tourisme. Plus précisément, elle prévoit que Suisse Tourisme adapte son activité aux besoins du marché. Il collabore étroitement avec les organismes touristiques indigènes et les autres milieux intéressés à la promotion de l’image de marque de la Suisse. Il définit les exigences relatives aux campagnes communes et veille à ce que les fonds nécessaires à l’encouragement de la demande soient réunis. Il peut créer des entreprises ou participer à des entreprises, dans la mesure où cela est nécessaire pour remplir son mandat légal. Le Secrétariat d’Etat à l’économie (SECO) exerce la surveillance de Suisse Tourisme.
Subject: Wild species & ecosystems, General
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Forest Law Enforcement, Governance and Trade (Amendment) Regulations 2016 (S.I. No. 940 of 2016).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Forest Law Enforcement, Governance and Trade Regulations 2012 (S.I. 2012/178) in regulation 5A (Fee for the verification of a FLEGT licence)so as to reduce the fee that is payable to the Secretary of State on an application for verification of a FLEGT licence. Also regulation 13 (Review) is amended so as to extend the deadline by which the Secretary of State is required to publish the first report under that regulation.

Policy: Decreto Nº 270 - Reglamenta el manejo ambiental de forma integral de las granjas porcinas.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto reglamenta el manejo ambiental de forma integral de las granjas porcinas, con el objetivo de regular las granjas porcinas en cuanto a su constitución, el ejercicio de la actividad, adecuación y cese de funciones, atendiendo las disposiciones legales de salud animal, humana y ambiental. Las personas naturales y jurídicas que en el territorio nacional operen o deseen operar granjas porcinas dedicadas a la tenencia, reproducción, crianza, cuidado, desarrollo, engorde de cerdos y comercialización, así como al aprovechamiento de sus subproductos, deberán cumplir con las normas contenidas en el presente reglamento.

Policy_Content: Les présentent instructions déterminent les modalités de conservation et de protection de l'hygiène dans la Ville de Kigali. En particulier, ces instructions visent à promouvoir l'hygiène et l'assainissement dans la Ville de Kigali; mettre en place des principes fondamentaux relatifs à la protection de l'hygiène dans toutes les manières; promouvoir le bien-être social de la population de la Ville de Kigali en tenant compte de la promotion de l'hygiène et de la prévention des maladies causées par une mauvaise hygiène; et sensibiliser les résidents de la Ville de Kigali sur le développement durable basé sur l’hygiène.

Policy: Resolución Nº 1.514 - Términos de referencia para la inclusión de nuevas fuentes de materiales en los proyectos de infraestructura de transporte que cuenten con licencia ambiental.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución adopta los Términos de Referencia para la inclusión de nuevas fuentes de materiales en los proyectos de infraestructura de transporte que cuenten con licencia ambiental. Los términos de referencia que se adoptan son aplicables a las autoridades ambientales y a los particulares dentro del trámite de modificación de licencia ambiental, con el fin exclusivo de incluir nuevas fuentes de materiales. El interesado en modificar la Licencia Ambiental, deberá verificar que no queden excluidos de la evaluación aspectos que puedan afectar y/o producir deterioro grave a los recursos naturales renovables o al ambiente o introducir modificaciones considerables o notorias al paisaje.

Policy: Décret n° 2016-879/ PRES/PM/MATDSI/MINEFID/MAECBE du 14 septembre 2016 portant création, attributions, organisation et fonctionnement de la Commission Nationale de la Coopération Décentralisée (CONACOD).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée une Commission Nationale de la Coopération Décentralisée (CONACOD) et fixe ses attributions, son organisation et son fonctionnement.  La CONACOD a pour mission de promouvoir la coopération décentralisée. A ce titre, elle est chargée de susciter et encourager la concertation entre les différents acteurs de la coopération décentralisée; formuler des recommandations pour une meilleure coordination des interventions des différents acteurs de la coopération décentralisée; proposer des domaines prioritaires d’intervention aux acteurs de la coopération décentralisée; promouvoir une meilleure couverture spatiale des partenariats; contribuer à l’élaboration et à la mise en œuvre de la politique nationale de la coopération décentralisée. La Commission Nationale de la Coopération Décentralisée comprend: une Assemblée Générale; et un Secrétariat Technique.

Policy: Decreto Nº 40077-MEIC-H-MICITT ─ Modifica el Decreto Nº 37662-MEIC-H-MICIT, Procedimiento para la demostración de la evaluación de la conformidad de los reglamentos técnicos.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto modifica los procedimientos para la demostración de la evaluación de la conformidad que deben utilizarse en los Reglamentos Técnicos Nacionales, en relación a los productos exentos del procedimiento para la demostración de conformidad. Policy: Ley Nº 27.275 - Ley de Acceso a la Información Pública.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley de Acceso a la Información Pública tiene por objeto garantizar el efectivo ejercicio del derecho de acceso a la información pública, promover la participación ciudadana y la transparencia de la gestión pública. El derecho de acceso a la información pública comprende la posibilidad de buscar, acceder, solicitar, recibir, copiar, analizar, reprocesar, reutilizar y redistribuir libremente la información bajo custodia de los sujetos obligados enumerados en la presente Ley, con las únicas limitaciones y excepciones que establece esta norma. Se presume pública toda información que generen, obtengan, transformen, controlen o custodien los sujetos obligados alcanzados por esta Ley.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Land Use and Spatial Planning Act, 2016 (No. 925 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act provides with respect to spatial and land use planning at national, regional and district level in Ghana. It established the Land Use and Spatial Planning Authority and the Land Use and Spatial Planning Development Fund. The objects of the Authority are to (a) provide for sustainable development of land and human settlements through a decentralised planning system; (b) ensure judicious use of land; and (c) enhance the attainment of Ghana’s decentralisation programme and in particular create an enabling environment for District Assemblies to better perform the spatial planning and human settlements management functions. For the purpose of achieving its objects the Authority shall, in support of the National Development Planning Commission, perform the spatial, land use and human settlements planning functions of the national development planning system established under the National Development Planning Commission Act, 1994 (Act 479) and the National Development Planning (System) Act, 1994 (Act 480). It shall also, among other things, ensure the control of physical development in uncontrolled or less controlled but sensitive areas such as forest reserves, nature reserves, wildlife sanctuaries, green belts, coastal wetlands, water bodies, water catchment areas, mining areas, open spaces and public parks.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil, Water, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Natural Resources (Classes of Transactions Subject to Ratification) Act, 2016 (No. 41 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act concerns classification of transactions regarding natural resources so as to make their granting subject to ratification by Parliament in accordance with Article 71 of the Constitution. Classes are set out in the Schedule to this Act and include, amongst others, the extraction of underground steam within a water conservation or other water resource protected area, the extraction of sea water within the territorial sea for private commercial use, excision or change of boundaries of gazetted national park or wildlife protection area, long term concession of a gazetted forest resource, excision or change of boundaries of gazetted public forests of nature reserves.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 363-pp validating the Regulation on state nature landscape reserve of regional significance “Mudyugansky”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes that state nature landscape reserve of regional significance “Mudyugansky” is constituted with a view of conservation of natural features and historical monuments of Mudyug island, protection of rare and precious bird species in the areas of their nesting and maintenance of the general ecological balance. Owners and tenants of land plots located within the boundaries of the reserve are obliged to observe the special protection regime established in the nature reserve. On the territory of nature reserve shall be prohibited any activity contrasting the scope of nature reserve or damaging natural complexes and components, including: (a) felling of forest species (except for felling for forest fire extinguishment, sanitary felling and felling related to the construction, reconstruction and operation of transportation, communications and utilities lines); (b) capture of wild fauna species that are not subject to hunting; (c) hunting, except for the purpose of regulation of the number of game; (d) destruction of nesting grounds and mating grounds of wild fauna species; collection of eggs; (e) application of chemicals, mineral fertilizers, plant protection means and nutrients; (f) entry, exit and parking of motor vehicles, except for service vehicles; (g) waste disposal; (h) exploration of subsoil and mining; (i) organization of tourist camps and making fires outside specially equipped areas; and (j) destruction or damaging warning signs and information boards.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Cultural heritage,Protection of habitats,Wild fauna,Wild flora,Birds,Endangered species,Protection of species

Policy: Regional Decree No. 357-pp validating the Regulation on state nature biological reserve of regional significance “Luchsky”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes that state nature reserve of regional significance "Luchsky" shall be constituted with a view of conservation, reproduction and restoration of number of waterfowl game, natural habitats thereof and maintenance of general ecological balance. Owners and tenants of land plots located within the boundaries of the reserve are obliged to observe the special protection regime established in the nature reserve. On the territory of nature reserve shall be prohibited any activity contrasting the scope of nature reserve or damaging natural complexes and components, including: (a) entry, exit and parking of motor vehicles, except for service vehicles; (b) felling of forest species (except for felling for forest fire extinguishment, sanitary felling and felling related to the construction, reconstruction and operation of transportation, communications and utilities lines); (c) hunting, except for the purpose of regulation of the number of game; (d) capture and hunting of wild fauna species that are not subject to hunting; (e) destruction and damaging mating and nesting grounds of wild fauna species, collection of eggs; (e) application of chemicals, mineral fertilizers, plant protection means and nutrients; (f) release of alien species; (g) waste disposal; (h) ploughing up of the territory; (i) grazing of cattle; (j) stay with unleashed dogs of all breeds; and (k) destruction or damaging warning signs and information boards.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 359-pp validating the Regulation on state nature biological reserve of regional significance “Klonovsky”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes that state nature reserve of regional significance "Klonovsky" shall be constituted with a view of conservation and reproduction of valuable wild fauna species from economic, scientific and cultural point of view. Owners and tenants of land plots located within the boundaries of the reserve are obliged to observe the special protection regime established in the nature reserve. The following activities shall be prohibited on the whole territory of the protected area: a) felling of forest species (except for felling for forest fire extinguishment, sanitary felling and felling related to the construction, reconstruction and operation of transportation, communications and utilities lines); (b) entry, exit and parking of motor vehicles, except for service vehicles; (c) hunting, except for the purpose of regulation of the number of game; (d) capture and hunting of wild fauna species that are not subject to hunting; (e) destruction and damaging mating and nesting grounds of wild fauna species, collection of eggs; (f) navigation in motor boats, except for service and life-saving motor boats; (g) organization of tourist camps and making fires outside specially equipped areas; (h) application of chemicals, mineral fertilizers, plant protection means and nutrients; (i) release of alien species; (j) waste disposal; (k) destruction or damaging warning signs and information boards; (l) exploration of subsoil and mining; (m) construction of buildings, facilities, roads and pipelines, power lines and other communications, with the exception of facilities ensuring operation of the reserve; and (n) stay with unleashed dogs of all breeds.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 358-pp validating the Regulation on state nature landscape reserve of regional significance “Lensky”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes that state nature landscape reserve of regional significance “Lensky” is constituted with a view of conservation and restoration of natural landscape and components thereof, and maintenance of the general ecological balance. Owners and tenants of land plots located within the boundaries of the reserve are obliged to observe the special protection regime established in the nature reserve. On the territory of nature reserve shall be prohibited any activity contrasting the scope of nature reserve or damaging natural complexes and components, including: (a) entry, exit and parking of motor vehicles, except for service vehicles; (b) felling of forest species (except for felling for forest fire extinguishment, sanitary felling and felling related to the construction, reconstruction and operation of transportation, communications and utilities lines); (c) destruction and damaging mating and nesting grounds of wild fauna species, collection of eggs; (d) construction of buildings, facilities, roads and pipelines, power lines and other communications, with the exception of facilities ensuring operation of the reserve; (e) waste disposal; (f) exploration of subsoil and mining; and (g) destruction or damaging warning signs and information boards.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems

Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes that state nature reserve of regional significance "Permilovsky" shall be constituted with a view of conservation of potable groundwater of Permilovsky deposit and adjacent territory thus ensuring optimal hydrological balance. . Owners and tenants of land plots located within the boundaries of the reserve are obliged to observe the special protection regime established in the nature reserve. On the territory of nature reserve shall be prohibited any activity contrasting the scope of nature reserve or damaging natural complexes and components, including: (a) clear felling except for felling for forest fire extinguishment, sanitary felling and felling related to the construction, reconstruction and operation of transportation, communications and utilities lines); (b) waste disposal, including drainage water discharge; (c) application of chemicals, mineral fertilizers, plant protection means and nutrients; (d) drainage and land reclamation; (e) organization of tourist camps and making fires outside specially equipped areas; and (f) destruction or damaging warning signs and information boards.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 360-pp validating the Regulation on state nature biological reserve of regional significance “Plesetsky”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes that state nature reserve of regional significance "Plesetsky" shall be constituted with a view of conservation and reproduction of valuable wild fauna species from economic and scientific point of view, natural habitats thereof, rare and endangered wild fauna species, and maintenance biological reserve and resting ground for wild fauna species. Owners and tenants of land plots located within the boundaries of the reserve are obliged to observe the special protection regime established in the nature reserve. The following activities shall be prohibited on the whole territory of the protected area: (a) felling of forest species (except for felling for forest fire extinguishment, sanitary felling and felling related to the construction, reconstruction and operation of transportation, communications and utilities lines); (b) entry, exit and parking of motor vehicles, except for service vehicles; (c) hunting, except for the purpose of regulation of the number of game; (d) capture and hunting of wild fauna species that are not subject to hunting; (e) destruction and damaging mating and nesting grounds of wild fauna species, collection of eggs;  (f) organization of tourist camps and making fires outside specially equipped areas; (g) waste disposal; (h) release of alien species; (i) waste disposal; (j) destruction or damaging warning signs and information boards; and (k) stay with unleashed dogs of all breeds.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 362-pp validating the Regulation on state nature landscape reserve of regional significance “Primorsky”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes that state nature landscape reserve of regional significance “Primorsky” is constituted with a view of conservation and restoration of particularly valuable or typical natural landscapes, maintaining biological diversity, organization of protection, reproduction and regulation of the number of wild fauna species, ensuring the right of the local population to a favorable environment and traditional types of fishing, restoration and maintaining climate control properties of the protective forest belt of tundra forests, protection of geological and paleontological heritage of the Winter Coast of the White Sea, and keeping general ecological balance of the protected area. On the territory of reserve flow the rivers that are the spawning grounds of Atlantic salmon, the rivers Kuya, Big Torozhma, Zimnyaya Zolotitsa with stream tributaries Letnyaya, Tova. Owners and tenants of land plots located within the boundaries of the reserve are obliged to observe the special protection regime established in the nature reserve. The following activities shall be prohibited: (a) felling of forest species (except for felling for forest fire extinguishment, sanitary felling and selective felling up to 25 percent of stand in 30 years); (b) land reclamation and swamp drying; (c) application of chemicals, mineral fertilizers, plant protection and nutrients; (d) entry, exit and parking of motor vehicles, except for service vehicles; (e) navigation on small-size vessels on the rivers that are spawning grounds for salmon in the period from June 1 to June 30 and from August 10 to November 1 except for service vessels and motorless small boats of local residents; (f) release of alien species; (g) use of GMO; (h) burning of vegetation; (i) ploughing up of the territory; (j) grazing of cattle; (k) collection and removal of fossil remains of ancient fauna, except for authorized cases; (l) waste disposal; (m) organization of tourist camps and making fires outside specially equipped areas; and (n) destruction or damaging warning signs and information boards.
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Protection of habitats,Biodiversity,Fishery management and conservation,Diadromous fish,Wild fauna

Policy: Water Act, 2016 (No. 43 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the regulation, management and development of water resources and water and sewerage services in line with the Constitution. Authorities shall, in administering or applying this Act, be guided by the principles and values set out in Articles 10,43. 60 and 232 of the Constitution. it establishes the Water Resources Authority ("Authority"), the National Water Harvesting and Storage Authority, the  Water Services Regulatory Board, the Water Sector Trust Fund and the Water Tribunal. This Act shall apply to Community land but any powers and functions conferred or imposed under this Act affecting land shall, in respect of community land, be exercised and performed subject to any written law relating to that land. The provisions of the Environmental Management and Coordination Act, 1999 relating to water resources conservation and protection and water pollution control shall be exercised subject to the relevant provision of this Act and only in the event that the Board has failed or neglected to take appropriate action to exercise its powers and functions under this Act.
Subject: Environment gen., Water

Policy: Law amending Law No. 208-III “On hydrocarbons”.
Policy_Content: Article 1 shall be amended to add the following wording: “Corporate group is a legal entity, which in accordance with this Law and the acts of the President of Turkmenistan is empowered to manage and use hydrocarbon resources (State Corporate Groups "Turkmenneft" and "Turkmengaz"). Article 6 shall be amended to add the following wording: “Production sharing agreement, concession agreement on royalty and tax terms and risk service contract shall be concluded between the Corporate Group and Contractor. In this case, the company may also act as a Contractor, which is a legal entity of the Group, or another national company. A Group company or other company that is a legal entity of the Group, or other national company may participate in the Joint Operation Agreement as a contractor."

Policy: Stratégie Nationale de Gestion des Risques et des Catastrophes 2016-2030.
Policy_Content: La Stratégie Nationale de Gestion des Risques et des Catastrophes (SNGRC) est un instrument stratégique à portée nationale, applicable pendant la période 2016-2030, qui a pour vision une nation résiliente aux chocs, protégée de tous dégâts, dans sa dimension sociale, culturelle, économique et environnementale pour un développement durable. L’objectif global du document consiste à ériger la gestion des risques et des catastrophes comme un pilier de développement durable.

Policy: Política para la gestión sostenible del suelo.
Policy_Content: El presente instrumento tiene por objeto promover la gestión sostenible del suelo en Colombia, en un contexto integral en el que confluyan la conservación de la biodiversidad, el agua y el aire, el ordenamiento del territorio y la gestión de riesgo, contribuyendo al desarrollo sostenible y al bienestar de los colombianos. Se establecen los siguientes objetivos específicos: a) generar acciones de preservación, restauración y uso sostenible del suelo, con el fin de mantener en el tiempo sus funciones y la capacidad de sustento de los ecosistemas; b) fortalecer la institucionalidad y la articulación interinstitucional e intersectorial para la toma de decisiones relacionadas con la gestión sostenible del suelo; c) fortalecer los instrumentos de planificación ambiental y sectorial para la gestión sostenible del suelo; d) promover la investigación, innovación y transferencia de tecnología para el conocimiento de los suelos, su preservación, restauración, uso y manejo sostenible; e) fortalecer políticas, normas e instrumentos relacionados con la gestión sostenible del suelo; f) impulsar procesos de educación, capacitación y divulgación que fortalezcan la participación social y la gestión ambiental para la conservación y uso sostenible del suelo; g) adelantar procesos de monitoreo y seguimiento a la calidad de los suelos que faciliten la toma de decisiones para su gestión sostenible.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil, Water

Policy: Agri-Environmental Programme ÖPUL 2015 Agriculture, Environment and Nature
Policy_Content: The Agri-environmental Programme (ÖPUL) is Austria's programme for the promotion of an agricultural management system. In the context of the uniform intervention logic applied throughout the European Union to attain the desired targets, ÖPUL 2015 particularly pursues the following strategic priority areas which are specifically addressed by corresponding ÖPUL measures:   – Restoring, preserving and enhancing of biodiversity, also of Natura 2000 sites, and in areas facing natural or other specific constraints, and of high nature value farming, as well as of the state of European landscapes   – Preventing soil erosion and improving soil management   – Improving water management, including fertilizer and pesticide management   – Fostering carbon conservation and sequestration in agriculturally used soils by implementing humus-promoting management practices   – Reducing greenhouse gas and ammonia emissions from agriculture and fostering carbon  conservation and sequestration as well as humus preservation   – Promoting quality regulations taking into account animal welfare standards and promotion of pasture grazing and straw bedding   – Fostering innovation, cooperation, and the development of the knowledge base in rural areas   – Agricultural training and raising farmers' awareness of the potential and added value of the ÖPUL measures and, in particular, of environmentally sound systems of land management that use natural resources sparingly   – Fostering competitiveness by specifically promoting environmentally friendly production methods and management systems adapted to climate change.  The programme mentions using natural resources sparingly to help ensure long term food security based on high quality foods. Further, sound environmental land management is described as a key objective. Rural support programs are introduced as benefitting agricultural and forestry holdings, processing and marketing operations, as well as other players involved in regional development. Priority is also given to supporting resource efficiency and the shift towards a low-carbon and climate resilient economy in agriculture, food and forestry sectors.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Forestry, Land & soil

Policy: Politique Nationale de Sécurité Alimentaire et Nutritionnelle (PolNSAN).
Policy_Content: Ce document a pour objet la Première Partie de la Politique Nationale de Sécurité Alimentaire et Nutritionnelle (PolNSAN). Cette Partie concerne l’analyse diagnostique de la situation alimentaire et nutritionnelle au Mali, tout en tenant compte du caractère multidimensionnel et multisectoriel de la sécurité alimentaire et nutritionnelle. Le document donne suite à une recommandation du Conseil National de la Sécurité Alimentaire (CNSA) et des conclusions de l’audit institutionnel et financier du Dispositif National de Sécurité Alimentaire, qui, toutes deux, plaident pour la nécessité de doter le Mali d’une Politique Nationale de Sécurité Alimentaire nutritionnelle, de résilience et de protection sociale, afin d’assurer l’accès à toutes et à tous, à tout moment, aux aliments nécessaires pour mener une vie saine et active.

Policy: Malawi National Irrigation Policy.
Policy_Content: Malawi National Irrigation Policy is a cross-sectoral policy designed to contribute to sustainable national economic growth and development through enhanced irrigated agriculture production and productivity. The expected policy outcomes are: Increased irrigated agriculture production and productivity for local and export use using irrigation technologies that take into account climate change; Improved national and household incomes, food and nutritional security;  Improved irrigation service delivery; Increased employment opportunities; and Enhanced land and water productivity through sustainable land tenure arrangements, catchment management and water harvesting.

Policy: Intended Nationally Determined Contribution of Democratic People’s Republic of Korea.
Policy_Content: This Intended Nationally Determined Contribution (INDC) of Democratic People’s Republic of Korea  was developed in accordance with relevant decisions of the Conference of the Parties to  the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change.  DPR Korea’s INDC includes a mitigation and an adaptation component.   With domestic resources, DPR Korea’s emissions will be reduced by 8.0% by 2030 compared to the Business as Usual scenario (BAU). The sectors covered include: Energy; Industrial Processes and Product Use (IPPU); Agriculture, Forestry and Other Land Use (AFOLU); Waste. Moreover, DPR Korea will seek to   adapt to climate change by enhancing  institutional arrangement, financing, capacity building and technology transfer by 2030.

Policy: Nationally Determined Contributions, September 2016.
Policy_Content: The Ministry of Mahaweli Development and Environment in Sri Lanka as the National Focal Point to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) is pleased to submit its Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs) in accordance with Decision 1/CP.21 of the 21st session of the Conference of the Parties to the UNFCCC. We are in confident that the NDCs submitted by the Parties to the UNFCCC will support in achieving the set objectives of the Paris Agreement. Sri Lanka believes that a fair and ambitious Agreement is an imperative for countries to reach the long-term temperature and Sustainable Development Goals, and is pleased to take part in the efforts of tackling current and projected climate change challenges by implementing Sri Lanka’s NDCs. The NDCs have been formulated based on previously submitted INDCs following the principle of common but differentiated responsibilities and respective capabilities. The information presented in this submission is based on the data available at the time of preparation of country’s NDCs. Sri Lanka’s NDCs for Food Security comprise of three major areas; agriculture, livestock and fisheries. Climate change will affect these sectors regarding food security, food availability, food accessibility, food utilization and food system stability. This will have impacts on human life in many ways, on human health, livelihood assets, food production and distribution channels as well as changing purchasing power and market flow. Impacts would be both short term and long term. More frequent short term impacts and extreme weather events, and long term impacts caused by changing temperature and precipitation patterns.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Forestry, Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Climate change,Agricultural development,Sustainable development,Sustainable use,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Food security,Cultural heritage,Emissions,Environmental planning,Disasters,Desertification,Risk assessment/management,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Governance,Ecosystem preservation,Biodiversity,Tourism,Forest management/forest conservation,Freshwater resources management,Irrigation
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Indian Ocean, South Asian Seas, Southern Asia

Policy: National Health Strategy 2016‒2020.
Policy_Content: The Mission Statement of the Ministry of Public Health of the Government of the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan is to prevent ill health and achieve significant reductions in mortality in line with the national targets and sustainable development goals and to reduce impoverishment due to catastrophic health expenditure. Also to be responsive to the rights of citizens through improving access and utilization of quality, equitable, affordable health and nutrition services among all communities especially mother and children in rural areas, And through changing attitudes and practices, promoting healthy lifestyles and effectively implementing other public health interventions. All in coordination and collaboration with other stakeholders within the framework of strong leadership, sustained political will and commitment, good governance, and effective and efficient management; in its continuous pursuit to become a ministerial ‘institution of excellence’.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, General
Keyword: Public health,Gender,Human rights,Governance,Rural employment,Nutrition,Food quality control/food safety
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, Southern Asia

Policy: Décret n°2016-242/PRE du 10/09/2016 portant mise en place d'un Conseil de Développement Economique de Djibouti.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée un Conseil de Développement Economique (CDED) chargé de la planification et du suivi de l'exécution des politiques et stratégies de promotion du développement et de la croissance économique en République de Djibouti. Sa mission est de veiller à la cohérence des activités de l'Etat pour la promotion d'une croissance économique durable. A ce titre, il supervise et coordonne l'action des différents ministères et institutions nationales dans la planification et l'exécution des politiques de développement économique favorisant le Développement industriel et commercial et la création d'emplois.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Décret n° 0453/PR/MPERNFM du 09 septembre 2016 portant création et organisation de la Bourse nationale du bois du Gabon.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret la  Bourse Nationale du Bois du Gabon (BNBG) ayant pour missions de: développer un marché de bois gabonais plus attractif et plus compétitif; offrir un espace sécurisé et normalisé de commerce et d'échange de la matière première aux concessionnaires et aux opérateurs économiques; participer à la lutte contre l'exploitation illégale de la ressource; veiller à la traçabilité des produits bois et mettre sur le marché des produits certifiés; définir et réguler la mercuriale des produits bois; promouvoir les essences peu ou pas connues; de promouvoir les produits dérivés issus de la transformation du bois. La BNBG comprend le conseil d'Administration; la Direction Générale; l'Agence Comptable. Les attributions et l'organisation de ces organes sont fixées par les statuts matérialisés par décret pris sur proposition du Ministre assurant la tutelle technique.

Policy: Loi nº 37/2016 du 08/09/2016 déterminant l’organisation, ressort, compétence et fonctionnement du Comité d’Abunzi.
Policy_Content: La présente loi détermine l’organisation, ressort, compétence et fonctionnement du Comité d’Abunzi.  Le Comité d’Abunzi est un organe chargé de régler les différends survenus entre les parties sur la base de la tradition rwandaise. Organe de conciliation qui règle les petits conflits de villages, le comité d’Abunzi est compétent pour connaître d’un litige impliquant une propriété foncière située dans des ressorts différents.

Policy_Content: La présente Loi crée l’ordre de la profession de praticiens en environnement au Rwanda (RAPEP), et détermine son organisation et son fonctionnement. Les attributions de RAPEP sont les suivantes : rassembler les praticiens d’évaluation environnementale; analyser et trouver des solutions à tous les problèmes relatifs à la profession de praticiens d’évaluation environnementale; promouvoir le professionnalisme et la bonne conduite des membres de RAPEP; échanger l'information relative à la profession de praticiens d’évaluation environnementale; et représenter les intérêts des praticiens d’évaluation environnementale et assurer leur plaidoyer au Rwanda et à l’étranger.

Policy: Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2016/1613 providing for exceptional adjustment aid to milk producers and farmers in other livestock sectors.
Policy_Content: This Regulation provides for adjustment aid to milk producers and farmers in other livestock sectors. European Union aid shall be available to Member States to provide exceptional adjustment aid to milk producers or to farmers in the beef and veal, pigmeat and sheepmeat and goatmeat sectors. The measures taken by the Member States shall support milk producers and farmers in other livestock sectors who engage in one or more of the following activities that aim at fostering the economic sustainability of their holdings and that contribute to market stabilization: (a) small-scale farming; (b) the application of extensive production methods; (c) the application of environmental and climate friendly production methods; (d) the implementation of cooperation projects; (e) the implementation of quality schemes or projects aiming at promoting quality and value added; (f) training in financial instruments and risk management tools.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock

Policy: Organic Agriculture Bylaw No.133 of 2016.
Policy_Content: The provisions of this Bylaw, consisting of 25 articles, shall be applicable to a manufactured or non-manufactured organic agricultural product, described on the label card, advertising materials, or commercial documents showing that it is an organic, biological, or ecological product subjected to the standard metrology. The Bylaw deals with: organic plant production (art. 4); raw materials (art.5); preparation and storage (art.6); GMOs (art.7); operator duties (art.8); procedures for obtaining the organic agricultural production certificate (art. 9); import of organic products (art. 10); establishment, duties and powers of the National Committee of Organic Agriculture (art. 12); rules for the transitional period to which organic farming is subject (art. 14); distinction between annuals crops and permanent crops (art. 16); soil fertility and its biological activity (art. 17); adoption of preventive and curative measures to control pests without using chemical compounds (art. 19); conditions to consider wild plants in forests and agricultural areas as an organic product (art.20).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Red Sea  Gulf of Aden, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This bylaw enters into force after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Law on agricultural organic production (Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina)
Policy_Content: This Law prescribes the goals and principles of organic production as regards the territory of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina. This Law further determines general production rules for organic farming production, labelling of organic products, control system in organic production, register of entities in organic production, administrative and inspection supervision, import, export and placing on the market of organic products, violations and other issues of importance for organic production. Organic production is here defined as a way of producing agricultural and other products by using production rules for organic production at all stages of production, processing and distribution in accordance with the provisions of this Law and regulations adopted on its basis thereof.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Food & nutrition, Fisheries, Land & soil, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Ecological production/organic production,Basic legislation,Aquaculture,Ecofriendly products/ecofriendly processes,Sustainable use,Inspection,Offences/penalties,Processing/handling,Fish products,Packaging/labelling,Internal trade,International trade,Food quality control/food safety,GMO,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Animal feed/feedstuffs,Animal production,Planting material/seeds,Plant production
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This text entered into force eight days after the day of its publication in "Official Gazette of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina ", and it will be applied exactly one year later.

Policy: Major Accidents Ordinance.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance implements the Environment Protection Act of 29 May 2008 and transposes the Directive 2012/18/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 4 July 2012 on the control of major-accident hazards involving dangerous substances, amending and subsequently repealing Council Directive 96/82/EC. Article 1 of the Ordinance establishes that this Ordinance is intended to protect humans, animals and the environment from serious damage caused by accidents. In particular, the Ordinance regulates the: a) precaution against accidents; b) management of accidents; c) organization and implementation. The text consists of 36 articles divided into 7 chapters as follows: General provisions (I); Precaution against major accidents (II); Managing major accidents (III); Special provisions for businesses (IV); Organization and implementation (V); Penalties (VI); Transitional and final provisions (VII). Four Annexes are enclosed.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, Western Europe

Policy_Content: This Decree-Law amends and re-publishes Decree-Law No. 37/2014 of 22 July on the special legal regime for the implementation of land cadastre in Sal, Boa Vista, Sao Vicente and Maio islands. Amendments deal with the following issues: concepts, collection of information, contracting of the executing entity, demarcation of buildings, declaration of ownership, presumption, and technical standards, exposure and public consultation, claim of provisional characterization, publicity of the public deed of notary justification and authorization of heirs, to vacant lands without owner, as well as to regulate buildings in situation of inheritance, to the compulsory registration of registered buildings, to the buildings integrated in the deferred cadastre, the Certificate of Property Identification, exemption of fees or reduction of emoluments of acts of registration, deadline, etc.

The tariff is non-refundable and should be deposited at the bank account of the Ministry of Environment. The generated revenues go hundred percent to the state treasury.

Policy: Decree No. 47.042 regulating the State Secretariat for Environment and Sustainable Development (SEMAD).
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 75 articles divided into six Chapters and three Annexes, regulates the State Secretariat for Environment and Sustainable Development (SEMAD). SEMAD aims to formulate, coordinate, implement and supervise public policies for the conservation, preservation and recovery of environmental resources, aiming at sustainable development and improvement of the environmental quality of the State. It is responsible to plan, execute and coordinate environmental management in a participatory and decentralized way, through environmental regularization and other environmental management instruments; coordinate and carry out administrative police power; promote environmental education and production of scientific awareness to improve the formulation and implementation of state policies on the environment and water resources; propose and establish norms related to the conservation, preservation and recovery of environmental resources and the control of activities considered effectively or potentially polluting or capable of causing environmental degradation in cooperation with other organs; guide, assess and decide on processes of environmental licensing and authorization for environmental intervention, except for the powers of the State Environmental Policy Council - COPAM; determine emergency measures; decide, through its regional environmental agencies, on environmental licensing processes for environmental activities according to their potentiality of pollution; etc.
Subject: Environment gen., Water

Policy: Neighbourhood Planning (General) and Development Management Procedure (Amendment) Regulations 2016 (S.I. 873 of 2016).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Neighbourhood Planning (General) Regulations 2012 so as to, among other things: to prescribe circumstances in which a local planning authority must designate all of the area specified in a neighbourhood area application; insert a new Part 8A which provides for cases where a qualifying body requests the Secretary of State to intervene to decide whether to put a proposal for a neighbourhood development order or plan to referendum. These Regulations also amend the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015 to make provision for cases where a neighbourhood forum is notified of a planning application in their area, and for forums to be consulted on local development order proposals and applications for urgent Crown development.

Policy: East African Community Food and Nutrition Security Policy.
Policy_Content: East African Food and Nutrition Security Policy is a regional policy with a cross-sectoral approach. The overall goal of this policy is to achieve food security and adequate nutrition for the people in Kenya, Uganda, Tanzania, Rwanda and Burundi, in order to enhance their health as well as their social and economic well-being.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Food & nutrition, Forestry

Policy: Resolution No. 826 of the Forest Agency validating the Unified system of state forest cadastre.
Policy_Content: Unified system of state forest cadastre was developed on the basis of clause 3, Article 34 of the Forest Code of the Republic of Tajikistan and is a collection of information and documents on the natural, economic and legal regime of forests, their protection category, forest quality characteristics, economic value, location and size of forest areas for sustainable forest management and efficient use of forests. The object of the state forest cadastre is the total state forest fund of the Republic of Tajikistan. The main task of the state forest cadastre shall be the continuous improvement of the technology for developing, systematizing, storing, updating and providing users with reliable and accurate forest cadastral information. The state forest cadastre is maintained by conducting work on aerial survey, space-surveying, topographic-geodesic, cartographic, soil, agrochemical, geobotanical and other surveys, conducting quantitative and qualitative accounting and economic valuation of forests, state registration of rights to forest lands of legal entities and natural persons. The state forest cadastre is intended to provide local self-government, relevant bodies, legal entities and natural persons with information about the forest in order to regulate forest relations, organize rational use, restoration and protection of forests, forest management, and substantiation of payments for forest use and evaluation of economic activities on land of state forest fund. The state forest cadastre is maintained for all forests of the total state forest fund according to a unified system based on forest management materials, and for forests where forest management has not been conducted - based on inventory data, aerotaxation and other forest surveys.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Decision of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress on Ratifying the Paris Agreement on Climate Change.
Policy_Content: The twenty-second meeting of the twelfth session of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress made the decision on ratifying the Paris Agreement which sets out a global action plan to put the world on track to avoid dangerous climate change. The Agreement was signed by the representative of the People's Republic of China on April 22, 2016 in New York. The agreement is due to enter into force in 2020.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Fisheries Management and Development Act, 2016 (No. 35 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act provides with respect to a wide range of matters concerning the fisheries sector including fisheries management and conservation, aquaculture and fish processing and marketing. It establishes the Kenya Fisheries Advisory Council (“Council”),  The Kenya Fisheries Service (“Service”), The Fish Marketing Authority (“Authority”), the Fisheries Research and Development Fund and the Fish Levy Trust Fund. The Act also implements obligations under international law concerning fisheries. The objective of this Act is to protect, manage, use and develop the aquatic resources in a manner which is consistent with ecologically sustainable development, to uplift the living standards of the fishing communities and to introduce fishing to traditionally non-fishing communities and to enhance food security. Guiding principles of the Act include, among other things, conservation and protection of fisheries habitats, ensuring the effective application of the ecosystem approach to fisheries management and that biodiversity and genetic diversity in the marine environment is maintained and enhanced, encouraging the participation of users of the fisheries resources, and the general community, in the management of fisheries, application of the precautionary approach to the management and development of the fisheries at no less standard than is set out in any international agreement.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Fisheries, Sea, Water, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 479 validating the Regulation on methodology of drafting and contents of the project of maximum allowable emissions to the atmospheric air.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree validates the methodology of drafting and contents of the project of maximum allowable emissions to the atmospheric air to be used by economic entities in the process of planning their projected activities. Maximum allowable emissions shall be calculated for each single economic entity on condition that ground level concentration of pollutants shall not exceed the established air quality standards. It contains calculation formula for emissions and description of the contents of the project.

Policy: Punjab Prohibition of Child Labour at Brick Kilns Act, 2016 (No. XXXVII).
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 19 sections, establishes the Punjab Prohibition of Child Labour at Brick Kilns. Since the environment at a brick kiln is hazardous for children, adversely affecting their growth, health and education, this Act prohibits the child labour and regulates the labour at the brick kilns in the whole Punjab. Every engagement or appointment of a worker shall be subject to a written contract in the prescribed Form between the worker and the occupier showing the terms and conditions of his/her employment. If it appears to an inspector that a child has been engaged on work or found at a brick kiln, or if the occupier fails to comply with any direction under section 18, the Inspector may, in the prescribed manner, seal the brick kiln for a period not exceeding seven days.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Indian Ocean, South Asian Seas, Southern Asia
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force at once.

Policy: Measures for Public Announcement of Major Illegal Acts Concerning Labor Security.
Policy_Content: These Measures, consisting 0f 13 articles, aim to strengthen the punishment on  major labor security violations, and strengthen supervision of public opinions, and  promote the employers to abide by labor and social security laws, regulations and rules. The administrative department of human resources and social security shall announce to the public the major illegal acts of labor security that have been investigated and dealt with according to law and made a decision on handling.  Such major illegal acts concerning labor security include: violating seriously the special labor protection provisions for female workers and juvenile; violating the provisions prohibiting the use of child labor; causing serious adverse social impact as a result of the labor security violation; other major labor security violations.

Policy: Public Sector Investment Programme.
Policy_Content: The Trinidad and Tobago Public Sector Investment Programme is a national Programme with a multi-sectoral approach. This Programme implements the goals set by the National Development Strategy 2016-2030. Its main objective is to transform Trinidad and Tobago into a developed country, with sustainable growth. The Programme also aims at creating the conditions for social advancement across all segments of the population particularly the vulnerable groups in society, increasing productivity and international competitiveness and providing a comprehensive, well-coordinated and holistic enabling platform for effective management of environmental issues across sectors.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 392 validating National Development Strategy for the period until 2030.
Policy_Content: This National Development Strategy lays down cross-sectoral approach covering either urban or rural areas, or the population, at national level. The period of implementation shall be from 2016 to 2030. The Strategy addresses social protection of the population, ensuring access to safe foodstuffs, improvement of hygiene and sanitary practices, reduction of gender inequality in all forms and enhancing employment in production sector of the national economy with a view of poverty reduction. Access to high quality safe foodstuffs entails provision of adequate nutrition to the population and improvement of access to potable water. Reduction of gender inequality envisages inclusive development and ensuring well-being of children, improvement of gender potential and gender sensitivity of staff in public administration bodies at all levels, prevention of all forms of violence against women and girls, formation and introduction of gender sensitive information system. One of the main objectives is the promotion of ecofriendly agro-industrial complex, stimulation of “green employment”, ecofriendly entrepreneurship and ecological services market with a view of reaching ecological sustainability. Poverty reduction objective shall be addressed through sustainable maintenance and operation or irrigation and drainage systems as sustainable functioning of irrigated agriculture as a basis for ensuring food security, rural employment and poverty reduction at the local level. The goal shall be twofold reduction of poverty and eradication of extreme poverty. Long-term objectives in the sphere of ensuring safe and healthy living environment for the population shall be quality improvement and financial sustainability of housing and utilities infrastructure, creation safe living areas with a view of prevention of natural disasters risks. The Strategy envisages improvement of accountability and transparency of public administration, improvement of parliamentary control and participation of civil society in budgeting process. This Strategy sets forth the following objectives for implementation in the following 15 years: (a) ensuring energy security and efficient energy saving; (b) ensuring food security and access to high quality products by the population; and (c) raising employment of the population.  The supreme goal shall be considered improvement of living standards of the population on the basis of sustainable economic development of the country. In the sphere of energy security shall be set forth the following priorities: (a) diversification of energy sources; (b) use of renewable energy sources; and (c) use of hydropower generated from big and small rivers. In the sphere of food security shall be set forth the following priorities: (a) promotion of agrarian and water management reforms; (b) stabilization of agrarian sector in order to ensure physical access to foodstuffs of the population; (c) diversification of agricultural production; (d) improvement of access to high quality seeds and fertilizers, and introduction of new agricultural production methods; and (e) raising efficiency of irrigation and drainage infrastructure.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Energy, Food & nutrition, Water

Policy: Regulations on Criteria to be used for Expropriation of Agricultural Land (G.N. 209 of 2016).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made under section 77 of the Agricultural (Commercial) Land Reform Act, establish criteria to be used in expropriating agricultural land for purposes of section 20(1A) of the Act. The Regulations also concern the identification of agricultural land suitable for expropriation and lays down the method of calculating whether an agricultural land is highly suitable, suitable, moderate suitable or not suitable for expropriation (scoring criteria for agricultural land). The Minister, after having - (a) identified agricultural land for expropriation; and (b) conducted a suitability assessment of the agricultural land as contemplated these Regulations, must for the purposes of section 14(1) of the Act score the agricultural land in accordance with the scoring criteria set out in the Annexure. The Minister, after consultation with the Commission and having scored the identified agricultural land may decide to expropriate the identified agricultural land.
Subject: Land & soil

The organization and functioning of Local Government Agencies are governed by the principles of decentralization and simplification of administrative procedures and differentiation, without prejudice to the central powers of the Executive, aiming at bringing public services closer to citizens, in order to guarantee the speed and adequacy of the decisions of the public administration to the local reality.

Policy: Regulation on the method of assessing the pollution of the land surface.
Policy_Content: The Regulation of the Minister of  Environment, which is composed of 15 paragraphs and three Annexes, lays down the method of assessing the pollution of the land surface, including: (1) substances causing risk particularly important for the protection of the land surface, their acceptable levels in the soil, differentiated for individual soil properties and soil groups (specified in Annex 1); (2) detailed requirements regarding the determination of the acceptable levels of substance causing risk other than specified in point 1 in the soil, including the analysis of its impact on human healt and the state of the environment; (3) stages of identification of polluted areas; (4) activities that are likely to cause historical pollution of the land surface, with an indication of examples of pollution for these activities (Annex 2); (5) reference methodologies for soil and soil pollution testing (Annex 3); (6) specific requirements for the assessment of soil, land or groundwater pollution.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Regulation entered into force on 5 September 2016.

Policy: Regulation on remedying actions.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Environment, which is composed of nine paragraphs, lays down: (1) types of remedial actions, as well as conditions and methods to conduct them for damages to protected species or protected natural habitats or waters; (2) conditions and methods of remediation for damage to the environment in the surface of land. Three types of remedial actions are defined: basic, supplementary and compensating. The basic remedial actions are carried out first. They should cause restoration of the initial or approximate state in the shortest possible time. Supplementary remedial actions are carried out in a way which ensures the achievement of a similar state of elements or their functions as would be ensured by basic remedial actions. Compensatory remedial actions are carried out in a way ensuring compensation of losses incurred in the period from the occurrence of damage in the environment to the restoration of the initial or approximate state, or to achieve a similar state of natural elements or their functions.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Regulation entered into force on 5 September 2016.

Policy: Regulation establishing criteria of environmental damage assessment.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Environment, which is composed of five paragraphs, establishes criteria for assessing the occurrence of environmental damage in protected species or protected natural habitats, in waters and in the surface of land. The criteria for assessing the occurrence of environmental damage in the protected species is a change or changes causing one or more of the following measurable effects that have a significant adverse effect on the achievement or maintenance of a favorable conservation status for these species: (1) destruction of a protected species habitat; (2) deterioration of the condition or function of the protected species population, consisting in particular of: (a) reducing the population size of the protected species or reducing its density; (b) deterioration of the reproductive species population, its spread or deterioration of other vital functions; (c) an increase in mortality; (d) reducing the possibility of contact between the protected species population and neighboring populations.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Regulation entered into force on 5 September 2016.

Policy: Regulation on register of environmental damages.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Environment, which is composed of five paragraphs, lays down, with a view of preventing and remedying environmental damage, detailed scope of information that is collected in the register of environmental damages and direct threats to environmental damage. The scope of information is specified in art. 2 and contains, in particular, information on the type of environmental damage in protected species, protected natural habitats, waters or the surface of land.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Liability/compensation,Polluter pays principle,Protection of habitats,Data collection/reporting

Policy: Contribution Déterminée au niveau National dans le cadre de la CCNUCC.
Policy_Content: La Contribution Déterminée au	niveau National (CDN) du	Maroc est une version bonifié de la Contribution	prévue	déterminée au niveau national (CPDN) que le Maroc a présentée au	 secrétariat de	la Convention cadre	des Nations unies  sur	 les  changements climatiques (CCNUCC) le 5 juin 2015. La	 Contribution  du Maroc trouve	 son	 ancrage institutionnel  dans  la SNDD et permet d’esquisser	une	vision du	Maroc à l’horizon 2030. En ce sens, la mise en œuvre de la CDN du Maroc s’inscrit dans une perspective intégrée, allant	au-delà du changement climatique, incluant ainsi:  le respect des droits de la personne et l’égalité homme–femme, reconnu au sein de la Constitution du Maroc de 2011; les synergies à exploiter avec les deux autres Conventions de Rio, visant la restauration, le respect et le maintien de la diversité biologique, la gestion intégrée des ressources en eaux ainsi que la gestion durable des terres permettant de contrer la désertification et la dégradation des sols sur son territoire; l’alignement des actions en matière de changement climatique avec le respect des Objectifs de développement durable (ODD) de l’ONU, particulièrement les objectifs 1, 6, 7, 8, 9, 11, 12, 13 et 17; la mise en œuvre du projet de régionalisation avancée au Maroc, misant sur une démarche de planification stratégique territoriale intégrée et participative. Ce projet apportera une contribution significative à la mise en œuvre de la NDC grâce à une vision de l’aménagement du territoire national basée sur la valorisation des potentialités et des ressources propres à chaque région et à la solidarité interrégionale. La	 vision	 du	 Maroc	 en	 matière	 d’adaptation	 se	 décline	 en	 plusieurs	 objectifs	 sectoriels	 chiffrés	 pour	les	 horizons 2020	 et	 2030,	 présentés	 dans	le	 tableau 3. Les champs d'action sont les suivants: agriculture; eau; forêts; et pêche et aquaculture.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Fisheries, Forestry, Water, Wild species & ecosystems, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Climate change,Risk assessment/management,Emissions,Ozone layer,Air quality/air pollution,Pollution control,Public private partnership (PPP),Sustainable use,Marine fisheries,Afforestation/reforestation,Forest management/forest conservation,Waste management,Waste disposal,Sewerage,Effluent waste water/discharge,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Water supply,Ecosystem preservation,Marine protected areas,Protected area

Policy: Water Awareness Strategy.
Policy_Content: This Water Sector Awareness Strategy is a 10-years sectoral document representing a framework of what needs to be communicated to close the information gap  on water initiatives among the stakeholders and outlines the possible target audiences as well as communication tools. It is also a basis for developing national specific implementation plans by Water Sector Organizations and service providers. PWA, as leading organization, has the lead role in strategy implementation and coordinates the efforts amongst relevant water sector organizations for the purpose of achieving the awareness objectives. However, some local and international organizations can play major role in strategy implementation through providing technical and financial support.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 2.887 - Promueve el reciclaje de botellas de Polietileno Tereftalato Post Consumo grado alimentario (PET-PCR).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo tiene por objeto promover el reciclaje de botellas de Polietileno Tereftalato Post Consumo grado alimentario (PET-PCR). Sus disposiciones se aplican a: a) las empresas que producen botellas PET para bebidas carbonatadas, gaseosas, sodas, aguas, energizantes, rehidratantes y otras bebidas similares; b) las envasadoras que utilicen botellas PET para la comercialización de bebidas carbonatadas, gaseosas, sodas, aguas, energizantes, rehidratantes y otras bebidas similares. Las empresas que producen botellas PET, deben obligatoriamente incluir en la cadena productiva material PET-PCR grado alimentario en al menos un treinta por ciento.

Policy: Land Laws (Amendment) Act, 2016 (No. 28 of 2016).
Policy_Content: The Land Laws (Amendment) Act, 2016 lays down amendments to the Land Act, 2012, Land Registration Act, 2012 and the National Land Commission Act, 2012. The aim is to provide for the sustainable and productive management of land resources. The Act applies to public land, private land and community land as categorized in articles 62, 63 and 64 of the constitution. Article 67(2)(e) requires the Land Commission to initiate investigations, on its own initiative or on a complaint, into present or historical land injustices, and recommend appropriate redress. The Act places restrictions on transactions in "controlled land". No transaction in controlled land, including a transfer for a consideration or by way of trusts, gift inter vivos or otherwise to an ineligible person, shall be dealt with without the prior written approval of the Cabinet Secretary. The Act also concerns the prohibition of unlawful occupation of private community or public land and eviction from such lands.
Subject: Forestry, Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Protection of Traditional Knowledge and Cultural Expressions Act, 2016 (No. 33 of 2016).
Policy_Content: The Act concerns protection of traditional knowledge (including knowledge relating to  agriculture and the environment) and cultural expressions in Kenya. It concerns, among other things, definition and management of rights in this respect and civil remedies. In the performance of the functions and exercise of powers under this Act, every person dealing with matters relating to traditional knowledge or cultural expressions shall be guided by the national values and principles of governance set out in Article 10 of the Constitution. An authorization granted under this Act to access protected traditional knowledge associated with genetic  resources shall not be an authorization to access the associated genetic resources. "Genetic resources" means microorganisms, plant and animal material including indigenous seeds, genetic plant varieties and traditional animal breeds that contain functional hereditary units and whose management shall also be subject of other relevant legislations. Where protected traditional knowledge is not  being sufficiently exploited by the owner or rights holder, or where the owner or holder of rights in traditional knowledge refuses to grant licenses for exploitation, the Cabinet Secretary may, with prior informed consent of the owners, grant a compulsory licence for exploitation subject to Article 40(3) (b) of the Constitution.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Cultivated plants, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy_Content: The Purpose of this Decree is to prescribe matters delegated by the Rearrangement of Agricultural and Fishing Villages Act and those necessary for the enforcement of such matters. Article 3 lists item subject to a resource survey to be conducted under article 3 of the aforementioned Act. Article 5 lays down provisions relating to the proposal of a rural landscape management plan. Policy: Decree No. 587 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Detailed instruction for manufacturing of organic production.
Policy_Content: This Detailed instruction sets forth the requirements for the manufacturing of organic production of vegetable origin and establishes agrotechnical particulars applicable to the process of manufacturing. The basis for organic production shall be the exclusion from the technological process of the use of chemical fertilizers, pesticides, genetically modified organisms and their derivatives and products made from genetically modified organisms and conserving agents. In the process of organic production the producer must ensure: (a) conduct of economic activity without harmful effect on soil fertility, contributes to increasing soil fertility and preserve quality thereof, , prevent irreversible loss of humus, nutrients, etc. ; (b) minimum use of non-renewable resources and non-agricultural products; (c) use of the benefits of biologization of agriculture through the expansion of perennial grasses and the introduction of bacterial drugs, increasing the area of agricultural crops sown on green fertilizers; (e) use in ecofriendly processes; (f) recycle waste and by-products of plant origin in the course of organic production; and (g) take into account local or regional ecological balance when choosing products (raw materials) for manufacturing.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Ecological production/organic production,Ecofriendly products/ecofriendly processes,Fertilizers/nutrients,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Biological agents,GMO,Biotechnology
