Policy: Arrêté n° 828-2016/PM du 31 août 2016 portant création d'un Comité Interministériel du Développement des Partenariats Public-Privé en Mauritanie (CIDPPPM).
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté crée, auprès du Premier Ministre, un Comité interministériel du Développement des Partenariats Public-Prive en Mauritanie (PPP). Le Comité interministériel du Développement des Partenariats Public Privé (PPP) en Mauritanie est l’organe de décision, de validation et d’orientation du cadre institutionnel de pilotage de Partenariats Public-Prive en Mauritanie. Le Comité est présidé par le Premier Ministre. II comprend des membres permanents et des membres non permanents. Comme membres permanents, le Comité est composé de: Ministre de l'Economie et des Finances; Ministre de la Justice; Ministre du Pétrole, de l'Energie et des Mines; Ministre de l'Equipement et des Transports; Ministre des Pêches et de l'Economie Maritime; Ministre de I' Agriculture; Ministre de l'Hydraulique et de l'Assainissement. Les membres non permanents sont les Ministères techniques porteurs de projets faisant l’objet d’examen par le Comité.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, Least Developed Countries, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, North Atlantic, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy: CGWA Guidelines/Criteria on Ground Water Abstraction by Food Parks/Agro Based Industries in Areas Notified for Ground Water Regulation.
Policy_Content: Industries falling under this category would be considered for grant of NOC for groundwater withdrawal in Notified areas subject to the following conditions: i) The general conditions applicable to over-exploited category in non-notified areas shall apply. However, the saving of water due to change in cropping pattern along with the Artificial Recharge component to be taken into account for water budgeting/ computing of recharge factors. ii) The concurrence of Ministry of Food Processing Industries is mandatory for establishing of Food Parks/Agro Industries. iii) There must be food processing units for low water intensive crops and not for high water intensive crops in the Food Parks/Agro Industries, thereby saving in ground water withdrawal. iv) No water intensive industries/units should be allowed within the Food Parks/Agro industries. However, food processing unit products such as starch and glucose would be permitted. v) Food Parks/Agro Industries shall submit a detail report duly approved by the State Agriculture Department on the quantity of ground water to be saved through the proposed change in cropping pattern in the same assessment unit. vi) Assurance/undertaking from the Panchayat or local governing body regarding change in cropping pattern by the farmers in the same assessment unit would be submitted while applying for NOC. vii) Food Parks/Agro Industries shall submit their applications to the concerned Regional Office of Central Ground Water Board through the authorized officer of CGWA. viii) The net annual ground water saving due to such proposed change in cropping pattern shall be more than 30%, as per the assessment of the State Agriculture Department. ix. Waste water generated shall be treated and gainfully utilized. x) The Food Parks/Agro Industries shall submit yearly report to the district Administration and CGWA indicating the saving of ground water withdrawal of the area. xi) CGWA reserves the right to withdraw the NOC in case of any violation of the guidelines.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Water
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Indian Ocean, South Asian Seas, Southern Asia
Entry into force notes: These Criteria enter into force with effect from 31 August 2016.

Policy: Order No. 42n of the Federal Agency of Scientific Organizations validating the Regulation on the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution "Federal Scientific Center of Agroecology, Integrated Land Reclamation and Protective Afforestation of the Russian Academy of Sciences" as protected natural area of federal significance.
Policy_Content: This Order validates the Regulation on the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution "Federal Scientific Center of Agroecology, Integrated Land Reclamation and Protective Afforestation of the Russian Academy of Sciences" as protected natural area of federal significance, defines tasks, scientific profile, the particulars of legal status, organizational structure, applicable special protection regime as protected natural area of federal significance, including "Cluster Dendrological Park of the Pan-Russian scientific research institution of agroforestry" located in Volgograd region and "Kulundinsky arboretum" located in Altai region. Both dendrological (arboretum) parks shall have the status of protected areas of federal significance. The main purpose of the Arboretum Parks is introduction and acclimatization of woody plants, selection of an assortment for protective afforestation and gardening, diversity conservation and enrichment of flora, as well as carrying out fundamental scientific research and applied development in the field of bioecology of woody plants and forest nursery. The main tasks of the Arboretum Parks shall be as follows: (a) comprehensive study of the adaptive capabilities of trees and shrubs in the arid region in order to solve the problems of their rational use, enrichment of dendroflora of degraded areas and forest reclamation complexes; (b) development of theoretical foundations for the introduction and acclimatization of plants in the arid belt of Russia; (c) development of scientific foundations of decorative gardening and greenery; (d) development of theoretical foundations and methods of preservation, restoration and continuous use of the gene pool of woody plants for the formation of protective forest plantations of various target destinations; (e) development of methodological foundations for the selection of an adapted gene pool of economically valuable plants; (f) creation of special collections and expositions, experimental sites and plant nurseries; (g) creation of a seed fund, organization of exchange of seeds and planting material with specialized institutions from different geographic areas; (h) development of methods for protecting woody plants from pests and diseases; (i) development of methods for environmental education; (j) popularization and propaganda of bioecological knowledge; (k) preservation and enrichment of plant collections; (l) conducting educational, pedagogical and scientific and educational work in the field of dendrology, landscaping of settlements, protective afforestation; and (m) cooperation with specialized organizations on research issues related to plant resources.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Forestry
Keyword: Institution,Drainage/land reclamation,Agro-forestry,Research,Education,Protected area,Forest management/forest conservation,Afforestation/reforestation,Protection forest,Planting material/seeds,Genetic resources

Policy: Companies Act 2016 (Act 777).
Policy_Content: This Act consisting of 620 articles aims at reforming the company landscape in Malaysia. It establishes that (i) a company shall have one or more members; (ii) companies can generally be classified as (1) limited and unlimited liability companies and (2) public and private companies; (iii) to form a company it is sufficient that the Registrar of Companies (‘ROC’) assigns a registration number to the company and issues the notice of registration upon compliance of the procedure and payment of the appropriate fee; (iv)  who signs a pre-incorporation contract will be personally liable on the contract or transaction accordingly; (v) rights, powers, duties and obligations of the company, director and member are prescribed by the present Act unless modified by the company’s constitution. The company’s constitution can modify any of those rights, powers, duties and obligations only if the Act permits it; (vi) a company shall have the capacity to carry on or undertake any business or activity. Nonetheless, if the company has a constitution which states the company’s objects, it shall be restricted from carrying on any business or activity that is not within those objects. Other then these main rules, the Act deals also with (i) Share Capital; (ii) Share Certificate; (iii) Transfer of shares; (iv) Directors (the minimum number is one for a private company and two for a public company); (v) Company Secretary; (vi) Company Accounts; (vii) Auditor; (viii) Company Meetings; (ix) Resolutions; (x) Corporate Restructuring; (xi) Liquidation of Companies.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, South-Eastern Asia
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force on the date to be appointed by the Minister by notification in the Gazette (may be different dates for the different provisions).

Policy: Namibia Investment Promotion Act (2016).
Policy_Content: This Namibia Investment Promotion Act determines the rules aimed to provide for the promotion of sustainable economic development and growth through the mobilization and attraction of foreign and domestic investment to enhance economic development, reduce unemployment, accelerate growth and diversify the economy; to provide for reservation of certain economic sectors (also natural resources) and business activities to certain categories of investors (including concessions); to provide for dispute resolution mechanisms involving investment; and to provide for incidental matters. The text is divided into seven main thematic parts, as follows: Part I. Introductory provisions; Part II. Administration of act; Part III. Investors, economic sectors and business activities; Part IV. Change of ownership and control of investments; Part V. Rights and obligations for investors; Part VI. Dispute settlement; Part VII. General provisions. Section 11 sets rules regarding the approval of proposed change of ownership and control of investment. Section 21 sets terms regarding the expropriation of land. Section 33 sets penalties for offences.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, South Atlantic, Southern Africa

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 5 - Reglamenta parcialmente el artículo 20 de la Ley Nº 160, modificado por el artículo 101 de la Ley Nº 1.753, sobre el Subsidio Integral de Reforma Agraria (SIRA).
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo reglamenta el Subsidio Integral de Reforma Agraria (SIRA), en cuanto a sus generalidades, sujetos de atención, predios a adquirir, proyecto productivo y procedimiento para su otorgamiento. El presente Acuerdo únicamente se aplicará cuando no existan las zonas rurales con intervenciones integrales para promover el desarrollo rural, o cuando existiendo no sea viable la asignación del subsidio al interior de ellas. El SIRA será equivalente al valor de la Unidad Agrícola Familiar (UAF), fijada en función de la evaluación técnica y financiera del proyecto productivo.

Policy: Law No. 13.572 establishing the State Policy and System for the Resilience to Semi-arid weather.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 36 articles divided into six Chapters, establishes the State Policy and System for the Resilience to Semi-arid weather. This State Policy, as a strategic component of the sustainable development of the State of Bahia, is an instrument of inter-sectoral and cross-cutting management and planning of governmental policies and civil society actions. The objectives of the State Policy are: ensure the development of semi-arid populations, considering and the integration of social, cultural, environmental, economic, ethnic-racial, generational and gender aspects; strengthen the autonomy of the semi-arid population through socio-productive inclusion, employment and income generating activities; articulate, in an integrated way, the planning, management and monitoring of any activity to promote the coexistence with the semi-arid weather; ensure the participation of civil society in the design, management and social control of public policies for living in the semi-arid; guarantee access to semi-arid lands; universal access to water for human consumption, animal nutrition and productive use, with technologies appropriate to the semi-arid, guaranteeing water security; mitigate the effects of drought and climate change through the adoption of prevention and adaptation practices; foster new processes and agricultural planning making compatible the use of water, land and biodiversity; promote food and nutritional sovereignty and security, guaranteeing the human right to adequate and healthy food; promote access to the Unified Health System, providing integral care at all levels; preserve cultural identities of the desert sertão; protect rights over knowledge, practices, production systems and traditional uses; develop tourism-related production by integrating the economic and cultural aspect; promote wind, solar and biomass renewable energy.
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen., Water

Policy: Decree No. 53.180 creating the Steering Committee for the Water and Soil Conservation Policy.
Policy_Content: This Decree creates the Steering Committee for the Water and Soil Conservation Policy within the State Public Administration. The Committee aims at analyzing and proposing actions and measures to guarantee their implementation and effectiveness in the State. It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the Steering Committee, in line with the guidelines presented in the Soil and Water Conservation Policy in the State of Rio Grande do Sul to perform the following activities: seek the participation and cooperation of regional and state entities; develop projects to implement actions, management and conservation of soil and water; plan, evaluate, supervise, monitor and make feasible the implementation of actions; make available a database of information necessary for managerial decision-making processes; and assist in the elaboration of technical and educational materials regarding the use, management and conservation of soil and water.

Policy: Decreto Nº 442 - Ley de Cultura.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley de Cultura tiene por objeto establecer el régimen jurídico que desarrolle, proteja y promueva la cultura, así como los principios, definiciones, institucionalidad y marco legal que fundamenta la política estatal en dicha materia, con la finalidad de proteger los derechos culturales reconocidos por la Constitución y tratados internacionales vigentes. El Estado salvadoreño está obligado a proteger la riqueza artística, histórica y arqueológica del país que forman parte del tesoro cultural salvadoreño, reconociendo su importancia nacional, centroamericana e internacional.

Policy: Order No. 233/2016 amending Order No. 134/2015 on the regime of operation 8.1.3 "Forest Prevention against biotic and abiotic agents".
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the first amendment of Order No. 134/2015 of 18 May, establishing the regime for the operational system 8.1.3 "Forest Prevention against biotic and abiotic agents" and operation 8.1.4 "Restoring the affected forestry sector by biotic and abiotic agents or catastrophic events", of the continental rural development programme, referred to as PDR 2020. The amended Annex III deals with administrative proceedings and specifies that the expenditure set out in Section II are eligible from the date of occurrence of fire or disaster, only if the transactions are not physically completed or fully implemented before the request for support.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Agricultural development,Subsidy/incentive,Disasters,Procedural matters,Forest management/forest conservation,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Southern Europe

Policy: Smart Meters Operation Act.
Policy_Content: The main purpose of the present Act is to facilitate the implementation of smart meters. The Act transposes the EU Directives 2009/72/EG and 2009/73/EG into German law. The new Act also introduces specific and detailed requirements, both for the design of the smart meter devices and for the transmission of data. The overall goal is to open up the German energy market to digitisation, while ensuring a high standard regarding data protection and ICT security. Thus a digital infrastructure shall be developed that is capable of connecting more than 1.5 million electricity producers and large-scale consumers by introducing smart meters. They shall provide a secure communication platform which will make the electricity supply system fit for the energy transition. The Act also establishes binding protection profiles and technical guidelines to ensure data protection, data security and interoperability. The text consists of 77 articles divided into 4 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Smart meters operation (II); Provisions on data communication in intelligent energy nets (III); Special tasks of the controlling authority (IV). One Annex is enclosed.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Resource Management (Network Utility Operations) Regulations 2016.
Policy_Content: These Regulations, consisting of 5 sections and one Schedule, prescribe environmental planning for certain projects as network utility operations for the purposes of section 166 of the Resource Management Act 1991. The effect of these regulations is to enable a person who undertakes, or proposes to undertake, a prescribed project to seek and, if appropriate, be granted, requiring authority status under that Act for the project. Schedules deals with the following issues: Transitional, savings, and related provisions; Mayfield Hinds In-race Generation project; and Wairau Hydroelectricity Scheme project.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Environmental planning,Environmental standards,Land-use planning,Authorization/permit,Hydropower generation,Sustainable development
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: These regulations enter into force on 29 September 2016.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 522-pp validating the Regulation on regional state nature reserves “Boyskye bolota” (Boysk wetlands), "Zulumaysky", "Irkutny", "Kadinsky", "Kireysky", "Kochergatsky", "Magdansky", "Tayursky", "Tukolon", "Chaysky" and "Educhansky".
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes that regional state nature reserves “Boyskye bolota” (Boysk wetlands), "Zulumaysky", "Irkutny", "Kadinsky", "Kireysky", "Kochergatsky", "Magdansky", "Tayursky", "Tukolon", "Chaysky" and "Educhansky" shall be classified as complex (landscape)  reserves constituted on permanent (open-ended) basis with a view of conservation of unique and typical natural complexes and objects, wild fauna and wild flora species, genetic resources thereof, ecological education and healthcare of the population. The aforesaid regional nature reserves shall perform the following functions: (a) reduction of anthropogenic impact and conservation of natural landscapes; (b) conservation and reproduction of wild fauna and wild flora species, natural habitats and migratory routes thereof; (c) scientific research; and (d) performance of state environmental monitoring. The following activities shall be prohibited: (a) resin tapping; (b) timber extraction, except for sanitary felling and felling for extinguishment of forest fires; (c) any type of hunting except for regulation of number of wild fauna species; (d) water abstraction; (e) soil disturbance; and (f) radioactive pollution of the territory.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Protection of habitats,Monitoring,Research,Management/conservation,Wild fauna,Wild flora,Genetic resources,Migratory species
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Decree enters into force ten days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Agreement between the Federal Service for Hydrometeorology and Environmental Monitoring (ROSHYDROMET) and the Government of Magadan region on cooperation in the field of hydrometeorology and related fields, environmental monitoring and monitoring of pollution on the regional territory.
Policy_Content: This Agreement defines the intentions of the Parties in the main areas of cooperation between Roshydromet and the Government of Magadan region on the issues referred to the subjects of joint management of the Russian Federation and the regions of the Russian Federation, requiring concerted action and joint decisions in the framework of works in the field of hydrometeorology and related fields, in the field of state environmental monitoring, improvement of the functioning of an integrated system of observations of the state of the environment in the territory of Magadan region, assessment and forecast of the state of  changes thereof under the impact of natural and anthropogenic factors. The Agreement is designed to strengthen cooperation between the Parties in the field of state environmental monitoring, adoption and implementation of target programs and planned environmental protection activities, providing the population and regional executive bodies with information on the state of the environment and its pollution. The main areas and forms of interaction between the Parties shall be as follows: (a) ensuring the functioning and improvement of the state observation network and territorial system of observations of the state of the environment and its pollution in the regional territory; (b) improving the efficiency of forecasting of natural disasters, phenomena and creation of optimal conditions for the improvement of the level of protection of the population and reduction of damage caused by natural disasters; (c) improvement of early warning system for the population related to dangerous natural phenomena and actual and projected changes in weather and environmental pollution, which may threaten the life and health of the population and cause damage to the environment; and (d) planning and implementation of joint programs and activities in the fields of interaction, exchange of information, working meetings and conferences on the most important issues requiring joint solutions in the of state environmental monitoring and environmental pollution on the territory of Magadan region.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Keyword: Contract/agreement,Pollution control,Monitoring,Disasters,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Public health,Data collection/reporting,Access-to-information
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Agreement enters into force from the date of signature.

Policy: Land Regulations 2016.
Policy_Content: These Regulations, consisting of 16 sections and four Schedules, aim to the following objectives: (a) to restrict the activities of members of the public on licensed water frontages; and (b) to prescribe fees and forms for the purposes of the Land Act 1958; and (c) to provide for the issue of duplicate documents; and (d) to provide for other matters for the purposes of the Land Act 1958. These Regulations are made under section 413 of the Land Act 1958 and are divided as follows: Definitions; Application to surrender land; Duplicate licence document; Duplicate residence area right; Notice of demand to owner; Notice of municipal council that a road is unused; Water frontages; Licence fees; Lease fees; Crown grant fees; Fee to assign interest under contract of sale; General fees; Schedules deal with the following matters: Application to surrender land; Notice of intention to surrender land; Notice of demand to owner; Notice of municipal council that road is unused.
Subject: Land & soil, Water
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: These Regulations enter into force on 28 August 2016.

Policy_Content: The present Act introduces some amendments to the Population Protection Act of 26 April 2007. In particular, the Act amends article 1 on Object and purpose; article 8 on International aid; article 15 on National police force; article 21 on Exemption; article 30 on Economical land supply; article 37 on Costs of vocational training; article 48 on Implementing Ordinances. The text consists of 2 articles.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Biofuels Regulation 2016.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, consisting of 14 sections and completed by one Schedule on Penalty notice offences, implements the Biofuels Act 2007, regulates records to be kept by a volume fuel seller for the purposes of section 12 of the Act, in respect of each sale of petrol (including petrol-ethanol blend) and diesel fuel (including biodiesel blend) by the volume fuel seller showing in respect of each sale: (a)  the volume of petrol and diesel fuel sold, and (b)  whether the petrol sold was or was not petrol-ethanol blend, and (c)  whether the diesel fuel sold was or was not biodiesel blend, and (d)  in the case of a sale of petrol-ethanol blend, the amount of ethanol in the petrol-ethanol blend, and (e)  in the case of a sale of biodiesel blend, the amount of biodiesel in the biodiesel blend, and (f)  whether the petrol-ethanol blend or biodiesel blend sold complies with a biofuel sustainability standard, including details of any relevant certification. (2)  Records required by this clause may be kept in the form of copies of invoices or other records of sale issued by the volume fuel seller.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force on 1 September 2016.

Policy: Resolution of the Council of Ministers No. 46/2016 approving the National Strategy for Air Quality (ENAR 2020).
Policy_Content: This Resolution of the Council of Ministers approves the National Strategy for Air (ENAR 2020) aiming to improve air quality for the protection of human health, quality of life and preservation of ecosystems. This Strategy, consisting of 7 sections and 11 Tables, establishes that ENAR 2020 vision is based on improving the air quality through the following main objectives: a) meet in 2020 the emission targets and air quality; b) comply with targets for improvement of air quality recommended for 2020; c) outline the path to be achieved in the long term quality objectives of air recommended by the World Health Organization (WHO); d) align protective measures with the policy on Climate Change addressing both the air pollutants and greenhouse gas effect with benefit to air quality and climate change. To achieve these objectives, ENAR 2020 is based on three axes: a) 'Evaluate' with the diagnosis of emissions and air quality; b) 'Anticipate' through projections of air emissions and air quality planned for 2020; c) "Act" with the definition of the strategic vectors of performance and the identification of the respective measures.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Emissions,Environmental standards,Authorization/permit,Climate change,Monitoring,Pollution control
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Southern Europe

Policy: Décision 00131/D/MINEPDED/CAB du 26 août 2016 fixant les modalités de délivrance des attestations de respect des obligations environnementales (AROE) dans le cadre du régime d’autorisation FLEGT
Policy_Content: La présente décision fixe les modalités de délivrance des attestations de respect des obligations environnementales (AROE) dans le cadre du régime d’autorisation FLEGT en particulier.  L’AROE certifie du respect des obligations environnementales par un opérateur dont les activités ont bénéficié d’une évaluation environnementale (évaluation environnementale stratégique, étude d’impact environnemental et social, audit environnemental et social, notice d’impact environnemental). Au sens de la présente décision, on entend par opérateur forestier, toute personne physique ou morale détentrice d’un titre, d’un permis d’exploitation forestière ou d’une unité de transformation de bois.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 320 “On agricultural development in Vitebsk province”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Presidential Decree shall be improvement of efficiency of agricultural production by means of introduction of measures and arrangement aimed at financial recovery of agro food sector and, in particular, food (grain) processing enterprises. Among financial agricultural measures shall be applicable payment by instalments of previously allocated credits and interests on credits. In case of prolongation of the period of payment by instalments shall not be applicable either interests or penalties.

Policy: Decreto Nº 111 - Reglamento del Proceso de elaboración y adopción de las Guías de Buenas Prácticas Ambientales.
Policy_Content: El presente Reglamento del Proceso de elaboración y adopción de las Guías de Buenas Prácticas Ambientales, tiene como objetivo establecer las disposiciones por las cuales se regirá el uso de las Guías de Buenas Prácticas Ambientales. Una Buena Práctica Ambiental se define como aquella acción que reduce el impacto ambiental negativo y mejora el desempeño ambiental a través de cambios en la organización de los procesos y las actividades, y que se caracterizan por su simplicidad, resultados rápidos y útiles y sencillez en sus aplicaciones. El presente reglamento es aplicable a acciones humanas que, por su naturaleza, características, efectos, ubicación o recursos, y con base en los criterios de protección ambiental, pueden generar riesgos ambientales estimados como bajos.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances

Policy_Content: La présente loi modifie et complète l’article 2 du dahir n° 1-63-226 du 14 rabii I 1383 (5 août 1963) portant création de l'Office national de l’électricité. Ces modifications portent notamment sur le titre, ainsi l'Office national de l’électricité devient l'Office national de l’électricité et de l’eau potable: L’Office national de l’électricité et de l’eau potable est chargé de l’énergie électrique. « Toutefois, ladite production ne concerne pas l’électricité « produite à partir d'installations EN R. On entend au sens « de la présente loi par installation ENR, toute centrale « de production électrique utilisant des sources d'énergies « renouvelables à l’exception des stations de transfert d’énergie « par pompage, des moyens de production d’électricité destinés « à garantir la stabilité du réseau électrique national et des « installations de production d'électricité de sources d'énergies « renouvelable régies par les dispositions de la loi n° 13-09 « relative aux énergies renouvelables.

Policy: Loi n° 39-16 portant modification de la loi n°16-09 relative à l’Agence nationale pour le développement des énergies renouvelables et de l’efficacité énergétique.
Policy_Content: La présente loi qui modifie de la loi n°16-09 relative à l’Agence nationale pour le développement des énergies renouvelables et de l’efficacité énergétique, fixe de nouveaux objectifs, notamment: la promotion de la production d’énergie à partir de sources renouvelables, sa commercialisation et de son exportation par des entités publiques ou privées ; l’assujettissement des installations de production d’énergie à partir de sources renouvelables à un régime d’autorisation ou de déclaration et ; le droit, pour un exploitant, de produire de l’électricité à partir de sources d’énergies renouvelables pour le compte d’un consommateur ou un groupement de consommateurs raccordés au réseau électrique national de moyenne tension (MT);  haute tension (HT) et très haute tension (THT) ; dans le cadre d’une convention par laquelle ceux-ci s’engagent à enlever et à consommer l’électricité ainsi produite exclusivement pour leur usage propre.

Policy: Order No. 2-155 of 2016 of Minister of Agriculture of Georgia on Charter of Laboratory of Ministry of Agriculture
Policy_Content: The Order adopts the Charter of the Laboratory of the Ministry of Agriculture of Georgia. It consists of 10 articles: General provisions (1); Scope of activities (2); Authority and functions of the Laboratory (3); Management of the Laboratory (4); Structure of the Laboratory (5); Functions of the structural units and territorial bodies of the Laboratory (6); State supervision of the Laboratory (7); Source of financing of the Laboratory (8); Property of the Laboratory (9); and Final provisions (10). According to the Charter, the Laboratory’s functions, among others, include laboratorial diagnostics of animal (i.e. birds, fish, bees) diseases; research of animal and plant-based food, feed, and potable water; testing plant materials and soil samples for plant quarantine and other dangerous organisms; assessment of the risk of an outbreak of a transmissible animal disease; and participating in animal disease quarantine measures.

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto modifica el Decreto Único Reglamentario del Sector Sector Vivienda, Ciudad y Territorio, en lo relacionado con el criterio de focalización para el acceso al subsidio familiar de vivienda para áreas urbanas en especie a los hogares que pertenezcan a pueblos y comunidades indígenas en atención a su situación de vulnerabilidad, con el fin de facilitar el acceso a una solución habitacional en condiciones dignas y adecuadas a su cultura, usos y costumbres.

Policy: Règlement grand-ducal instituant une prime à l’entretien du paysage et de l’espace naturel et à l’encouragement d’une agriculture respectueuse de l’environnement.
Policy_Content: L’article 1 établit qu’il est institué une prime à l’entretien du paysage et de l’espace naturel et à l’encouragement d’une agriculture respectueuse de l’environnement dont le bénéfice est réservé aux exploitants de surfaces agricoles, de pépinières, de vignobles, de vignobles en pente, en pente raide, en pente très raide ou en terrasses ainsi que de surfaces horticoles. Le texte comprend 37 articles répartis en 7 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (1er); Conditions communes à toutes les primes allouées (2); Conditions spécifiques à la prime allouée pour les parcelles agricoles (3); Conditions spécifiques à la prime allouée pour les pépinières (4); Conditions spécifiques à la prime allouée pour les parcelles viticoles (5); Conditions spécifiques à la prime allouée pour les surfaces horticoles (6); Dispositions communes (7). Sept annexes sont jointes.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Financial agricultural measures,Subsidy/incentive,Farming,Agricultural land,Crops/grasses,Ecological production/organic production,Agricultural development,Agroecology,Plant production,Viticulture/oenological practices,Fertilizers/nutrients

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 181 - Instructivo para el establecimiento del comprobante de origen y movilización del productor y el comprobante de movilización del comerciante, para identificar el origen de los productos agrícolas.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución expide el Instructivo para el establecimiento del comprobante de origen y movilización del productor y el comprobante de movilización del comerciante, que tendrán por objeto el registro de la producción nacional de productos agrícolas ecuatorianos considerados en el sistema. Su alcance será para los productos agrícolas que sean provenientes de las provincias fronterizas de Loja, El Oro, Carchi y Sucumbíos y, cuando aplique, en otras provincias de todo el territorio nacional, para conocer su origen y ruta de movilización o circulación por vía terrestre. Los comprobantes de origen y movilización del productor y los comprobantes de movilización del comerciantes son documentos únicos e intransferibles, no sujetos a la venta, préstamo o intercambio de cualquier naturaleza.

Policy: Waste Management and Resource Recovery Act 2016.
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 128 sections divided into 18 Parts and completed by one Schedule, aims to provide for the minimisation of waste, the recovery, recycling and re use of resources. The objects of this Act are to: (a) manage waste according to the following hierarchy: (i) minimise the generation of waste; (ii) maximise the recovery and re-use of resources; (iii) minimise the amount of waste that goes to landfill; (b) support innovation and investment in waste management; (c) promote responsibility for waste reduction; and (d) promote best-practice waste management. The objects of this Act are to be achieved by taking into account the following principles: (a) the inter-generational equity principle; (b) the polluter pays principle; (c) the precautionary principle; (d) the proximity principle; (e) the waste minimisation principle.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Waste management,Recycling/reuse,Waste prevention,Environmental planning,Enforcement/compliance,Offences/penalties,Polluter pays principle,Waste disposal
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Arrêté du 24 août 2016 fixant les critères de sortie du statut de déchet pour les déchets graisseux et les huiles alimentaires usagées pour un usage en tant que combustible dans une installation de combustion classée sous la rubrique 2910-B au titre de la nomenclature des installations classées pour la protection de l'environnement et d'une puissance supérieure à 0,1 MW et les esters méthyliques d'acides gras fabriqués à partir de ces déchets destinés à être incorporés dans un produit pétrolier
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté fixe les critères de sortie du statut de déchet pour les déchets graisseux et les huiles alimentaires usagées pour un usage en tant que combustible dans une installation de combustion classée sous la rubrique 2910-B au titre de la nomenclature des installations classées pour la protection de l'environnement et d'une puissance supérieure à 0,1 MW et les esters méthyliques d'acides gras fabriqués à partir de ces déchets destinés à être incorporés dans un produit pétrolier. Le présent arrêté est applicable aux exploitants d'une installation classée relevant des rubriques 2791 ou 2730 de la nomenclature des installations classées. Les graisses, huiles ainsi que les esters méthyliques d'acides gras fabriqués ou issus du traitement de déchets graisseux ou d'huiles alimentaires usagées cessent d'être des déchets lorsque la totalité des critères suivants sont satisfaits : a) les déchets entrant dans l'opération de valorisation satisfont aux critères établis dans la section 1 de l'annexe I ; b) les déchets entrant sont traités conformément aux critères établis dans la section 2 de l'annexe I ; c) les graisses, huiles et esters méthyliques d'acides gras issus de l'opération de valorisation satisfont aux critères établis dans la section 3 de l'annexe I ; d) l'exploitant a conclu un contrat de cession pour les lots de graisse ou d'huile pour un usage en tant que combustible dans une installation de combustion classée sous la rubrique 2910-B au titre de la nomenclature des installations classées pour la protection de l'environnement et d'une puissance supérieure à 0,1 MW ou pour les lots d'esters méthyliques d'acides gras destinés à être incorporés dans un produit pétrolier ; et e) l'exploitant satisfait aux exigences établies aux articles 4 à 9 du présent arrêté.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Law No. 29/2016 creating the Regime to support family farming in the Azores and Madeira islands.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 5 Chapters, establishes the Regime to support family farming within the Autonomous Regions of Azores and Madeira islands. This contributory regime for family farming applies to taxpayers under the simplified system of taxation provided for in the Tax Code on personal income. This Law covers by special regime: a) agricultural producers with tax residence in the Azores or Madeira, exercising the effective occupation in agriculture or equivalent exploitation; b) the spouses of farmers exercising effective professional farming activity; c) workers in agricultural or similar activities after 31 December 2010, whose principal purpose is the agricultural production and all workers who are admitted from 31 December 2016 under the same conditions. This Law is divided as follows: Object (Chap. I); Agricultural producers (Chap. II); Workers in agricultural or similar activities (Chap. III); Financing (Chap. IV); Final provisions (Chap. V).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Agricultural development,Farming,Family farming,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Special fund,Financial agricultural measures

Policy: Law No. 31/2016 on the third amendment of Law No. 54/2005 establishing the title ownership of water resources.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the third amendment of Law No. 54/2005 regulating the title ownership of water resources. Amendments deal with the ownership of water resources and lay down the requirements to be satisfied in order to use such resources. In addition, it regulates the lake and fluvial public domain which belongs to the state or to the autonomous regions. Without prejudice to the public domain of the State and the autonomous regions still belong: a) the public water domain of the lakes and ponds located entirely in municipal lands or municipal common areas; b) the public water domain of the municipal lakes and ponds entirely located on lands of the municipality or in vacant lots. Amended article also establish areas threatened by possible floods, expropriation and other type of public land ownership dispossessed from plots, beds or public waters resources.

Policy: Order No. D1-561 of the Minister of Environment regarding methods of land rehabilitation of landscapes damaged as a result of subsoil management.
Policy_Content: The Minister validates the methods of land rehabilitation of landscapes damaged as a result of subsoil management due to mining and extraction of minerals. It shall not be applicable to deep quarries subject to issuance of special permits for operation thereof. Land rehabilitation procedure must be performed by land owners and land tenants that have extracted common minerals on surface or near surface for their own individual needs.  The following land categories shall be subject to land rehabilitation of disturbed land: (a) agricultural land; (b) waterbodies; (c) forestland; (d) wetlands; and (e) urban land. Land rehabilitation shall be performed with the consideration of the following indicators: (a) hydrogeological and geomorphological conditions; (b) depth of mining; (c) soil composition; (d) soil fertility; and (e) environmental heritage. Land rehabilitation shall be performed by means of technical and biological land reclamation.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 457-p validating the Regulation on natural park "Donskoy".
Policy_Content: Natural park “Donskoy” is a multipurpose protected area of regional significance. Natural park shall perform the following tasks: (a) environmental protection purposes – conservation of the natural environment, unique and reference natural landscapes and objects; protection of plants, animals and other organisms related to the species listed in the Red Book of the Russian Federation and in the regional Red Book; preservation of upland oak forests valuable for the Volgograd region; preservation of unique geological objects - chalk mountains; restoration of disturbed natural ecosystems; (b) ecological purposes – preservation of forest ecosystems on the watersheds of the Don and Ilovlya rivers, having an important water-regulating and soil-strengthening value; preservation of spring systems that are part of the unified system of underground aquifers of the Ergeninskaya upland; ecological education of the population; (c) recreational purposes - meeting the recreational needs of residents of the Volgograd region and other regions of the Russian Federation; creation of a network of recreational places in ecologically clean territory with a rich flora and fauna, reducing the negative impact of anthropogenic loads on the environment; creation of a network of equipped tourist routes; (c) historical and ethnographic purposes - conservation, study and use in scientific, educational, tourist and recreational purposes of high natural and cultural-historical potential of the territory; conservation of historical sites; and (d) research purposes - development and implementation of scientific methods for the preservation of biological diversity and natural complexes in the conditions of the Volgograd area, as well as assessment and forecast of the ecological situation. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of natural park: (a) change of historical natural landscape and violation of the regime of maintenance of the objects of historical and cultural heritage; (b) creation of new and expansion of existing settlements, gardening, horticultural, peri-urban non-commercial partnerships; (c) allotment of land plots for residential construction; (d) mining (except for groundwater abstraction); (e) effluent waste water discharge, without prior sanitary treatment, to waterbodies; (f) domestic and non-domestic waste disposal; (g) movement and parking of motor vehicles outside roads of common access; (h) introduction of alien fauna and flora species; (i) reduction of the number of rare and endangered wild fauna and wild flora species; (j) burning of vegetation without taking preventive measures against destruction of wild fauna species; and (k) damage or destruction of notices, barriers, stands and other warning and information signs, and equipped places of rest. The following activities shall be authorized in the territory of the natural park: (a) state environmental monitoring; (b) protection of rare and endangered wild fauna and wild flora species; (c) forest fire prevention arrangements; (d) scientific research and environmental education; (e) construction, reconstruction, repair and operation of household and residential buildings; (f) grazing and transit of livestock; and (g) authorized haymaking.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry, Water
Keyword: Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Wetlands,Education,Tourism,Research,Cultural heritage,Monitoring,Forest fires,Forest management/forest conservation
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Decree enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Ley Nº 823 - Ley de modificación a la Ley Nº 356 de 2013, Ley general de cooperativas.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley modifica algunas disposiciones transitorias y finales de la Ley general de cooperativas. Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 467 validating National Plan of emergency response to nuclear and radiation disasters.
Policy_Content: This National Plan of emergency response to nuclear and radiation disasters shall be applicable to central and local government bodies, natural and legal persons operating in the sphere of nuclear energy uses. National Plan shall be applied in case of leakage of radiation outside authorized sites and transboundary nuclear disasters on the territory of foreign states that can represent risks for the territory of the Republic of Kazakhstan. Nuclear disasters shall be classified as local, regional and global. Competent body in the sphere of civil protection shall ensure information of the population through early warning system in case of the outbreak of nuclear or radiation disasters.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.
Keyword: Disasters,Nuclear energy,Radiation,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Local government
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Regulation on the earthquake research and application center of Afyon Kocatepe University.
Policy_Content: The earthquake research and application center of Afyon Kocatepe University shall carry out activities regarding disaster risk management, earthquake monitoring, registration of data due to geophysical, geotechnical, geodesic and geomorphological survey, the minimization of the loss of life and economic losses, urban planning, early warning systems, preparedness for post-disaster phases, and awareness raising. This Regulation sets forth provisions on the purpose, scope, management and administration of the center of the Afyon Kocatepe University.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Disasters,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Environmental planning,Environmental security,Land-use planning,Monitoring,Risk assessment/management,Capacity building
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force on the day it is published in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Decree on the air quality.
Policy_Content: The main objective of the Decree of the Ministry of Environment, which is composed of five articles and 14 Annexes, is to establish target values for the concentration of selected pollutants in ambient air in accordance with European Union legislation. The present Decree lays down in particular: (a) limit values, target values and long-term objectives for ozone, critical levels of air pollution for selected pollutants and deadlines to achieve them, ways of monitoring and assessing these criteria; (b) details on information and data on air quality which must be available to the general public; (c) methods and technical requirements for air quality assessment; (d) upper and lower limits to assess the level of air pollution for selected pollutants, requirements for the location of sampling points. Limit values of pollutants for human health protection are specified in Annex 1.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Pollution control,Air quality/air pollution,Hazardous substances,Data collection/reporting,Environmental standards
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on 31 December 2016.

Policy: Legislative Decree No. 177 laying down provisions to rationalize police functions and incorporating the State Forestry Corps.
Policy_Content: This Legislative Decree sets out rules to rearrange and reorganize State police funtions. It includes provisions on the State Forestry Corps, which is incorporated into the Police Authority.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Legislative Decree 9 August 2016, n. 177 Provisions on the rationalization of police functions and absorption of the State Forestry Corps.
Policy_Content: This Decree determines the modifications in terms of necessary rationalization and consequential implementation of related actions as regards the reorganization of forces of police, in particular (enhancement of effectiveness of the functions of some State bodies) the absorption of the State Forestry Corps, the attribution of their previous functions (and several other issues that were governed by State Forestry Corps and that here are redistributed to other State bodies, see article 7).

Policy: Decreto Nº 3.157 - Ordenanza para la extracción de áridos en cauces y álveos de cursos naturales de agua que constituyen bienes nacionales de uso público y en pozos lastreros de propiedad particular en la Comuna de Panquehue.
Policy_Content: En virtud del presente Decreto queda aprobada la Ordenanza para la extracción de Áridos en Cauces y Álveos de Cursos Naturales de Agua que constituyen Bienes Nacionales de Uso Público y en Pozos Lastreros de Propiedad Particular en la comuna de Panquehue. De conformidad con la Ley Nº 18.695 (Ley Orgánica Constitucional de Municipalidades) los bienes municipales o nacionales de uso público, incluido su subsuelo, que administre la Municipalidad, podrán ser objeto de permisos. Para extraer áridos de los cauces de los ríos, esteros y pozos lastreros, se requiere previamente el otorgamiento de un permiso municipal, el cual será visado técnicamente por la Dirección de Obras Hidráulicas del Ministerio de Obras Públicas o la institución que lo supla en sus funciones.
Subject: Mineral resources, Water
Geographical_area: Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Order No. 332 of the acting Minister of Energy setting criteria for classification of waste as recyclable materials.
Policy_Content: This Order sets the following criteria for classification of waste as recyclable materials: (a) domestic waste (recyclable paper, cardboard, glass containers, glass scrap, wood and rubber); (b) domestic waste used as raw materials for further processing; (c) domestic waste free of foreign matter (must not exceed 2% of the total weight); and (d) domestic waste free of oils, fats and oil emulsions.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Resolución Nº 980 - Plan Nacional del Ministerio de Salud para la Preparación, Respuesta y Recuperación ante Emergencias y Desastres.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución adopta el Plan Nacional del Ministerio de Salud para la Preparación, Respuesta y Recuperación ante Emergencias y Desastres, que establece los lineamientos para el diseño e implementación del Plan Nacional de Gestión Integral de Riesgo a Desastres en el Sector Salud. El Plan Nacional de Gestión Integral de Riesgo a Desastre en el Sector Salud, será el documento base, técnico y estratégico que incorporará y articulará los diferentes planes, programas, herramientas, instrumentos, procedimientos, protocolos y acciones en materia de reducción de riesgos y del impacto de los desastres a la salud.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Child Employment Regulation 2016.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, consisting of 47 sections divided into four Parts and completed by three Schedules, regulates the general provisions for work performed by children in Queensland. In particular, it establishes the restrictions on work for children under 13 years, specifying that an employer must not require or permit a child under 13 years to do any work. However, a child of any age may do volunteer work or work in the entertainment industry. Also, a child who is at least 11 years may do delivery work. A special circumstances certificate may provide an exception to requirements under this section (See section 9(5) of the Act). It specifies prohibited working hours; working hours for school-aged children;  working conditions related to children’s safety, health and wellbeing, etc. An employer of a child must keep a record about the child’s employment with the employer that includes specific information. Part 3 provides for work performed by children in entertainment industry;
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force on 19 August 2016.

Policy: Order INEMA No. 12.215 establishing procedures, documents and studies necessary for the environmental regularization of agro-silvo-pastoral activities classified as Agriculture (Rainfed and Irrigated Agriculture) or Extensive Livestock.
Policy_Content: This Order INEMA establishes procedures, documents and studies necessary for the environmental regularization of agro-silvo-pastoral activities classified as Agriculture (Rainfed and Irrigated Agriculture) or Extensive Livestock to be carried within the State of Bahia. These activities will be subject to the special environmental licensing procedures, and must be registered at INEMA, through the State Environmental and Water Resources Information System (SEIA) aimed at the environmental regularization. For this regularization of the enterprise, the applicant must be aware of the environmental constraints and requirements previously established by the licensing body. The conditions set forth above should contemplate the mitigating measures for the location, implementation and operation of agro-silvo-pastoral activities that may be subject to a special licensing procedure.
Subject: Livestock, Forestry
Keyword: Authorization/permit,Agro-forestry,Pastoralism,Registration,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Environmental planning,Protection forest,Forest management/forest conservation,Monitoring,Animal health,Animal production

Policy_Content: These Measures are enacted to regulate and strengthen the administration of subsidy funds  for assisting the impoverished people, improve the fund use efficiency, and ensure the timely and full distribution of the subsidy funds to the relief objects. Policy: Decreto Nº 309 - Fija cobro mínimo y establece cobro por los tiempos de esperas y cautivos en las prestaciones de servicios que realiza el Servicio Agrícola y Ganadero, a solicitud de terceros, según se indica.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto del Ministerio de Agricultura, establece un cobro mínimo de 0,25 UTM para las prestaciones realizadas por el Servicio Agrícola y Ganadero, a solicitud de terceros, con las excepciones que se encuentran en la actualidad reguladas en decretos específicos.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 33/2016 on the Regulation for Electricity Licensing and Tariff.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 21 articles divided into five Chapters, establishes the regime of tariffs and prices of electricity, as well as the conditions of access to the public electricity distribution and supply network, including the control and inspection rules. The regime provided for in this Decree-law applies to all consumers of electricity from the national public distribution network. The Decree-Law is divided as follows: General provisions (Chap. I); Licensing for electrical installation (Chap. II); Offences and penalties (Chap. III); Competence and procedures for imposing sanctions (Chap. IV); Final provisions (Chap. V).
Subject: Energy

Policy: Decree-Law No. 32/2016 regulating the Offshore Oil Operations in Timor-Leste.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 183 articles divided into 23 Chapters and one Annex, regulates the Offshore Oil Operations in Timor-Leste. The purpose of this Decree-Law is to regulate petroleum operations relating to offshore petroleum resources, pursuant to article 31 of the Petroleum Activities Law. The present Decree-Law has the following objectives: a) guarantee the maximum recovery of Petroleum Resources of Timor-Leste; b) Avoid waste and pollution; c) Impose the use of safe and effective practices of research and exploitation; d) enable the effective monitoring, supervision and inspection of petroleum operations; e) contribute to the achievement of Timor-Leste's overall development objectives and priorities.
Subject: Energy, Mineral resources

Policy: Resolución Nº 462/16 – Por la cual se establece un Programa de reducción gradual de la comercialización del R-22 en forma pura o como componente de una mezcla; se crea el Registro R-22 Puro o en Mezclas y se deja sin efecto la Resolución Nº 399/15 y la Resolución Nº 195/16.
Policy_Content: Por medio de esta Resolución se crea el Registro R-22 Puro o en Mezclas en el que deberán inscribirse todos los importadores de dicho gas refrigerante y todas las personas físicas y jurídicas que realicen la venta del mismo dentro del territorio nacional.

Policy: Busia County Trade Development Revolving Fund Act, 2016 (No. 7 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the establishment of a Revolving Fund for purposes of promoting micro and small enterprises in Busia County in order to— (a) enhance economic growth and development in the county; (b) enhance equity and equality in access to trade development services; (c) ensure rural and regional development within the county; (d) improve the standards of living among the residents of Busia; (e) protect interests of marginalized communities; (f) enhance provision and access to basic services such as health, education, transport and communication and water. The Funds shall be a body corporate and shall be managed by a Board. The Board shall, among other things, consider and approve loan applications submitted from each Small and Micro Enterprise owner and facilitate capacity development of each Small and Micro enterprise owner. The Board shall undertake remedial action on all problematic loans to prevent the loss of resources which action shall include rescheduling of loans, exercising right of lien over securities charged or litigation as shall be necessary in accordance to the analysis report of the Secretary of the Board.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa

Policy: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2016/1394 amending Implementing Regulation (EU) No. 809/2014 laying down rules for the application of Regulation (EU) No. 1306/2013 of the European Parliament and of the Council with regard to the integrated administration and control system, rural development measures and cross compliance.
Policy_Content: This Regulation supplements Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) No. 809/2014 laying down rules for the application of Regulation (EU) No. 1306/2013 of the European Parliament and of the Council with regard to the integrated administration and control system, rural development measures and cross compliance. In particular it inserts new article 33a, which concerns additional control rate for on-the-spot checks to follow-up the beneficiaries referred to in article 19a(2) of Delegated Regulation (EU) No. 640/2014.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Decree No. 31/2016 amending Decree No. 16/2007 creating the Centre for Research of Marine and Coastal areas (CEPAM).
Policy_Content: This Decree amends article 3 of the Statute of the Centre for Research of Marine and Coastal areas (CEPAM). CEPAM is under the supervision of the Minister regulating marine and inland waters. This supervision includes in particular the following activities: a) approving the Activity Plans and CEPAM budget, including periodic activity reports and accounts of the institution; b) suspending or revoking the acts of the institutional bodies and other legal instruments that violate the law; c) appointing the Director, the Deputy Director and the CEPAM's Administrator; d) appointing the members of the Scientific Council, after hearing the respective institutions; e) carrying out inquiries and investigations, where appropriate; f) approving the Rules and other institutional management tools; g) creating and abrogating local representations of CEPAM; h) approving all acts under the tutelage authorization lack.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea
Keyword: Institution,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Land-use planning,Marine pollution,Navigation,Marine area,Marine protected areas,Protected area

Policy: Decreto Legislativo Nº 436 - Interpreta auténticamente el artículo 4º de la Ley Especial para facilitar la cancelación de las deudas agraria y agropecuaria.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Legislativo interpreta auténticamente el artículo 4º de la Ley Especial para Facilitar la Cancelación de las Deudas Agraria y Agropecuaria, así como el de otros Decretos Legislativos que han reformado o prorrogado sus beneficios, en el sentido que “No se podrá iniciar ninguna acción judicial de reclamo de deuda contra los beneficiarios amparados de legal forma al pronto pago, así como también se suspenderá todo proceso civil o mercantil declarativo o especial ya iniciado en cualquier etapa del mismo, incluyendo las diligencias de ejecución forzosa, hasta antes de la realización de los bienes embargados.”

Policy_Content: Upon the request of the Ministry of Environment and Urbanization, the Council of Ministers decrees to designate the coastal band between Sarisu-Beldibi Tunnel, Sarisu stream in the District of Konyaalti, as well as some natural protected areas in the District of Konyaalti and Kemer, as specially protected areas. The designated areas are shown in the maps attached to this Decree.

Policy: National Adaptation Plan (NAP) to Climate Change.
Policy_Content: This National Adaptation Plan (NAP) is a nationwide sectoral document aiming at providing (i) an assessment of historic trends in climate in relation to the State of Palestine; (ii) an identification and prioritization of vulnerabilities; (iii) future climate-scenarios for the State of Palestine; (iv) identification and prioritization of adaptation options, including related costs; (v) future developments required for the State of Palestine’s institutions to be able to participate in climate-modelling research; and (vi) an outline of the process for future monitoring and evaluation. The process for assessing vulnerabilities and identifying adaptation options has been built on the UNFCCC’s guidelines for least developed countries. The adaptation measures are provided based on three different future-climate scenarios from the most optimistic (a global average temperature increase not exceeding 2°C) to a mid-range scenario (some reductions from historic levels but breaching the 2°C target) until, finally, at the most pessimistic, assuming that emissions continue unabated.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Energy, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Forestry, Land & soil, Cultivated plants, Water

Policy: Floodplain Management Plan for the Gwydir Valley Floodplain 2016.
Policy_Content: This Regulation approves the Floodplain Management Plan for the Gwydir Valley Floodplain. The Plan, consisting of 57 sections divided into ten Parts and completed by one Schedule and eight Appendixes, is made under section 50 of the Water Management Act 2000. This Plan is a plan for floodplain management and generally deals with the matters set out in sections 29 and 30 of the Act, as well as other sections of the Act. The vision of this Plan is to contribute to a sustainable, healthy and working floodplain by managing the development of new flood works and amendments to existing flood works to protect the passage of floodwater through the floodplain, whilst recognising the need to minimise the risk to life and property.
Subject: Environment gen., Water

Policy_Content: This Regulation, consisting of 6 sections and completed by two Schedules, implements the Petroleum (Offshore) Act 1982 and establishes fees and requirements to the transfer of land title.

Policy: Mining Regulation 2016.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, consisting of 102 sections divided by ten Parts and completed by 11 Schedules, establishes the requirements to be met in order to perform all activities related to the mining sector. The Regulation prescribes the content of notices of applications for exploration licences, assessment leases, mining leases, mineral claims, opal prospecting licences, etc. The Regulation is divided as follows: Preliminary (I): Prospecting and mining generally (II); Authorities (Exploration licences and  Leases) (III); Small-scale titles (IV); Reports (V); Use of information and protected documents (VI); Royalty (VII); Fees (VIII); Boards of management (IX); Miscellaneous (X). Schedules deal with the following Minerals; Groups of minerals; Description of land for activities carried out by Hunter Enviro-Mining (Operations) Pty; Land identification; Other relevant legislation; Rate of royalty; Membership and procedure of boards of management; Form of permit to enter land; Fees; Penalty notice offences; Savings and transitional provisions.

Policy: Law No. 12/16 approving the Conflict Mediation and Conciliation Norms.
Policy_Content: This Law approves the Conflict Mediation and Conciliation Norms. This Act lays down norms on the establishment, organization, mediation and conciliation procedures as an alternative dispute resolution of conflicts. These Norms, consisting of 9 Chapters apply to disputes in civil, commercial, labor, family land and criminal, rights, and the disputes within communities, which are not contrary to the Constitution, nor threaten the human dignity in the respect of the principles of equality and impartiality, legality, confidentiality, independence, competence and responsibility and regulates the entire mediation procedures, mediators and conciliators of conflicts and the system of mediation centers.

Policy: Resolución Nº 435-2016-MINAGRI ─ Lineamientos para la ejecución del Procedimiento de Reconocimiento e Inscripción Administrativa de la Personería Jurídica de Comunidades Nativas.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba la Directiva que precisa la normatividad aplicable y establece normas que regulan el adecuado y uniforme procedimiento de inscripción de las Comunidades Nativas en el correspondiente libro del Registro de Personas Jurídicas, con el objeto de uniformizar, esclarecer, viabilizar y agilizar criterios técnicos y legales a ser utilizados por los gobiernos regionales de la Selva y Ceja de Selva del Perú en el referido Procedimiento. Los Lineamientos son de observancia obligatoria por parte de los gobiernos regionales, ubicados en las regiones de selva y ceja de selva. El representante de la Comunidad Nativa encargado de gestionar el reconocimiento de la Comunidad Nativa, deberá presentar la solicitud de reconocimiento y/o inscripción de su personería jurídica, ante la Dirección Regional Agraria u órgano que haga sus veces de su ámbito territorial, para su inscripción en los registros administrativos del Gobierno Regional y del Ministerio de Agricultura y Riego (MINAGRI), para que evalúe y disponga la apertura del respectivo procedimiento y considere la factibilidad de su atención, elaborando el plan de trabajo y el presupuesto requerido. La Dirección Regional Agraria o unidad orgánica que haga sus veces en el Gobierno Regional, es la autoridad competente para ejecutar el Procedimiento, la misma que expedirá la Resolución de Reconocimiento e Inscripción de la Personería Jurídica de la Comunidad Nativa solicitante en el Registro Regional de Comunidades Nativas.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Agricultural development,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Land reform,Agricultural land,Indigenous peoples,Traditional rights/customary rights,Non-governmental entity

Policy: Business and Intellectual Property Authority Authority Act, 2016 (No. 8 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the establishment of the Business and Intellectual Property Authority Authority (BIPA), defines functions and powers of the Authority and provides with respect to its administration. The Authority shall me the main focal point for the regulation and administration the registration of business and industrial property under the applicable legislation. It shall, among other things: advise the Minister, public sector and private sector on matters pertaining to business and intellectual property falling within the scope of BIPA; perform any functions imposed on it by or under this Act, applicable legislation or necessary to achieve the objects of this Act and monitor compliance with this Act and the applicable legislation; regulate and administer the registration of business and industrial property under the applicable legislation. For the purposes of promoting the objects of this Act, the Minister may issue general or specific policy directives to BIPA not inconsistent with the provisions of this Act or applicable legislation.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, South Atlantic, Southern Africa

Policy: Loi n°1/09 du 12 aout 2016 portant code de l'urbanisme, de l'habitat et de la construction au Burundi.
Policy_Content: Le présent code fixe les règles qui régissent l’urbanisme, l’habitat et la construction sur l’ensemble du territoire national, conformément aux dispositions légales se rapportant à l’assainissement et à la protection de l’environnement.  En effet, ce code définit les différentes opérations d'urbanisme concrétisant les diverses destinations prévues pour les espaces urbains par les schémas directeurs d'aménagement et d'urbanisme et d'autres outils d'urbanisation. II établit en outre, des règles applicables à la construction tant en milieu urbain que rural.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Order No. 429 of the Ministry of Natural Resources validating the Regulation on the national park “Bikin”.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes that the location of the national park “Bikin” shall be Pozharskiy district in Primorie region of the Russian Federation. National park “Bikin” shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of natural complexes, unique and reference natural sites and objects; (b) conservation of historical and cultural heritage; (c) environmental education of the population; (d) promotion of regulated tourism and recreation; (e) development and introduction of scientific methods of nature protection and environmental education; (f) implementation of state environmental monitoring; (g) restoration of disturbed natural and historical-cultural complexes and objects; and (h) protection of living habitat and traditional way of life of indigenous peoples of the Russian Federation. On the territory of the national park, shall be prohibited any activity that can damage natural complexes and objects of flora and fauna, cultural and historical objects and which contradicts the purposes and tasks of the national park, including: (a) exploration and mining; (b) disturbance of the soil cover and geological outcrops; (c) activities entailing changes in the hydrological regime; (d) allotment of land parcels for horticulture and smallholding; (e) construction of main roads, pipelines, power transmission lines and other communications, as well as construction and operation of economic and residential facilities, except for tourism industry facilities, museums and information centers, facilities related to the functioning of the national park and the functioning of settlement located within its boundaries; (f) logging; (g) procurement of soft resin; (h) commercial, sports and artisanal hunting; (i) commercial fisheries; (j) procurement of edible non-timber forest resources (with the exception of procurement by citizens of such resources for their own personal needs); (k) disturbance of natural habitats of wild fauna and wild flora species; (l) biological collections, except for research purposes, envisaged by thematic and research plans of the Institution; (m) introduction of living organisms in order to acclimatize them; (n) passage and grazing of domestic animals; (o) organization of mass sports and entertainment events, organization of tourist camps and making bonfires outside the specially designated places for such purpose; (p) unauthorized conduct of archaeological excavations, collection and removal of objects of historical and cultural value; (q) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, including hunting firearms and hunting gear, except for traditional hunting by indigenous peoples; (r) blasting operations; (s) burning of vegetation (with the exception of fire-fighting measures implemented in coordination with the Institution); (t) clear cutting of forest species and shrubbery, with the exception of sanitary felling, felling associated with extinguishing forest fires, including the creation of fire breaks, and felling associated with the construction, reconstruction and operation of line facilities carried out in accordance with this Regulations; (u) waste disposal of domestic and non-domestic waste, radioactive waste, chemical, explosive, toxic, poisonous and hazardous substances; (v) washing vehicles on the banks of waterbodies; (w) movement and parking of motorized vehicles outside public roads and specially designated places (except for cases related to the functioning of the national park); (x) destruction and damage of posts, barriers, stands, boundary poles and other information signs, developed ecological paths and recreation areas, buildings on the territory of the national park, as well as property of the Institution, inscriptions and signs on boulders, outcrops and historical and cultural objects; and (y) keeping unleashed dogs outside the cages or other structures that limit the zone of their movement, and training of dogs. Shall be also prohibited flight of aircraft less than 500 meters above the territory of the national park without prior authorization by the Institution, application of chemicals, fertilizers, nutrients and plant protection means.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Ley Nº 1639 - Adhiérese la Provincia de Formosa a las Leyes Nacionales Nº 26.190 “Régimen de Fomento Nacional para el uso de Fuentes Renovables de Energía destinada a la Producción de Energía Eléctrica” y su modificatoria Nº 27.191.
Policy_Content: En virtud de la presente Ley la Provincia de Formosa se adhiere a las Leyes Nacionales Nº 26.190 “Régimen de Fomento Nacional para el uso de Fuentes Renovables de Energía destinada a la Producción de Energía Eléctrica” y su modificatoria Nº 27.191. En este contexto, se exime de impuestos, tasas y contribuciones a los beneficiarios mencionados en el artículo 8º de la Ley Nacional Nº 26.190, que se dediquen a la realización de emprendimientos de producción de energía eléctrica a partir de fuentes renovables de energía.
Subject: Energy
