Policy: Law No. 16.033 providing for the Policy on the non-potable water reuse within the State of Ceará.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes criteria for the reuse of non-potable water within the State of Ceará, based on art. 326 of the State Constitution and Law No. 14.844 of 28 December 2010. Reusing non-potable water will meet the following guidelines: protection and promotion of public health; maintaining the integrity of ecosystems; protection and preservation of existing water resources; sustainable water use. The reuse of non-potable water covers the following aspects: water reuse for general urban irrigation, washing of public places and vehicles, civil construction and fire fighting; water reuse for irrigation in agricultural production and of planted forests cultivation, refilling the groundwater; water reuse for implementation of environmental recovery projects; water reuse in activities and industrial operations; water reuse in aquaculture for rearing animals or growing aquatic vegetables. The modalities of reuse are not mutually exclusive and may be used simultaneously. The reuse of non-potable water for human supply is prohibited.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Forestry, Water
Keyword: Irrigation,Agricultural development,Policy/planning,Sustainable use,Public health,Afforestation/reforestation,Forest management/forest conservation,Recycling/reuse,Environmental planning,Aquaculture,Industrial water use
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Law No. 16.032 creating the State Policy on Solid Waste Management within the State of Ceará.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the State Policy on Solid Waste within the State of Ceará, providing its principles, objectives and instruments, as well as guidelines on the integrated management and management of solid wastes, including hazardous waste. Individuals or legal entities responsible for the generation of solid waste and those carrying out actions related to integrated management or solid waste management, within the scope of the State of Ceará are subject to compliance with this Law. It does not apply to radioactive waste, which is regulated by specific legislation. The objectives of the State Solid Waste Policy are: protect public health and environmental quality; do not generate, reduce, reuse, recycle and treat solid waste, as well as to carry out the final environmentally appropriate disposal of the wastes; adopt a system of monitoring of integrated solid waste management; adopt, develop and improve clean technologies as a way to minimize environmental impacts; reduce the volume and hazardous waste; encourage the recycling industry; promote the integrated management of solid waste; promote continuous technical training in the area of ​​solid waste; promote the regularity for solid waste management, in compliance with Law No. 11.445 of 5 January 2007; foster the development of research in order to modernize and optimize the effectiveness of solid waste management; adopt simplified technologies and logistics and treatment management; etc.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Waste management,Solid waste,Environmental planning,Waste disposal,Waste prevention,Integrated management
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Law No. 16.035 creating the Irrigation Project of the Secretariat of Agrarian Development (SDA).
Policy_Content: This Law creates the Irrigation Project of the Secretariat of Agrarian Development (SDA). Its objective is to strengthen the family farming business by facilitating farmers' access to efficient irrigation systems. The Project will be widely disseminated through: seminars developed by EMATERCE; printed materials to family farmers, explaining the Project and procedures to be followed by farmers who wish to be beneficiaries; selection criteria for farmers' participation, observing the guidelines of Federal Law 11.326, of 24 July 2006. The registration of the farmers will be done by SDA, filled by interested people to participate in the irrigation system. The registration will be submitted for evaluation and eventual approval by SDA, for the technical installation of the irrigation systems. The State Government will stimulate the development of irrigation systems powered by photovoltaic energy. The Irrigation Project guidelines aims to the efficiently and sustainably use water resources, prioritizing the techniques of localized irrigation and reducing irrigation by flood.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Water
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Complementary Law No. 162 establishing the State Policy for Water Supply and Sanitation in the State of Ceará, the State System for Water Supply and Sanitation, the State System Information on Sanitation, and creating the State Sanitation Fund.
Policy_Content: This Complementary Law, consisting of 35 articles divided into ten Chapters, establishes the State Policy for Water Supply and Sanitation, the State System for Water Supply and Sanitation, the State System Information on Sanitation, and creates the State Sanitation Fund. The objectives of the State Policy on Water Supply and Sanitation are: to promote universal access to water supply and sewage services; improve conditions; provide adequate services: and apply national guidelines to water supply services water and sanitation within the State of Ceará. This Policy should be articulated with the state policies of urban and regional development, to fight against poverty, to protect the environment and human health. Monitoring of the environmental impacts on health should be carried out, based on an articulation with the State Health Secretariat (SESA) and other competent bodies and/or institutions, in order to evaluate the evolution of the water supply and sanitation from the application of this State Policy. The State Policy for Water Supply and Sanitation consists of the institutional and financial support of the State of Ceará for public sanitation services and has the following instruments: the State Plan for Water Supply and Sanitation (PAAES); the State Fund for Basic Sanitation (FESB); the Information System for Sanitation in the State of Ceará (SISANCE).
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Environmental planning,Water quality standards,Waterworks,Special fund,Access-to-information,Freshwater resources management,Pollution control,Potable water,Water supply,Water users' associations,Sustainable use,Monitoring

Policy: Loi n° 16-04 du 14 Ramadhan 1437 correspondant au 19 juin 2016 modifiant et complétant la loi n° 04-04 du 5 Joumada El Oula 1425 correspondant au 23 juin 2004 relative à la normalisation.
Policy_Content: La présente loi modifie et de complète les dispositions des articles 2, 3 10, 11, 19, 19 bis, 24, 25 de la loi n° 04-04 du 5 Joumada El Oula 1425 correspondant au 23 juin 2004 relative à la normalisation. L’article 2 définit les termes suivants: de normalisation, norme, objectifs légitime, règlement technique, Organisme à activité normative, certification, organisme national de normalisation, produits, référentiel, marquage de conformité aux règlements techniques, norme nationale. L’article 3 précise que la normalisation a notamment pour objectifs: f) de rationaliser les ressources et de protéger l’environnement ; g) de répondre aux objectifs légitimes qui sont notamment : la sécurité nationale, la protection des consommateurs, la protection de l’économie nationale, la loyauté dans les transactions commerciales, la protection de la santé ou de la sécurité des personnes, de la vie ou de la santé des animaux, la préservation des végétaux, la protection de l’environnement et à tout autre objectif de même nature.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Décret n°2016-304/PRN/MAG/EL du 29 juin 2016 portant modalité d’application du Règlement C/REG.13/12/12 relatif au contrôle de qualité des engrais dans l’espace CEDEAO.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret s’applique à l’ensemble des activités relatives aux engrais, en particulier l’octroi de l’agrément et de l’autorisation, le contrôle de la qualité du produit, la fabrication, le stockage, l’importation, l’exportation, la distribution et la mise sur le marché des engrais sur le territoire national.  Ce texte détaille également les modalités d’exercice de la profession de fabricant, de commerçant et de distributeur d’engrais.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Africa, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy: Law “On plant protection”.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes legal, economic and organizational grounds for plant protection against pests, diseases and weeds, and is aimed at crop protection. Plant protection shall be based upon the following principles: (a) protection of human health and ensuring environmental security in the process of plant protection arrangements; (b) scientific, ecological and economic substantiation of plant protection arrangements; (c) priority of application of biological plant protection means; (d) transparency and timely submittal of information related to the issues of plant protection. Public competent authority in the sphere of plant protection shall be responsible for: (a) realization of state policy in the sphere of plant protection; (b) registration and classification of particularly harmful pests, diseases and weeds; (c) testing of plant protection means subject to state registration; (d) keeping of state register agrochemicals, including pesticides and fertilizers; and (e) public control in the sphere of plant protection.
Subject: Environment gen., Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 33 amending Regional Law No. 16 “On land protection and improvement of soil fertility”.
Policy_Content: Article 11 shall be amended to add the following wording: “With a view of prevention of agricultural land degradation, reproduction of soil fertility of degraded and polluted agricultural land, conservation of such land, with expropriation thereof, shall be allowed in accordance with the modalities envisaged by the acting legislation of the Russian Federation”.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Law No. 411-V “On employment of the population”.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes legal, economic and organizational grounds of state policy in the field of employment of the population and is aimed at ensuring the right of citizens to labour, protection against unemployment and establishes state guarantees in the field of employment. This Law shall be applicable to relations originating in the field of employment of the population on the territory of Turkmenistan. The main directions of state policy in the field of employment of the population shall be as follows: (a) ensuring equal rights and opportunities for free choice of profession, occupation, location of workplace, healthy and safe working conditions; (b) social assistance to the unemployed; (c) stimulation of the creation of new jobs; (d) creation of conditions for employment of persons in need of state assistance; and (e) protection of internal labour market setting quotas for foreign labour force. State guarantees in the field of employment of the population include protection against unemployment and ensuring unemployment benefit to the unemployed. Particular state guarantees shall be ensured to the vulnerable categories of the population. In order to implement state policy in the field of employment of the population shall be set up Special fund of assistance to employment of the population.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on 1 July 2016.

Policy_Content: Article 3 shall be amended to add the following wording: “Citizens interested in timber extraction for individual personal needs shall submit, in the period from 1 May to 1 September of the current year, written application related to conclusion of purchase and sale contract of forest species to executive body through multifunctional centers of public and municipal services”.

Amendments deal with administrative and legal proceedings for requirements for family agribusiness property or farmer ownership(s) relative(s) or farmer(s) family(s) under individual management or collective, located in rural or urban areas, as well as small family farms for handmade processing, in order to benefit and/or transform materials materials from farms, livestock, fisheries, aquaculture, extractive and forestry, ranging from simple cases to the most complex, such as physical, chemical and/or biological operations.

Policy: Resolución Nº 138-2016-SERFOR ─ Lineamientos para la articulación de las autoridades en el ejercicio de su potestad sancionadora y desarrollo del procedimiento administrativo sancionador.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba los Lineamientos para la articulación de las autoridades en el ejercicio de su potestad sancionadora y desarrollo del procedimiento administrativo sancionador, que tienen como objetivo establecer las definiciones y criterios que deben aplicar las autoridades administrativas del sector forestal y de fauna silvestre en el ejercicio de su potestad sancionadora y el desarrollo de los procedimientos administrativos sancionadores destinados a determinar las responsabilidades administrativas por la comisión de conductas que infrinjan la legislación forestal y de fauna silvestre, con la finalidad de uniformizar criterios para que las autoridades administrativas puedan ejercer su potestad sancionadora ante la comisión de infracciones tipificadas en la legislación forestal y de fauna silvestre, teniendo en cuenta la especificidad de esta última para la gestión y administración de los recursos forestales y de fauna silvestre.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Multi-Sector Air Pollutants Regulations (SOR/2016-151).
Policy_Content: The present Regulations are made under the Canadian Environment Protection Act, 1999. In particular, the Regulations require owners and operators of specific industrial facilities and equipment types to meet consistent performance standards across the country. The objectives of the Regulations are to: 1) Limit the amount of nitrogen oxides (NOX) emitted from modern (new) and pre-existing (existing), gaseous-fuel-fired non-utility boilers and heaters used in many industrial facilities; 2) Limit the amount of NOX emitted from modern and pre-existing stationary spark-ignition gaseous-fuel-fired engines used by many industrial facilities (e.g., those used for gas compression or back-up generators(; 3) Limit the amount of NOx and sulphur dioxide (SO2) emitted from cement kilns. The text consists of 123 sections divided into 4 Parts as follows: Boilers and heaters (1); Stationary Spark-ignition Engines (2); Cement (3); General (4). Twelve Schedules are enclosed.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Resolution No 266 of 2016 of Georgian Government on Permits for Movement of Ozone-depleting Substances and Distribution of Annual Quotas
Policy_Content: The Resolution regulates ozone depleting substances in Georgia. It consists of 12 articles: Purpose (1); Scope of regulation (2); Definition of terms (3); Agency issuing the permit and its authority (4); Issuance and validity period of permits, documents that need to be filed for issuance of the permit (5); Quotas and distribution of ozone depleting substances (6); Grounds to denial of permits and rules for appellation (7); Duties and rights of permit holder and compliance control of permit terms (8); Registry of permits (9); Form of permit (10); Loss or damaging permits (11); and Liability (12). The Resolution also adopts the list of ozone depleting substances included in A, B, C and E Annexes of Montreal Protocol on Substances that Deplete the Ozone Layer.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, Eastern Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Western Asia

Policy: Ley Nº 16 - Ley que instituye la Justicia Comunitaria de Paz y dicta disposiciones sobre Mediación y Conciliación Comunitaria.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley instituye la Justicia Comunitaria de Paz y dicta disposiciones sobre Mediación y Conciliación Comunitaria, y regula la justicia comunitaria y la aplicación de los métodos de solución de conflictos en Panamá para promover la solución efectiva de las controversias comunitarias y la convivencia pacífica, a fin de garantizar el acceso democrático a la justicia por igual, sin discriminación de raza, sexo, religión o ideología política.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Institution,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Dispute settlement,Court/tribunal,Local government,Indigenous peoples

Policy_Content: This Act amends the Public Procurement and Disposal of Public Property Act in provisions concerning, among other things, establishment of Public Procurement Review Board and appeal from Review Board. It also inserts a new Part (VIa) on the disposal of state land, which may be subject to regulations made by the Minister, the State Lands Act notwithstanding.

Policy: Arrêté A/2016/2092/MATD/CAB/SGG du 17 juin 2016, portant création, mission, organisation et fonctionnement du conseil préfectoral de développement (CPD).
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté crée le conseil préfectoral de développement (CPD), et détermine sa mission, son organisation et son fonctionnement. Espace de concertation des acteurs du Développement Local au niveau de la Préfecture, le CPD est chargé de soutenir dans l'éthique et la transparence, toutes les opportunités de développement de la Préfecture et des Collectivités Locales en formulant des avis, des observations et des recommandations, notamment dans les domaines de: l'élaboration du schéma d'aménagement de la Préfecture et la gestion du domaine Préfectoral ; la mobilisation des ressources humaines, matérielles et financières nécessaires pour le développement ; le suivi des programmes de développement à l'échelle de la Préfecture ; la collecte des données statistiques relatives aux budgets et programmes de développement local ; du programme de l'intercommunalité ; l'élaboration et l'application d'un système fiable de péréquation des ressources issues du secteur privé entre les Collectivités Locales ; et la prévention et la gestion des conflits en privilégiant la conciliation. Ses membres sont issus des services publics et privés et de la société civile, notamment les associations paysannes des jeunes et féminines.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Resolución Nº 206/2016 - Desígnese a la Unidad de Evaluación de Riesgos Ambientales del Ministerio de Ambiente y Desarrollo Sustentable como área competente a los fines del artículo 22 de la Ley Nº 25.675, Ley General del Ambiente.
Policy_Content: En virtud de esta Resolución se designa a la Unidad de Evaluación de Riesgos Ambientales como área competente a los fines de requerir y verificar el cumplimiento de las obligaciones establecidas en el artículo 22 de la Ley Nº 25.675 de política ambiental nacional. Dicho artículo establece que toda persona física o jurídica, pública o privada, que realice actividades riesgosas para el ambiente, los ecosistemas y sus elementos constitutivos, deberá contratar un seguro de cobertura con entidad suficiente para garantizar el financiamiento de la recomposición del daño que en su tipo pudiere producir; asimismo, según el caso y las posibilidades, podrá integrar un fondo de restauración ambiental que posibilite la instrumentación de acciones de reparación.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Sandalwood Regulations 2016.
Policy_Content: These Regulations regulate the growing of sandalwood in Tonga and the trade in sandalwood grown in Tonga. Their purpose is to: (a) ensure the sustainable management of the sandalwood resource in Tonga for current and future generations; and (b) promote the planting of sandalwood in Tonga in order to substantially increase the size and value of the resource so as to maximise its contribution to the economy of Tonga. They shall apply to a — (a) landholder on whose land sandalwood trees are planted, grown, cultivated and maintained for the sandalwood trade; (b) person involved with planting, growing or trading in sandalwood; and (c) person who intends to, or is an exporter of sandalwood. The Ministry is responsible for establishing a system and implementing the framework for the development and advancement of a sustainable sandalwood trade in Tonga. The Minister responsible for forests shall establish a system and implementing the framework for the development and advancement of a sustainable sandalwood trade in Tonga.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Oceania, Polynesia, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Resolución Nº 136-2016-SERFOR ─ Lineamientos para la elaboración de Declaraciones de Manejo para el aprovechamiento sostenible de productos forestales diferentes a la madera en asociaciones vegetales no boscosas.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba los Lineamientos para la elaboración de Declaraciones de Manejo para el aprovechamiento sostenible de productos forestales diferentes a la madera en asociaciones vegetales no boscosas, como plantas medicinales, especies arbustivas y herbáceas, vegetación acuática emergente y ribereña y otros tipos de vegetación silvestre. La finalidad es promover el aprovechamiento sostenible de productos forestales diferentes de la madera, proveniente de asociaciones vegetales no boscosas, a través del establecimiento de medidas que favorezcan su manejo y conservación, en concordancia con lo dispuesto en la Política Nacional Forestal y de Fauna Silvestre.

Policy: Energy Sector Organisation Act (2016)
Policy_Content: The Act provides the measures for achieving the national target of energy efficiency of Estonia. It sets out the requirements for improving energy efficiency and designates the obligated parties in the public as well as private sector. More specifically, it lays down rules for national energy efficiency target and strategies in the sector; national measures to achieve energy savings, improving efficiency in energy generation and energy supply; requirements for measuring energy consumption and for provision of information in order to improve final customers’ energy efficiency; general energy efficiency obligations; obligation of major energy utilities to provide information; energy audits and energy management systems; government actions in promoting energy efficiency and developing energy services; and state supervision in the sector.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: Sections 18, 27 and 28 of the Act enter into force on 1 October 2016, and sections 6, 7(1), 8(2), 10–13, 16(2) and 40(1–3) enter into force on 1 January 2017.

Policy: Kwale County Quarrying Act, 2016 (No. 11 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act regulates the activity of "quarrying" in Kwale County. It establishes the Technical Minerals Harvesting Committee. It shall advise the  County Executive Committee on operations of harvesting of common minerals and ensure the (environmentally) sustainable development of common mineral resource exploitation and observance of national norms and standards regarding such activity. Common mineral harvesting from any riverbed shall be undertaken in a way that ensures water retention. The Chief officer in charge of environment shall be responsible for the issuing of licenses under this Act.
Subject: Environment gen., Mineral resources, Water
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa

Policy: Guide d'Application de l'Arrêté n° 105/MFEPRN/SG/DGF/DDF/SACF du 06 mai 2014 fixant le mode le de cahier de charges contractuelles en République Gabonaise.
Policy_Content: Ce guide propose une méthodologie claire pour la mise en oeuvre effective des dispositions réglementaires pour un partage des bénéfices issus de l’exploitation forestière sur toute l’étendue du territoire national.  Cet outil technique résulte non seulement de nombreux échanges et ateliers, mais aussi de la capitalisation des expériences de terrain notamment dans le département de l’Ivindo. Ce guide explique comment procéder à la signature des Cahiers de Charges Contractuelles et élaborer des projets de développement local dans le cadre des Comités de Gestion et de Suivi des Projets qui devront être mis en place.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Loi n° 2016-413 du 15 juin 2016 relative à la transhumance et aux déplacements du bétail.
Policy_Content: La présente loi, composée de 35 articles repartis en sept (7) chapitres, définit les principes généraux et les règles en matière de transhumance et de déplacement du bétail. Spécifiquement, elle vise à préciser les obligations de l'Etat, des Collectivités territoriales, des éleveurs, des agriculteurs, des pasteurs, des bouviers et de toute personne intervenant dans les activités pastorales, dans le cadre de ta mobilité des animaux; prévenir les conflits de cohabitation entre les agriculteurs et les éleveurs; définir les modalités de gestion de ces conflits; lutter contre la divagation des animaux sous toutes ses formes sur le territoire national; créer les conditions de l'émergence d'un élevage stabilisé et moderne; définir tes modalités d'aménagement et de gestion des ressources pastorales.

Policy_Content: Por medio de esta Ley la Provincia de Córdoba declara de interés público la protección ambiental y el uso óptimo, responsable y racional de los recursos naturales en todas sus variantes, y en especial del espacio físico o franja de terreno colindante a todo curso de agua, a partir de la línea de ribera de que se trate y extendido hasta los treinta y cinco metros contados desde esa base.

Policy: Ordonnance du DETEC relative à la preuve de conformité des biocarburants aux exigences écologiques.
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance met en exécution l’ordonnance du 20 novembre 1996 sur l’imposition des huiles minérales. Notamment, l’article 1er établit que la présente ordonnance régit les modalités liées à l’établissement de la preuve que les biocarburants remplissent les exigences écologiques, preuve que le requérant doit apporter pour que l’allégement fiscal visé à l’article 12b de la loi du 21 juin 1996 sur l’imposition des huiles minérales soit accordé. Le texte comprend 12 articles comme suit: Objet (1er); Preuve de conformité aux exigences écologique (2); Indications sur la nature et la qualité du biocarburant (3); Indications sur les surfaces utilisées (4); Indications sur la culture et la récolte des matières premières (5); Indications sur la fabrication du biocarburant (6); Indications sur les sites de transformation et le transport (7); Procédure simplifiée (8); Bilan des gaz à effet de serre et de la charge environnementale (9); Examen et évaluation de la conformité aux exigences écologiques (10; Abrogation (11); Entrée en vigueur (12).
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: La présente ordonnance entre en vigueur le 1er août 2016.

Policy_Content: Por la presente Resolución el Grupo Mercado Común aprueba los requisitos fitosanitarios armonizados aplicados por la Organización Nacional de Protección Fitosanitaria de los Estados Partes del MERCOSUR para Pinus Spp. (Pino) según país de destino y origen.
Subject: Forestry, Cultivated plants

Policy: Resolución Legislativa Nº 1 - Plan Integral para la Amazonía (PIA) 2016 – 2035.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución Legislativa aprueba el Plan Integral para la Amazonía (PIA) 2016 – 2035, que reemplaza al Plan Maestro para el Ecodesarrollo Regional Amazónico de 1998. El Secretario Ejecutivo del Instituto para el Ecodesarrollo Regional Amazónico, realizará a través de la Dirección de Planificación del Instituto, las acciones pertinentes para la difusión y promoción del PIA 2016 - 2035. El objetivo general del PIA es definir un instrumento de planificación integral que permita alcanzar un desarrollo territorial pertinente y sustentable en la Amazonía ecuatoriana, a través del impulso de la conservación de su biodiversidad, el mejoramiento de las condiciones de vida de su población y la diversificación productiva acorde con las características propias de la región, para alcanzar el Buen Vivir de la ciudadanía en las seis provincias amazónicas.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Décret n°2016-351 du 15 juin 2016 portant création, attributions, organisation et fonctionnement du Bureau d'Etudes et d'Appui au Secteur Agricole (B2A).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée à la Présidence de la République du Benin, un Bureau d'Etudes et d'Appui au Secteur Agricole (B2A) dans le cadre de la mise en œuvre du Programme de Développement Agricole, au titre du quinquennat 2016-2021. Ce Bureau a pour objet de veiller : au respect des orientations du Chef de l'Etat et du Gouvernement en matière de politique de développement agricole ; à la construction de synergies et à l'harmonisation des interventions ; au suivi-évaluation de la mise en œuvre du programme de développement agricole au titre du quinquennat 2016-2021.

Policy: Regional Law No. 1660-Z N 963-V “On nomadic family”.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the legal basis for the preservation and support of a peculiar social institution of the indigenous small-numbered peoples of the North of the Republic of Sakha (Yakutia), a nomadic family living in extreme natural and climatic conditions, which is the basis for the conservation and development of reindeer husbandry, and is aimed at improving the socio-demographic situation in the Republic of Sakha (Yakutia) and the formation of the ethno-cultural identity of indigenous small-numbered peoples of the North, leading a nomadic way of life, in the Republic of Sakha (Yakutia). Nomadic family - a family moving during the calendar year to places of nomadic, reindeer pastures for the rational (inexhaustible) use of feed, aquatic biological and hunting resources, carrying out traditional economic activities and dealing with traditional crafts of indigenous small-numbered peoples of the North, the main function of which is the upbringing of children and the transfer from generation to generation of family values of the indigenous small-numbered peoples of the North, based on historical experience of ancestors in the field of traditional nature management, original culture, language and traditional knowledge. The objectives of this Law are: (a) to increase the status of nomadic families in the Republic of Sakha (Yakutia); and (b) establishment of a system of economic, social and legal guarantees to ensure the improvement of the living standards of the nomadic family. The targets of this Law are: (a) to create conditions for improving the demographic indicators of the indigenous small-numbered peoples of the North who are nomadic, living in the Republic of Sakha (Yakutia); (b) provision of social guarantees to members of nomadic families on the basis of the principle of targeting, differentiated and individual approach; (c) the revival and preservation of the nomadic way of life; (d) preservation of traditional knowledge, family and ethno-pedagogical traditions, respect and protection of cultural heritage; and (e) improving the conditions for the education and upbringing of children in nomadic conditions, protecting the health of members of nomadic families. The principles of state support for the nomadic family are: (a) the recognition and preservation of the nomadic way of life in the Republic of Sakha (Yakutia); (b) equal access of the nomadic family to state support in accordance with the terms of its provision; (c) consideration of the specific features of the vital activity of the nomadic family when providing state and other services by the executive authorities of the Republic of Sakha (Yakutia); and (d) providing the members of the nomadic family with equal opportunities in the fields of education, health, culture and social security. The procedure for registering the status of a nomadic family is established by the Government of the Republic of Sakha (Yakutia). In order to legalize the status of a nomadic family, register of nomadic families shall be instituted and updated in the Republic of Sakha (Yakutia). The state support of the nomadic family provides: (a) conservation and protection of places of nomadic territories for traditional nature management, traditional economic activities and a nomadic way of life; (b) ensuring the protection and preservation of family values, traditional knowledge of the indigenous small-numbered peoples of the North, leading a nomadic way of life, as an important component of the ethno-cultural development of indigenous small-numbered peoples of the North; (c) ensuring the availability of preschool, basic general and additional education without detaching children from parents who lead a nomadic way of life; (d) establishment of a quota for a targeted admission at the expense of budgetary allocations of the state budget of the Republic of Sakha (Yakutia) to organizations engaged in educational activities on the basis of a contract on targeted admission and a contract on targeted education in accordance with the legislation of the Russian Federation and the legislation of the Republic of Sakha (Yakutia); (e) ensuring the provision of annual medical preventive examinations, the provision of free medicines and preparations, as well as sanatorium-resort and rehabilitation treatment for members of the nomadic family; (f) organization and support of small forms of entrepreneurship in the collection and processing of berries and medicinal plants (wild plants), the production of traditional crafts in places of nomadic activities; (g) modernization of the republican satellite communication network in places of nomadic migration; and (h) provision of free legal aid within the framework of the state system of free legal aid in accordance with the legislation of the Republic of Sakha (Yakutia).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Fisheries, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Indigenous peoples,Traditional rights/customary rights,Traditional knowledge/indigenous knowledge,Public health,Pastoralism,Inland fisheries,Fruits/edible nuts,Wild fauna,Management/conservation,Ranching/captive breeding,Hunting rights
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Atmospheric Air Protection Act (2016)
Policy_Content: The Act determines principles for the protection of atmospheric air in Estonia. It provides for the requirements set for affecting ambient air by chemical and physical pollutants; the measures for maintaining and improving the quality of ambient air; the requirements for protection of ozone layer; the measures for mitigation of climate changes and reduction of greenhouse gas emissions; the organisation of state supervision over compliance with the requirements provided for in this Act; and the liability for failure to comply with the requirements.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Pollution control,Hazardous substances,Ozone layer,Climate change,Emissions,Governance,Liability/compensation,Basic legislation,Enforcement/compliance,Environmental standards
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Act enters into force on 1 January 2017.

Policy: Loi n°2016-411 du 15 juin 2016 relative au Système National de Métrologie en Côte d’Ivoire.
Policy_Content: Cette loi définit et détermine les unités de mesure légales utilisables et les modalités de leur utilisation, le contrôle et l'évaluation de la conformité des instruments de mesure et des produits préemballés, les conditions de fabrication, de réparation, d'importation, de vente, de détention et d'utilisation des instruments de mesure soumis au contrôle métrologique légal, les règles de contrôle et de traçabilité métrologiques par rapport aux étalons de référence, les différents acteurs de la métrologie.

Policy: Mineral Resources Regulations 2016.
Policy_Content: These Regulations, consisting of 19 sections divided into six Parts and completed by four Schedules, implement provisions of the Mineral Resources Development Act 1995. The Regulations provide for marking out of land in respect of lease or licence applications and prescribe rates of royalties and fees payable in respect of leases or licences. Schedules establish the following matters: Royalties; Fees for Licences and leases; Rent; and Prescribed minerals, such as: Metallic minerals; Industrial minerals; Semi-precious stones; and Precious stones.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: These regulations enter into force on 28 June 2016.

Policy: Decree 15 June 2016 Implementation of the tax credit for remediation of goods and areas containing asbestos.
Policy_Content: This Decree, taking into the rules adopted in the European Parliament resolution of 14 March 2013 on asbestos related occupational health threats and prospects for abolishing all existing asbestos (2012/2065(INI)), sets the provision to be applied on the territory of the Republic of Italy as regards the attribution of the tax credit for remediation interventions in relation to the asbestos presence in goods and land parcels or areas. This text determines the types of interventions eligible for the tax credit; the terms and conditions for granting the credit tax; the appropriate provisions to ensure the necessary compliance with the limit of maximum spending; the determination of the cases of revocation and forfeiture of the benefit; the recovery procedures in cases of illegitimate use of tax credit itself.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Hazardous substances,Hazardous waste,Subsidy/incentive,Procedural matters,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Waste management
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Order No. 27n of the Federal Agency of Scientific Organizations validating the Regulation on the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution Botanical Garden of Peter the Great of the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution Botanical Institute named after V.L. Komarov of the Russian Academy of Sciences as protected natural area of federal significance.
Policy_Content: This Order validates the Regulation on the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution Botanical Garden of Peter the Great of the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution Botanical Institute named after V.L. Komarov of the Russian Academy of Sciences as protected natural area of federal significance (located in St. Petersburg) defines tasks, scientific profile of the institution as natural science, legal status, organizational structure and applicable protection regime. The main purpose of the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution Botanical Garden of Peter the Great of the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution Botanical Institute named after V.L. Komarov of the Russian Academy of Sciences shall be performance of fundamental and applied research in the field of botany, ecology, forest management, plant protection, conservation of nature. The main tasks of the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution Botanical Garden of Peter the Great of the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution Botanical Institute named after V.L. Komarov of the Russian Academy of Sciences shall be as follows: (a) development of scientific foundations and methods for preserving and protecting the gene pool of plants of natural and cultural flora, introduction and acclimatization of plants; (b) creation and preservation in artificial conditions of collections of living plants (especially rare and endangered species) and other botanical species of great scientific, educational, economic and cultural importance, and also exhibitions in order to preserve biodiversity and enrich flora; and (c) conducting educational, pedagogical and scientific and educational work in the fields of botany and nature protection, ecology, plant growing and selection, decorative gardening and landscape architecture.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry
Keyword: Institution,Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Research,Forest management/forest conservation,Plant protection,Genetic resources

This Decree sets forth provisions on green care interventions and management of plant diseases and pests.

Policy_Content: Le présent décret a pour objet de déclarer d’utilité publique, l’opération relative aux travaux d’aménagement hydro-agricole de la plaine de M’Leta à partir de la station d’épuration des eaux usées d’El Karma, wilaya d’Oran, dans les wilayas d’Oran et de Mascara, en raison du caractère d’infrastructure d’intérêt général, d’envergure nationale et stratégique de ces travaux Article 1er, en application des dispositions de l’article 12 bis de la loi n° 91-11 du 27 avril 1991 fixant les règles relatives à l’expropriation pour cause d’utilité publique et, conformément aux dispositions de l’article 10 du décret exécutif n° 93-186 du 27 juillet 1993, complétée, fixant les règles relatives à l’expropriation pour cause d’utilité publique.

Policy: Cabinet Regulation No. 363 of 2016 on Procedures for Controlling, Inspecting and Detaining Ships in Latvian Waters
Policy_Content: The Regulation prescribes the procedures by which ships are controlled, inspected and detained in Latvian waters. The controlling, inspecting and detaining of ships within the exclusive economic zone of Latvia must be performed in accordance with the 1982 United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea. The Coast Guard must carry out the inspection of ships if there are grounds to believe that the ship has breached the laws and regulations governing the use of Latvian waters or provisions of the international law binding to Latvia; there are grounds to believe that manoeuvres of the ship jeopardise maritime safety; information has been received that the ship is illegally transporting firearms, explosives, illegal immigrants or is involved in other criminal offences; the ship does not provide information to the Coast Guard, the provided information is incomplete or there are grounds to suspect that false information has been provided; there is a threat of terrorism; and there are reasonable grounds to suspect that pollution of the marine environment has occurred.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea
Keyword: Marine pollution,Territorial sea,International agreement-implementation,Maritime zone,Inspection,Navigation,EEZ-Exclusive Economic Zone
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Decreto Nº 42-2016 ─ Aprueba en todas y cada una de sus partes el Acuerdo Nº 6-DGTC-2015 que contiene el Convenio Internacional sobre Cooperación, Preparación y Lucha contra la Contaminación por Hidrocarburos.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto aprueba en todas y cada una de sus partes el Acuerdo Nº 6-DGTC-2015 que contiene el Convenio Internacional sobre Cooperación, Preparación y Lucha contra la Contaminación por Hidrocarburos 1990, con el fin de proporcionar un marco global para responder a los sucesos de contaminación por hidrocarburos en los que intervienen buques, unidades mar adentro, puertos marítimos e instalaciones de manipulación de hidrocarburos que representen una seria amenaza para el medio marino.

Policy: Foresight Act (2016)
Policy_Content: This Act regulates the objective and organization of foresight. Foresight is the identification and analysis of long-term developments in the Estonian society, preparation of development scenarios on their bases together with the distinction of opportunities and risks for the society, monitoring the realization of development scenarios and, where necessary, the adjustment of development scenarios and their outcome.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Regional Decree No. 217-pp validating the Regulation on state nature complex (landscape) reserve of regional significance “Iron Gate”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes that state nature complex (landscape) reserve of regional significance “Iron Gate” is constituted with a view of preserving natural complexes of karst landscapes and a unique karst ravine in the southeastern part of the White Sea-Kuloi plateau and the karst lake system of the Karas Lake in the natural state, complexes on the site of felling and burned-out forest, maintaining the ecological balance in the catchment area of the unique Karas Lake wetland system, protecting typical and unique natural communities, rare and endangered species of plants, animals, and other organisms. Owners and tenants of land plots located within the boundaries of the reserve are obliged to observe the special protection regime established in the nature reserve. On the territory of nature reserve shall be prohibited any activity contrasting the scope of nature reserve or damaging natural complexes and components, including: (a) entry, exit and parking of all motor vehicles outside, except for service vehicles; (b) felling of forest species in the area exceeding 1 ha (except for felling for forest fire extinguishment, sanitary felling and felling related to removal dead, fallen and damaged forest stand); capture and hunting of wild fauna species that are not subject to hunting; (c) destruction and damaging mating and nesting grounds of wild fauna species, collection of eggs; (d) construction of buildings, facilities, roads and pipelines, power lines and other communications, with the exception of facilities ensuring operation of the reserve; (e) land reclamation; (f) the use of outboard engines operating on fuel derived from petroleum products except for service small-size vessels; (g) application of chemicals, mineral fertilizers, plant protection means and nutrients; (h) spring hunting except for hunting for the purpose of regulating the number of game; (i) release of alien species; (j) waste disposal; (k) exploration of subsoil and mining; (l) ploughing up of the territory; and (m) destruction or damaging warning signs and information boards.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Wetlands,Protection of habitats,Forest management/forest conservation,Forestry protection measures,Wild fauna,Wild flora,Birds,Endangered species,Game,Protection of species
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Decree enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 215-pp validating the Regulation on state nature biological reserve of regional significance “Shylovsky”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes that state nature biological reserve of regional significance "Shylovsky" shall be constituted with a view of conservation, reproduction and restoration of the population of large ungulate reindeer and moose, as well as rare and endangered species of wild flora and wild fauna valuable in economic and scientific relations, their habitats and maintain an overall ecological balance. On the territory of state nature biological reserve a differentiated regime of special protection is established by functional zones. Allocation of functional zones shall be performed in accordance with local, natural, historical, cultural and social characteristics. Owners and tenants of land plots located within the boundaries of the reserve are obliged to observe the special protection regime established in the nature reserve. On the whole territory of nature reserve shall be prohibited any activity contrasting the scope of nature reserve or damaging natural complexes and components, including: (a) entry, exit and parking of motor vehicles, except for service vehicles; (b) felling of forest species (except for felling for forest fire extinguishment, sanitary felling and felling related to removal dead, fallen and damaged forest stand); (c) exploration of subsoil and mining; (d) construction of buildings, facilities, roads and pipelines, power lines and other communications, with the exception of facilities of the local municipal unit in case of impossibility to allocate them elsewhere; (e) hunting, except for the purpose of regulation of the number of game; (f) capture and hunting of wild fauna species that are not subject to hunting; (g) destruction and damaging mating and nesting grounds of wild fauna species, collection of eggs; (h) application of toxic chemicals, mineral fertilizers, plant protection means and nutrients; (i) release of alien species; (j) drainage, land reclamation and swamp drying; (k) waste disposal; (l) grazing of cattle; (m) ploughing up of the territory except for small areas for application of biotechnical arrangements; and (o) destruction or damaging warning signs and information boards.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Protection of habitats,Wild fauna,Wild flora,Endangered species,Protection of species
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Decree enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 216-pp validating the Regulation on state nature biological reserve of regional significance “Yarensky”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes that state nature reserve of regional significance “Yarensky” shall be constituted with a view of conservation, reproduction and restoration the number of wild fauna species, natural habitats thereof and maintenance of the overall ecological balance. Owners and tenants of land plots located within the boundaries of the reserve are obliged to observe the special protection regime established in the nature reserve. On the whole territory of nature reserve shall be prohibited any activity contrasting the scope of nature reserve or damaging natural complexes and components, including: (a) entry, exit and parking of motor vehicles, except for service vehicles; (b) felling of forest species (except for felling for forest fire extinguishment, sanitary felling and felling related to removal dead, fallen and damaged forest stand); (c) geological exploration of subsoil and mining; (d) construction of buildings, facilities, roads and pipelines, power lines and other communications, with the exception of facilities of the local municipal unit in case of impossibility to allocate them elsewhere; (e) organization of sports and entertainment events, the organization of tourist camps and the development of campfires outside specially equipped places; (f) hunting, except for the purpose of regulation of the number of game; (g) capture and hunting of wild fauna species that are not subject to hunting; (h) destruction and damaging mating and nesting grounds of wild fauna species, collection of eggs; (i) application of toxic chemicals, mineral fertilizers, plant protection means and nutrients; (j) release of alien species; (k) drainage, land reclamation and swamp drying; (l) waste disposal; (m) ploughing up of the territory except for small areas for application of biotechnical arrangements; and (n) destruction or damaging warning signs and information boards.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Protection of habitats,Wild fauna,Endangered species,Protection of species
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Agreement between the Federal Service for Hydrometeorology and Environmental Monitoring (ROSHYDROMET) and the Government of Sakhalin region on cooperation in the field of hydrometeorology and related fields, environmental monitoring and monitoring of pollution on the regional territory.
Policy_Content: This Agreement defines the intentions of the Parties in the main areas of cooperation between Roshydromet and the Government of Sakhalin region on the issues referred to the subjects of joint management of the Russian Federation and the regions of the Russian Federation, requiring concerted action and joint decisions in the framework of works in the field of hydrometeorology and related fields, in the field of state environmental monitoring, improvement of the functioning of an integrated system of observations of the state of the environment in the territory of Sakhalin region, assessment and forecast of the state of  changes thereof under the impact of natural and anthropogenic factors. The Agreement is designed to strengthen cooperation between the Parties in the field of state environmental monitoring, adoption and implementation of target programs and planned environmental protection activities, providing the population and regional executive bodies with information on the state of the environment and its pollution. The main areas and forms of interaction between the Parties shall be as follows: (a) ensuring the functioning and improvement of the state observation network and territorial system of observations of the state of the environment and its pollution in the regional territory; (b) improving the efficiency of forecasting of natural disasters, phenomena and creation of optimal conditions for the improvement of the level of protection of the population and reduction of damage caused by natural disasters; (c) improvement of early warning system for the population related to dangerous natural phenomena and actual and projected changes in weather and environmental pollution, which may threaten the life and health of the population and cause damage to the environment; and (d) planning and implementation of joint programs and activities in the fields of interaction, exchange of information, working meetings and conferences on the most important issues requiring joint solutions in the of state environmental monitoring and environmental pollution on the territory of Sakhalin region.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Keyword: Contract/agreement,Pollution control,Monitoring,Disasters,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Public health,Data collection/reporting,Access-to-information
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Agreement enters into force from the date of signature.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 012-2016-EM ─ Modifica el Decreto Supremo Nº 021-2012-EM, Reglamento de la Ley Nº 29852, que crea el Sistema de Seguridad Energética en Hidrocarburos y el Fondo de Inclusión Social Energético.

Policy_Content: La presente Resolución establece la Lista Oficial de Especies Forestales Maderables Aprovechables con Fines Comerciales, aplicando las medidas para la lucha contra la tala ilegal, implementando el Módulo de Control y del Módulo de Monitoreo de la Cobertura Bosques, el proceso de zonificación y  el inventario forestal nacional que proveen información real sobre el potencial existente de los recursos forestales y las actividades forestales y de fauna silvestre, para realizar un mejor control y fiscalización del aprovechamiento, transporte, comercialización y exportación de los productos forestales y de fauna silvestre.

Policy: Resolución Nº 3.103 - Establece requisitos fitosanitarios para la importación, admisión temporal y tránsito de maquinaria usada.
Policy_Content: Mediante esta Resolución el Servicio Agrícola y Ganadero establece los requisitos fitosanitarios para la importación, admisión temporal y tránsito de maquinaria usada. El concepto de maquinaria contempla las máquinas, equipos, implementos y sus partes, de uso agrícola, forestal, jardinería, movimiento de tierra, compactadoras de basura y cualquiera otra que el Servicio determine, según el riesgo fitosanitario asociado.

Policy: Climate Leadership Act (SA 2016, c. C-16.9).
Policy_Content: The purpose of the present Act is to provide for a carbon levy on consumers of fuel to be effected through a series of payment and remittance obligations that apply to persons throughout the fuel supply chains. The revenue from the carbon levy may only be used: a) for initiatives related to reducing emissions of greenhouse gases or supporting Alberta’s ability to adapt to climate change, or b) to provide rebates or adjustments related to the carbon levy to consumers, businesses and communities, including adjustments in the form of tax credits or tax rate reductions. The text consists of 82 sections divided into 5 Parts as follows: Carbon levy on fuel (1). This Part consists of the following Divisions: Imposition of carbon levy (1); Special rules (2); Exemptions (3); Rebates and biomethane credits (4); Other circumstances in which a carbon levy is payable (5); Remittance and recovery of carbon levy (6); Registration (7); Assessments (2); Investigations, enforcement and offences (3); Administrative provisions and regulations (4); Transitional provisions, related amendments and coming into force (5). One Schedule is enclosed.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Basic legislation,Climate change,Emissions,Emissions trading,Ecofriendly products/ecofriendly processes,Air quality/air pollution,Polluter pays principle,Tax/levy,Registration,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Pollution control

Policy: Ozone-depleting Substances and Halocarbon Alternatives Regulations (SOR/2016-137).
Policy_Content: The present Regulations are made under the Canadian Environment Protection Act. In particular, the Regulations control the export, import, manufacture, sale and certain uses of ozone-depleting substances (ODS) and products containing or designed to contain them. These controls include the gradual elimination of such ODS, a requirement to obtain written authorizations for certain activities and a requirement to report on the export, import and manufacture of ODS. Several ODS have already been phased out, while hydrochlorofluorocarbons are in the process of being phased out. The Regulations also require that permits be obtained for the import, export and manufacture of hydrofluorocarbons, and that reports on these activities be submitted.The text consists of 78 sections divided into 7 Parts as follows: CFCs, Bromofluorocarbons, Bromochlorodifluoromethane, Tetrachloromethane, 1,1,1Trichloroethane, HBFCs and Bromochloromethane (1) ; Methyl Bromide (2); HCFCs (3); HFCs (4); Essential purpose (5); Notice and application for permit (6); Miscellaneous provisions (7). Seven Schedules are enclosed.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Resolution No. 263 of 2016 of Georgian Government on Rules and Procedure of Export-Importing Certain Hazardous Chemical Substances and Pesticides
Policy_Content: The Resolution provides legal rules in compliance with Rotterdam Convention on the Prior Informed Consent Procedure for Certain Hazardous Chemicals and Pesticides in International Trade and the Stockholm Convention on Persistent Organic Pollutants. The Regulation consists of 21 articles: Purpose (1); Scope of application (2); Definition of terms (3); Designated national agencies (4); Notice on chemicals and pesticides prohibited or strictly restricted by the Rotterdam Convention (5); Obligations for importing chemicals and pesticides subject to PIC Procedure (6); Documentation required for obtaining permit on importing certain hazardous chemicals and pesticides (7); Agency issuing the permit and procedure (8); Validity period and terms of import permit (9); Agency registry of import permits (10); Exchange of information between designated national agencies (11); Rules for denial of import permit and appellation (12); Duties and rights regarding import permits (13); Loss or damage to an import permit (14); Compliance control of import permit (15); Notice on export given to Parties or other countries (16); Notices received from Parties and other countries (17); Obligations associated with exporting chemicals and pesticides (18); Information that are provided together with chemicals and pesticides (19); export-import control of chemicals and pesticides (20); and Liability (21). The Regulation also includes as its annexes the list of prohibited and restricted chemicals under the Rotterdam and Stockholm Conventions as well as various forms for permits and information exchange as provided under this Regulation and the Conventions. In general, the Resolution aims to define responsibilities of individual state entities for better protection of human health and the environment; and to encourage safe use of certain hazardous substances and pesticides.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Décret D/2016/163/PRG/SGG du 13 juin 2016, portant restructuration de l'Agence Nationale d'Aménagement des Infrastructures Minières (ANAIM) et adoption de nouveaux statuts.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret définit la restructuration de l'Agence Nationale d'Aménagement des Infrastructures Minières (ANAIM) ayant pour missions : la conception, l'étude, le financement, la construction de toutes infrastructures minières en vue de faciliter l'extraction, le traitement, la transformation, la manutention, le transport et l'évacuation des substances minérales. Ces infrastructures peuvent être mises à la disposition des entreprises minières qui les utilisent, les exploitent, les gèrent et les rémunèrent à des termes et conditions convenu ; d'un commun accord. Ainsi, l'ANAIM peut charger tout opérateur compétent agréé par son Conseil d'Administration, de l’exploitation, de la gestion, de l'entretien, de la réparation et du renouvellement des infrastructures minières faisant partie de son patrimoine ; L'ANAIM peut aussi faire appel aux entreprises publiques ou privées, nationales ou étrangères pour exécuter une partie de sa mission.

Policy: Arrêté n° 058/MERF/SG/DRF du 13 juin 2016 fixant le canevas de convention des forêts communautaires au Togo (FCT).
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté fixe le canevas de rédaction de la convention de gestion des forêts communautaires au Togo. Ce texte définit la convention comme un contrat par lequel l’administration forestière confie a une communauté une forêt ou une portion de forêt du domaine de l'Etat, en vue de sa gestion durable et de son exploitation pour l'intérêt de cette communauté. Pour la gestion d'une foret communautaire, ii existe deux formes de convention: une convention provisoire qui est signée pour une durée de deux (02) ans non renouvelable; une convention définitive qui est signée pour une durée de quinze (15) ans renouvelable après approbation du Plan Simple de Gestion (PSG) par l’administration en charge des ressources forestières.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Ce texte définit la charte les règles qui organisent les droits et devoirs des membres de la communauté et sur la base desquelles ils gèrent leur forêt communautaire.

Policy: Arrêté n° 60/MERF/SG/DRF du 13 juin 2016 définissant la procédure de création ou d'attribution et la gestion des forêts communautaires au Togo (FCT).
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté fixe la procédure de création, d'attribution et la gestion des forêts communautaires au Togo en application des articles 24 et 25 de la loi n°2008-009 du 19 juin 2008 portant code forestier au Togo. En effet, la création ou l’attribution d’une forêt communautaire comporte les étapes suivantes:  l’information et sensibilisation; la constitution de l’entité juridique (un Comité Villageois de Développement (CVD); un Comité de Développement du Quartier (CDQ); une Union des CVD (UCVD); un Comité Cantonal de Développement (CCD); une Union des CCD (UCCD); une Association Villageoise de Gestion des Aires Protégées (AVGAP); une Union des A VGAP (UA VGAP)); la délimitation de la forêt communautaire; la réunion de concertation; constitution du dossier de création ou d'attribution d'une forêt communautaire; la soumission du dossier de création ou d'attribution d'une forêt communautaire; l’élaboration du plan simple de gestion et de la convention ou de la charte définitive de gestion; et la soumission, l’examen, l’approbation et signature du plan simple de gestion et du projet de convention ou de charte définitive de gestion.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Arrêté n° 57/MERF/SG/DRF du 13 juin 2016 définissant le canevas de Plan Simple de Gestion des forêts communautaires au Togo (PSG/FCT).
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté définit le canevas de plan simple de gestion des forets communautaires au Togo. Aux termes de ce règlement, le plan simple de gestion (PSG) est un document qui ressort, pour une forêt communautaire, des données sur les caractéristiques socio-économiques, le potentiel des ressources disponibles, les affectations des terres, la planification des activités à mener, et les moyens de leur mise en œuvre ainsi que les modes de gestion de ladite foret et des revenus générés. Le plan simple de gestion constitue un outil indispensable de gestion durable de la forêt communautaire et revêt un caractère obligatoire.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Law No. HO-86-N “On Medicinal Products”.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates the circulation of medicines, substances, herbal substances and preparations, and investigational medicinal products with the aim of securing safe, effective, qualitative, and affordable medicinal products and reliable information thereon to the population. This Law also defines the powers of the competent state authorities of the Republic of Armenia and the powers of entities involved in the circulation of medicinal products in this sphere. The circulation of medicinal products, substances, medicinal herb materials, and investigational medicinal products containing narcotics or psychotropic (psychoactive) substances shall be regulated by this Law unless the Republic of Armenia Law on Narcotics and Psychotropic (Psychoactive) substances directly provides otherwise. The Authorized Body of state government in the health sector shall carry out the following in the sphere of state regulation of the circulation of medicinal products: (a) policy of the Republic of Armenia Government in the sphere of circulation of medicinal products; (b) regulation of the circulation of medicinal products within the framework of its competence; (c) licensing the types of activities stipulated by law in the sphere of circulation of medicinal products, and oversight stipulated by law; (d) state registration of medicines; (e) organizing and carrying out expert examinations in the sphere of state regulation of the circulation of medicinal products; (f) issuance of a certificate for the registration of medicines, GMP, and GDP, and ensuring other inspections stipulated by this Law; (g) ensuring the maintenance of the medicines register; (h) ensuring the rational use of medicines, the pharmacovigilance, and development of appropriate recommendations; (i) international cooperation; (j) inter-agency cooperation; (k) development of state medicine policy programs and monitoring their implementation; and (l) Functions reserved for it by this Law and other laws. In the Republic of Armenia, it shall be permitted to manufacture, import, distribute, dispense, sell, and use medicinal products that are registered in the Republic of Armenia, except for medicinal products stipulated by this Law. The registration of medicinal product, refusal to register, and suspension and voiding of the registration of medicinal product shall, on the basis of an expect conclusion, be performed by the Authorized Body in accordance with the procedure established by the Republic of Armenia Government, except for veterinary vaccines, plasmas, and diagnostic materials, for which state registration, refusal to register, suspension, and voiding shall be reserved for the authorized state body in the field of agriculture under the procedure established by the Republic of Armenia Government. The Republic of Armenia Government shall approve the procedure of expert examinations performed for medicinal product registration, re-registration, and certificate maturity extension, defining the form of the conclusion issued on the basis of expert examination performed for registration, re-registration, and certificate maturity extension for new medicinal products, reproduced medicinal products, biosimilars, combinations of medicinal products, homeopathic medicinal products, biological medicinal products, including those derived from blood or plasma, immunological medicinal products, radioactive medicinal products, veterinary medicinal products (including animal fodder containing substances), herbal medicinal products (including those packaged in consumer packaging and labelled medicinal herb materials), and antiseptic and anti-parasitic medicinal products destroying disease agents for skin, mucous membrane, hair, and nails, as well as the insects carrying them and parasites. This Law consists of 10 Chapters divided into 31 Articles. Chapter 1 lays down general provisions. Chapter 2 regards state regulation of the circulation of medicinal products. Chapter 3 establishes key principles of the state policy for providing medicines to the population and the developing pharmaceutics. Chapter 4 regards the discovery of medicinal products, state registration of medicinal products and post-registration pharmacovigilance. Chapter 5 regards manufacturing of medicinal products, substances, and investigational medicinal products, processing of medicinal herb materials and preparation of medicines. Chapter 6 regards import and export of medicinal products. Chapter 7 regards trade of medicinal products. Chapter 8 regards information about medicinal products. Chapter 9 regards supervision in the sphere of medicinal products and establishes liability for the infringement of this Law. Chapter 10 lays down final and transitional provisions.
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force six months after it official publication.

Policy: Politique Agricole.
Policy_Content: La Politique agricole est un instrument stratégique à dimensions multiples: alimentaire, écologique, énergétique et industrielle. Elle s’inscrit dans le développement agricole durable qui s’entend comme étant le développement des productions végétales. La Politique Agricole est donc un instrument à portée nationale qui a pour vision de contribuer au développement soutenu du Niger par la promotion d’une agriculture modernisée, productive, compétitive, émérite à accroître la résilience des populations nigériennes face aux adversités de la nature, et apte à les entretenir dans un état de sécurité alimentaire et nutritionnelle assurée, de façon durable, tout en préservant l’environnement de production persistant, pour les générations postérieures. La politique repose sur les Axes stratégiques suivants: 1) Accroissement et diversification des productions agricoles; 2) Approvisionnement régulier des marchés ruraux et urbains en produits agricoles et agroalimentaires; 3) Amélioration de la résilience des populations face aux changements climatiques, crises et catastrophes; 4) Amélioration de l’état nutritionnel des nigériennes et des nigériens.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Water

Policy: Strategic Plan for Agricultural and Rural Statistics (SPARS) 2016 – 2025.
Policy_Content: This Strategic Plan for Agricultural and Rural Statistics is a 10-year nationwide sectoral document aiming at implementing a system that provides comprehensive, timely, transparent and reliable data using up-to-date methods for the collection, processing and dissemination of statistics that meets international standards, supporting informed decision making in the agricultural sector. To achieve the aim, the Plan sets out 3 strategic goals as follows (1) improve regulation and institutional frameworks for agricultural and rural statistics; (2) develop statistical infrastructure for agricultural and rural statistics; and (3) manage and develop agricultural and rural statistics. It is a long-term strategy to gradually introduce new methodologies and improve data quality. Through the implementation of the SPARS, the Government will achieve the following (i) evaluate the existing agricultural and rural statistics system; (ii) assess data quality; (iii) identify data gaps; (iv) determine programs and interventions needed to improve statistics; (v) collect information for  coordinating and financing agricultural and rural statistics development activities; (vi) contribute more information on integrating agricultural statistics into the national statistics system, the cost of implementing the plan, sources of funding, and technical aspects of statistics improvement work.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Fisheries, Forestry
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: National Fisheries and Aquaculture Policy (NFAP).
Policy_Content: This National Fisheries and Aquaculture Policy (NFAP) is a 5-year nationwide sectoral document that revises the National Fisheries and Aquaculture Policy of 2001 with the aim of addressing critical issues affecting fisheries and aquaculture development in Malawi such as the need for strengthening monitoring and evaluation as well as the utilization of Public-Private Partnerships (PPP). Main goal of the Policy is a sustainable increasing of fisheries and aquaculture productivity for accessible nutritious food and increased contribution to economic growth. The specific objectives are as follows (i) increase annual fish production from capture fisheries; (ii) increase small and large scale aquaculture production; (iii) strengthen participatory fisheries management regimes; (iv) halve post harvest losses; (v) increase annual fish exports; (vi) increase per capita fish consumption; (vii) improve decent employment in fishing communities for youth, women and men and to reduce the number of child laborers; (viii) promote applied research in fisheries and aquaculture and monitor the impact of pollution and environmental changes including climate change; and (ix) develop capacity of the Government and local management institutions to serve the industry.

Policy: Environment and Natural Resources Sub-Sector Gender Mainstreaming Strategy 2016-2021.
Policy_Content: This Gender Strategy is a policy document for the period of 2016-2021 at national level. It serves to provide guidance to gender mainstreaming for Environment & Natural Resources sub-sector departments, local governments, agencies, civil society / NGOs, private sector , development partners and other stakeholders in sector wider manner. The purpose is to guide the Environment & Natural Resources sub-sector to attain gender equity and equality in service delivery. Specific Objectives are: 1. To integrate gender in ENR policies, legislation, planning, budgeting, implementation, monitoring and evaluation. 2. To improve access and control of Environment and Natural Resources by men, women and vulnerable groups. 3. To promote equal opportunities for participation by men, women and vulnerable groups in planning and sustainable management of ENR at all levels. 4. To promote equitable sharing of environment and natural resource products and services. 5. To build and strengthen capacity for gender mainstreaming in Environment & Natural Resources sub-sector at all levels.
