Policy: Stratégie Nationale de Protection Sociale (SNPS) 2015-2035.
Policy_Content: La Stratégie Nationale de Protection Sociale (SNPS) est un instrument à portée nationale couvrant la période 2015-2035. Dans le long terme (horizon 2035), l’objectif est de construire un système de protection sociale accesible à toutes les Sénégalaises et à tous les Sénégalais, fournissant à chacun un revenu minimum garanti et une couverture maladie, mais aussi un filet de sécurité global assurant la résilience à tous ceux qui souffrent des chocs et des crises qui peuvent les faire basculer dans la pauvreté. Cette vision s’appuie sur les principes suivants: a) La solidarité  nationale fondée sur une acception sénégalaise qui lie les droits humains aux obligations sociales et responsabilités individuelles et collectives; b) la responsabilité  générale de l’Etat; c) la mutualisation des risques; d) la participation et la contribution de chaque citoyen au financement de la protection sociale en fonction de ses ressources; e) l’accès effectif et équitable aux services de protection sociale sans aucune discrimination, ni stigmatisation dans une perspective de contractualisation et de responsabilisation; f) l’Efficience et la gouvernance inclusive des régimes et programmes; g) la subsidiarité; et h) la pérennité financière basée sur des ressources internes.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Water
Keyword: Agricultural development,Disasters,Climate change,Smallholders/peasants,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Registration,Food security,Poverty,Social protection,Human rights,Sustainable development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy: National Forest Policy 2016.
Policy_Content: This National Forest Policy is the second nationwide sectoral document developed by the Government of Malawi with the aim of providing guidance to the management of forests, offering an enabling framework for all stakeholders to participate in the management of forests, and sustaining the contribution of the national forest resources for the improvement of the quality of life. The goal of the Policy is the conservation, establishment, protection and management of trees and forests for the sustainable development of Malawi through (1) improvement of provisions of forest goods and services; (2) control deforestation and forest degradation; (3) promoting strategies that will contribute to increased forest cover by 2% by 2021; and (4) developing a sustainable management of existing forest resources. Specific objectives of the document are (i) provide an enabling framework for promoting the participation of local communities, the civil society and the private sector in forest conservation and management; (ii) promote the establishment of forest based small and medium scale industries; (iii) promote the growing of trees in order to achieve sustainable self-sufficiency of wood and forest derived products and services; (iv) protection of the environment, conservation of biodiversity and climate change management through the forest management; (v) promote short, medium and long term financing mechanisms for the forestry sector and its contribution to GDP; (vi) development of requisite human resource commensurate with the implementation of the policy; (vii) sustainable management and utilization of forest resources based on research findings and recommendations; (viii) clearly defined forest standards and guidelines; and (ix) enhance cooperation in forestry related issues at national, regional and international levels. The Policy focuses on ten priority areas, namely 1. Community Based Forest Management; 2. Indigenous Forests, Forest Reserves, and Ecosystem Management; 3. Forest Plantations and Estates Management; 4. Forestry Regulation and Quality Control; 5. Forestry Knowledge Acquisition and Management; 6. Capacity Development for Forestry Sector; 7. Biomass Energy Development; 8. Development of Forest Based Industries; 9. Regional and International Cooperation; and 10. Financing Mechanisms. The Policy includes an Implementation Plan for the years 2015 - 2020.
Subject: Forestry, Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Sustainable development,Sustainable use,Community management,Forest management/forest conservation,Afforestation/reforestation,Forestry protection measures,Public private partnership (PPP),Business/industry/corporations,Biodiversity,Climate change,Capacity building,Ecosystem preservation,Non-timber products,Planting material/seeds,Internal trade,International trade

Policy: Social Development Sector Plan 2015/2016-2019/2020.
Policy_Content: The Social Development Sector Plan is a national policy with a cross-sectoral approach. The timeframe of the policy is 5 years between 2015/2016 and 2019/2020. The overall purposes of this Plan are to promote employment, labour productivity, protect rights of vulnerable and empower marginalised groups for gender responsive development while empowering communities to participate in the development process.

Policy: National Climate Change Management Policy, 2016
Policy_Content: This policy document is prepared by the Ministry of Natural Resources, Energy and Mining Environmental Affairs Department. The policy identifies that natural resources form a principal source of social wellbeing and economic development in Malawi and identifies the following issues that need urgent attention: Climate variability; Inadequate institutional capacity for managing climate change; Inadequate mainstreaming of climate change issues; Inadequate enforcement of climate relevant legislation; and Increasing deforestation and unsustainable land use. The overall goal of the policy is to promote climate change adaptation, mitigation, technology transfer and capacity building for sustainable livelihoods through Green Economy measures for Malawi. The policy aims to; Effectively manage the impacts of climate change through interventions that build and sustain the social and ecological resilience of all Malawians; Contribute towards the stabilization of greenhouse gas concentrations in the atmosphere at a level that would prevent dangerous human-induced interference with the climate system within a timeframe that enables social, economic and environmental development to proceed in a sustainable manner; Integrate climate change into planning, development, coordination and monitoring of key relevant sectors in a gender sensitive manner; and integrate cross-cutting issues into climate change management through an appropriate institutional framework.it seeks to achieve 6 outcomes, namely; Reduced vulnerability to climate change impacts through improved social, economic and ecological resilience; Reduced greenhouse gas emissions; Increased awareness of climate change impacts, adaptation and mitigation measures; Research, technology development and transfer and systematic observations enhanced and strengthened; Enhanced capacity to implement climate change related interventions; and Climate change and its cross cutting issues mainstreamed in development policies and in planning, development, coordination and monitoring of key relevant sectors. The principles provided for in the Malawi Constitution, the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change and the Kyoto Protocol guide the policy, these include; protection of human rights and freedoms; gender equality; sustainable development; polluter pays principle; precautionary principle; informed participation, among others. The policy concentrates on 6 priority areas for climate change management in the country, namely; climate change adaptation; climate change mitigation; capacity building, education, training and awareness; research, technology development and transfer, and systematic observation; climate change financing; and cross-cutting issues like gender considerations, population dynamics, etc
Subject: Environment gen., Water

Policy: Real Decreto Nº 253/2016 - Bases reguladoras para la concesión de subvenciones para la creación de grupos operativos supraautonómicos en relación con la Asociación Europea para la Innovación en materia de productividad y sostenibilidad agrícolas.
Policy_Content: El presente Real Decreto tiene por objeto establecer las bases reguladoras para la concesión de subvenciones, en régimen de concurrencia competitiva, para la creación de grupos operativos supraautonómicos de la Asociación Europea para la Innovación en materia de productividad y sostenibilidad agrícola (AEI-agri). La finalidad de las ayudas es impulsar la creación de grupos operativos supraautonómicos, que idearán, diseñarán y redactarán sus correspondientes proyectos innovadores que previsiblemente ejecutarán en un futuro, los cuales podrán ser objeto de otra línea de subvención dentro del Programa Nacional de Desarrollo Rural 2014-2020.

Policy: Real Decreto Nº 254/2016 - Bases reguladoras de la concesión de ayudas a la cooperación para el suministro sostenible de biomasa en el marco del Programa Nacional de Desarrollo Rural 2014-2020.
Policy_Content: El presente Real Decreto tiene por objeto  establecer las bases reguladoras para la concesión, en régimen de concurrencia competitiva, de subvenciones para el apoyo financiero a proyectos de cooperación para el suministro sostenible de biomasa entre agentes que la reciben o la proveen, destinada la producción de energía en la transformación de los productos agroalimentarios. En la cooperación participarán al menos dos de las siguientes figuras, una entidad asociativa prioritaria, una PYME agroalimentaria supraautonómica u otra persona física o jurídica, siendo imprescindible la participación de una entidad asociativa prioritaria o una PYME agroalimentaria supraautonómica. Las ayudas reguladas mediante este Real Decreto de bases se encuentran enmarcadas en el Programa Nacional de Desarrollo Rural, financiado por el Ministerio de Agricultura, Alimentación y Medio Ambiente (MAGRAMA) y el Fondo Europeo Agrícola de Desarrollo Rural (FEADER) y regulado por el Reglamento (UE) relativo a la ayuda al desarrollo rural a través del Fondo Europeo Agrícola de Desarrollo Rural (FEADER).

Policy: Ley Nº 20.930 – Establece el derecho real de conservación medioambiental.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece el marco jurídico que reconoce y regula el derecho real de conservación medioambiental. Se trata de un derecho real que faculta a su titular a conservar el patrimonio ambiental de un predio o de ciertos atributos o funciones de éste. Este derecho se constituye en forma libre y voluntaria por el propietario del predio en beneficio de una persona natural o jurídica determinada. La facultad de conservar se ejercerá de conformidad a las normas establecidas en esta Ley y en el contrato constitutivo.
Subject: Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Decreto Nº 947 - Modifica el Decreto Único Reglamentario del Sector Administrativo Agropecuario, Pesquero y de Desarrollo Rural, en lo relacionado con la medidas para garantizar la continuidad en el recaudo e inversión de los recursos de los fondos parafiscales del sector agropecuario y pesquero en caso de liquidación de un fondo.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto modifica el Decreto Único Reglamentario del Sector Administrativo Agropecuario, Pesquero y de Desarrollo Rural, en lo relacionado con la reglamentación de las medidas necesarias para garantizar la continuidad en el recaudo e inversión de los recursos de los fondos parafiscales del sector agropecuario y pesquero, en caso de liquidación de un fondo. La liquidación de un fondo parafiscal no suspenderá la causación y recaudo de la cuota parafiscal respectiva mientras legalmente subsistan las normas que la regulen. La cuota parafiscal se seguirá causando de conformidad con la ley que la regule y deberá ser recaudada por las personas o empresas previstas en cada ley. Los activos y pasivos existentes a la fecha en que se ordene la liquidación del fondo parafiscal se entregarán al liquidador designado por quien ordene la liquidación a fin de darle continuidad al trámite de la liquidación.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Circular 15/2016/TT-BNNPTNT on the conditions and eligibility criteria of agricultural cooperatives for investment support in infrastructure development.
Policy_Content: This Circular, consisting of 7 articles, establishes the requirements, conditions and eligibility criteria of agricultural cooperatives for benefiting from investment support in infrastructure development. It specifies conditions and criteria for enjoying the above mentioned investment supports for infrastructure development of cooperatives and cooperative unions operating in the fields of agriculture, cultivation, husbandry, forestry, fishery, salt-making and irrigation (collectively called as agricultural cooperatives). This Circular applies to the cooperative agricultural product supply service and its members engaged in agricultural production and agencies, organizations, individuals involved in infrastructure development. In addition, a list of related infrastructures of agricultural cooperative is appended to the text warehouses and stores of agricultural supplies; processing workshops: preservation and processing of agricultural products; slaughterhouses for cattle and poultry. electric works, running water and markets: low-voltage electricity systems for production, preliminary processing and processing in the fields of agriculture, forestry, fishery and salt production; water works, including water supply pipelines; wholesale markets, auctions of agricultural products; irrigation water works, dams, canals and reservoirs, and shores of various types, water supply systems for irrigation; infrastructure works for aquaculture (including mariculture).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Fisheries, Forestry, Water
Keyword: Cooperative/producer organization,Irrigation,Subsidy/incentive,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Agricultural development,Financial agricultural measures,Aquaculture,Mariculture,Animal production,Water supply,Waterworks

Policy: Pacific Catastrophe Risk Insurance Facility Act 2016 (No. 1 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act establishes the Pacific Catastrophe Risk Insurance Facility as agreed at the 2015 Forum Economic Ministers' Meeting. The facility is established in the form of a foundation and a Pacific Catastrophe Risk Insurance Company. The foundation shall - (a) establish and own a company to undertake captive insurance activities on behalf of the Foundation for the benefit of each of its member countries; and (b) develop, review, and approve the strategic plan for the Pacific Catastrophe Risk Insurance Facility. The Foundation is the sole shareholder of the Company. No Act of the Cook Islands, or any regulation, by-law, or rule may- (a) impose on the Foundation or the company (or both)- (i) any liability, duty, responsibility, obligation, or restrictions: (ii) any fee, impost, tax, levy, dues, duty, or excise: (iii) any fine or penalty: (b) require, in relation to the Foundation or the Company ( or both),- (i) the deposit of any money in any public account: (ii) the filing of any accounts, returns, reports, or records: (iii) the licensing or registration of the Foundation.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen.

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto crea la Unidad de Proyección Social y Asuntos Comunitarios de la Presidencia de la República, con el propósito de apoyar e impulsar, así como gestionar y dar respuesta oportuna sin detrimento a las atribuciones establecidas de las diferentes Secretarías de Estado, a los temas sociales en materia de educación, salud, mujer, niñez, adolescencia, familia, adulto mayor, ayudas económicas y desarrollo social sostenible entre otras, a fin de fomentar una mejor calidad de vida en las familias que viven en condiciones de pobreza en las zonas urbanas y rurales del país.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Decreto N° 2.350 - Crea el Ministerio del Poder Popular de Desarrollo Minero Ecológico.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto crea el Ministerio del Poder Popular de Desarrollo Minero Ecológico, y dispone que el Ministerio del Poder Popular de Petróleo y Minería, pase a denominarse Ministerio del Poder Popular de Petróleo.
Subject: Mineral resources

Policy: Decreto Nº 41-2016 ─ Reglas para prevenir la contaminación atmosférica ocasionada por los buques.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto aprueba el Anexo VI de MARPOL sobre las Reglas para prevenir la contaminación atmosférica ocasionada por los buques, para prevenir la contaminación atmosférica ocasionada por los buques y que se encuentra vinculada a la estrategia nacional para prevenir la Contaminación de las aguas jurisdiccionales de Honduras.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Fisheries, Sea
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Décret n° 2016-504/PRES/PM/MFPTPS/MS/MFSNF du 09 juin 2016 portant détermination de la liste des travaux dangereux interdits aux enfants
Policy_Content: Le présent décret, pris en application de l’article 153 du Code du Travail, détermine la liste des travaux dangereux interdits aux enfants (toute personne âgée de moins de dix-huit Ans) au Burkina Faso.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Fisheries, Forestry, Mineral resources, Cultivated plants

Policy: Act amending the Energy Efficiency Act.
Policy_Content: The present Act introduces some amendments to the Energy Efficiency Act of 24 April 2008. In particular, the Act amends article 4 dealing with promotion principles establishing that certain measures listed in this article shall not be promoted. The text consists of 2 articles.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: The present Act enters into force on 9 June 2016.

Policy: Act amending the Energy Efficiency Evidence Act.
Policy_Content: The present Act introduces some amendments to the Energy Efficiency Evidence Act of 23 May 2007. In particular, the Act amends article 2 concerning protected buildings.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: The present Act enters into force on 9 June 2016.

Policy: Guideline No. 1 dated 9 June 2016 on the rules and procedures for examining and approving lease requests for the use of public pasture and forestry funds.
Policy_Content: The Guideline provides for areas of the public forestry and pasture fund that may be leased according to the public competition/bidding procedures. The forestry authorities assess the forestry and pasture areas at the beginning of the year and submit the proposed list of leases to the municipality together with a detailed report on their potential use. The leases should comply with the law requirements regarding the allowed activities as well as the long- and short-term management plans. Further, the Guideline sets forth the institutional and regulatory frameworks for the auction procedures including rules of procedure for lease advertising, bids evaluation, and lease awards. Templates of the technical- economical evaluation reports are attached to the guidelines.
Subject: Livestock, Forestry, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Guideline enters into force after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2016/1387 amending Annexes I and III to Council Regulation (EC) No. 2173/2005 following a Voluntary Partnership Agreement with Indonesia for a FLEGT licensing scheme for imports of timber into the European Union.
Policy_Content: This Regulation amends Annexes I and III to Council Regulation (EC) No. 2173/2005 on the establishment of a FLEGT licensing scheme for imports of timber into the European Community. The amendments concern the entry referring to Indonesia. They take into account the Voluntary Partnership Agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Indonesia, which entered into force on 1 May 2014.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Regional Law No. 28-RZ amending Regional Law No. 10-RZ “On environmental protection”.
Policy_Content: Article 4 shall be amended to add the following wording: “Objects of environmental protection against pollution, exhaustion, degradation. Damaging, destruction and other negative environmental impact of economic and other activities shall be environmental components, natural objects and ecosystems”.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force ten days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 26-RZ amending Regional Law No. 40-RZ “On protected areas”.
Policy_Content: Article 2 shall be amended to add the following wording: “System of protected areas of regional significance shall include: (a) natural parks; (b) state nature reserves; (c) nature monuments; and (d) dendrological parks and botanical gardens. System of protected areas of local significance shall include: (a) recreational areas; and (b) nature micro-reserves”.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Rural Affairs and Social Enterprise (Transfer of Departmental Administration and Ministerial Functions) Order 2016 (S.I. No. 308 of 2016).
Policy_Content: These Regulations transfer the functions vested in the Minister for the Environment, Community and Local Government by or under specified legislation to the Minister for Arts, Heritage and the Gaeltacht. Functions are related to (rural) social affairs.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Resolución Nº RES-MA-2016-14 — El Ministerio de Agricultura adopta el concepto de Agricultura Familiar.
Policy_Content: Por la presente Resolución el Ministerio de Agricultura adopta el concepto de Agricultura Familiar, como un sistema de producción en el que se desarrollan actividades agropecuarias y no agropecuarias, en un territorio determinado, donde la gestión, los ingresos y el trabajo de la unidad productiva se caracteriza mayormente por los vínculos familiares y emplea ocasionalmente mano de obra contratada. Las actividades productivas incluyen cultivos, pecuaria, pesca artesanal, acuacultura, agroforestería, agregación de valor, mientras que las actividades no agropecuarias comprenden artesanía servicios rurales y turismo rural. La producción de la agricultura familiar va dirigida tanto para el consumo de las familias, como para el mercado. Se crea el Consejo Consultivo de la Agricultura Familiar, con el propósito de dar seguimiento y apoyo a los planes estratégicos para su fortalecimiento.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Fisheries
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Decreto Nº 172/016 - Se crea el Sistema Nacional Ambiental con el el cometido de fortalecer, articular y coordinar las políticas públicas nacionales en las temáticas de ambiente, agua y cambio climático.
Policy_Content: En virtud de este Decreto se crea el Sistema Nacional Ambiental, cuyo objetivo es el de fortalecer, articular y coordinar las políticas públicas nacionales en materia ambiental, de agua y cambio climático. La finalidad es alcanzar un desarrollo  ambientalmente sostenible, promoviendo la protección y el uso racional del agua, incrementando la resiliencia al cambio climático. El Sistema está integrado por: el Presidente de la República; el Gabinete Nacional Ambiental; la Administración de Obras Sanitarias del Estado; el Instituto Uruguayo de Metereología; el Sistema Nacional de Respuesta al Cambio Climático; el Sistema Nacional de Emergencias; la Secretaría Nacional de Ambiente, Agua y Cambio Climático.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Climate change,Institution,Sustainable development,Integrated management,Governance,Freshwater resources management,Sustainable use
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 67 - Medidas de protección y conservación de los arrecifes y comunidades coralinas del Ecuador.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo expide las Medidas de protección y conservación de los arrecifes y comunidades coralinas del Ecuador, cuyo objetivo es promover la protección y conservación de los arrecifes y comunidades coralinas en todo el territorio nacional, tanto dentro y fuera de áreas protegidas, incluyendo sus aguas jurisdiccionales. Corresponde al Ministerio del Ambiente la formulación, planificación y ejecución de políticas para la conservación de los recursos naturales; así como realizar inventarios de los recursos naturales y fomentar y desarrollar programas de formación ambiental formal y no formal. A través de la Subsecretaría de Gestión Marina y Costera, deberá velar y ejecutar acciones necesarias para el manejo integral del ecosistema marino especialmente en fondos rocosos y arrecifes de coral, para preservar los bienes y servicios que generan y promover su investigación.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Regulation No. 435 date 8.6.2016 amending and supplementing Regulation No. 1374 date 10.10.2008 on rules and rules of procedure for removal, addition, and change in the destination of the pasture fund.
Policy_Content: Regulation 435 of 2016 amends and supplements certain definitions laid down in Regulation 1347 of 2008 as well as its sections 7, 12, and 17. According to the amendment, the line Ministry has to request a technical report from the municipality within one week of an application submission while the municipality has to respond and prepare a technical report within 10 days of the request. Further, the value of the removed pasture area has to be paid in full before the approval is issued. The responsible departments at municipalities and the ministry update the forest and pasture cadastre accordingly.
Subject: Livestock, Forestry, Land & soil
Keyword: Pastoralism,Special fund,Authorization/permit,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Agro-forestry,Forest management/forest conservation
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Regulation No. 438 date 8.6.2016 on the criteria and rules of forests exploitation and sale of timber and other forestry and non-forestry products.
Policy_Content: This Regulation sets forth criteria and rules regarding the exploitation of forests and the sale of timber and other forestry and non-forestry products with the purpose of responding to public demand for fire logs while preserving the forests health.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Timber,Timber extraction/logging,Non-timber products,Internal trade

Policy: Regulation 438 date 8.6.2016 on the criteria and rules of forest exploitation and sale of timber and other forestry and non-forestry products.
Policy_Content: This Regulation sets forth criteria and rules for forest exploitation and trade of timber and other forestry and non-forestry products in order to provide supply for the demand of the local population for fire wood while not violating the rules laid down by Law 5/2016 on the moratorium on forests in the republic of Albania.

Policy: Regulation No. 434 date 8.6.2016 amending and supplementing Regulation No. 1353 date 10.10.2008  on the rules of submission of applications, gathering of documentation, criteria and procedures for benefiting from the Forestry Fund.
Policy_Content: Regulation 434 of 2016 amends and supplements various definitions stipulated in Regulation 1353 of 2008 as well as its sections 7, 11, and 16. The changes in section 7 concern the rules of procedure for the review of the applications by the municipal structures while changes in sections 11 and 16 deal with the procedures for the assessment, removal, and/or changes in destination of certain forestry areas from the forestry fund.

Policy: Regulation No. 427 date 8.6.2016 on the organization and functioning of the National Agency of Territory Planning.
Policy_Content: The National Agency of Territory Planning (NATP) is a public agency under the authority of the ministry responsible for territory and urban planning. The Agency performs coordinating functions in the process of preparing and drafting planning and development documents and supports vertical and horizontal coordination between authorities involved in this process.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Radiation Act (2016)
Policy_Content: The Act provides for the basic safety requirements for the protection of people and the environment against the adverse impact of ionizing radiation; the rights and obligations of persons in using ionizing radiation; the requirements for radiation practices; the organisation of state supervision over compliance with the requirements provided for in this Act; the liability for failure to comply with the requirements provided for in this Act. The Act regulates radiation practices and activities where natural radiation sources may cause a significant increase of the exposure incurred by workers or members of the public; intervention in the case of accidental and existing exposure; radioactive residues, waste and emissions; radiation practice licences; and radiation practice licences for importation, exportation and transit of radioactive waste. The Act does not regulate exposures to radon in dwellings, exposure caused by cosmic radiation at ground level or overground exposure to radionuclides present in the undisturbed earth's crust untouched by human activity.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Radiation,Public health,Environmental standards,Governance,Liability/compensation,Disasters,Authorization/permit,Hazardous waste,Transboundary movement of waste,Residues,Transport/storage,Emissions,Waste management
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Act enters into force on 1 November 2016.

Policy: Regulation establishing the construction right in forests and on forest land owned by the Republic of Croatia.
Policy_Content: This Regulation here determines the necessary procedure and criteria for establishing the right to build or construct in forests and on forest land if owned by the Republic of Croatia, which are managed by the Croatian Forestry Company, also for the purpose of the construction of golf courses and camps.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Public forest,Right of use,Procedural matters

Policy: Décret n° 2016-759 du 7 juin 2016 relatif aux fonds de mutualisation des risques sanitaires et environnementaux en agriculture.

Policy_Content: Le présent décret prévoit les modalités d'élaboration des évaluations des émissions de gaz à effet de serre et de polluants atmosphériques prévues pour les PDU par l'article L. 1214-8-1 du code des transports et pour les PLU valant PDU par l'article L. 153-30 du code de l'urbanisme.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Norfolk Island Administration Act 2016.
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the administration of Norfolk Island. New South Wales may enter into arrangements with the Commonwealth for the effective application and administration of the laws in force in Norfolk Island. Without limiting the generality of subsection(1), such an arrangement may provide for the exercise of powers by: a) an authority of New South Wales, or b) an employee of New South Wales, in or in relation to Norfolk Island. In particular, it establishes that the powers under arrangement with Commonwealth are as follows: 1) An authority or employee of New South Wales may exercise any power conferred on the authority or employee by or under an arrangement between New South Wales and the Commonwealth under this Act; 2) A power vested in an authority or employee of New South Wales by or under the Norfolk Island Act may be exercised by the authority or employee if such an arrangement authorises the authority or employee to exercise that power.
Subject: Land & soil, Sea
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force on 7 June 2016.

Policy: Resolución Nº 255-2016-MINAGRI ─ Estrategia por Resultados del Sector Agricultura y Riego.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba la Estrategia por Resultados del Sector Agricultura y Riego, dentro de los lineamientos estratégicos y en el marco del Eje de Política 12 de la Política Nacional Agraria: Desarrollo Institucional, que se propone implementar un sistema integrado de seguimiento y evaluación de los programas y proyectos en el sector agrario: evidencias, estudios, experiencias y modelos exitosos y resultados. La Dirección General de Seguimiento y Evaluación de Políticas del Ministerio de Agricultura y Riego (MINAGRI), a través de su Dirección de Seguimiento y Evaluación de Políticas, está a cargo de efectuar el seguimiento y la supervisión del cumplimiento de las políticas nacionales y sectoriales, planes sectoriales, normas en materia agraria, y de los objetivos de los programas y proyectos especiales del MINAGRI, por lo que es necesario contar con un instrumento que permita articular las actividades de seguimiento y evaluación que realizan los órganos, programas, proyectos especiales y organismos públicos orientadas al logro de los objetivos del Sector.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants, Water
Keyword: Institution,Agricultural development,Policy/planning,Monitoring,Data collection/reporting,Plant production,Agricultural commodities,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Freshwater resources management,Irrigation,Pollution control

Policy: Resolución Nº 087-2016-CONCYTEC ─ Directiva que regula el Repositorio Nacional Digital de Ciencia, Tecnología e Innovación de Acceso Abierto.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba la Directiva que regula el Repositorio Nacional Digital de Ciencia, Tecnología e Innovación de Acceso Abierto, que establece los procedimientos que regulan el funcionamiento del Repositorio Nacional Digital de Ciencia, Tecnología e Innovación de Acceso Abierto, también denominado “Acceso Libre a la Información Científica para la Innovación” (ALICIA).

Policy: Ley Nº 30477 - Ley que regula la ejecución de obras de servicios públicos autorizadas por las municipalidades en las áreas de dominio público.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene el objeto de regular los procedimientos para la ejecución de obras de servicios públicos de saneamiento, electricidad, telecomunicaciones, gas natural y de servicios públicos locales, con la finalidad de mitigar el impacto negativo en las áreas de dominio público, en favor de los ciudadanos, que autoricen las municipalidades. La presente Ley se aplica a gobiernos locales y a las empresas públicas, privadas y mixtas que prestan: a) Servicios de saneamiento (agua potable, alcantarillado sanitario y pluvial y disposición sanitaria de excretas); b) Servicios eléctricos (suministro, transmisión y distribución de energía eléctrica); c) Servicios de telecomunicaciones (servicios portadores, servicios finales, servicios de difusión y servicios de valor añadido); d) Servicio de distribución de gas natural; e) Servicios públicos locales.
Subject: Energy, Water
Keyword: Energy conservation/energy production,Business/industry/corporations,Public private partnership (PPP),Environmental audit,Environmental standards,EIA,Natural gas,Local government,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Water supply,Potable water,Sewerage,Waste disposal,Waste domestic sources,Waste non-domestic sources,Water quality standards

Policy: Law No. 78 “On ensuring fire safety”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Law shall be to protect human life and public health, private and public property by ensuring fire safety through application of forest fire safety arrangements. In relation to forest fire safety arrangements along with the provisions set forth by this Law shall be observed also the provisions of other normative legislative acts. Forest fire safety shall be the responsibility of local government and Forest service staff.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Forest service/forest officers,Forest fires,Local government
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Décret n°350-PR-MPERNFM du 7 juin 2016 fixant les conditions d’exploitation du Kévazingo et de l’Ozigo.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe les conditions d’exploitation (toute opération de reconnaissance, de coupe des arbres sur pied et de transformation à des fins déterminées)  du Kévazingo et de l’Ozigo. Le présent décret abroge toutes dispositions antérieures contraires, notamment celles du décret n°137/PR/MEFEPEPN du 04 février 2009 portant mise en réserve de certaines espèces végétales à usages multiples de la forêt gabonaise.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Land Leases (Amendment) Act, 2016 (No. 10 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act amends the Land Leases Act by deleting “Companies Act [CAP 191]” (wherever occurring) and  substituting “Companies Act No. 25 of 2012. It also makes amendments to section 4 on registration of leases held by companies in the Land Leases Register.

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 91 - Medidas sobre los recursos forestales y arbolado público.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo del Consejo Municipal de Panamá dicta medidas sobre los recursos forestales y arbolado público, con el objetivo general de establecer acciones para la conservación, protección y promoción de los recursos forestales ubicados en el distrito de Panamá, en el área urbana y rural, así como determinar el procedimiento para al control y manejo, la obtención de permisos de poda, tala y trasplante de árboles. El Municipio de Panamá, por conducto de la Dirección de Gestión Ambiental, tiene la función de la conservación y protección del arbolado público de aquella parte del patrimonio municipal que constituyen las áreas de uso público, tales como las áreas verdes, parques, paseos, jardines en áreas contiguas a las vías públicas.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Decreto Nº 39756-MTSS-MBSF ─ Modifica el Decreto Nº 38202-MTSS-MBSF, Reglamento parcial de la Ley Nº 5.662, Ley de Desarrollo Social y Asignaciones Familiares.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto modifica el Reglamento parcial de la Ley de Desarrollo Social y Asignaciones Familiares y del Fondo de desarrollo social y asignaciones familiares (FODESAF), en aspectos relacionados con los criterios para la selección de los beneficiarios de los programas de Beneficio de Asignación Familiar y de Prestaciones Alimentarias, ajustando el derecho de acuerdo al principio de legalidad, previendo además una mayor eficacia en la ejecución de los recursos.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Written Laws (Miscellaneous Amendments) Act, 2016 (No. 3 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act amends various written laws including the Economic and Organized Crime Control Act. This Act, among other things, gives a new meaning to "Court" for purposes of that Act and inserts a definition of “corruption offence”. The Court for purposes of the principal Act shall be Corruption and Economic Crimes Division, which is established within the High Court by this Act. This Act also sets out the jurisdictional competence of the Court, provides with respect to proceedings and makes the Whistleblower and Witness Protection Act and any other relevant law applicable in matters relating to witness protection under this Act. The principal Act is also amended in the First Schedule, which defines economic offences. Such offences include offences under specified provisions of wildlife legislation (Cap. 282 and 283), offences committed under the Territorial Sea and Exclusive Economic Zone Act, an offence under section 18 of the Deep Sea Fishing Authority Act, an offences section 18 of the Mining Act, an offence under section 32, 18 or 114 of the Tanzania Food and Drugs Control Act, and an offence under section 86 or 89 of the Forest Act.
Subject: Food & nutrition, Fisheries, Forestry, Mineral resources, Sea, Wild species & ecosystems, General
Keyword: Offences/penalties,Marine fisheries,Fraud/deceit/adulteration,Timber,Timber extraction/logging,Forest management/forest conservation,Wildlife products,Wild flora,Wild fauna
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Ratification of International Agreements Act, 2016 (No. 34 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act concerns the process of ratification of international multilateral agreement by Zambia and incorporation of such agreements into national law. The ratification process shall be initiated by the Minister responsible for the subject matter of the international agreement. Cabinet shall consider and approve or disapprove a proposal set out in a Cabinet Memorandum to ratify an international agreement. Agreements shall be ratified by the National Assembly. Where the National Assembly has approved the ratification of an international agreement in accordance with section five, the Ministry responsible for the subject matter of the international agreement shall, where necessary, initiate the domestication process. An international agreement may be domesticated by— (a) an Act that sets out the international agreement in a schedule; (b) setting out salient provisions of the international agreement, in the substantive part of an Act, that will require specific interventions or measures to be undertaken, and annexing the international agreement to the Act; (c) rephrasing the terms of the international agreement in an Act and annexing the agreement to the Act; (d) adopting, in an Act, the terms of the international agreement in its entirety; or (e) the use of any other enforceable means, where applicable. The Ministry responsible for foreign affairs shall cause to be laid before the National Assembly, annually, a report on international agreements.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Bushfires Management Act 2016.
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 111 sections divided into seven Parts and completed by one Schedule, provides for the protection of life, property and the environment through the mitigation, management and suppression of bush fires. It establishes provisions to control forest fires and specifies protecting forest measures. Subject to the direction and control of the Chief Executive Officer, the executive director is responsible for the management of Bushfires NT. The functions of the executive director are: a) to implement measures for the mitigation, management and suppression of bushfires; and b) to assist the Council and each regional committee generally in the exercise of its powers and the performance of its functions and duties; and c) to determine how Government funded firefighting assets are to be allocated among volunteer bushfire brigades. The executive director has the powers necessary to perform the executive director's functions. The executive director may, by written notice given to the captain of a volunteer bushfire brigade, direct the captain to transfer Government funded firefighting assets held by the brigade and specified in the notice to another brigade specified in the notice. The executive director may delegate any of the executive director's powers and functions under this Act to a public sector employee. The Chief Executive Officer: has  all the powers of the executive director; and may perform any of the functions of the executive director.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest fires,Institution,Protected area,Zoning,Forest management/forest conservation,Indigenous peoples
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force on 2 November 2016.

Policy: Coastal Management Act 2016.
Policy_Content: The objects of this Act are to manage the coastal environment of New South Wales in a manner consistent with the principles of ecologically sustainable development for the social, cultural and economic well-being of the people of the State, and in particular: (a) to protect and enhance natural coastal processes and coastal environmental values including natural character, scenic value, biological diversity and ecosystem integrity and resilience, and (b) to support the social and cultural values of the coastal zone and maintain public access, amenity, use and safety, and (c) to acknowledge Aboriginal peoples' spiritual, social, customary and economic use of the coastal zone, and (d) to recognise the coastal zone as a vital economic zone and to support sustainable coastal economies, and (e) to facilitate ecologically sustainable development in the coastal zone and promote sustainable land use planning decision-making, and (f) to mitigate current and future risks from coastal hazards, taking into account the effects of climate change, and (g) to recognise that the local and regional scale effects of coastal processes, and the inherently ambulatory and dynamic nature of the shoreline, may result in the loss of coastal land to the sea (including estuaries and other arms of the sea), and to manage coastal use and development accordingly, and (h) to promote integrated and co-ordinated coastal planning, management and reporting, and (i) to encourage and promote plans and strategies to improve the resilience of coastal assets to the impacts of an uncertain climate future including impacts of extreme storm events, and (j) to ensure co-ordination of the policies and activities of government and public authorities relating to the coastal zone and to facilitate the proper integration of their management activities, and (k) to support public participation in coastal management and planning and greater public awareness, education and understanding of coastal processes and management actions, and (l) to facilitate the identification of land in the coastal zone for acquisition by public or local authorities in order to promote the protection, enhancement, maintenance and restoration of the environment of the coastal zone, and (m) to support the objects of the Marine Estate Management Act 2014.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Keyword: Coastal zone management,Land-use planning,Policy/planning,Environmental planning,Wetlands,Marine area,Sustainable development,Indigenous peoples,Sustainable use
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force on 3 April 2018.

Policy: Regional Law No. 31-ZAO “On industrial policy”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that industrial policy shall be intended complex of legal, economic, organizational and other arrangements directed at the development of industrial potential at the regional level. Il shall not be applicable to tobaccos and manufacturing of liquors and spirits for alimentary purposes. It shall be applicable to mining and extraction of minerals, including hydrocarbons, energy generation and distribution, forest management for the purpose of timber extraction and timber processing. This Regional Law regulates relations originating between subjects operating in the sphere of industry, regional and state bodies and local self-government in the process of formation and implementation of industrial policy. The tasks of industrial policy shall be as follows: (a) formation and development of modern industry; (b) stimulation of industrial activity; (c) increase of industrial production output; (d) promotion of innovations and research in industry; (e) application of best available industrial technologies and methods; and ensuring technological independence of the regional economy. Particular attention shall be paid to promotion of inter-regional and international cooperation in various branches of industry.
Subject: Energy, Forestry, Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 001-2016-MC ─ Modifica el Decreto Supremo Nº 011-2006-ED, Reglamento de la Ley Nº 28296, Ley general del patrimonio cultural de la nación.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo modifica el Reglamento de la Ley general del patrimonio cultural de la nación, en relación a la necesidad de garantizar la protección, preservación y conservación de los bienes inmuebles integrantes del Patrimonio Cultural de la Nación, disponiendo que para la ejecución de toda obra pública o privada de edificación nueva, remodelación, restauración, ampliación, refacción, acondicionamiento, demolición, puesta en valor o cualquier otra que involucre un bien inmueble integrante del Patrimonio Cultural de la Nación, requiere de la autorización del Ministerio de Cultura (MC). Las intervenciones en bienes inmuebles arqueológicos se rigen por las disposiciones especiales emitidas por el MC sobre la materia.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Protection of Traditional Knowledge, Genetic Resources and Expressions of Folklore Act, 2016 (No. 16 of 2016).
Policy_Content: The Act concerns protection of traditional knowledge (including knowledge relating to  sustainable agriculture and biodiversity-related knowledge) and cultural expressions in Zambia. This Act protects— (a) a holder against infringement of the holder’s rights in relation to traditional knowledge, genetic resources and expressions of folklore; (b) traditional knowledge and expressions of folklore against misappropriation, misuse and unlawful exploitation; (c) an equitable balance between the rights and interests of holders and users; (d) genetic resources found in-situ and ex-situ against misappropriation and illegal exploitation; and (e) improper grant and exercise of intellectual property rights in traditional knowledge, genetic resources and expressions of folklore. Despite anything to the contrary, this Act shall not apply to— (a) the access, use and exchange of traditional knowledge, genetic resources and expressions of folklore by an owner or among traditional communities, as the case may be; and (b) the sale of produce of biological resources for direct consumption that do not involve the use of genetic resources. A “holder” means a traditional community, an individual or a group, irrespective of the pattern of ownership, and who is the owner of the traditional knowledge, genetic resource or expression of folklore in a traditional and intergenerational context who has a right over or to whom traditional knowledge, a genetic resource or expression of folklore belongs to, in accordance with customary laws and practices.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Cultivated plants, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Traditional knowledge/indigenous knowledge,Access and benefit-sharing,Traditional rights/customary rights,International agreement-implementation,Cultural heritage,Genetic resources,PIC-prior informed consent,Biodiversity,Basic legislation
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Ley de Desarrollo Rural Sustentable del Estado de Colima. Texto consolidado.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto: 1) Mejorar de manera integral la calidad de vida de la sociedad; 2) Incorporar a la sociedad rural al desarrollo económico del Estado, de manera  competitiva y sustentable; 3) Fomentar la protección y mejoramiento de los recursos naturales y los servicios  ambientales en el medio rural del Estado; 4) Coadyuvar con el cumplimiento de las normas que aseguren la sanidad,  inocuidad y calidad agroalimentaria; 5) Contribuir a la seguridad y autosuficiencia alimentaria en el Estado; 6) Fomentar el empleo de estrategias de mitigación y adaptación a los efectos del cambio climático. La Ley se compone de los siguientes Títulos: I) Disposiciones generales; II) De la planeación y coordinación de la política para el desarrollo sustentable; III) Del fomento agropecuario y de desarrollo rural sustentable.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Water
Keyword: Agricultural development,Basic legislation,Sustainable development,Food sovereignty,Indigenous peoples,Climate change,Institution,Food security,Waterworks,Irrigation
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy: Loi n°2016-002 du 04 juin 2016 portant loi-cadre sur l’aménagement du territoire.
Policy_Content: Le titre premier I fixe les dispositions générales, notamment l’objet, les définitions, le champ d'application La présente loi fixe le cadre juridique de toutes les interventions de l'Etat et des autres acteurs ayant pour effet la structuration, l'occupation, l'utilisation du territoire national et de ses ressources. Elle détermine les règles et les institutions de l'aménagement du territoire à différentes échelles. La loi-cadre sur l'aménagement du territoire s'applique à l'ensemble du territoire de la République Togolaise. En effet, ce texte s’applique à l’intégration nationale: atténuation des disparités inter et intra-régionales, la répartition harmonieuse de la population sur l'espace National, la restructuration de l'armature urbaine; l’intégration sous-régionale et régionale; le développement économique et social: lutte contre la pauvreté, gestion des ressources foncières et de la protection de l'environnement). Elle définit les principes directeurs de l’aménagement du territoire, notamment le principe d'unité et de solidarité nationales, le principe d'anticipation, le principe de cohésion économique et sociale, le principe de complémentarité, le principe de durabilité du développement, le principe de participation de tous les acteurs, le principe de subsidiarité, et le principe d’intégration régionale).
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil, Sea
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Real Decreto Nº 244/2016 - Desarrolla la Ley Nº 32/2014, Ley de metrología.
Policy_Content: El presente Real Decreto tiene por objeto el desarrollo de los capítulos II, III y V de de la Ley de Metrología, que regulan, respectivamente, el Sistema Legal de Unidades de Medida, el control metrológico del Estado y la organización de la metrología. El Centro Español de Metrología es responsable de la realización, materialización y diseminación de las unidades de medida, al más alto nivel metrológico, con la mayor exactitud y la menor incertidumbre que permita el estado de la ciencia. Los laboratorios asociados al Centro Español de Metrología, forman parte de la estructura metrológica nacional y son responsables de la realización, materialización y diseminación de las unidades de medida que les hayan sido asignadas.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Keyword: Agricultural commodities,Equipment,Internal trade,International trade,Institution,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Packaging/labelling,Standards

Policy_Content: La presente Resolución, como consecuencia de la nueva legislación en materia de otorgamiento de tierras eriazas, deroga la que estableció un procedimiento para identificar e incorporar al dominio del Estado las tierras eriazas de libre disponibilidad que debían ser otorgadas por la entonces Comisión de Promoción de la Inversión Privada (COPRI) a favor de terceros, bajo la modalidad de subasta pública para concesión o venta.

Policy: Resolución Nº 242-2016-MINAGRI ─ Lineamientos para la ejecución de la etapa de calificación en los procedimientos de formalización y titulación de predios rústicos.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba los Lineamientos para la ejecución de la etapa de calificación en los procedimientos de formalización y titulación de predios rústicos, con el objeto de uniformizar los criterios para el desarrollo de las labores de calificación en los procedimientos de formalización y titulación de predios rústicos de propiedad del Estado y de declaración de propiedad por prescripción adquisitiva de dominio. Los presentes Lineamientos son de alcance nacional y de observancia obligatoria por los gobiernos regionales a los que se haya efectivizado la transferencia de la función referida al saneamiento de la propiedad agraria, así como por el Organismo de Formalización de la Propiedad Informal (COFOPRI).

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 256-2016-MINEDU ─ Lineamientos para el mejoramiento del Servicio Educativo Multigrado Rural.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo aprueba los Lineamientos para el mejoramiento del Servicio Educativo Multigrado Rural, con la finalidad de asegurar que las instituciones educativas unidocentes y con aulas multigrado ofrezcan los seis grados de Educación Primaria, garantizando las condiciones para su buen funcionamiento, priorizando la creación de una institución educativa polidocente respecto a la unidocente. El objetivo general que se proponen los Lineamientos es proporcionar a los estudiantes del nivel primaria de la Educación Básica Regular, un servicio educativo multigrado rural de calidad y con pertinencia pedagógica, cultural y linguistica, acorde a la diversidad de los ámbitos rurales, a fin de alcanzar logros de aprendizaje, permanencia escolar, culminación oportuna de la educación primaria hacia la continuidad en la educación secundaria.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Law of Georgia on Improvement of Cadastral Data and Procedure for Systematic and Sporadic Registration of Rights to Plots of Land within Framework of State Project (No. 5153-RS of 2016)
Policy_Content: This Law establishes special procedures for the systematic and sporadic registration of rights to plots of land, the legal framework for such registration, and the rights and obligations of parties participating in administrative proceedings. The purpose of this Law is to ensure the creation of comprehensive legal and cadastral data within the framework of the State Project, in particular the systematic performance, within the Pilot Project, of cadastral works on plots of land and the registration of title in accordance with the special procedure provided for by this Law; the sporadic registration of rights to plots of land throughout the country in accordance with the special procedure provided for by this Law; the conformity of cadastral data on plots of land with their actual location; the conformity of cadastral data on plots of land registered with unspecified cadastral data with the Public Registry with the requirements defined by the legislation of Georgia; and the improvement and mutual consistency of data registered with the Public Registry.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, Eastern Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Western Asia

Policy: Ordonnance concernant l’octroi d’allégements fiscaux en application de la politique régionale
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance concerne l’octroi d’allégements fiscaux en application de la politique régionale. Selon l’ordonnance, la Confédération peut, dans le cadre de la politique régionale, accorder des allégements fiscaux à des entreprises industrielles et à des entreprises de services proches de la production (entreprises) pour des projets qui: a) remplissent les conditions de la loi et de la présente ordonnance; et b) sont réalisés dans une commune appartenant aux zones d’application. Le Département fédéral de l’économie, de la formation et de la recherche (DEFR) définit les entreprises visées à l’al. 1. Le texte comprend 6 sections réparties en 24 articles.

Policy: Decree No. 53.052 creating the Sustainable Management Programme of the Family Farming within the Rio Grande do Sul State.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 8 articles, creates the Sustainable Management Programme of the Family Farming within the Rio Grande do Sul State. The above mentioned Sustainable Management Programme has the following objectives: to guide farmers through a management and adequacy plan of its rural area, designed from the current use and occupation of lands and the sustainability index, in order to have agricultural, livestock and environmental productions integrated in other public policies, such as: agricultural, environmental and water resources through the dissemination of agro-silvopastoralism techniques of sustainable production; and to establish a sustainable management system of rural property, in order to monitor and evaluate all rural activities on the property, aiming to promote the qualification of processes as well as social, economic and environmental inclusion of farmers who will benefit from assistance.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic

Policy_Content: This Act amends the County Governments Act by adding a new section (7A), which concerns the duly constitution of county assemblies after election. A county assembly shall not be be duly constituted at first sitting. fully and duly constituted for the first sitting after a general election unless all the members provided for under paragraphs (b) and (c) of Article 177(1) of the Constitution have been duly nominated and their names published in the Gazette.

Policy: Resolución Nº 340 - Modifica la Resolución Nº 398, sobre requisitos para la inscripción en el Registro de auditores ambientales.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución modifica la que establece los requisitos para la inscripción en el Registro de auditores ambientales del Ministerio de Ambiente, del personal habilitado para realizar auditorias ambientales y programas de adecuación y manejo ambiental. Se modifican los requisitos para inscribirse como personal natural en relación a la necesidad de poseer un titulo universitario de licenciatura, postgrado, maestría o doctorado en áreas de calidad de agua, aire, ruido, suelo, residuos, flora, fauna, desechos, producción más limpia, gestión ambiental, riesgo ambiental, seguridad e higiene industrial, obras civiles, procesos tecnológicos o sociología. Asimismo, haber participado y aprobado cursos teóricos prácticos sobre Auditorías Ambientales y/o Programas de Adecuación y Manejo Ambiental, aprobados por la Dirección de Protección de la Calidad Ambiental.

Policy: Land Code (Amendment) Order, 2016 .
Policy_Content: The Land Code is amended by inserting new sections dealing with many aspects related to land tenure, such as: concepts related to Land Code; Land Commissions and officer in charge of the Land Office administrative and legal proceedings; Land  purchasing requirements (owned by purchaser as nominee on behalf of another person); prescribed fees presented to the Land Officer; a Land Officer's caveat shall continue in force until it is cancelled by the Land Officer: (a) of his own motion; or (b) on an application in that behalf by the registered owner of the land or any other person having a registered interest in the land or estate affected by the caveat; or (c) pursuant to any order of the Minister made on an appeal under subsection (5); where the Land Officer effects a cancellation under subsection (3), the Land Officer shall cancel the entry thereof in the Register and the extract of title and notify the registered owner of the land or any other person having a registered interest in the land affected by the caveat, etc.

Policy: Arrêté A/2016/1565/MEH/CABISGG du 02 juin 2016, portant création, attributions et organisation de la cellule de partenariat public-privé et de producteurs indépendants d'énergie du ministère de l'énergie et de l'hydraulique.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté crée une Cellule de Partenariat Public-Privé et de Producteurs Indépendants d'Energie, placée sous l'autorité du Ministre de l'Energie et de l'Hydraulique. Cette Cellule a pour mission d'assurer la promotion du partenariat public-privé et d'appuyer le Ministère de l'Energie et de l'Hydraulique dans le processus de passation de ces marchés. A ce titre, elle est particulièrement chargée: conseiller le Ministère de l'Energie et de l'Hydraulique dans l’élaboration de la politique sectorielle en matière de Partenariat public-privé; tenir à jour la liste des projets susceptibles d'être développés sous forme de partenariat public-privé; informer les investisseurs sur le cadre législatif et règlementaire ; formuler les conseils et appuis pendant le cycle du projet de partenariat public-privé; et gérer les contrats signés avec les investisseurs.;

Policy: Customs Law (2016)
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Law is to determine the competence of the Republic of Latvia in customs matters insofar as customs matters are not specified in the directly applicable laws and regulations of the European Union. It provides for emblem of the customs authority; management of customs matters; competence of the cabinet in customs matters; determination of the amount of the customs duty; exemption from notification of the customs debt; calculation and collection of customs duty arrears; adjustment of a credit balance for the payment of the customs duty; cases where the state revenue service takes a decision to prevent irreparable damage for a debtor; certificates for non-preferential origin of goods; submission of documents to the customs authority; customs control; search of a person; inspection of a person; procedures for the inspection of a person; protocol of an inspection of a person; completion of customs clearance after control conducted by another state administration institution; handling of goods by the customs authority in special cases; provision of a service at customs control points; guaranteeing association; simplification of TIR procedure - authorised consignor in TIR procedure; duty-free shop; authorisations, certificates, powers of attorney, statuses and approvals for the performance of customs clearance operations; guarantee for ensuring the debt of customs charges; administration of the funds transferred into the account of the deposited financial resources of the state revenue service; and condition regarding serious, repeated and minor customs or tax rules infringements and application thereof in the field of customs.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants
Keyword: International trade,Institution,Governance,Procedural matters,Tax/levy,Business/industry/corporations,Data collection/reporting,Inspection,Transport/storage,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Agricultural commodities,Authorization/permit,Certification,Liability/compensation,Enforcement/compliance,Credit,Offences/penalties,Risk assessment/management,Food quality control/food safety
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Loi n° 2016-03 du 06 janvier 2016 autorisant le Président de la République à ratifier le Protocole de Nagoya sur l’accès aux ressources génétiques et le partage juste et équitable des avantages découlant de leur utilisation relatif à la Convention sur la diversité biologique, adopté le 29 octobre 2010.
Policy_Content: La présente loi autorise la ratification du Protocole de Nagoya sur l’accès aux ressources génétiques et le partage juste et équitable des avantages découlant de leur utilisation relatif à la Convention sur la diversité biologique, adopté le 29 octobre 2010. Le protocole de Nagoya se fixe comme objectif le partage juste et équitable des avantages découlant de l’utilisation des ressources génétiques, notamment grâce à un accès satisfaisant aux ressources génétiques et à un transfert approprié des techniques pertinentes.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 2.785 - Crea el Programa de Centros Municipales de Servicios en Mecanización Agrícola.
Policy_Content: Mediante el presente Decreto se crea el Programa de Centros Municipales de Servicios en Mecanización Agrícola. Su objetivo es fortalecer las capacidades de los sistemas de producción agropecuaria de los municipios, a través de los gobiernos autónomos municipales. Los componentes del programa son los siguientes: 1) Transferencia de maquinaria, equipos e implementos agrícolas; 2) Transferencia de capacidades técnicas; 3) Seguimiento y evaluación.

Policy: Withdrawal from Disposal of Certain Tracts of Territorial Lands in Nunavut (Kivalliq area) Order (SI/2016-29).
Policy_Content: The present Order is made under the Territorial Lands Act. In particular, the purpose of this Order is to withdraw from disposal certain tracts of territorial lands in order to facilitate the conclusion of Aboriginal land agreements. In particular, section 2 establishes that the tracts of territorial lands set out in the Schedule, including the surface and subsurface rights to the lands, are withdrawn from disposal for a period of three years beginning on the day on which this Order is made. The text consists of 5 sections and 1 Schedule.

Policy: Order No. 12 on internationally designated wetland protection.
Policy_Content: The Regulation provides a framework for the management and protection of wetland areas in the Greenland Ramsar sites, and sets regulations with regard to sailing, trespassing, flying, building and other activities which may threaten wildlife. The Regulation provides strict requirements and measures (with the exception of exploration and exploitation of non-living resources, including mineral resources) to adhere to the conservation goals of Greenland's international obligations under the Ramsar Convention. It is prohibited to: fly over the area between 15 April and 30 September; fishing with pelagic trawls, bottom trawling and scraping for scallops; harvesting seaweed; engaging in agricultural activities, animal husbandry, cultivation or planting of vegetation. Net-fishing is banned between 1 March and 30 September. The relevant municipal council shall ensure compliance with this Regulation, while the Ministry of Nature, Environment and Energy shall ensure adherence to the Regulation of Ramsar sites outside the municipal boundary.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protection of habitats,Wetlands,Protected area,Protection of environment,Birds,Management/conservation,Ecosystem preservation,International agreement-implementation,Wild fauna

Policy: Presidential Decree No. PP-2539 "On measures on organization and holding of the annual International Fruit and Vegetable Fair".
Policy_Content: The President, in order to familiarize foreign partners with the unique in their consumer properties vegetables, fruits, grapes and melons and vegetables, establish long-term stable cooperation ties between producers, manufacturers and suppliers of fruit and vegetable products through modern market mechanisms and, on this basis, to increase the volumes and expand the range deliveries for export of fresh and processed fruit and vegetable products, development of new markets for its trade, decrees to organize, beginning from 2016, on the regular annual basis International Fruit and Vegetable Fair. The scope and the functions of International Fruit and Vegetable Fair shall be set forth as follows: (a) formation of an effective, transparent, complying with the modern international requirements and standards, the market mechanism for the promotion of fresh and processed fruits and vegetables on foreign markets; (b) access to information by foreign processing and trading companies related to the huge potential of ecological production of fresh vegetables, fruits, grapes and melons, in Uzbekistan; and (c) creation of favorable conditions and rendering any possible assistance in finding partners and signing contracts for the supply of fruits and vegetables.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition

Policy: Stratégie de Protection de l’Enfance pour la réponse humanitaire à l’Extrême-Nort du Cameroun 2016-2017.
Policy_Content: La présente Stratégie s'inscrit dans le contexte de la crise au Nigeria voisin qui oppose la secte Boko Haram au gouvernement du Nigeria avec ses alliés. Plus de 100,000 personnes se sont déplacés pour rechercher refuge soit  à  l’intérieur  du  territoire  Nigérian  soit  dans  les  pays    voisins  que  sont  le  Tchad, le Cameroun et le Niger. Cette situation a provoqué une crise de protection de l’enfant sans précédent dans la région de  l’Extrême  Nord  du  Cameroun.  Les  enfants  sont  affectés  par  des  problèmes  de  protection spécifiques  tels  que:  la  détresse  psychosociale,  la  séparation  familiale,  l’association  à  des groupes armés et la détention arbitraire, entre autres. L'objectif général de cette stratégie de protection de l'enfant est de disposer d'une vision cohérente concernant les mécanismes de prévention et réponse à toutes les formes de a'bus, de violences, d'exploitation et de négligence des filles et garçons affectés par la crise humanitaire dans la région de l'Extrême Nord. Ceci  permettra  d’assurer  des interventions  harmonisées  et  cordonnées  entre  les  différents  acteurs  de  protection  de l’enfance aussi bien du secteur public que du secteur privé.  Les objectifs spécifiques de cette stratégie sont: donner des orientations techniques de mise en œuvre  des projets/programmes de protection de l’enfant sous la  coordination du gouvernement; prévenir toutes formes d’abus, de violences et d’exploitation à l’égard des filles et garçons de la région de l’Extrême-Nord contre; et assurer  une  prise  en  charge  holistique  adéquate  des  filles  et  garçons  affectés  par  la  crise humanitaire  dans  la  région  de  l’Extrême  et  ceux  victimes  de  toutes  formes  d’abus,  de violences, d’exploitation et de négligence.
Subject: General
Keyword: Disasters,Social protection,Human rights,Early warning system/emergency intervention system
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, North Atlantic

Sous l’autorité du Secrétariat Général du Ministère des Domaines de l’Etat et des Affaires Foncières, le secrétaire permanent est chargé de programmer, de diriger et de coordonner l’exécution des missions assignées au secrétariat permanent de la reforme domaniale et foncière au Mali. Policy: Ley Federal de Zonas Económicas Especiales.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley regula la planeación, el establecimiento y la operación de Zonas Económicas Especiales para impulsar el crecimiento económico sostenible que, entre otros fines, reduzca la pobreza, permita la provisión de servicios básicos y expanda las oportunidades para vidas saludables y productivas, en las regiones del país que tengan mayores rezagos en desarrollo social, a través del fomento de la inversión, la productividad, la competitividad, el empleo y una mejor distribución del ingreso entre la población. Las Zonas Económicas Especiales serán consideradas áreas prioritarias del desarrollo nacional y el Estado promoverá las condiciones e incentivos para que, con la participación del sector privado y social, se contribuya al desarrollo económico y social de las regiones en las que se ubiquen. Dentro del Capítulo Segundo, sobre determinación de las Zonas, el artículo 6º especifica los requisitos que deben reunirse a fin de ser designada Zona Económica Especial. La sustentabilidad, protección y preservación del medio ambiente es uno de los criterios rectores del establecimientos de las Zonas.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy: Regional Law No. 208-oz “On delimitation of plenary powers between regional state bodies in the sphere of management of industrial and domestic waste”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law delimits plenary powers between regional state bodies in the sphere of management of industrial and domestic waste. Regional executive body in the sphere of waste management shall have the following plenary powers: (a) elaboration and realization of regional programs in the sphere of waste management, including solid domestic waste; (b) regulation of solid domestic waste management; (c) establishment of the rates of solid domestic waste storage; (d) organization of separate collection, transport, recycling and disposal of solid domestic waste; and (e) regulation of operators in the sphere of waste management. Regional executive body in the sphere of environmental protection in relation to waste management shall have the following plenary powers: (a) prevention of disasters originating from waste management and mitigation of the consequences thereof; (b) elaboration and application of waste prevention programs; and (c) state environmental supervision through application of environmental audit to waste management.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
