Policy: Regional Law No. 2012-OZ “On some issues related to organization of public control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the modalities of organization and performance of public control as a form of public participation. It shall not be applicable to elections and referendum. Regional executive bodies shall have the following plenary powers: (a) formation of advisory councils at the regional executive bodies; (b) examination of final documents drafted by public control bodies; and (c) consideration of proposals, recommendations and conclusions contained in the final documents. Public control shall be performed by the Public (Civic) Chambers, advisory councils at the regional executive bodies and local government, public inspections and public control groups. Public control can initiate public hearings, obtain results of inspections performed by regional and municipal executive bodies and participate at joint supervisory (control) arrangements.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Land & soil, Water
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Kajiado County Trade License Act, 2017 (No. 5 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act of the County Assembly of Kajiado County provides with respect to licences to conduct a business within the County. No person shall conduct a business within the county, unless the person has duly been granted a trade license for that business in accordance with this Act. An application for the grant of a trade license shall be lodged with the chief licensing officer. "Business" includes a profession, trade or occupation, other than a business prescribed by Regulations.

Policy: Marketing of Agricultural Products Act: Establishment of Statutory Measure: Prohibition regarding the removal of imported regulated agricultural products intended for sale in the Republic of South Africa from the prescribed ports of entry (No. 570 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Measure of the Minister of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries acting under section 4A(1) of the Agricultural Product Standards Act, 1990, prohibits the removal of regulated agricultural products imported for sale in the Republic of South Africa from the ports of entry specified in the Table, or any other place as determined by the Executive Officer, unless - (a) each consignment of such product has been inspected, graded, sampled for quality control and approved by the Executive Officer or designated assignee for such purpose; or (b) written permission for the removal of a particular quantity of such product has been granted by the Executive Officer on the conditions which he or she deems necessary. An application for - (a) the inspection, approval and subsequent removal of a consignment of imported regulated agricultural products; or (b) the removal of a particular quantity of a consignment of imported regulated agricultural products from the ports of entry specified in the Table, or any other place as determined by the Executive Officer, shall be made in the manner prescribed in the Annex.

Policy: Décret n° 2016-1430 PM du 27 mai 2016 fixant les modalités d'organisation et de fonctionnement de la commission consultative en matière foncière et domaniale.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe les modalités d'organisation et de fonctionnement de la commission consultative en matière foncière et domaniale, organe collégial chargé d'assister les autorités compétentes dans le cadre de la gestion du domaine national. (2) A ce titre, elle propose à l'autorité compétente, la répartition de l'espace rural en zones agricole et pastorale suivant les besoins des populations ; émet un avis sur les demandes d'attribution des concessions ou d'immatriculation des terrains du domaine national ; examine et régie le cas échéant, tous les litiges qui lui sont soumis dans le cadre de la procédure d'obtention du titre foncier sur les dépendances du domaine national occupées ou exploitées ;choisit les terrains indispensables aux collectivités villageoises ; reçoit toutes les observations et informations en rapport avec la gestion du domaine national et fait des recommandations au Ministre charge des affaires foncières ; examine et règle le cas échéant, tous les litiges fonciers se rapportant aux terrains non immatricules du domaine national; constate la mise en valeur des terrains pour l’obtention du titre foncier. Par ailleurs, il fixe l’organisation, le fonctionnement et les modalités de prise en charge de la commission consultative.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Land commission,Agricultural land,Drainage/land reclamation,Cadastre/land registration,Land-use planning,Transfer,Ownership

Policy: Décret n° 2016-1431 PM du 27 mai 2016 relatif aux transactions immobilières privées.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret régit les transactions immobilières privées (la vente, la cession gratuite ou l’échange d'un immeuble entre particuliers).  Toute transaction immobilière d’un immeuble ne peut faire l'objet de transaction par parcelles qu'après un lotissement approuve conformément à la règlementation en vigueur. Toute personne privée désirant entreprendre une transaction immobilière saisit le service départemental du cadastre territorialement compétent d'une demande de bornage de la parcelle concernée. Le dossier de la transaction contient, entre autres, des tirages de plan et un procès-verbal de bornage ; le certificat d’urbanisme ; le certificat de propriété; la copie du titre foncier assortie, le cas échéant, du plan de localisation approuvé ; la minute de l'acte ; le plan; la preuve du paiement de tous les impôts et taxes dus.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, North Atlantic

Policy: Energy Efficiency Act (No. 3 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act provides with respect to energy efficiency. Its purpose is to promote, in Tuvalu, energy efficiency, energy conservation and to give effects to certain obligations that Tuvalu has under the Climate Change Conventions and related conventions. It defines the precautionary approach to be observed by all persons and agencies having responsibilities under this Act and requires the Minister to determine standards for minimum energy performance and/or energy labelling for the products subject to this Act. The Director of Energy is designated as the Regulator of products for purposes of the Act. He or she shall maintain a register of products complying with the Act.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Least Developed Countries, Oceania, Polynesia, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Law No. 108 “On natural gas”.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this law shall be as follows: to create a common legal framework for organizing, regulating, ensuring the effective operation and monitoring of the natural gas sector, designed to supply consumers with natural gas in conditions of accessibility, availability, reliability, security, quality and transparency; ensuring free access to the natural gas market; ensuring an adequate balance between supply and demand, the proper level of capacity of natural gas networks, including intersystem connections; development of the natural gas market and integration into the competitive natural gas market; the establishment of measures designed to guarantee the safety of natural gas supply, the proper performance of obligations to provide public services, ensuring compliance with consumer rights, as well as environmental protection standards. It shall be applicable to: (a) production of natural gas; (b) natural gas transportation, including transboundary natural gas flows; (c) distribution of natural gas; (d) storage of natural gas; (e) supply of natural gas; (f) supply of compressed natural gas for vehicles at gasoline stations; (g) determination and approval of regulated prices for natural gas; (h) licensing of activities in the natural gas market; (i) natural gas market and access to the natural gas market; (j) organization, functioning and monitoring of the natural gas system; (k) safety and reliability of natural gas supply to end users; (l) access to public or private property for the purposes of construction, operation, maintenance, rehabilitation or modernization, including technological re-equipment, of natural gas networks; (m) controlled access of third parties to natural gas networks; and (n) consumer protection. Gas producing enterprises can be entitled with the tasks of environmental protection and improvement of energy efficiency. This Law consists of XVII sections. Section I lays down general provisions. Section II establishes administrative and regulatory powers. Section III regards organization and licensing in the sphere of natural gas management. Section IV regards production of natural gas. Section V regards transportation of natural gas. Section VI regards distribution of natural gas. Section VII regards storage of natural gas. Section VIII regards access to gas distribution networks and gas storage facilities, supply of services for transportation, distribution and storage of natural gas. Section IX deals with power selection and overload management. Section X deals with tenancy of land plots and the right of ownership of third parties. Section XI regards end consumers. Section XII regards supply of natural gas. Section XIII regards natural gas market. Section XIV regards regulation of prices and tariffs, separation of accounting. Section XV regards safety of natural gas supply. Section XVI regards dispute settlement and establishes liability for the infringement of legislation in the sphere of natural gas. Section XVII lays down final and transitional provisions.
Subject: Energy, Mineral resources
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Resolución Nº 013-2016-VMI-MC ─ Procedimientos para la aplicación de lo dispuesto sobre  consulta previa en materia de construcción y mantenimiento de infraestructura sanitaria, educativa y servicios públicos.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba la Directivav que establece los Procedimientos para la aplicación de lo dispuesto en el Reglamento de la Ley del Derecho a la Consulta Previa a los Pueblos Indígenas u Originarios reconocido en el Convenio 169 de la Organización Internacional del Trabajo (OIT), en materia de construcción y mantenimiento de infraestructura sanitaria, educativa y servicios públicos, disponiendo que la construcción y mantenimiento de infraestructura en materia de salud, educación, así como la necesaria para la provisión de servicios públicos que, en coordinación con los pueblos indígenas esté orientada a beneficiarlos, no requerirán ser sometidos al procedimiento de consulta previsto en el Reglamento. La presente Directiva es de aplicación a las entidades públicas responsables de aprobar medidas administrativas que constituyan títulos habilitantes para la construcción y/o el mantenimiento de infraestructura en materia de salud o educación, así como la necesaria para la provisión de servicios públicos.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Law No. 107 “On electric energy.”
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Law shall be to create a general legal framework for the organization, regulation, ensuring the effective functioning and monitoring of the electricity sector, designed to supply electricity to consumers in conditions of accessibility, availability, reliability, continuity, quality and transparency; to ensure free access to the electricity market; to promote electricity production; and to ensure an adequate balance between supply and demand, an adequate level of inter-system capacity to facilitate the flow of electricity. Public land plots shall be transferred free of charge for construction, operation and servicing of electric networks. Private land plots shall be transferred on condition of servitude or with the application of use restrictions for construction, operation and servicing of electric networks. This Law contains XV Chapters divide into 96 Articles. Chapter I lays down general provisions. Chapter II establishes administrative and regulatory powers. Chapter III regards organization and licensing of activities in electric energy sector. Chapter IV regards generation of electric energy. Chapter V regards transmission of electric energy. Chapter VI regards transboundary exchange of electric and management of overload. Chapter VII regards distribution of electric energy. Chapter VIII regards access to electricity grids and provision of transmission and distribution services. Chapter IX regards use of land plots and the right of ownership of the third person. Chapter X regards end users. Chapter XI regards electric energy supply. Chapter XII regards electric energy market. Chapter XIII regards regulation of prices and tariffs, and accounting. Chapter XIV regards dispute settlement and establishes liability for the infringement of legislation in the field of electric energy. Chapter XV lays down final provisions.
Subject: Energy, Land & soil
Keyword: Energy conservation/energy production,Hydropower generation,Public land,Private land,Servitude,Use restrictions
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Décret relatif à la réparation de certains dommages causés par des calamités naturelles publiques (1).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret est relatif à la réparation de certains dommages causés par des calamités naturelles publiques. Aux fins du présent arrêté, on entend par ”calamités publiques” des phénomènes naturels de caractère exceptionnel ou d'intensité imprévisible ayant provoqué des dégâts importants et qui répondent aux critères de reconnaissance arrêtés par le Gouvernement. Le texte comprend 26 articles répartis en 9 chapitres comme suit: Définitions (Ier); Champ d'application (II); Bénéficiaires de l'aide à la réparation (III); Biens indemnisables (IV); Procédure d'indemnisation (V); Dommages au domaine public(VI); Dispositions réglant le financement (VII); Dispositions diverses (VIII); Dispositions finales et abrogatoires (IX).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Regional Decree No. 400/17 “On the modalities of performance of municipal land control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes the modalities of performance of municipal land control by local government. Municipal land control shall be conducted in the form of ordinary and extraordinary inspections of legal persons and individual entrepreneurs. The subject of inspection shall be checking data and information contained in the documentation related to land tenure. The scope of inspection shall be to control compliance by land tenant with compulsory legislative requirements related to land tenure with a view of prevention and suppression of unauthorized transactions with land. Municipal land control shall be performed in accordance with the annual plans. The outcome of municipal land control shall be legalized in the form of inspection certificate.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Decree enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Water Supply (Water Quality) Regulations 2016  (S.I. No. 614 of 2016).
Policy_Content: These Regulations are primarily concerned with the quality of water supplied in England by water undertakers and licensed water suppliers for domestic or food production purposes and with arrangements for the publication of information about water quality. They transpose  transpose requirements of Council Directive 98/83/EC on the quality of water intended for human consumption and Council Directive 2013/51/Euratom laying down requirements for the protection of the health of the general public with regard to radioactive substances in water intended for human consumption and  supplement Chapter III of the Water Industry Act 1991 on water supply. The Regulations, among other things:  require water undertakers to identify annually the areas (“water supply zones”) that are to be relevant for a particular year for the purposes of the application of the provisions of the Regulations; prescribe standards of wholesomeness in respect of water supplied by water undertakers to premises for domestic or food production purposes; provide for the monitoring of water supplies; require water undertakers and combined licensees to identify every point from which it abstracts water for supply and sets out sampling requirements; require water undertakers and combined licensees to investigate the cause of any failure, or apprehended failure, of any parameters set out in Schedule 1 or any indicator parameters set out in Schedule 2 and to notify the Secretary of State; provide with respect to treatment of water and regulates the substances, processes and products that may be used by water undertakers in connection with the supply of water; deal with the maintenance of records and provision of information by water undertakers, combined licensees and retail licensees; provide with respect to duties of local authorities and enforcement.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Water
Keyword: Pollution control,Radiation,Food quality control/food safety,Potable water,Standards,Water supply,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Water quality standards,Water conservation zone,Inspection,Monitoring,Offences/penalties
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 412 validating the Regulation on performance of environmental audit.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of performance of environmental audit with a view of ensuring environmental security and reduction of risks of negative environmental impact through independent control of activities for compliance with environmental requirements set forth by the national legislation. Environmental audit shall not include either state environmental audit of project documentation or supervision in the sphere of environmental protection and rational management of natural resources. Environmental audit shall be performed by individual entrepreneurs and legal persons with university degree in ecological sciences, natural sciences, techniques and technologies. Environmental audit can be voluntary or mandatory.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This Ministerial Decree enters into force on 1 July 2016.

Policy: Resolución Nº 368 - Regula las características técnicas mínimas de los equipos autorrescatadores para el personal que ingrese a labores mineras subterráneas.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución tiene como objeto establecer las características técnicas mínimas de los equipos autorrescatadores de las personas que ingresan a las labores mineras subterráneas, siendo de obligatorio cumplimiento para los titulares del derecho minero, explotadores mineros y empleadores que desarrollen labores mineras subterráneas en el territorio Nacional. EL autorrescatador es un aparato o equipo personal, de protección respiratoria, diseñado para escapar de atmósferas contaminadas o con deficiencia de oxígeno.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Resolución Nº 475 – Establece régimen provisorio y dicta instrucciones generales sobre deberes de remisión de información para fuentes emisoras reguladas por la Norma de Emisión para la Regulación de la Contaminación Lumínica, Decreto Supremo Nº 43 de 2012 del Ministerio del Medio Ambiente.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución establece obligaciones de remisión de información a la Superintendencia del Medio Ambiente por parte de los titulares de proyectos de instalación y recambio de las fuentes emisoras sujetas a la Norma de Emisión para la Regulación de la Contaminación Lumínica.

Policy: Ley Nº 8.877 - Modifica la Ley Nº 8.573 (Declara de Interés Público Provincial la Producción Sustentable de Azúcar y de Alcohol elaborados a partir de Caña de Azúcar y crea el Instituto de Promoción del Azúcar y Alcohol de Tucumán -IPAAT-) en diversos artículos.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley modifica algunas disposiciones de la Ley Nº 8.573 sobre producción sustentable de azúcar y alcohol elaborados a partir de caña de azúcar. Las enmiendas se refieren a la tasa retributiva de servicios a cargo de los productores cañeros, como así también a la obligación de las empresas dar cumplimiento al 12 % en la participación obligatoria del bioetanol en su mezcla con las naftas de uso automotor para el abastecimiento del mercado interno.
Subject: Energy, Cultivated plants

Policy: Décret n° 2016-305 du 26 mai 2016 portant création, attributions, organisation et fonctionnement du Comité de pilotage pour la mise en œuvre de la de la zone franche du savoir et de l’innovation.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée un comité de pilotage de la mise en œuvre de la zone franche du savoir et de l’innovation. Ce comité proposera au chef de l’Etat des mesures en vue de la mise en place d’une zone franche du savoir et de l'innovation, dans le cadre d’un partenariat avec les entreprises, industries et structures d’enseignement supérieur et de recherche.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Master Plan for Crop Production in Cambodia to 2030.
Policy_Content: The Master Plan for Crop Production in Cambodia to 2030 is a national policy with a cross-sectoral approach. The timeframe of the policy is 15 years between 2016 and 2030. This Crop Master Plan aims at structural transformation of the sector from traditional agriculture to the modern agricultural system capable of generating high value added and multiplier effects in the rural and urban economy through the development of agroindustry, agribusiness, and non-farm employment.

Le Global Green Growth Institute (GGGI) est une organisation internationale fondée sur un traité, dont le siège est à Séoul, Corée du Sud.

Policy: Resolución Nº 208-2016-MC ─ Aprueba la lista de Pueblos Indígenas de la Amazonia y las referencias geográficas.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba la lista de 51 pueblos indígenas de la Amazonia y las referencias geográficas denominadas "Pueblos Indígenas de la Amazonia", como contenido actualizado a incorporar a la información comprendida en la Base de Datos Oficial de Pueblos Indígenas u Originarios. Las referencias geográficas denominadas “Pueblos Indígenas de la Amazonía”, constituyen una fuente de información actualizada sobre la información geográfica de los polígonos o áreas de comunidades nativas georeferenciadas reconocidas y/o tituladas, provista por las Direcciones Regionales Agrarias de los Gobiernos Regionales en el marco de la Base de Datos Oficial de Pueblos Indígenas u Originarios a cargo del Viceministerio de Interculturalidad del Ministerio de Cultura
Subject: Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Décret  gouvernemental n° 2016-626 du 25 mai 2016, portant création du conseil des pairs pour l’égalité et l’équivalence des chances entre la femme et l’homme.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée  le «conseil des pairs pour l’égalité et l’équivalence des chances entre la femme et l’homme », désigné par « le conseil des pairs pour l’égalité » ayant pour mission l’intégration de l’approche genre dans la planification, la programmation, l’évaluation et dans le budget, afin d’éliminer toutes les formes de discrimination entre la femme et l’homme et de concrétiser l’égalité de droits et devoirs entre eux.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Acuerdo por el que se emiten los Lineamientos y Modelos de Contratos para el uso, goce, afectación o, en su caso, adquisición de los terrenos, bienes o derechos para realizar las actividades de la exploración y extracción de hidrocarburos y de transporte por medio de ductos.
Policy_Content: Mediante este Acuerdo la Secretaría de Energía emite los lineamientos y modelos de contratos para el uso, goce, afectación o, en su caso, adquisición, de los terrenos, bienes o derechos para realizar las actividades de exploración y extracción de hidrocarburos y de transporte por medio de ductos.

Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba el Manual del Sistema de Gestión de Proyectos del Ministerio del Ambiente (MINAM) y dispone que los nuevos proyectos que se encuentren en proceso de inicio o planificación, gestionen sus actividades de acuerdo a lo establecido en el Manual.

Policy: Regional Law No. 922-OZ amending Regional Law No. 918-OZ “On protection of the population and the territory against inter-municipal and regional natural and technological disasters”.
Policy_Content: Article 4 shall be amended to add the following wording: “Regional Government shall be responsible for training and keeping in service operational resources for protection of the population and territory against natural and technological disasters”.

Policy: Regulation No. 383 date 25.5.2016 supplementing Regulation 103 date 4.2.2015 of the Council of Ministers on the establishment, organization, and functioning of the State Inspectorate of Environment and Forests.
Policy_Content: This Regulation 383 of 2016 supplements article 4 of Regulation 103 of 2015 by stipulating that the specialists of the State Inspectorate of Environment and Forests and its regional departments are supplied with uniforms carrying distinctive signs, identification documents, and other technical equipment necessary to implement their tasks for protection and prevention of  damages and for the discovery of criminal activities in forests. The type of uniforms, distinctive signs, technical specifications, and every other element for the production of the uniforms and technical equipment will be approved by the order of the minister responsible for the environment.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Planning Act 2016.
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 231 sections divided into eight Chapters and completed by two Schedules, aims to establish an efficient, effective, transparent, integrated, coordinated, and accountable system of land use planning (planning), development assessment and related matters that facilitates the achievement of ecological sustainability. These are the planning instruments: sets out policies for planning or development assessment, and is a State/local or State planning instrument made by the Minister to protect or give effect to State interests, and is either: a) a State planning policy (including a temporary State planning policy); or b) a regional plan. A local planning instrument is a planning instrument made by a local government, and is either: a) a planning scheme; or b) a TLPI; or c) a planning scheme policy. To the extent of any inconsistency: a) a State planning policy applies instead of a regional plan or local planning instrument; and b) a regional plan applies instead of a local planning instrument; and c) a planning scheme applies instead of a planning scheme policy; and d) a TLPI applies instead of a planning scheme or planning scheme policy.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Keyword: Land-use planning,EIA,Environmental planning,Institution,Authorization/permit,Policy/planning,Public participation,Governance,Offences/penalties,Dispute settlement,Sustainable development,Cultural heritage,Indigenous peoples,Basic legislation
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Decree No. 73 of the Ministry of Public Health validating the Regulation on allowable indices of combined noise and electromagnetic pollution on the population in residential areas.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes maximum allowable limits for combined noise and electromagnetic pollution on the population in residential areas caused by ventilation, air conditioning, elevators and other engineering and technological equipment producing tonal noise and impulsive noise. It establishes rating of acceptable noise pollution.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Noise pollution,Public health,Pollution control
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force six months after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Order No. 150/2016 establishing the application regime for action No. 4.0.1 "Investments in forestry products identified as agricultural products in Annex I to the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union (TFEU)" and Action No. 4.0.2 "Investments in forest products not identified as agricultural in Annex I to the TFEU", both included in Measure 4 "Enhancement of forestry resources" of the Mainland Rural Development Programme (PDR 2020).
Policy_Content: This Order, consisting of 30 articles divided into six  Chapters and five Annexes, establishes the application regime for action No. 4.0.1 "Investments in forestry products identified as agricultural products in Annex I to the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union (TFEU)" and Action No. 4.0.2 "Investments in forest products not identified as agricultural in Annex I to the TFEU", both included in Measure 4 "Enhancement of forestry resources" of the Mainland Rural Development Programme (PDR 2020). The financial support provided for will pursue the following objectives: a) strengthen the productive capacity of small and medium-sized enterprises in the forestry sector; b) foster the modernization of the business entrepreneurship of the forestry sector.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Agricultural development,Subsidy/incentive,Forest management/forest conservation,Non-timber products,Timber,Agro-forestry,Sustainable development,Sustainable use
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Order enters into force the day after its publication.

Policy: Kajiado County Disaster Management Act, 2016 (No. 6 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act designs and establishes the Kajiado county disaster management structure and provides with respect to disaster prevention and mitigation in the Kajiado County. It establishes the Disaster Management Committee, the Disaster Management Directorate, defines functions and powers of the Committee and the Directorate, and provides with respect to the administration of the funds. The Act sets out the measures to be taken by the County Government for purposes of disaster management. For the purposes of this Act, a disaster exists when the Governor declares by notice that a disaster exists after receiving advice from the Committee that a disaster has occurred. When an emergency exists or is imminent or a disaster has occurred or is imminent, the Directorate or other persons designated in the Plan may cause the County Disaster Management Plan to be implemented. The Act establishes a County Disaster Management Fund.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 301 validating the Regulation on selection of sites for placing of nuclear plants and nuclear waste disposal sites.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of selection of sites for placing of nuclear plants and nuclear waste disposal sites. Sites for nuclear plants shall be selected with the consideration of the following criteria: (a) possible external impact of natural and (or) technological type; (b) possible drift of radioactive substances; and (c) possibilities for the prevention of damages to the population and environment, and prevention of the risk of nuclear disasters.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Disasters,Nuclear energy,Radiation,Hazardous waste,Waste disposal,Waste non-domestic sources,Waste management
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Ministerial Decree enters into force ten days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Resolución Nº 014-2016-PCM ─ Modifica la Resolución Nº 036-2013-PCM, que crea el Registro de Mancomunidades Regionales y aprueba su Reglamento.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución modifica el Reglamento del Registro de Mancomunidades Regionales, en aspectos relacionados con el procedimiento para la inscripción de la adhesión de Gobiernos Regionales a la Mancomunidad Regional, el procedimiento para la inscripción de la separación de un Gobierno Regional de una Mancomunidad Regional, y el procedimiento para la inscripción de la extinción de la Mancomunidad Regional.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Punjab Agriculture, Food and Drug Authority Act 2016 (Act XXXII of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 28 sections, provides for the establishment of the Punjab Agriculture, Food and Drug Authority entitled to carry out forensic examination and testing of fertilizer, pesticide, food and drug; to render an expert opinion in respect of the ingredients and quality of fertilizer, pesticide, food or drug. It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Authority entitled to: make policies for carrying out forensic examination and testing of fertilizer, pesticide, food and drug and establish and manage the testing facilities for the purpose; accredit the facilities and provide expert opinion for forensic examination and testing of fertilizer, pesticide, food and drug; suggest the use of suitable scientific instruments for forensic examination and testing of fertilizer, pesticide, food and drug; approve procedures for the collection, preservation and handling of samples for forensic examination and testing of fertilizer, pesticide, food and drug; promote general awareness on matters relating to forensic examination and testing of fertilizer, pesticide, food and drug; specify timelines for retention of samples and results of forensic examination and testing of fertilizer, pesticide, food and drug; ensure complete independence and impartiality of all the laboratories administered or accredited by it; undertake research and development in the relevant and allied fields; be responsible for obtaining and maintaining international accreditation for its laboratories.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Indian Ocean, South Asian Seas, Southern Asia
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force at once.

Policy: Wajir County Climate Change Fund Act, 2016 (No. 3 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act establishes the Wajir Climate Change Fund, which shall be used to fund Climate Change projects, programs and activities provided for in the Climate Finance Framework established under this Act. The Act provides with the administration of the Fund and requires the Executive Member in charge of finance to publish a Climate Finance Framework for the County every two years. The Climate Finance Frameworks shall be developed through a consultative process spearheaded by the Steering Committee (established under this Act. The Act also establishes the Wajir County Climate Change Fund Planning Committee. The functions of this Committee shall, among other things, be to develop a projects eligibility criteria under this Act and to design a Climate Change Awareness strategy for the County. There shall be Fund Administrator for the Fund who shall be the secretary to the County Planning Committee.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Keyword: Climate change,Integrated management,Gender,Air quality/air pollution,Emissions,Pollution control,Disasters,Institution,Special fund,Environmental planning
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa

Policy: Order No. 526 on subsidies to establish natural water levels through Natura2000 projects.
Policy_Content: This Order sets regulations on rural development and funding for projects related to Natura2000. The Ministry of Environment and Food of Denmark regulates this Order and may grant subsidies for non-productive investments aimed at establishing natural water level conditions to improve the conservation of habitats and species in particularly designated Natura2000 hydrology areas. These subsidies may be granted following digital application to the Ministry and shall be evaluated and accepted based on priority criteria set out for these projects in adherence to EU provisions. These areas must not be used for growing crops, seed production nor for cultivation of energy crops, ornamental plants, greenery and Christmas trees. The areas within these projects must permanently remain a region of natural water level conditions and maintained as grassland or natural areas.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Agricultural development,Subsidy/incentive,Protection of habitats,Water conservation zone,Wetlands,Inland waters
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: 1 July 2016.

Policy: Décret n° 2-16-263 du 17 chaabane 1437 (24 mai 2016) portant création de la commission ministérielle permanente de la politique foncière.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret institue auprès du Chef du gouvernement une commission ministérielle permanente de la politique foncière, ci-après dénommée « la commission ». La commission est chargée notamment de : proposer au gouvernement les orientations stratégiques de la politique de l'Etat dans le domaine foncier, et veiller sur le suivi de leur exécution et évaluation après leur sou mission à l’approbation conformément aux dispositions de l’article 49 de la Constitution;  coordonner les interventions des secteurs publics concernés par la gestion du foncier aussi bien public que privé, et prendre les mesures à même de garantir la convergence des politiques publiques dans ce domaine;  délibérer sur les mesures législatives, réglementaires et procédurales que le gouvernement projette de prendre en vue de reformer la politique publique dans le domaine foncier, notamment les mesures à même de maitriser le patrimoine foncier public, d'améliorer sa gouvernance, de faciliter les conditions de sa mobilisation en vue de réaliser des projets d'investissement et de garantir son accès dans le respect des règles de transparence et d’égalité des chances; faire une évaluation périodique de la politique de l’Etat dans le domaine de la gestion foncière, afin de mesurer l’impact des reformes mises en œuvre dans ce domaine.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, North Atlantic, Northern Africa

Policy: Order No. 230 of the Ministry of Agriculture validating the Regulation on production and turnover of organic commodities.
Policy_Content: This Order validates the Regulation applicable to natural or legal persons involved in production and turnover of organic commodities under any phase of such activity. This Regulation shall be applicable to the following agricultural commodities, produced and (or) marketed as organic commodities: (a) untreated agricultural and fish products, aquaculture products; (b) manufactured agricultural commodities and fish products; (c) fodder; and (d) vegetative planting material. Products derived from wild livestock shall not be considered organic commodities. In organic crop production tillage and cultivation methods are used that maintain organic matter in the soil or increase such matter and enhance the soil stability and biodiversity, which prevent compacting and soil erosion, preventing the development of degradation processes. For organic production land plots are used that meet soil phytosanitary norms. The methods of organic crop production used are aimed at preventing and minimizing environmental pollution. When selecting livestock, their breed and species is taken account for compliance to produce under given local conditions and organic production. All animals are provided access to pastures, territories for grazing, paddock for free-range, including semi-shelters and the opportunity to use them in all cases. Livestock grazing for organic production on the total territory is allowed on land plots that had not been treated for a minimum of six months with substances, which are prohibited for use in organic production. Poultry shall not be kept in cages. Aquatic birds shall be granted access to running water, a pond or a lake. Organic fish and (or) other aquatic livestock production is organized in an organic production unit in line with specie-specific fish requirements, where they: (a) have sufficient habitat for livelihood; and (b) are maintained in a temperature and light which meet the specific requirements.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Fisheries, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Ecological production/organic production,Agricultural commodities,Ecofriendly products/ecofriendly processes,Fish products,Animal feed/feedstuffs,Grazing
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Order enters into force ten days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Republic Act No. 10915 establishing Philippine Agricultural and Biosystems Engineering Act of 2016.
Policy_Content: The Philippine Agricultural and Biosystems Engineering Act, consisting of seven Articles, declares a policy of the State to promote, strengthen and regulate the practice of agricultural and biosystems engineering profession in the Philippines by instituting measures that will result in relevant agricultural and biosystems engineering education and enhanced roles and better career prospects for agricultural and biosystems engineers. Likewise, the State hereby guarantees the application and delivery of agricultural and biosystems engineering services to accelerate agricultural and fishery modernization: and ensure food and water security, bio-energy development, natural resources conservation, environmental protection and human health and safety by fostering the training and development of an adequate and well-trained pool of agricultural and biosystems engineers in the country. This Act shall cover the following aspects of the practice of the profession of agricultural and biosystems engineering: (a) Examination, registration and licensing of agricultural and biosystems engineers: (b) Supervision, control and regulation of the practice of agricultural and biosystems engineering: (c) Development, upgrading and updating of the curriculum of the agricultural and biosystems engineering profession in coordination with the Commission on Higher Education (CHED) and the concerned state universities and colleges (SUCs): (d) Development and improvement of the professional competence and practice of agricultural and biosystems engineers. Continuing Professional Development (CPD) and career progression and specialization; and (e) Integration of all agricultural and biosystems engineers under one national Accredited Integrated Professional Organization (AIPO) of agricultural and biosystems engineers which shall be recognized by the Board of Agricultural and Biosystems Engineering and the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Fisheries, Water
Keyword: Agricultural development,Institution,Irrigation,Drainage/land reclamation,Renewable energy,Freshwater resources management,Equipment,Capacity building,Monitoring,Sustainable use,Processing/handling,Aquaculture,Fishery management and conservation,Animal health,Animal production,Poultry
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, North Pacific, South-Eastern Asia
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force 15 days after its publication in the Official Gazette.

This set of characteristics is specified in the Annex and contains the following Sections: (1) Threshold values of indicators for good environmental status of marine waters; (2) The method of classifying indicators in relation to the characteristics; (3) The method of assessment of environmental status of marine waters.

Policy: Radiation Protection Regulations 2016.
Policy_Content: These Regulations, consisting of 63 sections divided into twelve Parts and completed by three Schedules, provide for the following issues: Licensing, Registration, Accreditation and Issue of Certificates of Compliance (Part 2); Radiation Management Plans, including Information to be contained in radiation management plans (Part 3); Dose limits for occupational exposure of persons, for public exposure of persons, and Occupational exposure to radon-222 (Part 4); Storage (Part 5); Transport (Part 6) Disposal (Part 7); Fees (Part 8); Banned Radiation Sources (Part 9); Exemptions (Part 10); Registers (Part 11); Infringement Notices (Part 12). Schedules specify Fees; Banned radiation sources and Infringement Notices.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: These regulations enter into force on 24 May 2016.

Policy: Resolución Nº 789 - Modifica la Resolución Nº 898, sobre criterios ambientales de calidad de los combustibles líquidos y sólidos.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución modifica la que regula los criterios ambientales de calidad de los combustibles líquidos y sólidos utilizados en hornos y caldera de uso comercial e industrial y en motores de combustión interna de vehículos automotores, en lo relacionado con los parámetros y requisitos de calidad del Etanol Anhidro Combustible y Etanol Anhidro Combustible Desnaturalizado utilizado como componente oxigenante de gasolinas, con el objetivo de proteger el medio ambiente y mejorar la calidad de los combustibles líquidos. Lo anterior, en el marco de la Política de Prevención y Control de la Contaminación del Aire que busca minimizar la generación de emisiones contaminantes y ruido a la atmósfera, así como, reducir los impactos sobre la salud pública.

Policy: Act on energy efficiency.
Policy_Content: The aim of this Act is to enhance the cost-effective improvement of energy. The present Act lays down: (1) rules for the preparation of the national action plan on energy efficiency (specified in Sec. 2); (2) tasks of public sector entities in the field of energy efficiency (Sec. 3); (3) rules for the implementation of the obligation to obtain energy savings (Sec. 4); (4) rules for conducting an energy audit of an enterprise (Sec. 5). The competent minister prepares the national action plan every three years. This plan contains in particular: (1) description of planned programs containing activities in the field of energy efficiency improvement in individual sectors of the economy; (2) specification of the national target for energy efficiency; (3) information on the energy savings achieved, including those in transmission or distribution, in delivery and in final energy consumption; (4) strategy for supporting investments in the renovation of buildings.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.
Keyword: Energy conservation/energy production,Renewable energy,Ecofriendly products/ecofriendly processes
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Act entered into force on 1 October 2016.

Policy: Decree No. 53.037 creating and regulating the State System of Conservation Units (SEUC).
Policy_Content: This Decree, composed of 21 articles divided into five Chapters, creates and regulates the State System of Conservation Units (SEUC) provided for in Law No. 9.519 of 21 January 1992, on the Forest Code of the State of Rio Grande do Sul, and arts. 36 to 50 of Law No. 11.520 of 3 August 2000, establishing the State Environmental Code. SEUC, is made up federal, state, municipal and private Units of Conservation created within the territory of the State, and has the following purposes: promote and encourage the creation, implementation and maintenance of Conservation Units in order to protect representative natural ecosystems in the state territory and its jurisdictional waters, ensuring the conservation and preservation of biodiversity; promote the preservation and restoration of ecosystems, the ecological management of the species and the use of the natural resources of the Conservation Units in accordance with the existing legislation and the guidelines established in the Management Plans; strengthen services for the preservation of the ecology, fauna, flora, historical, archaeological, paleontological, cultural and scientific heritage contained in legally protected areas, providing for their use in conditions that ensure their conservation; promote the policy of creation, implementation, valorization, use and register of the Conservation Units in the State; demonstrating the established criteria, observing the pertinent legislation; prioritize areas where a danger of elimination or degradation, or where rare, endemic or threatened species exist; encourage and coordinate scientific research, studies, monitoring, education activities and environmental interpretation in Conservation Units; foster cooperation between federal, state and municipal public agencies and civil society organizations; and protect and recover water resources.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Classification/declassification,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Forest management/forest conservation,Ecosystem preservation,Research,Registration,Wild fauna,Wild flora,Zoning,Protection forest,Protection of environment,Protection of habitats,Protection of species,Protected area
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Act on Promoting the Distribution and Use of Legally Harvested Wood and Wood Products (Act No. 48)
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act, consisting of 40 articles divided into seven Chapters, given that illegal forestry harvesting in Japan or foreign nations and the distribution of wood pertaining to illegal logging activity may affect prevention of global warming, preservation of the natural environment, and supply of forestry products and other diverse functions of forests, and that illegal logging may also impede fair transactions in the wood market, is to promote sustainable and sound development of the wood industry with consideration for the preservation of the natural environment by specifying basic matters for promoting the distribution and use of legally harvested wood, etc., and taking measures, etc., to ensure the use of legally harvested wood, etc., by wood-related business operators, thereby contributing to the preservation of the local and global environment.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Timber,Forest management/forest conservation,Timber extraction/logging,Collecting/harvesting,Inspection,International trade,Protection forest,Protection of environment,Risk assessment/management,Sustainable use,Climate change,Registration
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Act shall enters into force one year after the date of its promulgation.

Policy: Executive Order No. 206 adopting the Policy for Ensuring Sustainable Renewable Energy Resource Management and Mandating the Department of Energy (DOE) to lead in its implementation.
Policy_Content: This Order, consisting of five sections, adopts the Policy for Ensuring Sustainable Renewable Energy Resource Management and Mandating the Department of Energy (DOE) to lead in its implementation. Consistent with the Philippines contributions under the UNFCCC, the government adopts the policy for ensuring sustainable RE resource management in the country. The DOE and/or other departments, bureaus, offices, agencies and instruments of the government, may enter into such agreements as may be necessary for an effective implementation of this Order and consistent with existing laws and the commitments of the Philippines under UNFCCC Paris Agreement.
Subject: Energy

Policy: National Innovation-Driven Development Strategy Outline.
Policy_Content: This National Innovation-Driven Development Strategy Outline is a cross-sectoral policy document covering the period of 2016-2050.  The Policy proposed a "three-step" strategic target. The first step, by 2020, China will become an innovative country, creating more optimized environment for innovation, making more complete policies and regulations encouraging innovation, more strict intellectual property protection, to create the value-oriented culture of advocating the innovation and entrepreneurship. The second step, by 2030, China will become the forefront of innovation-oriented country. The third step, by 2050, China will build the world's scientific and technological innovation powerhouse. The Policy proposes the technological development directions of 9 key areas, including modern agriculture, information, intelligent manufacturing, modern energy, ecological and environmental protection, ocean and space, new urbanization, population health, modern service industry. It requests to actively participate in the formulation of major international scientific and technological cooperation rules, so as to jointly respond to global challenges such as food security, energy security, environmental pollution, climate change, and public health.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, General

Policy: European Union Environmental Objectives (Standards for Monitoring of Quality Elements) Regulations 2016 (S.I. No. 277 of 2016).
Policy_Content: These Regulations require the Environmental Protection Agency, and any other person or body as appropriate, in undertaking the monitoring requirements of the Water Framework Directive as laid out in the European Communities Environmental Objectives (Surface Waters) Regulations, as amended, to employ the standards for monitoring of quality elements listed in Schedule 1. Methods used for the monitoring of type parameters shall conform to the international standards listed in Schedule 1 in so far as they cover monitoring, or to such other national or international standards as will ensure the provision of data of an equivalent scientific quality and comparability. In doing so they give effect to Directive 2014/101/EU, which amends Annex V of the Water Framework Directive.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Environmental standards,Freshwater resources management,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Water quality standards,Monitoring,Pollution control

Policy: Order No. 439 on environmental objectives for rivers, lakes, groundwater, transit and coastal waters.
Policy_Content: This Order sets regulations concerning the identification of environmental policies to establish the quality and standards of water bodies through the classification thereof and to ensure the protection from water pollution. These include good surface water status (good ecological and chemical status of surface water), good ecological potential and good surface water chemical status for artificial and heavily modified water bodies, and good status of groundwater (quantitative status and good chemical status) referred in Appendices 1-3.

Policy: Great Bear Rainforest (Forest Management) Act ([SBC 2016] Chapter 16).
Policy_Content: The present Act enables the implementation of forest management aspects of the ecosystem based management (EBM) system by providing unique forest management rules for this globally significant area, while still ensuring the application of the normal Forest Act rules where appropriate. In particular, British Columbia has entered into government-to-government protocols with area First Nations to ensure management decisions are informed by their perspectives. An integral component of ecosystem-based management implementation in the Great Bear Rainforest is to ensure there is sufficient habitat for five species of special interest – mountain goats, grizzly bears, marbled murrelets, tailed frogs, and northern goshawk.

Policy: Law on the Latgale Special Economic Zone (2016)

The Law further provides for functions of the Latgale planning region development council in the management of the Latgale special economic zone; functions of the Latgale special economic zone authority;  budget of the Latgale special economic zone; support foundation for commercial activity of the Latgale special economic zone; tax relief permit; immovable property in the Latgale special economic zone; and control of aid for commercial activity.

The Act gives effect to the provisions of Articles 1, 10, 174, 196, 232 and paragraph 14 of Part 2 of the Fourth Schedule of the Constitution and Part VIII of the County Governments Act. The Act sets out guiding principles, and mechanism and processes of public participation, and provides with respect to encouragement and coordination of the public participation process, in particular at the local level. The Act also provides with respect to petitions and affirmative action programmes for people with disabilities, minorities and marginalized groups.

Policy: Regulation (2016: 448) on support for strategic use of cutting-edge technology for sustainable urban development.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, made under section 7 of Chapter 8  of the Government law, concerns granting of incentives for investment in cutting-edge technology for sustainable urban development in accordance with Commission Regulation (EU) No 1407/2013. This will promote the environmental, and social and economic dimensions of sustainable development. Cutting-edge technology for sustainable development means a new generation of advanced technology with high environmental performance and significant degree of innovation, and advanced system solutions: the integration of technical or other subsystems into a city to achieve significant synergies and environmental benefits. Support may be provided for project planning, planning and preliminary studies for sustainable urban development where the use of cutting-edge technology or advanced system solutions is in focus. The technology or system solutions must be able to be used in connection with new neighbourhoods being organized or existing areas are being renovated or administered.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil

Policy: Ley Nº IX-0939-2016 - Emergencia pública en materia ambiental en el ámbito de la Cuenca El Morro y su área de influencia.

El objetivo es mitigar y detener los procesos de erosión, agotamiento, degradación y desbalances hídricos del suelo de la cuenca, en el marco del derecho a un ambiente sano, equilibrado y apto para el desarrollo humano.

Policy: Act on environmental assessment of plans and programs (No. 425 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act aims at ensuring a high level of environmental protection which can contribute to integrating environmental measures into the preparation and adoption of plans and programs promoting sustainable development. For this scope to take effect, environmental assessment is carried out on significant effects on the environment caused by factors such as biodiversity, population, human health, flora, fauna, soil, land, water, air, climatic factors , material assets, landscape, cultural heritage, natural disaster risks and accidents. The Ministry of Environment and Food of Denmark shall regulate this Act and coordinate the required procedures for said environmental assessment of projects which may impact international protected areas and protected species.

Policy: Ley Nº 929 - Modifica la Ley Nº 462, Ley de conservación, fomento y desarrollo sostenible del sector forestal.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley modifica la que tiene por objeto establecer el régimen legal para la conservación, fomento y desarrollo sostenible del sector forestal, en lo relacionado con el Instituto Nacional Forestal (INAFOR) que, bajo la rectoría sectorial del Ministerio del Ambiente y de los Recursos Naturales, tiene por objeto velar por el cumplimiento del régimen forestal en todo el territorio nacional. El Ministerio del Ambiente y de los Recursos Naturales (MARENA), es la institución del Estado encargada de la administración de las tierras forestales nacionales, las que estarán sujetas a concesiones o contratos de explotación racional. La Comisión Nacional Forestal (CONAFOR) es la instancia del más alto nivel y foro para la concertación social del sector forestal, la cual tendrá participación en la formulación, seguimiento, control y aprobación de la política, la estrategia y demás normativas que se aprueben en materia forestal.

Policy: Order No. 186 of the Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources validating the Regulation on the procedure for the functioning of the electronic system for the issuance of permits in the field of waste management.
Policy_Content: This Order sets forth the procedure for the functioning of the electronic system for the issuance of permits in the field of waste management. The system provides: (a) access to information on the procedure of issuance of permits in the field of waste management in electronic form; (b) access to electronic forms of declarations related to waste management; (c) registration, processing and examination of electronic declarations by the person in charge; (d) provision of information on the status and results of examination of electronic declarations related to waste management; and (e) registration and acceptance of electronic declarations. Authorized state institution for issuance of permits for waste management and administrator of the electronic system shall be the Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Regulation No. 372 date 18.5.2016 approving the rules of communication, bilateral consultation, and decision-making of the type-A environmental permission for the functioning of installations placed in the territory of the Republic of Albania that has real potential for considerable negative impact in the environment of a different state, or after it is required by such a state.
Policy_Content: This Regulation lays down the rules of communication, bilateral consultation, and decision-making regarding the type-A environmental permission concerning the functioning of installations placed in the territory of the Republic of Albania that has real potential for considerable negative environmental impact in the territory of a different state. The rules concern the content of the application, the requirements for its publication in various media including the notification of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in order for them to follow up with the required trans-boundary consultation, as well as the rules of procedure for public consultation. The National Environmental Agency is the main authority responsible for implementation and coordinating with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs consultation with potential foreign stakeholders.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: 15 days after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Ley Nº 20.920 - Establece marco para la gestión de residuos, la responsabilidad extendida del productor y fomento al reciclaje.
Policy_Content: La presente ley tiene por objeto disminuir la generación de residuos y fomentar su reutilización, reciclaje y otro tipo de valorización, a través de la instauración de la responsabilidad extendida del productor y otros instrumentos de gestión de residuos, con el fin de proteger la salud de las personas y el medio ambiente. Algunos de los principios rectores que rigen esta materia son: a) el que contamina paga (el generador de un residuo es responsable de éste, así como de internalizar los costos y las externalidades negativas asociados a su manejo); b) jerarquía en el manejo de residuos (orden de preferencia de manejo, que considera como primera alternativa la prevención en la generación de residuos, luego la reutilización, el reciclaje de los mismos o de uno o más de sus componentes y la valorización energética de los residuos, total o parcial, dejando como última alternativa su eliminación, acorde al desarrollo de instrumentos legales, reglamentarios y económicos pertinentes); c) precautorio; d) responsabilidad del generador de un residuo.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Waste management,Polluter pays principle,Precautionary principle,Waste disposal,Waste prevention,Business/industry/corporations,Liability/compensation,Ecofriendly products/ecofriendly processes,Recycling/reuse,Basic legislation
Geographical_area: Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Decreto Ley Nº 2/2016 - Modifica la Ley Nº 6/1998, Ley de Regulación del Funcionamiento de las Secciones de Crédito de las Cooperativas.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Ley modifica la Ley que regula el funcionamiento de las Secciones de Crédito de las Cooperativas, en el sentido de introducir el capítulo IV, sobre el Fondo cooperativo de apoyo a las secciones de crédito, con la finalidad de dar soporte financiero a las cooperativas con sección de crédito con el objeto de contribuir al retorno a sus titulares los fondos constituidos como saldos acreedores a las secciones de crédito, siempre que los socios hayan acordado la baja de la sección de crédito correspondiente antes de recibir el mencionado soporte financiero.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Ley Nº 930 - Ley de fomento a la producción de granos básicos y ajonjolí de las pequeñas productoras y pequeños productores.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto fomentar la producción de granos básicos (frijol, maíz, arroz y sorgo) y ajonjolí de las pequeñas productoras y pequeños productores mediante el acceso al crédito para el desarrollo de actividades, prácticas y procesos productivos, y está dirigida a las pequeñas productoras y pequeños productores que posean como máximo 20 manzanas, y que para efectos de esta Ley el beneficio será aplicado hasta 5 manzanas dedicadas a la producción de granos básicos y ajonjolí. Para efectos de gozar del beneficio de la tasa de fomento, las pequeñas productoras y los pequeños productores de granos básicos y ajonjolí deberán inscribirse en el registro que para este fin crea el Ministerio de Economía Familiar Comunitaria, Cooperativa y Asociativa (MEFCCA).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants

Policy: Resolución Nº 72/2016 - Procedimiento para la Obtención del Certificado de Inclusión en el Régimen de Fomento de las Energías Renovables.

Policy: Decree No. 19/2016 amending the Regulation of the National Council for Sustainable Development.
Policy_Content: This Decree amends the Regulation of the National Council for Sustainable Development (CONDES). Amendments deal with the new composition of the CONDES which is chaired by the Minister of Land, Environment and Rural Development and has the following composition: a) Representative of the Ministry of Economy and Finance; b) Representative of the Ministry of Agriculture and Food Security; c) Representative of the Ministry of Transport and Communications; d) Representative of the Ministry of Public Works and Housing; e) Representative of the Ministry of Industry and Commerce; f) Representative of the Ministry of the Sea, Inland Waters and Fisheries; g) Representative of the Ministry of Mineral Resources and Energy; h) Representative of the Ministry of Education and Human Development; i) Representative of the Ministry of State Administration and Public Administration; j) Three individuals nominated by the Minister of Land, Environment and Rural Development; k) Three representatives of academic institutions; l) Three representatives of civil society organizations and the private sector. " In addition, it extinguishes the CONDES Secretariat.

Policy: Cabinet Regulation No. 294 of 2016 on Procedures for Calculating Savings of Primary Energy Produced by Cogeneration Plants
Policy_Content: The Regulation prescribes the procedures by which savings of primary energy produced by cogeneration plants must be calculated. The values which are used for the calculation of electricity produced in cogeneration must be determined on the basis of the expected or actual operation of the installation under normal conditions of use. In relation to micro-cogeneration installations such calculations may be based on approved values. The Regulation also adopts the following annexes: proportion between electricity produced in cogeneration and useful thermal energy for different cogeneration technologies; efficiency coefficients; and correction factors z for avoided grid losses that are applicable to the calculation of efficiency coefficient for separate production of electricity.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Décret n° 2016-292 du 17 mai 2016 fixant la structure type des ministères.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe le cadre de référence pour la définition des attributions, de l'organisation et du fonctionnement des ministères. La structure type se fonde sur les principes de clarification des missions de l'Etat et vise la construction d'une administration publique moderne pour l'efficacité du développement impliquant : la séparation des fonctions politiques, techniques et administratives au sein des ministères ; le respect de l’intérêt général, des principes et des valeurs de la gouvernance ; la satisfaction des usagers/clients de l'administration publique ; la subsidiarité ; la gestion axée sur les résultats ; la capitalisation des bonnes pratiques ; la gouvernance participative et inclusive ; la promotion de l'égalité des chances ; la promotion des compétences ; la responsabilisation des Agents publics ; le respect de l’environnement ; reddition des comptes et imputabilité ; et  la rupture avec l’impunité.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Western Africa
