Policy: Cabinet Regulation No. 297 of 2016 Procedures by which the State Fire and Rescue Service Performs and Manages the Fire-fighting and Rescue Operations
Policy_Content: This Regulation prescribes the procedures by which the State Fire and Rescue Service shall perform and manage the fire-fighting and rescue operations. At the place of the event the following priority order of the fire-fighting and rescue operations shall be complied with: rescue and evacuation of persons; elimination of threats of explosion, collapse of a building or structure, or leakage of hazardous substance; and containment of the spread of fire or hazardous factors that have arisen as a result of the accident.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Decree laying down detailed rules for the protection of quality of agricultural land and amending Decree specifying some details of agricultural land resources protection.
Policy_Content: This Decree of the Ministry of Environment lays down detailed rules for the quality protection of agricultural land. The preventive values of hazardous substances in the agricultural land are set out in Annex 1. The indicative values of hazardous substances in agricultural land are set out in Annex 2. Determination of the contents of hazardous substances in agricultural land shall be carried out using the procedures is specified in Annex 3. The sampling procedure for determination of contents of hazardous substances in agricultural land is set out in Annex 4. Part 2 of the present Decree lays down some amedments to Decree specifying some details of agricultural land resources protection. It repeals article 2 and Annexes 1 and 2 to the amended Decree.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on 1 June 2016.

Policy: Andhra Pradesh Forest (Amendment) Act, 2016 (Act No. 15 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act amends several sections of the Andhra Pradesh Forest Act, 1967. Amendments deal with administrative and legal proceedings, in particular dealing with the following issues: competent authorities; income earnings or assets derived or obtained form or attributable to illegally acquitted sandal wood or Red Sanders wood or other scheduled tree; land property; offences and penalties; Vehicles involved in smuggling Red Sanders Wood/Sandal Wood/ Scheduled tree; Seizure or freezing of illegally acquired property; creation of Special Courts for trial of forest offences, etc.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Indian Ocean, South Asian Seas, Southern Asia
Entry into force notes: This Act shall come into force on such date as the State Government may, by notification in the Andhra Pradesh Gazette, appoint.

Policy: Loi n° 2016-05 du 17 mai 2016 portant Code de l'Electricité.
Policy_Content: La présente loi régit les activités de production, de transport, d'importation, d'exportation, de transit, de distribution et de commercialisation de l'énergie électrique de toutes sources primaires (source existante dans son état naturel sur le territoire de la République du Niger ou importée, qui peut être soit utilisée directement en tant que combustible, comme les matières organiques (pétrole, huile, schiste, charbon, tourbe, biomasse, gaz combustible, etc.), soit convertie en d'autres formes d'énergie comme le combustible nucléaire, soit dérivée d'une source d'énergie renouvelable (Hydraulique, solaire, éolienne et géothermique, etc.); ou secondaires (source résultant de la conversion des ressources d'énergie primaires, avec perte d'une portion du capital origine d'énergie, par un procédé de transformation) en République du Niger. Le service public de l'énergie électrique correspond aux missions suivantes: garantir un approvisionnement permanent et continu pour la sécurisation de la fourniture en énergie électrique dans les meilleures conditions de qualité et de prix; assurer le respect des principes d’égalité de traitement et d'accès aux services de l'électricité sur l'ensemble du territoire national; assurer la desserte sur le territoire national selon l' adaptabilité et l' acceptabilité du service de l'électricité que l'intérêt général peut raisonnablement commander; rationaliser la production, le transport, l'importation, l'exportation, le dispatching et la distribution par la maitrise de la demande d'énergie, la gestion optimale des ressources et des choix technologiques futurs, en accord avec les politiques de développement du sous- secteur de l'électricité tout en garantissant son équilibre financier et économique. Sont abrogées toutes dispositions antérieures contraires à la présente loi, notamment la loi n° 2003-004 du 31 janvier 2003 portant Code de l'Electricité.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Africa, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy: Republic Act No. 10816 on Farm Tourism.
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 18 sections, provides for the Development and Promotion of Farm Tourism in the Philippines. The Act seeks to promote environment-friendly, efficient and sustainable farm practices; provide alternative recreation facilities and farm tourism activities and promote health and wellness with high-quality farm-produced food. To maximize the benefits that can be derived from agriculture and tourism combined, it is therefore the declared policy of the State to provide the policy and enabling environment for the encouragement, development and promotion of farm tourism in the country.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, North Pacific, South-Eastern Asia
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force 15 days after its publication.

Policy: Ley Nº 30435 - Ley que crea el Sistema Nacional de Focalización (SINAFO).
Policy_Content: La presente Ley crea el Sistema Nacional de Focalización (SINAFO) que establece los principios, alcance, organización, ámbito, procesos, procedimientos, infracciones y sanciones que lo regulan, y especifica los integrantes del Sistema y sus funciones en concordancia con la Política Social y en articulación con el Sistema Nacional de Desarrollo e Inclusión Social (SINADIS). EL SINAFO tiene por objeto lograr una adecuada asignación de los recursos públicos de las intervenciones públicas definidas en el marco de la política social del Estado, con la finalidad de contribuir al cierre de brechas relativas a los problemas o necesidades que dichas intervenciones buscan resolver. A partir de la vigencia de la presente Ley, el Sistema de Focalización de Hogares (SISFOH), o la denominación que el Ministerio de Desarrollo e Inclusión Social (MIDIS) le asigne, formará parte del Sistema Nacional de Focalización (SINAFO).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Institution,Sustainable development,Financial agricultural measures,Less favoured areas,Social protection,Poverty,Data collection/reporting,Subsidy/incentive,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Classification/declassification
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Resolución Nº 186-2016-MEM ─ Criterios para la elaboración de Auditorías Energéticas en entidades del Sector Público.
Policy_Content: El presente Resolución aprueba los criterios para la elaboración de Auditorías Energéticas que deberán realizar las entidades del sector público cuya facturación mensual por consumo de energía eléctrica sea mayor a cuatro Unidades Impositivas Tributarias (UIT), con el objeto de proveer de información útil para que las entidades del sector público cuenten con los lineamientos generales para el desarrollo de una auditoría energética, contribuyendo considerablemente al ahorro energético en la entidad. Los criterios tienen como finalidad de optimizar los consumos energéticos, por ende, la reducción de sus facturaciones por consumo de energía, a fin de coadyuvar al desarrollo energético sostenible del país.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Resolución Nº 63 - Parámetros de conducta y participación de los agentes dentro de las actividades de comercialización mayorista y distribución de gas licuado de petróleo (GLP).
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución tiene por objeto establecer medidas regulatorias dentro de las actividades de comercialización mayorista y distribución de gas licuado de petroleo (GLP), en relación con los parámetros de conducta y participación de los agentes de estas actividades, a fin de evitar que se presenten eventos que afecten el marco regulatorio y la forma como se debe realizar la prestación del servicio público domiciliario de GLP, reforzando la operatividad del esquema de responsabilidad de marca en cilindros y propiedad de los distribuidores.

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 2/16 - Normas y procedimientos para la aplicación de exoneraciones a los sectores productivos.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo aprueba las normas y procedimientos para la aplicación de exoneraciones de impuestos en las compras locales e importaciones a los sectores productivos, en aplicación de la Ley Nº 822, Ley de Concertación Tributaria (LCT), que exonera de impuestos las enajenaciones de materias primas, bienes intermedios, bienes de capital, repuestos, partes y accesorios para la maquinaria y equipos a las productores agropecuarios y de la micro, pequeña y mediana empresa industrial y pesquera, mediante lista taxativa. Beneficios que se aplicarán de manera individual a cada productor, quien estará exonerado y gravado con las alícuotas correspondientes, en los plazos y porcentajes establecidos.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 9/16 - Lista taxativa de bienes o mercancías exentas del pago del IVA.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo aprueba la lista taxativa de bienes o mercancías exentas del pago del IVA, en aplicación de la Ley Nº 822, Ley de Concertación Tributaria (LCT). Están exentas del traslado del IVA, mediante listas taxativas establecidas las siguientes enajenaciones, entre otras: los bienes agrícolas producidos en el país, no sometidos a procesos de transformación o envase; el arroz, excepto el empacado o envasado en cualquier presentación menor o igual de cincuenta libras y de calidad mayor a 80/20; el azúcar de caña; el aceite comestible vegetal, excepto el de oliva, ajonjolí, girasol y maíz; el café molido; los huevos de gallina; la tortilla de maíz; sal comestible; harina de trigo, maíz y soja; pan simple y pan dulce tradicionales; levaduras vivas para uso exclusivo en la fabricación del pan simple y pan dulce tradicionales; leche modificada, maternizada, integra y fluida; preparaciones para la alimentación de lactantes; las bebidas no alcohólicas a base de leche, aromatizadas, o con frutas o cacao natural o de origen natural; el queso artesanal nacional.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Keyword: Tax/levy,Agricultural commodities,Internal trade,International trade,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Subsidy/incentive,Business/industry/corporations,Non-governmental entity,Equipment,Processing/handling

Policy: Décret n°2016-359/PRES/PM/MUH du 16 mai 2016 portant organisation du Ministère de l’Urbanisme et de l’Habitat.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe l’organisation du Ministère de l’Urbanisme et de l’Habitat qui s’articule autour des structures suivantes : le Cabinet du Ministre; et le Secrétariat Général.  La cellule environnementale est chargée de: du plaidoyer pour l’intégration de la dimension environnementale dans les politiques, programmes et projets du département ministériel; la participation à la vulgarisation des outils juridiques et techniques de l’évaluation environnementale; la participation avec le ministère en charge de l’environnement et les agences d’exécution des projets, au suivi de la mise en œuvre des plans de gestion environnementale et sociale; l’appui conseil au ministère dans les domaines de l’environnement ou elles ont acquis des compétences les concernant; la participation à l’éducation environnementale et à toute activité relevant du domaine de l’environnement.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy: Measures for Cleaner Production Review.
Policy_Content: For purposes of promoting cleaner production and regulating cleaner production review, these Measures are enacted in accordance with the Cleaner Production Promotion Law of the People's Republic of China. The Measures consist of 6 Chapters:  General Provisions; 	Scope of Cleaner Production Review; Conduct of Cleaner Production Review;  Organization and Management of Cleaner Production Review; Rewards and Penalties; Supplementary Provisions.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Energy, Environment gen., General

Policy: Law No. 13.288 providing for integration contracts, obligations and responsibilities in contractual relations between integrated producers.
Policy_Content: This Law provides for vertical integration contracts in agroforestry activities, establishes general obligations and responsibilities for integrated producers and integrators. In addition, it establishes transparency mechanisms in the contractual relationship, creates national integration forums and Commissions for Monitoring, Development and Reconciliation of Integration (CADEC), or similar, respecting existing structures. Vertical integration between cooperatives and their members or between cooperatives is a cooperative act, regulated by specific legislation applicable to cooperative societies and aims to plan and carry out the production and industrialization or commercialization of raw materials, intermediate goods or final consumer goods, with reciprocal responsibilities and obligations established in integration contracts.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Forestry
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Regulation regarding Muğla Sitki Koçman University agricultural research and practice center.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the Center for Agricultural Research and Practice under the University of Muğla Sıtkı Koçman.   The Regulation also provides for the main objectives and the scope of activity of the Center. The objectives of the Center are defined as; defining the level of productivity of agricultural lands, making research on increasing the productivity of the agricultural lands, making laboratory analysis of soil, plant, irrigation water and fertilizers upon request by public and private institutions, conducting consultancy on agricultural production and raising awareness by publishing the results of research and practices conducted by the Center. The Regulation further sets forth the governing bodies, their duties and responsibilities. The Regulation also covers the rules and procedures regarding the management and administration.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Agricultural development,Agricultural land,Capacity building,Institution,Irrigation,Research,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Sustainable development,Sustainable use,Fertilizers/nutrients
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: The Regulation enters into force on the day it is published in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 003-2016-MIDIS ─ Aprueba la Estrategia de Acción Social con Sostenibilidad.
Policy_Content: La Estrategia de Acción Social con Sostenibilidad (EASS) es un instrumento intersectorial de alcance nacional, cuyo objetivo general es mejorar las condiciones de vida y desarrollo de la población de las comunidades nativas de la Amazonía. Son objetivos específicos los siguientes: a) ofertar servicios de calidad y culturalmente pertinentes a la población de las comunidades nativas, que reconozcan el ejercicio de los derechos de los pueblos indígenas; b) proveer a la población de las comunidades nativas los servicios que oferta el Estado, tanto en términos de disponibilidad como de acceso a los mismos; c) promover la inclusión económica de los hogares amazónicos con economías de subsistencia; d) facilitar información a la población de las comunidades nativas sobre la disponibilidad y el acceso a los servicios del Estado, así como sobre su derecho ciudadano a hacer uso de los mismos. El punto VI contiene una tabla con los resultados e intervenciones priorizados, organizados según las intervenciones se dirijan a individuos y familias, o bien a comunidades indígenas (dimensión colectiva).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Forestry, Land & soil, Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Agro-forestry,Biodiversity,Indigenous peoples,Community management,Poverty,Smallholders/peasants,Capacity building,Sustainable use,Family farming,Food security,Afforestation/reforestation,Forest management/forest conservation,Agricultural land,Land tenure,Ecosystem preservation
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Uganda Development Corporation Act, 2016.
Policy_Content: This Act provides with for the establishment of the Uganda Development Corporation as a body corporate, defines its object and its functions and powers, and provides rules for its organization and administration. The object of the Corporation is to promote and facilitate the industrial and economic development of Uganda. The Corporation shall, among other things, facilitate Government investment in strategic sectors of the economy, promote, facilitate and implement public private partnerships and to take over the interest of Government in the entities specified in Schedule 2 and administer those entities. The Corporation shall be governed by a Board. The Act also establishes an Industrial and Economic Development Fund.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, General
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Regulation on Water Quality Control
Policy_Content: This Regulation sets provisions to control the quality of water in the country. The Regulation consists of 37 articles, divided into 4 Chapters: General Provisions (I); Polluters of Water Resources (II); Duties of Ministries, Official Authorities, Non-governmental Authorities, and Individuals (III); Final Provisions (IV). The main objectives of the Regulation include: to determine water quality control’s standards; to prevent pollution of water resources; to provide canalization and discharge sewage services. Any activities which cause water pollution more than the permitted limit of national standards, are prohibited. Following activities by ministries and official authorities require the permit of Department of Environment: storage of coal and other mining materials; storage of explosives; establishment and development of oil products’ reserves; establishment of storage for destroyed equipment, used bottles and used tires; engine washing; storage of remaining materials of incinerators; establishment of industrial installations; construction of septic sewage tanks; establishment of animal husbandry farms; installation and development of drainage; storage of construction waste. The Ministry of Energy and Water shall prepare and update  groundwater vulnerability maps and control regularly the quality of groundwater. The same Ministry is also responsible for: managing groundwater to prevent floods; storing water of water bodies; constructing installations and canals; transferring water; preventing salinization of freshwaters. The Department of Environment shall monitor the compliance with the provisions of this Regulation.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Emissions,Mining,Oil pollution,Public health,Authorization/permit,Drainage/land reclamation,Flood,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Freshwater resources management,Groundwater,Inspection,Institution,Monitoring,Sewerage,Standards,Surface water,Water quality standards,Waterworks,Pollution control,Enforcement/compliance

Policy: Real Decreto Nº 197/2016 - Bases reguladoras de la concesión de ayudas a la cooperación para planteamientos conjuntos con respecto a proyectos medioambientales y prácticas medioambientales en curso orientados a la mejora de la eficiencia energética mediante el uso de energías renovables.
Policy_Content: El presente Real Decreto tiene por objeto establecer las bases reguladoras para la concesión, en régimen de concurrencia competitiva, de subvenciones para el apoyo financiero a la cooperación para planteamientos conjuntos con respecto a proyectos medioambientales y prácticas medioambientales en curso, orientados a la mejora de la eficiencia energética mediante el uso de energías renovables, en el marco del Programa Nacional de Desarrollo Rural 2014 - 2020. En la cooperación participarán al menos dos de las siguientes figuras, una entidad asociativa prioritaria, una Pequeña y mediana empresa agroalimentaria supraautonómica (PYME supraautonómica) u otra persona física o jurídica, siendo imprescindible la participación de una entidad asociativa prioritaria o una PYME supraautonómica.

Policy: Announcement of the Department of Fisheries on notification of operations by the operators of aquaculture control (Red Lobster or Crayfish Shrimp Procambarus clarkii or Cherax spp.) (No. 2), 2016.
Policy_Content: These Rules of the Director-General of the Department of Fisheries, made under Section 78 (1) and (7) of the Royal Fisheries Ordinance concern aquaculture of specified crustacean. Section 78. An aquaculture undertaking an aquaculture enterprise under control in aquaculture zones pursuant to section 77 shall comply with specified requirements: (1) an aquaculture entrepreneur shall have to notify the aquaculture undertaking to the competent (local) authority as per the prescribed form and procedure (see Schedule). Cultivation shall take place with the aquaculture zones prescribed by the provincial Fisheries Commission. The following documents must be attached; (1) in the case of a natural person, a copy of ID card and residence; (2) In the case of a juristic person, a copy of the certificate of incorporation and a copy of the identification card and a copy of residence of managing director. The competent official shall issue a certificate of notification in the prescribed form. Operators of controlled aquaculture must comply with requirements to protect the environment as follows regarding the construction of the pond, drainage of pond water and prevention of release of red shrimp or crayfish shrimp into the environment or public watercourse.
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Water

Policy: Décret n°2016-357/ PRES/MCIA/MINEFID du 13 mai 2016 portant approbation des statuts de l’Agence Burkinabé de Normalisation, de la Métrologie et de la Qualité.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret approuve les statuts de l’Agence Burkinabé de Normalisation, de la Métrologie et de la Qualité. Policy: Prime Minister’s Order No. 15/PM on Strengthening Strictness of Timber Harvest Management and Inspection, Timber Transport and Business.
Policy_Content: This Order, based on the Forestry Law No. 06/NA of 24 December 2007, aims at strengthening the implementation of forest management, in particular timber business, harvest, processing and trade by strictly respecting laws and regulations established by the Government to prevent and eliminate drawback within forestry sector. The Prime Minister establishes the following: 1. Strengthening the emphasis and responsibilities in implementing ministerial duties and responsibilities in accordance with legislation related to forest governance, timber harvest, transport and business. 2. Suspend the export of logs, big size sawed timbers, sawn timbers, spited wood, roots, stumps, knots, branches and standing trees or decorative trees that are harvested from natural forest in any cases, including the timbers approved by Government that have not yet been implemented; logs must be processed to create value-added based on the standard set by the Ministry of Industry and Commerce (according to the Decision No. 2005/MOIC.DoIH, of 28/9/2015) prior to granting approvals for export.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Regional Law No.532 “On objects of cultural heritage”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations originating in the sphere of conservation, management, promotion and state protection of the objects of cultural heritage of regional significance.  Identified objects of cultural heritage shall be subject to mandatory state registration. Establishment and mapping of the boundaries of land areas containing objects of cultural heritage and land-use planning within the boundaries of the aforesaid areas, and special regime of land tenure shall be validated by the Regional Government. Regional executive body in the sphere of protection of the objects of cultural heritage shall be authorized to impose restrictions or stop movement of transport vehicle on the territory of areas containing objects of cultural heritage in case of risks for objects of cultural heritage. Special regional programs shall be adopted for protection of the objects of cultural heritage.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil

Policy: Ley Nº 30446 - Ley que establece el marco legal complementario para las Zonas Especiales de Desarrollo (ZED).
Policy_Content: La presente Ley dispone que los Centros de exportación, transformación, industria, comercialización y servicios (CETICOS), se denominarán Zonas especiales de desarrollo (ZED), siendo declarado de interés nacional su funcionamiento, con el objeto de promover la estabilidad de las inversiones, fomentar el empleo, contribuir al desarrollo socioeconómico sostenible y promover la competitividad e innovación en las regiones donde se ubican. Se amplía el plazo de vigencia de los beneficios, las exoneraciones y la permanencia de mercancías en las ZED existentes hasta el 31 de diciembre de 2042. Las ZED constituyen “punto de llegada” sin menoscabo de su condición de zona primaria aduanera de trato especial. El ingreso de mercancías destinadas a las ZED cancelará los regímenes aduaneros temporales y el transporte internacional de mercancías.

Policy: Energy Act 2016 (c. 20).
Policy_Content: This Act contains provisions to implement recommendations on UK offshore oil and gas recovery and its regulation. The Act  establishes the Oil and Gas Authority (OGA) as an independent regulator (taking the form of a Government company), transfers regulatory powers and functions to it, as well as providing it with new powers. This ensures the OGA has the powers it needs to be an independent and effective regulator, and enable it to deliver on a strategy to give effect to the principal objective, defined in section 9A of the Petroleum Act 1998. The Act also enables more comprehensive charging of the offshore oil and gas industry for permits and licences for environmental and decommissioning activity. This allows Government to continue to recover the costs of its environmental and decommissioning activity in line with the ‘polluter pays’ principle. The Act makes changes so that local authorities decide whether to approve planning applications for new onshore wind farms, and brings forward the closure of the Renewables Obligation (RO) to new onshore wind in Great Britain. It also allows for provision to be made for restricting the use of renewables obligation certificates relating to new onshore wind in Northern Ireland. In relation to onshore oil and gas licensing in Scotland and Wales, the Act will respect the changing devolution position. The Secretary of State’s environmental regulatory functions in relation to oil and gas will not be transferred. The OGA will additional powers including: access to company meetings; data acquisition, retention and transfer; dispute resolution; and sanctions. The Act introduces provisions in relation to charges for the offshore oil and gas environmental regulator's services to the industry and makes legislative changes with respect to consenting of onshore wind farms (planning regime in the Town and Country Planning Act 1990).
Subject: Energy, Environment gen., Mineral resources, Sea
Keyword: Energy conservation/energy production,Renewable energy,Institution,Pollution control,Environmental planning,Marine pollution,Ecofriendly products/ecofriendly processes,Mining,Natural gas,Oil,Exploration

Policy: Loi sur l’action publique en vue d’un développement durable (Agenda 21) (LDD)
Policy_Content: L’ensemble des activités des pouvoirs publics s’inscrit dans le cadre d'un développement équilibré et durable de Genève et de la région, qui soit compatible avec celui de la planète et qui préserve les facultés des générations futures de satisfaire leurs propres besoins. A cette fin, la convergence et l'équilibre durable entre efficacité économique, solidarité sociale et responsabilité écologique sont recherchés. Le Grand Conseil et le Conseil d’Etat veillent à la cohérence des objectifs poursuivis et des modalités adoptées, dans tous les domaines de l’action publique, avec la perspective d’un développement durable. Le département chargé du développement durable est l'autorité compétente pour l'application de la présente loi. A ce titre, il est chargé d'assurer la transversalité et la cohérence de l'action du canton en la matière.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Decree No. 8.772 regulating Law No. 13.123 providing for the access to genetic resources, protection and access to associated traditional knowledge and the sharing of benefits for conservation and sustainable use of biodiversity.
Policy_Content: This Decree consisting of 119 articles divided into 9 Chapters and one Annex, regulates Law No. 13.123 on the access to genetic resources, protection and access to associated traditional knowledge and the sharing of benefits for conservation and sustainable use of biodiversity. Chapter II regulates the Board of the Genetic Heritage Management - CGen, collegiate body of deliberative, legislative, advisory and appellate character has the following skills: I - to coordinate the preparation and implementation of policies for the management of access to genetic resources and associated traditional knowledge and benefit sharing; international trade of part or whole organisms, dead or alive of animal species, plants, microbial or of different origins, destined to the access to genetic resources; and implementation of international treaties on genetic resources or associated traditional knowledge approved by the National Congress. Chapter III assures the right to participation of indigenous peoples, traditional communities and traditional farmers who create, develop, hold or preserve traditional knowledge associated with the decision-making process on issues related to access to associated traditional knowledge and the sharing of benefits arising from such access. Chapter IV creates the National Genetic Heritage and Associated Traditional Knowledge Management System - Sis-Gen, electronic system to be implemented, maintained and operated by the Executive Secretariat of CGen for managing specific issues. Chapter V deals with the sharing of benefits mentioned in Law No. 13.123. Chapter VI establishes administrative offense against the genetic heritage or associated traditional knowledge the provisions of arts. 78-91 of this Decree. Chapter VII deals with the National Fund for Benefit Sharing - FNRB, established by Law No. 13,123, 2015, under the Ministry of Environment, having financial nature and intended to support actions and activities aimed at enhancing the genetic resources and associated traditional knowledge and promote their use in a sustainable manner. Chapter VIII establishes Transitory Provisions on the Adjustment and Regularization of activities. The Annex specifies the List of Benefits by classification.
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen., Cultivated plants
Keyword: Access and benefit-sharing,Biological agents,Biosafety,Biosecurity,Institution,Biodiversity,Biotechnology,Traditional knowledge/indigenous knowledge,Animal health,Animal production,Genetic resources

Among them, the forest coverage rate shall increase 23.04%, the forest stock amount will increase 1.4 billion cubic meters, the area of wetland will reach 800 million acres, the proportion of the area of forestry nature reserves to the total territory area will be more than 17%.

Policy: Política Forestal 2015-2035.
Policy_Content: El presente documento establece la Política Forestal relativa al período 2015-2035, que constituye una política sectorial de alcance nacional cuyo objeto es delinear los ejes estratégicos, definir objetivos generales y específicos, elaborar programas, identificar instrumentos y precisar mecanismos para alcanzar un desarrollo forestal sustentable.  La política está estructurada en torno a cuatro ejes estratégicos, cada uno de ellos desagregado en objetivos de impacto y objetivos de resultado y que presentan una síntesis de la línea base o situación inicial (al año 2015) y de las situaciones esperadas en el corto, mediano y largo plazo, fijadas en períodos de cuatro (2020), diez (2025) y veinte años (2035), respectivamente. Los cuatro ejes estratégicos son: 1) Institucionalidad forestal; 2) Productividad y crecimiento económico; 3) Inclusión y equidad social; 4) Protección y restauración del patrimonio forestal.

Policy: Décret n° 2016-064-PR 11-05-2016 portant création, attributions, organisation et fonctionnement de l’agence togolaise d’électrification rurale et des énergies renouvelables (AT2ER).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée l’agence togolaise d’électrification rurale et des énergies renouvelables (AT2ER), dont il fixe les attributions et détermine l’organisation et le fonctionnement. L’agence est chargée d’assurer: la programmation et la réalisation des ouvrages d’électrification rurale; la mise en valeur du potentiel national en énergies renouvelables ; la promotion et la vulgarisation des énergies renouvelables; la conduite des procédures de passation des marchés d’électrification rurale et de développement des énergies renouvelables; la conception des dossiers techniques en liaison avec les administrations concernées, les opérateurs du secteur pour le compte des communautés rurales, en vue du financement des projets et programmes d’électrification rurale et des énergies renouvelables; la proposition de mécanismes de financement et de gestion des programmes d’électrification en milieu rural et de promotion des énergies renouvelables; l’encadrement des communautés rurales bénéficiaires des installations d’électrification et des ouvrages d’énergies renouvelables en milieu rural dans la gestion et la maintenance des dits ouvrages ; la mobilisation des institutions pour le financement de l’électrification rurale et le développement des énergies renouvelables ; la réalisation de toute autre action rentrant dans le cadre de sa mission et qui lui serait confiée par l’Etat. L’agence est dotée de: un conseil de surveillance; un conseil d’administration; et une direction générale.

Policy: National Biodiversity Strategic Action Plan 2016-2022.
Policy_Content: The National Biodiversity Strategic Action Plan (NBSAP) is a planning instrument with a national coverage, relating to the period 2016-2022, which provides the strategic approach needed to ensure that Sri Lanka’s rich biodiversity is conserved and used in a sustainable manner. Its vision is that Sri Lanka’s biodiversity is valued, conserved, sustainably used and is more resilient and able to adapt to change, at the same time providing essential services and delivering benefits for all Sri Lankans, as well as contributing to sustaining a healthy planet. The document includes national targets that are synergistic with global targets such as the Aichi Biodiversity Targets and Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). In particular, 12 National Targets for 2022 are established (see Chapter 2). The NBSAP is based on the following five strategic objectives: (1) Ensure the long-term conservation of biodiversity; (2) Promote sustainable use of biological resources; (3) Conserve agrobiodiversity; (4) Promote equitable sharing of benefits from biodiversity; and (5) Improve human well-being through an ecosystem approach.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: National Disaster Management Plan (NDMP) 2016.
Policy_Content: The National Disaster Management Plan (NDMP) provides a framework and direction to the government agencies for all phases of disaster management cycle. The NDMP provides an over-arching planning framework for DM for the whole country, reviewed and updated annually. Disaster management, covering prevention, preparedness, response, and recovery, necessarily involves multiple agencies. Hence, the inter-agency coordination and collaboration among stakeholders are of utmost importance for the successful implementation of the NDMP and in ensuring effective risk reduction, response and recovery. It is in accordance with the provisions of the Disaster Management Act 2005, the guidance given in the National Policy on Disaster Management 2009 and the established national practices. Relevant agencies – central or state – will carry out disaster management activities in different phases in the disaster-affected areas depending on the type and scale of disaster. The NDMP provides a framework covering all aspects of the disaster management cycle. It covers disaster risk reduction, mitigation, preparedness, response, recovery, and betterment reconstruction. It recognises that effective disaster management necessitates a comprehensive framework encompassing multiple hazards. The NDMP incorporates an integrated approach that ensures the involvement of government agencies, numerous other relevant organisations, private sector participants, and local communities.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Forestry, Water

Policy: Sri Lanka E-agriculture Strategy.
Policy_Content: The Sri Lanka E-agriculture Strategy lays down a roadmap by which Information Communication Technology (ICT) developments can significantly contribute towards achievement of the country’s agricultural vision and development objectives. It integrates ICT experiments under a collaborative and inclusive framework while prioritizing solutions that can be scaled up and supported through the required ecosystem. This document provides an analysis and evaluation of current and prospective roles of ICT in agriculture in Sri Lanka, lays down a vision for e-agriculture in the country and recommends specific actions plans. The strategy document has been prepared based on the framework proposed by the FAO and the International Telecommunication Union (ITU) The strategy has been prepared through extensive research and stakeholder consultation from multiple sectors and has taken into consideration the fact that ICT would influence peoples life from many different aspects, not only agriculture, and will act as an efficiency multiplier that enables people and processes to achieve higher level of efficiency, efficacy and enhance the overall quality of life. It leverages on the existing ICT developments that impact agriculture in Sri Lanka and aims to mainstream it.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Keyword: Public health,Food security,Potable water,Institution,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Agricultural development,Nutrition,Special dietary uses,Breastfeeding/infant food,Food waste

Policy: Plan National Multisectoriel de Nutrition (2016-2020).
Policy_Content: La malnutrition, constitue un obstacle majeur au développement économique et social, notamment chez les enfants et les femmes. Pour remédier à cette situation, la Côte d’ Ivoire a adopté le 11 mai 2016, son «Plan National Multisectoriel de Nutrition (2016-2020). L’objectif général de ce plan est d’améliorer le statut nutritionnel de la population. Spécifiquement, il vise à réduire de 29,8% à 20% la prévalence du retard de croissance chez les enfants de moins de cinq ans; réduire de 7,5% à 5% la prévalence de la malnutrition aiguë globale; réduire de 14,9% à 10% la prévalence de l’insuffisance pondérale; réduire de 14,8% à 12% la prévalence du faible poids de naissance; réduire de 10% la prévalence du surpoids chez les populations ciblées; réduire la prévalence de l’anémie de 75% à 60% chez l’enfant et de 54% à 42% chez la femme en âge de procréer; et éliminer les troubles dus aux carences en iode. Au plan sectoriel, il vise à réduire de 20,5% à 15% la proportion de la population n’atteignant pas le niveau minimum d’apport calorique; accroître le taux d’allaitement maternel exclusif de 12% à 50 %; amener 40% de la population à adopter des Actions Essentielles en Nutrition; assurer une couverture maladie universelle à 80% de la population; réduire la proportion des ménages en insécurité alimentaire en milieu rural en dessous de 10%; réduire la prévalence des maladies liées aux aliments contaminés; assurer l’accès à l’eau propre à la population de 77% à 100% dans les zones à forte prévalence de malnutrition; porter la couverture de cantines scolaires à 100% dans les régions à forte prévalence de malnutrition et d’insécurité alimentaire; et apporter des services sociaux à 70% de la population hautement vulnérable. Pour réaliser ces objectifs, le plan s’articule autour de sept (7) axes prioritaires.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Food & nutrition, Fisheries
Keyword: Farming,Family farming,Capacity building,Artisanal fishing,Aquaculture,Community management,Nutrition,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,School feeding,Gender,Poverty,Processing/handling,Governance,Animal production

Policy: Bhutan E-RNR Masterplan.
Policy_Content: This Bhutan E-RNR Masterplan is a setoral policy document for the period of 2016-2023. As part of the country’s information and communication technology (ICT) efforts, this e-renewable natural resources (e-RNR) master plan has been developed using the RNR sector’s eleventh five year plan (2013-2018) as the guiding framework. The vision is: By 2023, application of Information and communication technologies (ICTs) will accelerate sustainable growth of renewable natural resources sector for equitable socio-economic well-being of the people and the nation.

Policy: Decree on reporting on energy from supported sources.
Policy_Content: This Decree of the Ministry of Industry and Trade, which is composed of 12 articles and five Annexes, lays down: (a) the way of reporting the amount of electricity from a renewable source and a non-renewable source, the amount of heat from a renewable source and a secondary source, real acquired amount of energy source and its quality, real use of all acquired energy sources; (b) the scope of data, deadlines and method of transmitting and recording the measured or calculated amount of electricity from supported sources; (c) the scope of data, deadlines and method of transmission and recording of measured amount of electricity from supported sources in the form of purchase prices; (d) the method, scope and deadlines of the transmission and recording of measured amount of produced and supplied heat from renewable sources to the heat distribution system; (e) the method of measuring and calculating the amount of electricity produced from renewable energy sources or secondary sources during production of electricity from a renewable source or a secondary source; (f) the method and extent of measurement of electricity produced, useful heat and spent fuel; (g) the method and extent of measurement of the amount of electricity produced at generator terminals, useful heat and spent fuel for electricity from high efficiency combined heat and power; (h) method of measuring heat supplied to the heat supply system; (i) method of registration of the place of delivery of heat produced from the heat generator to the heat distribution system; (j) method and procedure for putting the power plant into operation and the method and procedure for putting the heat generator into operation.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on 1 June 2016.

Policy: Decree No. D1-346 of the Minister of Environment validating environmental monitoring measures for the period of 2014-2020.
Policy_Content: This Decree regards disbursement of funds allocated by the European Union as investment program for the period of 2014-2020 related to environment, sustainable use of natural resources and adaptation to climate change.  It establishes requirements for the applicants regarding preparation and submittal of applications for financing. Only legal persons shall be considered applicants. The distributor of funds in the form of non-refundable subsidy shall be the Ministry of Environment. The scope of environmental monitoring shall be to improve the system of hydrological, meteorological observation, forecasting, modeling, hydrometeorological and climate services, monitoring of air quality and collection of environmental information, monitoring of forest condition, use, restoration, establishment and protection.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Regulation (EU) 2016/791 of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Regulations (EU) No. 1308/2013 and (EU) No. 1306/2013 as regards the aid scheme for the supply of fruit and vegetables, bananas and milk in educational establishments.
Policy_Content: This Regulation replaces Section 1 of Chapter II of Title I of Part II of Regulations (EU) No. 1308/2013 as regards aid for the supply of fruit and vegetables and of milk and milk products in educational establishments. The replaced provisions concern the aid scheme intended to improve the distribution of agricultural products and improving children's eating habits is aimed at children who regularly attend nurseries, pre-schools or primary or secondary-level educational establishments which are administered or recognized by the competent authorities of Member States. Further amendments concern Regulation (EU) No. 1306/2013 as regards the European Union's financial contribution to the measures related to animal diseases and loss of consumer confidence as referred to in article 220 of Regulation (EU) No. 1308/2013.

Policy: Order No. 285 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on the national park “Lower Kama”.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes that the location of the national park “Lower Kama” shall be Tatarstan region of the Russian Federation. National park “Lower Kama” shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of natural complexes, unique and reference natural sites and objects; (b) conservation of historical and cultural heritage; (c) environmental education of the population; (d) promotion of regulated tourism and recreation; (e) development and introduction of scientific methods of nature protection and environmental education; (f) implementation of state environmental monitoring; and (g) restoration of disturbed natural and historical-cultural complexes and objects. On the territory of the national park, shall be prohibited any activity that can damage natural complexes and objects of flora and fauna, cultural and historical objects and which contradicts the purposes and tasks of the national park, including: (a) exploration and mining; (b) disturbance of the soil cover and geological outcrops; (c) activities entailing changes in the hydrological regime; (d) allotment of land parcels for horticulture and smallholding; (e) construction of main roads, pipelines, power transmission lines and other communications, as well as construction and operation of economic and residential facilities, except for tourism industry facilities, museums and information centers, facilities related to the functioning of the national park and the functioning of settlement located within its boundaries; (f) logging (except for timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs); (g) procurement of soft resin; (h) commercial, sport and artisanal hunting, commercial and coastal fisheries; (i) procurement of edible non-timber forest resources (with the exception of procurement by citizens of such resources for their own personal needs); (j) disturbance of natural habitats of wild fauna and wild flora species; (k) biological collections, except for research purposes, envisaged by thematic and research plans of the Institution; (l) introduction of living organisms in order to acclimatize them; (m) passage and grazing of domestic animals; (n) water logging; (o) organization of mass sports and entertainment events, organization of tourist camps and making bonfires outside the specially designated places for such purpose; (p) unauthorized conduct of archaeological excavations, collection and removal of objects of historical and cultural value; (q) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, including hunting firearms and hunting gear; (r) blasting operations; (s) burning of vegetation (with the exception of fire-fighting measures implemented in coordination with the Institution); (t) clear cutting of forest species and shrubbery, with the exception of sanitary felling, felling associated with extinguishing forest fires, including the creation of fire breaks, and felling associated with the construction, reconstruction and operation of line facilities carried out in accordance with this Regulations; (u) waste disposal of domestic and non-domestic waste, radioactive waste, chemical, explosive, toxic, poisonous and hazardous substances; application of  chemicals, mineral fertilizers and nutrients (except for land plots used by owners and tenants for agricultural purposes); (v) washing vehicles on the banks of waterbodies; (w) movement and parking of motorized vehicles outside public roads and specially designated places (except for cases related to the functioning of the national park); (x) destruction and damage of posts, barriers, stands, boundary poles and other information signs, developed ecological paths and recreation areas, buildings on the territory of the national park, as well as property of the Institution, inscriptions and signs on boulders, outcrops and historical and cultural objects; (y) keeping unleashed dogs outside the cages or other structures that limit the zone of their movement, and training of dogs; and (z) ploughing up of the territory (except for forest fire fighting purposes).
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: National Adaptation Plan to Climate Change (NAP).
Policy_Content: The purpose of the Brazilian Federal Government’s National Adaptation Plan (NAP) is to guide initiatives for management and reduction of long-term climate risks, as established in Ministry of Environment (MMA) Order No. 150 of 10 May 2016. The Plan was drawn up by the Executive Group of the Inter-ministerial Committee on Climate Change (GEx-CIM) between 2013 and 2016, as provided for in the National Policy for Climate Change (PNMC - Law 12.187/09) and its enabling decree (Decree 7.390/10). The NAP was drawn up in line with the National Plan for Climate Change, with sectoral mitigation and adaptation plans, and with decisions on adaptation undertaken by Brazil within the framework of the Conference of the Parties (COP) on Climate Change (pag. 6). The general objective of this Plan is to promote reduction and management of climate-risk considering the effects of climate change, by taking full advantage of emerging opportunities, avoiding losses and damages, and building instruments to prepare natural, human, productive and infrastructure systems to adapt to climate change (pag. 18).

Policy: Decree No. 8.750 creating the National Council of Traditional People and Communities.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 5 Chapters, creates the National Council of Traditional People and Communities. It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Council (CNPCT), collegiate body of advisory nature, part of the structure of the Ministry of Social Development and Fight against Hunger. This Council CNPCT is entitled to: promote the sustainable development of traditional peoples and communities, in order to recognize, strengthen and ensure their rights, including for territorial, environmental, economic, cultural, traditional and ancestral knowledge and practices, their forms of organization and institutions; to propose National Conferences for Traditional Peoples and Communities, their preparatory steps and parameters for composition, organization and operation; to ensure the compliance with the conventions, agreements and international treaties ratified by the Brazilian government and other legislation related to the rights of traditional peoples and communities; to act on behalf of traditional communities in discussions and implementation processes and regulatory conventions, agreements and international treaties ratified by the Brazilian government and other; to coordinate and monitor the implementation and regulation of the National Policy for the Sustainable Development of Traditional Peoples and Communities - PNPCT and the National Sustainable Development of Traditional Peoples and Communities Plan, in collaboration with the competent bodies for its implementation, etc. The Decree is divided as follows: Nature and competence (Chap. I); Composition (Chap. II); Structure (Chap. III); Final Provisions (Chap. V).

Policy: Rural Needs Act (Northern Ireland) 2016 (2016 Chapter 19).
Policy_Content: This Act requires public authorities (listed in the Schedule to this Act) to have due regard to rural needs when - (a) developing, adopting, implementing or revising policies, strategies and plans, and (b) designing and delivering public services. “Rural needs” means the social and economic needs of persons in rural areas. The Department of Agriculture and Rural Development must, at least every three years, review the list of bodies and persons set out in the Schedule. The Department must also make arrangements with public authorities with a view to securing co-operation and the exchange of information between public authorities.

Policy: Mines and Minerals (Development and Regulation) Amendment Act, 2016.
Policy_Content: The Act makes minor changes to Act No. 67 In sections 3, 12 and 13 of the Mines and Minerals (Development and Regulation) Act, 1957 (hereinafter referred to as the principal Act). Amended sections establish that, for clause (a), the following clauses shall be substituted, namely: (a) "leased area" means the area specified in the mining lease within which mining operations can be undertaken and includes the non-mineralised area required and approved for the activities falling under the definition of mine as referred to in clause (i); (aa) "minerals” includes all minerals except mineral oils;’. In section 12A of the principal Act, in sub-section (6), the following shall be inserted, namely: "provided that where a mining lease has been granted otherwise than through auction and where mineral from such mining lease is being used for captive purpose, such mining lease may be permitted to be transferred subject to compliance of such terms and conditions and payment of such amount or transfer charges as may be prescribed". Explanation: For the purposes of this proviso, the expression “used for captive purpose” shall mean the use of the entire quantity of mineral extracted from the mining lease in a manufacturing unit owned by the lessee. In section 13 of the principal Act, in sub-section (2), after clause (qqj), the following clause shall be inserted, namely: "(qqja) the terms and conditions and amount or transfer charges under the proviso to sub-section (6) of section 12A”.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Indian Ocean, South Asian Seas, Southern Asia

Policy: Climate Change Act, 2016 (No. 11 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act shall be applied for the development, management, implementation and regulation of mechanisms to enhance climate change resilience and low carbon development for the sustainable development of Kenya. The Act places duties on the national government and county governments to mainstream climate change responses into development planning, decision making and implementation and to respond in various other ways to climate change. The Act sets out principles of climate change planning and implementation of measures. The National Climate Change Council is established as an  unincorporated body. The Cabinet Secretary for the time being responsible for environment and climate change affairs shall be the secretary to the Council. The Council shall provide an overarching national climate change coordination mechanism. It shall, among other things, approve and oversee implementation of the National Climate Change Action Plan. The Act also establishes a Climate Change Directorate and a Climate Change Fund. The Directorate shall be the lead agency of the government on national climate change plans and actions to deliver operational coordination and shall report to the Cabinet Secretary. The Directorate shall be headed by a Director of Climate Change.

Policy: Ley Nº 5915 - Servidumbres administrativas de electroducto y régimen especial de constitución de servidumbres administrativas para el desarrollo de proyectos de generación de energía eléctrica a partir de fuentes renovables sobre inmuebles de propiedad comunitaria.
Policy_Content: Esta Ley declara de utilidad pública y sujeto a la servidumbre administrativa de electroducto todo inmueble situado dentro de los límites de la Provincia de Jujuy, necesario para el cumplimiento de los planes de trabajo correspondientes a la prestación del servicio público de electricidad, incluida aquella generada a partir del aprovechamiento de la energía solar o de otras fuentes renovables de energía. Policy: Decreto Nº 780 - Decreto Único Reglamentario del Sector Salud y Protección Social.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto, considerando que la racionalización y simplificación del ordenamiento jurídico es una de las principales herramientas para asegurar la eficiencia económica y social del sistema legal y para afianzar la seguridad jurídica, y que constituye una política pública gubernamental la simplificación y compilación orgánica del sistema nacional regulatorio, expide el Decreto Único Reglamentario del Sector Salud y Protección Social, cuyo objeto es compilar la normatividad expedida por el gobierno nacional en ejercicio de las facultades reglamentarias para la cumplida ejecución de las leyes del Sector Salud y Protección Social.

Policy: European Union (Award of Contracts by Utility Undertakings) Regulations 2016 (S.I. No. 286 of 2016).
Policy_Content: These Regulations provide rules for the award of contracts for the procurement of services of a public character. the contracts are awarded by a contracting entity ad concern, among other things, the supply of drinking water to fixed networks. These Regulations also apply to contracts or design contests awarded or organised by contracting entities which pursue an activity referred to in paragraph (1) and which are connected with one of the following: (a) hydraulic engineering projects, irrigation or land drainage, where the volume of water to be used for the supply of drinking water represents more than 20% of the total volume of water made available by such projects or irrigation or drainage installations; (b) the disposal or treatment of sewage. A contracting entity shall, where it requires the production of certificates drawn up by independent bodies attesting that an economic operator complies with certain quality assurance standards, including on accessibility for disabled persons, refer to quality assurance systems based on the relevant European standards series certified by accredited bodies. The Regulations also concern other environmental obligations and a kind of public-private partnership for innovation.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Business/industry/corporations,Concession,Contract/agreement,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Public private partnership (PPP),EIA,Water supply,Non-governmental entity

Policy: Regional Law No. 648-ZO “On industrial policy”.
Policy_Content: Abstract	Industrial production shall pertaining to the sphere of competence of this Regional Law shall be economic activities related to mining, energy generation, including natural gas extraction and supply, water abstraction, water supply and sewerage, waste management and recycling, and pollution control. This Regional Law regulates relations originating between subjects operating in the sphere of industry, regional and state bodies and local self-government in the process of formation and implementation of industrial policy. The tasks of industrial policy shall be as follows: (a) formation and development of modern industry; (b) stimulation of industrial activity; (c) introduction of ecofrienfly processes and resource saving technologies; (d) increase of industrial production output; (e) reduction of disaster risks; and ensuring technological independence of the regional economy.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen., Mineral resources, Water
Keyword: Ecofriendly products/ecofriendly processes,Energy conservation/energy production,Hydropower generation,Business/industry/corporations,Financing,Recycling/reuse,Processing/handling,Mining,Natural gas,Water abstraction,Water supply,Sewerage,Pollution control,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution

Policy: Law No. 10.444 establishing the State Policy and Programme on the Technical Assistance and Rural Extension for Family Farming and Agrarian Reform of the State of Maranhão (PEATER/MA) and (PROATERES).
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 8 Chapters, establishes the State Policy on the Technical Assistance and Rural Extension for Family Farming and Agrarian Reform of the State of Maranhão (PEATER/MA) and the State Programme of Technical Assistance and Rural Extension for Family Agriculture and Agrarian Reform of the State of Maranhão - PROATERES. The objectives of these iniciatives are: to qualify and universalize the ATER within the State of Maranhao; to contribute to sustainable rural development; to promote the integration between ATER entities to optimize the performance of services and establishment, expansion and strengthening of ATER networks; to assist and support economic, social and environmental initiatives that consider the territorial and local vocations; to widen and improve the production arising from the activities and services agricultural and non-agricultural, including agro-extractive, forestry and craft; to increase the income of beneficiaries by adding value to products, marketing or through local markets, state, national and international; to promote the quality of life of its beneficiaries and beneficiaries; They aim at promoting sustainable rural development and improving the quality of life of the beneficiaries; supporting economic initiatives that promote regional and local potentiality, especially promoting endogenous development processes; increasing production, quality and productivity of agricultural, services and non-agricultural activities, including agro-extractive, forestry, fisheries, etc., respecting the principles of agroecology and sustainable development; advising the various stages of economic activities, business management, organization, production, market insertion and supply, including family farmers on the market; developing initiatives to use, manage, protect, conserve and rehabilitate natural resources, agricultural ecosystems and biodiversity; building sustainable production systems, considering the scientific and traditional knowledge, from agro-ecological foundations, etc. The beneficiaries of PEATER/MA are: indigenous peoples, quilombolas, pomeranians, traditional communities and urban and peri-urban farmers.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Agricultural development,Extension,Policy/planning,Capacity building,Indigenous peoples,Less favoured areas,Farming,Family farming,Agroecology,Traditional knowledge/indigenous knowledge,Biodiversity,Sustainable use
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Disposiciones administrativas de carácter general que establecen los Lineamientos para la conformación, implementación y autorización de los Sistemas de Administración de Seguridad Industrial, Seguridad Operativa y Protección al Medio Ambiente aplicables a las actividades del Sector Hidrocarburos que se indican.
Policy_Content: Los presentes lineamientos tienen por objeto establecer los requisitos mínimos para la conformación, operación, implementación y autorización de los Sistemas de Administración de Seguridad Industrial, Seguridad Operativa y Protección al Medio Ambiente de los Regulados a los que se refiere el Capítulo III de la Ley de Hidrocarburos. Estos  lineamientos son de observancia general para realizar las siguientes actividades del sector hidrocarburos: a) reconocimiento y exploración superficial, y exploración y extracción de hidrocarburos; b) tratamiento, refinación, enajenación, transporte y almacenamiento del petróleo; c) procesamiento, compresión, licuefacción, descompresión y regasificación, así como transporte, almacenamiento y distribución de gas natural; d) transporte y almacenamiento de gas licuado de petróleo; e) transporte y almacenamiento de petrolíferos; f) transporte por ducto y almacenamiento, que se encuentre vinculado a ductos de petroquímicos producto del procesamiento del gas natural y de la refinación del petróleo.
Subject: Environment gen., Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy: National Plan for Food and Nutrition Security (PLANSAN 2016-2019).
Policy_Content: This 2nd National Plan for Food and Nutrition Security (PLANSAN 2016-19) is the main instrument of the National Policy on Food and Nutrition Security, established by Decree No. 7.272 of 2010. It includes the different actions of the federal government that intend to respect, protect, promote and provide the Human Right to Adequate Food for all people in Brazil. The Plan will be guided by the eight guidelines of the National Policy on Food and Nutritional Security (PNSAN) and will be constructed by the inter-ministerial Chamber of Food and Nutrition Security based on the priorities established by CONSEA from the deliberations of the National Conference on Food and Nutrition Security. The Plan should: to analyse the national situation of food and nutritional security; have a duration of four years and validity corresponding to the multi-annual plan; consolidate the programmes and actions related to the guidelines designated in art. 3 and indicate priorities, targets and budget requirements for their implementation; to clarify the responsibilities of the organs and entities of the Union that are members of SISAN and the mechanisms of integration and coordination of that System with the sectoral systems of public policies; to incorporate territorial and inter-sectoral strategies and articulated visions of the demands of the populations, with attention to the specificity of the diverse population groups in situation of vulnerability and food and nutritional insecurity, respecting the social, cultural, environmental, ethnic-racial diversity and equity of gender; and define its monitoring and evaluation mechanisms.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition

Policy: Civil Protection and Disaster Management Law (2016)
Policy_Content: The Law lays down principles for civil protection and disaster management in Latvia. Its purpose is to determine the competence of the system of civil protection and disaster management subjects in order to ensure, to the extent possible, the safety and protection of people, the environment and property in case of a disaster or threats thereof. According to the Law, the system of civil protection is a component of the national security system which is formed by the State and local government authorities, legal and natural persons whose rights, tasks and responsibility in the field of civil protection are laid down in the law. The principle of co-operation of territories form the basis for the organisation of the system of civil protection, and municipalities and republic cities are the territorial basic units of the structure of the system of civil protection. The system of civil protection has the following tasks: (1) to ensure the safety of people, the environment and property; (2) to ensure, to the extent possible, the minimal basic needs for the public in case of a disaster or threats thereof; (3) to forecast in a timely manner the threats of a disaster; (4) to plan and perform preventive measures in a timely manner; (5) to provide assistance to victims of disasters and reduce damage that has been or may be caused by the disaster to people, the environment and property; (6) to plan and perform recovery measures; (7) to provide and receive international assistance in accordance with the procedures laid down in the laws and regulations; and (8) to support the national defence system if a military invasion or war has begun.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Disasters,Procedural matters,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Early warning system/emergency intervention system
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Regulation No. 340 date 4.5.2016 removing from the forestry fund and decreasing in volume the forestry economies of  “Gjadër-Mnelë”, “Gomsiqe”, “Karmë”, “Sllak 2”, “Qelëz”, “Krrab-Bushat”, “Koman-Karmë”, “Dedaj-Buhot”, “Bregu i Drinit”, “Mërtur Guridhe”, “Lumi i Berishës” in the district of Shkoder and the forestry and pasture economies of ‘Lugina e Tropojes”, “Lugina e T’Planit” in the district of Kukes for the construction of the 400 kv interconnection line ‘Shqiperi- Kosove’ (Vau i Dejes- Morine)”.
Policy_Content: This Regulation removes a total of 2.4964 ha from the forestry economies of “Gjadër-Mnelë”, “Gomsiqe”, “Karmë”, “Shllak 2”, “Qelëz”, “Krrab-Bushat”, “Koman-Karmë”, “Dedaj- Buhot”, “Bregu i Drinit”, “Mërtur Guridhe” dhe “Lumi i Berishës” in the Shkodra district and the forestry and pasture economies of “Lugina e Tropojës” and “Lugina e T’planit” in the Kukesi district. The value of the removed forestry and pasture areas and timber will be paid by the Operator of the Transmission System (OTS) in accordance with Regulation 391 date 21.6.2006 determining the tariffs in the forestry and pasture fund as amended. OTS is further obligated to rehabilitate with its own funds a foresty area of 3.62 ha  and a pasture area of 0.5 ha according to the agreements signed with the Ministry of Environment.

Policy: Environmental Monitoring Act (2016)
Policy_Content: The Act determines principles for environmental monitoring in Estonia. It establishes the organisation of national, local government and voluntary environmental monitoring, the completion of national environmental monitoring programme and its sub-programmes, the establishment, use, protection and liquidation of national environmental monitoring stations and areas, the procedure for the storage, use and dissemination of data obtained during the course of environmental monitoring, and the organisation of state supervision and the responsibility for failure to meet the requirements provided in this Act. The Act does not apply to such monitoring of the status of the environment which is not environmental monitoring for the purposes of this Act. According to the document, environmental monitoring is the continuous surveillance of the status of the environment and the factors affecting thereof, involving environmental observations, collection, processing and storage of observational data, analysis of observational results and predicting of changes. Environmental monitoring is divided into national environmental monitoring, local government environmental monitoring and voluntary environmental monitoring. The objective of national environmental monitoring is to obtain an overview of the environmental status of the state territory and the long-term changes therein, ensure the compliance with the obligations of monitoring the status of the environment arising from international agreements and national legislation and assess the impact of the completion of national action, development and management plans upon the status of the environment and the changes therein. National environmental monitoring data constitute the basis for the compilation of action, development and management plans and the drafting of legislations, and the assessment of the impact thereof.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Act entered into force on 1 January 2017.

Policy: Arrêté Présidentiel n° 008/01 du 04/05/2016 déterminant le fonctionnement et les compétences du Conservateur des titres fonciers.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté détermine les modalités et les compétences du Conservateur des Titres Fonciers en Chef et Conservateur des Titres Fonciers, en application des dispositions de l’article 18 de la loi nº 43/2013 du 16/06/2013 portant régime foncier au Rwanda. En effet, le Conservateur foncier est un officier public chargé du maintien et de la mise à jour de la base des données foncières ; il peut être le Conservateur des Titres Fonciers en Chef ou le Conservateur des Titres Fonciers. Par ailleurs, ce texte détermine le fonctionnement du conservateur des titres fonciers en chef et du conservateur des titres fonciers ; et les compétences et attributions du conservateur des titres fonciers en chef et du conservateur des titres fonciers.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2016/1393 amending Delegated Regulation (EU) No. 640/2014 supplementing Regulation (EU) No. 1306/2013 of the European Parliament and of the Council with regard to the integrated administration and control system and conditions for refusal or withdrawal of payments and administrative penalties applicable to direct payments, rural development support and cross-compliance.
Policy_Content: This Regulation lays down some amendments and addenda to Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) No. 640/2014, which supplemented Regulation (EU) No. 1306/2013 with regard to the integrated administration and control system and conditions for refusal or withdrawal of payments and administrative penalties applicable to direct payments, rural development support and cross compliance. The amendments hereby laid down concern registration of payment entitlements, derogations for the final date of submission of an aid application, individual limits or ceilings. New article 19 a is inserted; this new provision concerns administrative penalties in cases of over-declaration of areas for the basic payment scheme, the single area payment scheme, the re-distributive payment, the young farmers scheme, the payment for areas with natural constraints, the small farmers scheme, Natura 2000 and Water Framework Directive payments and payments to areas facing natural or other specific constraints.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
