Policy: Decree No. 8.735 provides for composition, structure, competence and functioning of the National Council for Rural Sustainable Development (CONDRAF).
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 4 Chapters, establishes composition, structure, competence and functioning of the National Council for Rural Sustainable Development (CONDRAF). CONDRAF, collegial body member of the basic structure of the Ministry of Agrarian Development, aims to propose guidelines for the formulation and implementation of structural policy consultation and coordination between the different levels of government and civil society organizations for sustainable rural development, agrarian reform and family farming. CONDRAF is entitled to perform the following activities: to promote the design of structural policies, based on the objectives and goals related to land reform, the reorganization of agrarian development, family farming and other policies related to rural sustainable development; to consider the rural areas as the focus of planning and management of sustainable rural development programmes between rural and urban spaces; to propose follow-up strategies, monitoring, evaluation and participation in the deliberative process guidelines and procedures for policies related to sustainable rural development; to propose the adequacy of federal public policy to the demand of the society and the needs of sustainable development of rural areas in order to incorporate experiences, considering the need for the articulation of a territorial economy and the importance of their externalities, align efforts and encourage actions aimed at overcoming poverty by generating employment and income; reducing gender, ethnical, regional and generational based inequalities; etc.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Institution,Agricultural development,Sustainable development,Policy/planning,Poverty,Rural employment,Family farming,Gender,Equity,Indigenous peoples
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Executive Decree No. 206/16 approving the terms of reference for the designing of Environmental Impact Assessment.
Policy_Content: This Executive Decree approves the Terms of Reference for the designing of Environmental Impact Assessment aimed at the construction of industrial centres in Angola. It specifies the requirements to be satisfied to perform such activity with a view to identify and analyse the potential environmental problems associated with its implementation, proposing a set of measures to be taken so that any negative effects are solved, mitigated or compensated. A further evaluation and licensing shall be issued by the Ministry of Environment.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Executive Decree enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Regulation implementing the measures M08-submeasure 8.5. "Support for Investments in improving the resilience and environmental value of forest ecosystems" from the 2014-2020 Rural Development Programme of the Republic of Croatia.
Policy_Content: This Regulation defines the necessary conditions for the correct implementation of the measures M08 "Investments in the development of forest areas and improvement of the sustainability of forests", including its sub-measure 8.5. "Support for investment in improving the resilience and environmental value of forest ecosystems" all part of the Rural Development Programme of the Republic of Croatia for the period 2014-2020, and also in full accordance with the provisions contained in articles 21 and 25 of the Regulation (EU) no. 1305/2013 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 17 December 2013 on support for rural development by the European Agricultural Fund for Rural Development (EAFRD) and its repealing Council Regulation (EC) No. 1698/2005; and with the article 35 of the Commission Regulation (EU) no. 702/2014 of 25 June 2014 on declaring certain categories of state aid in the agriculture and forestry and in rural areas compatible with the internal market in application of articles 107 and 108 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force eight days after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Décret n° 2016-272 du 03 mai 2016 portant mise en place de la commission nationale technique chargée des réformes politiques et institutionnelles.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret met en place la commission nationale technique chargée des réformes politiques et dont la  mission est d'étudier et de proposer au Président de la République, les réformes politiques et institutionnelles visant à améliorer le modèle politique conformément aux options fondamentales de la Conférence Nationale de février 1990. A cette fin, elle est chargée de : recenser et évaluer mes mesures politiques, institutionnelles et juridiques nécessitées par la reforme ainsi que les modalités de leur mise en œuvre en vue du renforcement du régime démocratique; élaborer l'avant-projet de loi portant révision de la Constitution du 11 d6cembre 1990 ;  et élaborer tous avant-projets de textes rentrant dans le cadre de cette mission.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Loi organique n° 16-001 du 3 mai 2016 fixant l’organisation et le fonctionnement des services publics du pouvoir central, des provinces et des entités territoriales décentralisées.
Policy_Content: La présente loi organique fixe l’organisation et le fonctionnement des services publics du pouvoir central, des provinces et des entités territoriales décentralisées, en application de l’article 194 de la Constitution du 18 février 2006 de la République démocratique du Congo. La présente loi organique circonscrit le sens des concepts et l’essentiel des principes fondamentaux utilisés. Elle fixe ensuite le cadre organique des services publics du pouvoir central, des provinces et des entités territoriales décentralisées. Elle détermine enfin le régime du patrimoine et des ressources des services publics à ces trois échelons du pouvoir d’État.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, South Atlantic

Policy: Order No. 134 of 2016 of Minister of Justice of Georgia on Charter of National Agency of Public Registry
Policy_Content: This Order approves the charter of the National Agency of Public Registry. It consists of nine chapters: General provisions (I); Purpose and functions of the Agency (II); Structure of the Agency (III); Management of the Agency (IV); Management of structural units of the Agency, its divisions and territorial offices (V); Purposes and functions of the structural units of the Agency (VI); Purposes and functions of the territorial units of the Agency (VII); Property, financing sources and state control of the Agency (VIII); and Final provisions (IX). The purpose of the Agency is to provide reliable and high quality services to the public and to maintain and ensure access to the registry of real estate, encumbrances on real estate, tax lien/mortgage, movable property and non-material property interests, businesses and non-commercial legal entities, economic activities and physical addresses (together, the public registry), as well as the registries of political parties and municipalities.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Critical Habitat of the White Sturgeon (Acipenser transmontanus) Upper Columbia River Population Order (SOR/2016-85).
Policy_Content: The present Regulations enact subsection 332(1) of the Canadian Environmental Protection Act, 1999.The purpose of the Regulations is to a) reduce emissions of hydrocarbons, oxides of nitrogen, particulate matter and carbon monoxide from engines by establishing emission limits for those substances or combinations of those substances; b) reduce emissions of the toxic substances formaldehyde, 1,3 butadiene, acetaldehyde, acrolein and benzene through the establishment of emission limits for hydrocarbons from engines; and c) establish emission standards and test procedures for engines that are aligned with those of the EPA. These Regulations apply to engines of the 2006 and later model years. The text - consisting of 26 sections - deals, inter alia, with the following matters: prescribed engines, application for authorization to apply the national emission mark, engine standards, replacement engines, transition engines, importation requirement and documents and defect information. One Schedule on national emissions mark is enclosed.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Arrêté primatoral n° 6.799 en date du 02 mai 2016 portant création et fixant les règles d’organisation et de fonctionnement d’un Comité de pilotage pour la formulation de la politique de promotion de l’emploi des jeunes en milieu rural.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté crée, sous l’autorité du Premier Ministre, un Comité de pilotage chargé de la formulation de la politique de promotion de l’emploi des jeunes en milieu rural dont la mission est de promouvoir l’emploi des jeunes en milieu rural. A ce titre, il est chargé notamment de: établir une situation de référence de l’emploi des jeunes en milieu rural; coordonner tout le processus de formulation et de validation de la politique de promotion de l’emploi des jeunes en milieu rural; assurer la mise en œuvre de la formulation de la politique de promotion de l’emploi des jeunes en milieu rural; identifier les projets et programmes structurants dans les différents ministères susceptibles de contribuer à la promotion de l’emploi des jeunes en milieu rural; identifier les sources de financement nécessaires à la promotion de l’emploi des jeunes en milieu rural; dresser un rapport annuel adressé au Premier Ministre.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy: Arrêté primatoral n° 6.799 du 02 mai 2016 portant création et fixant les règles d’organisation et de fonctionnement d’un Comité de pilotage pour la formulation de la politique de promotion de l’emploi des jeunes en milieu rural.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté crée, sous l’autorité du Premier Ministre, un Comité de pilotage chargé de la formulation de la politique de promotion de l’emploi des jeunes en milieu rural dont la mission est de promouvoir l’emploi des jeunes en milieu rural. A ce titre, il est chargé notamment de: établir une situation de référence de l’emploi des jeunes en milieu rural; coordonner tout le processus de formulation et de validation de la politique de promotion de l’emploi des jeunes en milieu rural; assurer la mise en œuvre de la formulation de la politique de promotion de l’emploi des jeunes en milieu rural; identifier les projets et programmes structurants dans les différents ministères susceptibles de contribuer à la promotion de l’emploi des jeunes en milieu rural; identifier les sources de financement nécessaires à la promotion de l’emploi des jeunes en milieu rural; dresser un rapport annuel adressé au Premier Ministre.  Le Comité de pilotage pour la formulation de la politique de promotion de l’emploi des jeunes en milieu rural est composé des représentants des ministères; du Conseil national de la Jeunesse (CNJS); un représentant des Organisations de jeunes producteurs; un représentant des Elus locaux ; et des partenaires techniques et financiers.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Decreto Nº 39724-MOPT-MINAE-S ─ Reglamento para el control de las emisiones contaminantes producidas por los vehículos automotores con motor de combustión interna.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto, considerando que el VII Plan Nacional de Energía (2015-2030) estableció como objetivos específicos regular la importación de vehículos nuevos y usados así como establecer la normativa de calidad de combustibles necesaria para regular el mercado de importación de vehículos, con el propósito de impulsar la renovación de la flota vehicular, aumentando su eficiencia en el consumo de hidrocarburos y reduciendo los niveles de emisiones, aprueba el Reglamento para el control de las emisiones contaminantes producidas por los vehículos automotores con motor de combustión interna.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Emissions,Pollution control,Environmental standards,Transport/storage,International trade

Policy: Loi n°13/2016 du 02/05/2016 régissant les activités d’exploration et de production pétrolières.
Policy_Content: La présente loi régit les activités d’exploration et de production pétrolières au Rwanda. Tous les droits de possession et de contrôle du pétrole se trouvant sur, dans ou sous la terre du Rwanda appartiennent uniquement à l'Etat sans préjudice de tout droit de propriété qu’une personne peut posséder sur le sol. Toute exploration ou exploitation du pétrole est subordonnée à un permis conformément à la présente loi ou tout accord pétrolier. Cette loi définit la carte et le permis d’exploration et de production pétrolières (Chapitre II); fixe les pratiques et les obligations pour un détenteur de permis, notamment la façon dont la construction et l'utilisation de l'oléoduc auraient un impact sur l'environnement et les mesures que le détenteur de permis vise à prendre pour réduire cet impact (Chapitre III) ; précise les règles de cession, d’annulation du permis et renonciation à une partie d’une zone couverte par le permis  (Chapitre IV); régit les accords pétroliers (Chapitre V); et prévoit des fautes et des sanctions administratives liées aux activités d'exploration et de production pétrolières (Chapitre VI).
Subject: Energy, Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Loi n° 14/2016 du 02/05/2016 régissant les partenariats public-privé.
Policy_Content: La présente loi régit les partenariats public-privé (PPP) dont les secteurs potentiels sont, entre autres, les infrastructures et services: ports sur mer et ports sur terre; l’énergie (l’énergie hydraulique, l’énergie solaire, l’énergie éolienne, l’énergie thermique, le biogaz et la tourbe); les ressources naturelles et environnement, notamment les forêts, le pétrole et les produits pétroliers, les minéraux, l’assainissement de l’eau et le traitement des déchets. Par ailleurs, ce texte prévoit les institutions publiques jouant un rôle dans le ppp et leurs attributions; accord de PPP; procédure de compétition pour la passation de marche pour un projet de PPP; procédure de passation de marches en cas d’une offre non sollicitée ; et les dispositions diverses et finales.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Federal Law No. 119-FZ “On the peculiarities of granting to citizens of public or municipal land plots located in the regions of the Far Eastern Federal District”.
Policy_Content: This Federal Law sets forth the provisions for allocation of public or municipal land plots in the regions of the Far Eastern Federal District to the Russian citizens. Land areas of the plots of land subject to allocation free of charge for land tenure for the period of 5 years in accordance with contract shall not exceed 1 hectare. After the expiry of five-year period the afore-mentioned plots of land, in case of the absence of the grounds for refusal, can be transferred to the citizens holders of the previous land tenancy contract on lease, in ownership free of charge or, in some cases envisaged by this Federal Law, in ownership for payment.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Federal Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Federal Law No. 132-FZ amending Federal Law No. 190-FZ “On thermal energy and heat supply”.
Policy_Content: This Federal Law introduces the concept of "federal state energy supervision", which will be implemented by authorized federal executive bodies. This supervision is aimed at preventing, detecting and suppressing violations in the sphere of heat supply. In addition, the law fixes the security requirements in the sphere of heat supply and establishes a duty to comply with these requirements by heat supply, heating network organizations and consumers of heat energy.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Federal Law enters into force ninety days after the date of its official publication.

Policy_Content: Le présent décret définit les modalités d’application de la Loi n° 2015-035 du 16 juillet 2015 portant organisation de la recherche, de l’exploitation et du transport des hydrocarbures. Policy: Décret n° 2016-0267 P-RM du 29 avril 2016 portant déclassement partiel des forêts classées de Tienfala et de la Faya dans la Région de Koulikoro et de la forêt classée de Zangasso dans la Région de Sikasso.

Policy: Ley Nº 30428 - Ley que oficializa el sistema de cuadrículas mineras en coordenadas UTM WGS84.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley oficializa el sistema de cuadrículas mineras con coordenadas referidas al Sistema Geodésico Horizontal Oficial (WGS84), con base en la Red Geodésica Geocéntrica Nacional (REGGEN), la misma que se sustenta en el Sistema de Referencia Geocéntrico para las Américas (SIRGAS). El Sistema de Cuadrículas Mineras corresponde al cuadrillado de la Carta Nacional a escala 1/100,000 elaborada por el Instituto Geográfico Nacional en el Sistema Geodésico Horizontal Oficial (WGS84) y define áreas cuyos vértices se ubican con coordenadas UTM expresadas en kilómetros enteros, sobre la base de una cuadrícula de un kilómetro de lado, equivalente a 100 hectáreas, como extensión mínima del petitorio.
Subject: Land & soil, Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Marketing of Agricultural Products Act: Establishment of statutory measure: Registration of producers, packers and exporters of fynbos products (No. R. 495 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Statutory Measure applies to all fynbos products destined for exports within a cold chain environment. It requires producers, packers and exporters of fynbos products to register with a the not for profit company Cape Flora SA (CFSA). The purposes of the Statutory Measure is to compel the parties set out herein to register with (CFSA).  Registration is necessary to assist the CFSA in ensuring that continuous, timeous and accurate information relating to the fynbos industry, is available to all role players.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, South Atlantic, Southern Africa

Las importaciones de mercancías originarias de los países de la Alianza del Pacífico pagarán los aranceles aduaneros resultantes de aplicar las reglas establecidas en el presente Decreto.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Notification No. 2016/13 on supporting self-irrigation systems within the scope of rural development.
Policy_Content: This Notification aims at (i) extending the use of modern pressurized irrigation systems by producers, (ii) providing production with better quality and suitable for market demand, and (iii) raising the level of income in rural areas. This Notification sets forth the duties and responsibilities of the General Directorate, Provincial Directorate and District Directorate under the Ministry of Food, Agriculture and Livestock. The areas of investment are as follows: a) drip irrigation system, b) springer irrigation system, c) micro springer irrigation system, d) linear system, and e) solar powered irrigation system.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Marsabit County Energy Development Act, 2015 (No. 2 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act concerns the supply of energy to Marsabit County and seeks to promote diversity of supply of (clean and sustainable) energy and its sources and to facilitate effective management of energy demand and its conservation. The County Government shall implement the National Energy Policy and Plan in the County. The County Department of Energy shall Accelerate the exploration and development of renewable energy resources in the County to - achieve energy self-reliance; reduce the county's dependence on fossil fuels; minimize the county's exposure to price fluctuations; ensure the adoption of clean energy to mitigate climate change; and promote socio-economic development in rural areas.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.

Policy: Decree No. 16 of the Ministry of Agriculture and Food validating the Instruction on financing out of national budget agricultural production, fishfarming and processing of agricultural commodities.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes the modalities of financing out of national budget of agricultural production, fishfarming and processing of agricultural commodities. In particular, finances shall be allocated for plant variety testing for patentability criteria, animal disease control measures, plant protection against pests, diseases and weeds, purchase of fertilizers and pesticides, and purchase of fish feedstuffs.

Policy: Regulation amending the Regulation on the certification and promotion of renewable energy sources.
Policy_Content: This Regulation repeals articles 10, 11, 16, 17, 19 and 25, as well as Paragraphs 4 ad 5 of Article 23 of the Regulation on the certification and promotion of renewable energy sources. Furthermore, this Regulation makes several changes in articles 12, 15, 18, 23, 26, 27 and 28 regarding tariff for the use of renewable energy sources by certified enterprises.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Resolution No. 2/2016 approving the Statute of the Ministry of Industry and Commerce.
Policy_Content: This Resolution approves the Statute of the Ministry of Industry and Commerce. This Statute, consisting of 23 articles divided into four Chapters, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Ministry. This Authority, in accordance with the principles and priorities defined by the Government, coordinates and ensures the execution of policies, strategies and plans for activities to be carried out in the areas of industry, commerce and services. In particular, the Ministry is responsible to perform the following activities: Propose and monitor the implementation of policies and strategies for the development of industry, trade and service; Promote adequate legal framework for the development of the sector, the standardization and quality services; Protect industrial property rights; Streamline inspection services for economic activities; Promote actions aimed at defending consumer rights; Coordinate with other State bodies to oversee matters relating to competition; Coordinate the development of the private sector; Promote industrialization geared towards the modernization of the economy; Foster industrial production, agro-processing and industrial competitiveness; Develop actions to promote cooperation programmes with a view to mobilizing technical assistance to projects and programmes in the sector; Promote the development of infrastructure for agricultural marketing and support to industrial activity; Develop and promote exports; Promote the development of products with added value and local content; research and industrial development, and the participation of the private sector in industrial, commercial and service development.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Keyword: Institution,Agricultural development,Agro-forestry,Business/industry/corporations,Processing/handling,Sustainable development,Internal trade,International trade,Food security,Food sovereignty,Nutrition
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Law No. 506-V amending some legislative acts related to migration of the Republic of Kazakhstan towards “green economy”.
Policy_Content: Article 43 of Land Code shall be amended to add the following wording: “Allotment of land plots located within 500 meters from coastline of a waterbody shall be performed after establishment of borders of water conservation zones and regime of its economic management, except for protected areas and public forests”. Article 82 of Water Code shall be amended to add the following wording: “Limits for water abstraction and water supply within water basins and provinces shall be established for ten-year periods in accordance with water basin management schemes and shall be validated by the authorized institution”. Article 5 of Ecological Code shall be amended to add the following wording: “Priority shall be considered recycling and reuse of domestic and non-domestic waste”. Article 6 of the Law No. 66-3 on state regulation of the development of agro-industrial complex and rural areas shall be amended to add the following wording: “Authorized state institution in the sphere of regulation of agro-industrial complex shall be responsible for monitoring and assessment of the state of drained agricultural land”. Article 1 of the Law No. 165-IV on support of the use of renewable energy shall be amended to add the following wording: “National renewable energy sources shall be considered renewable energy sources produced by the producers of Kazakhstan”.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Energy, Environment gen., Forestry, Land & soil, Water, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Agricultural land,Drainage/land reclamation,Energy conservation/energy production,Renewable energy,Waste domestic sources,Waste non-domestic sources,Waste management,Protected area,Water conservation zone,Ecosystem preservation,Public forest,Surface water,Water abstraction,Water supply

Policy: Resolución Nº 086-2016-MIDIS ─ Crea el Comité de Coordinación Interinstitucional con las organizaciones sociales de base del Programa de Complementación Alimentaria (PCA).
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución, considerando que resulta pertinente formalizar con carácter permanente el proceso de coordinación que se ha venido realizando desde el año 2012 hasta la fecha entre el MIDIS y las organizaciones sociales de base del Programa de Complementación Alimentaria (PCA), constituye el Comité de Coordinación Interinstitucional con las organizaciones sociales de base del Programa de Complementación Alimentaria (PCA), como instancia de coordinación de carácter permanente y que tendrá los siguientes objetivos: 1) canalizar permanentemente los aportes de las representantes de las organizaciones sociales de base que contribuyan a la mejora constante de la gestión del PCA; 2) promover la participación de las representantes de las organizaciones sociales de base en el diseño de los planes, programas y/o proyectos de fortalecimiento de capacidades y en la identificación de nuevas oportunidades de desarrollo; 3) hacer transparente la gestión del PCA respecto de todos los actores involucrados a nivel nacional; 4) canalizar la experiencia de las representantes de las organizaciones sociales de base en los diversos temas que vienen desarrollando y que puedan contribuir al mejor cumplimiento de los objetivos del PCA.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition

Policy: Immovable Property (Tenure, Registration and Valuation) Law (Amendment) (No. 2) 2016 (No. 66(I)/2016).
Policy_Content: The Basic Law is amended by adding at the end of Part VI A, the following new Part VIB on Land leasing Interpretative provisions. 65L: (A) "immovable property" includes any immovable property to let on lease under the provisions of this Law; the terms "ban", "competent District Land Office," "transfer" and "mortgage" have preserved "mutatis mutandis", the meanings attributed, respectively, to these terms by the Transfers and Mortgaging Property Law;"Leased" has the meaning given to this term by section 2 of the Leasing Act; (d) 'lease' means lease, any category, as defined in on Finance Tenancy Law. For the purposes of Part 2, the terms "landlord" and "tenant" include their respective heirs, personal representatives, administrators, guardians and commissioners of such persons and their guardians of the estate of such persons and (A) the current owner of the property leased; (B) in the case of the lessee, the current owner of the right acquired by registration of the lease. Leases Register. 65LA: (1) Where real property is leased for a period exceeding ten years, no right is acquired by the lease unless, subject to the provisions of this Part, is registered in accordance with the provisions of this article. For the record the land lease under the provisions of this article, a copy of the contract is produced in the competent District Land Authority.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia

Policy: Regional Law No. 55-ZSO “On regulation of grazing and passage of cattle on the regional territory”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Regional Law shall be to ensure conservation and rational tenancy of agricultural land and urban land and it establishes requirements for grazing and passage of cattle on the regional territory. Owners of cattle must form their livestock in herds and appoint a herdsman. In case of impossibility to for a herd, the owners must perform grazing personally or, in alternative, to keep cattle indoors. Passage of cattle to the collection points for the formation of herd shall be performed by owners of cattle or by persons appointed thereby. Grazing of cattle shall be performed with the application of public servitude of on land allotted to citizens on lease for such purposes.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Land & soil

Policy: Arrêté Présidentiel n°002/01 du 27/04/2016 portant gestion et utilisation des terres en Zones Economiques Spéciales (SEZ).
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté fixe la gestion et l’utilisation des terres en Zone Économique Spéciale (SEZ), définies comme Zone géographique délimitée, sécurisée physiquement, administrée par un seul organe et offrant des conditions favorables à l’investissement portant notamment sur la mise en place d’une réglementation économique plus libérale et plus simplifiée permettant aux entreprises de s’y établir et d’y opérer. Les catégories des terres des SEZ comprennent: les terres du domaine privé de l’Etat; les terres du domaine public des entités d’administration locales; les terres des établissements publics ; les terres individuelles privées.

Policy: Loi n° 133-12 relative aux signes distinctifs des produits de l'artisanat.
Policy_Content: La présente loi a pour objet de préserver la diversité des produits de l’artisanat, de les mettre en valeur, de protéger et de développer le patrimoine culturel et historique ; promouvoir la qualité des produits de l’artisanat par la reconnaissance des spécificités de leurs origines géographiques des matières premières qui les composent et du savoir-faire des artisans; contribuer à l’amélioration des revenus issus de l’artisanat.  Cette loi définit les conditions de reconnaissance, d'attribution, d'utilisation et de protection des signes distinctifs des produits de l’artisanat, et des labels nationaux et régionaux.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, North Atlantic, Northern Africa

Policy: Loi-cadre n° 97-3 relative à la protection et à la promotion des droits des personnes en situation d'handicap.
Policy_Content: La présente loi-cadre fixe les objectifs fondamentaux à atteindre par l'Etat dans le domaine de la protection et de la promotion des droits des personnes en situation de handicap, en application des dispositions des articles 34 et 71 de la Constitution et des dispositions des conventions internationales relatives aux droits de l’Homme, notamment la Convention internationale relative aux droits des personnes handicapées et son protocole facultatif qui sont ratifies par le Royaume du Maroc. Lesdits objectifs sont la garantie d'une protection efficace des droits et libertés des personnes en situation de handicap et leur promotion; la prévention et le diagnostic du handicap et la sensibilisation aux mesures préventives du handicap; la réadaptation et la réhabilitation des personnes en situation de handicap afin de leur permettre d'atteindre un niveau d'autonomie aussi élevé que possible dans leur vie et de bénéficier de leurs qualifications, et ce à travers le renforcement de leurs capacités et aptitudes, et la concrétisation de leur participation sociale ; la facilitation de leur intégration sociale et de leur participation normale à tous les aspects de la vie sur le même pied d’égalité avec les autres et sans discrimination aucune. La réalisation desdits objectifs est une responsabilité nation ale qui incombe à l'Etat, à la société et au citoyen et qui doit être assumée dans le cadre de la politique générale de l'Etat et des textes législatifs et règlementaires en vigueur.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, North Atlantic, Northern Africa

Policy: Regional Legislative Decree No. 21/2016/M creating the Institute of Forests and Nature Conservation, IP-RAM and extinguishing the Regional Directorate of Forests and Nature Conservation and the Service of the Natural Park of Madeira.
Policy_Content: This Regional Legislative Decree, consisting of 28 articles divided into six Chapters, creates the Institute of Forest and Nature Conservation (IFCN, IP-RAM) and extinguishes the Regional Directorate of Forest and Nature Conservation and the Service of the Natural Park of Madeira. IFCN, IP-RAM's mission is to promote nature conservation, management and sustainable management of bio and geodiversity, landscape and forests, as well as associated resources and management of protected areas. This Institute IFCN, IP-RAM, resulting from the merging of the Regional Directorate for Forestry and Nature Conservation and the Madeira Natural Park Service, is a public legal entity with administrative and financial autonomy. It is integrated in the indirect administration of the Autonomous Region of Madeira (RAM). IFCN, IP-RAM continues its attributions under the monitoring and superintendence of the Regional Secretariat for the Environment and Natural Resources. IFCN, IP-RAM is based in Funchal and operates in the entire territory of the Autonomous Region of Madeira, being able to collaborate with national and foreign services and organizations, as part of its responsibilities and competences.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Institution,Protected area,Protection forest,Sustainable development,Sustainable use,Biodiversity,Forest management/forest conservation,Wild fauna,Wild flora
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This enters into force on the day after its publication.

Policy: Loi n° 113-13 du 27 avril 2016 relative à la transhumance pastorale, à l'aménagement et à la gestion des espaces pastoraux et sylvopastoraux.
Policy_Content: La présente loi fixe les principes et les règles générales régissant l’aménagement et la gestion des espaces pastoraux et sylvo pastoraux, l’utilisation et le développement des ressources pastorales, la transhumance pastorale et la mobilité des troupeaux. Elle met en place le cadre juridique relatif à l’organisation, le développement et l’exploitation rationnelle et durable des ressources pastorales, à la sécurisation de l’assiette foncière des espaces pastoraux et sylvo pastoraux, à la garantie des droits d'accès et d'usage de ces espaces et de leurs ressources et au règlement des différends qui peuvent surgir de la pratique de la transhumance pastorale. Elle précise les conditions de mobilité des troupeaux et d'accès aux espaces pastoraux et sylvo pastoraux et à leurs ressources ainsi que les obligations qui incombent aux propriétaires desdits troupeaux, notamment la préservation de l’environnement, des écosystèmes et des biens publics et privés situés sur lesdits espaces.
Subject: Livestock, Land & soil
Keyword: Pastoralism,Access right,Right of use,Basic legislation,Grazing,Animal production,Sustainable use,Institution,Governance
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, North Atlantic, Northern Africa

Policy: Regional Law No. 1323-ZZK “On industrial policy”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations originating between subjects operating in the sphere of industry, regional and state bodies and local self-government in the process of formation and implementation of industrial policy. The tasks of industrial policy shall be as follows: (a) formation and development of modern industry; (b) stimulation of industrial activity; (c) increase of industrial production output; (d) promotion of innovations and research in industry; (e) application of best available industrial technologies and methods; and (f) ensuring technological independence of the regional economy. Particular attention shall be paid to promotion of inter-regional and international cooperation in various branches of industry.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Law No. 4384 establishing Agricultural Cooperatives, as forms of collective organization of rural lands.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 61 articles divided into twelve Chapters, establishes Agricultural Cooperatives, as forms of collective organization of rural lands. The Agricultural Cooperative (DP), is an autonomous association of individuals, constituted voluntarily seeking, through the mutual assistance and solidarity of its members, their collective economic, social, cultural development and promotion through a co-owned and democratically governed enterprise. DPs are also considered as: fishing, stock breeding, poultry, bee-keeping, agricultural, agro-tourism, agro-technical, farming and other cooperatives of any branch or activity of the rural economy. This Law does not apply to Forestry Cooperatives and their Associations. DP develops all kinds of activity in order to achieve its goals under the law and its statutes. DP may be legal entities, cooperate with consumers or other cooperatives, public or private legal entities, charitable organizations, local government and cooperative organizations other countries and with natural or legal persons in the context of transnational or interprofessional cooperation. DP members must be formed by a minimum number of five founding members. For matters not governed by this Law, the provisions of commercial law and the Civil Code shall apply.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries

Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Water Act (within the Saudi Vision 2030).
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 137 articles divided in XI Sections, aims to regulate and protect the sources of water, ensuring their sustainability and management, regulating their affairs, related rights and use. Water sources are listed as follows (i) rainwater, snow and discharge of torrents ; (ii) renewable and no-renewable groundwater; (iii) surface water; (iv) treated wastewater ; and (v) desalinated seawater. It establishes that all the water sources are property of the State and the Ministry of Environment, Water and Agriculture is responsible for their protection and exploitation with the following competencies: (i) grant licenses for the use and exploitation of water resources; (ii) the possibility of imposing numbers on wells in farms, recreational facilities and houses; (iii) prepare and up to date the National Water Strategy; (iv) develop an emergency and disaster management plan that incorporates the activation of monitoring and early warning techniques; (v) establish a national center for information and research; (vi) monitoring water sources; (vii) impose and monitoring the use of advanced and rational irrigation techniques and systems for the use of water in agricultural activities; (viii) prepare educational programs for farmers; (ix) promote the use of environmentally friendly technologies and materials in all water services and projects. The Authority responsible for regulating the public services shall develop plans to encourage the private sector participation in the water projects and services and in achieving the goals contained in the national policies. It also establishes the water tariffs or fees.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Water
Keyword: Freshwater resources management,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Monitoring,Research,Right to water,Authorization/permit,Basic legislation,Rainwater,Recreational water use,Groundwater,Surface water,Property rights,Disasters,Well sinking/boreholes,International trade,Royalties/fees,Water supply,Irrigation,Human rights

Policy: Agricultural Pesticides Law
Policy_Content: The Law, which is based on the principles 4 and 5 of Afghanistan’s Constitution, sets general provisions on agricultural pesticides.  The Law consists of 30 articles, divided into six Chapters; General Provisions (I); Duties and Authorities (II); Permit (III); Pesticides Registration (IV); Protective Measures(V); Miscellaneous Provisions (VI). The main objectives of the Law include: to control manufacture, importation, supply, transport, storage, and use of agricultural pesticides; to prevent the danger of pesticides for human, animal and plants' health; to protect the environment from adverse effects of pesticides; to dispose of the agricultural waste safely. The Law establishes an Agricultural Pesticides Committee for the efficient implementation of these provisions. The Committee is responsible to approve the quality of the pesticides for registration, prepare the list of allowed and prohibited pesticides, provide consultancy for proper use of agricultural pesticides, and to determine the safe methods for elimination of the unusable pesticides. Any production, importation, exportation, transport, storage, supply and sale of agricultural pesticides are only possible with a permit issued by the Committee. Any pesticide, which is produced in or imported to the country, should be registered within the Committee. However, in an emergency situation and in the pests' outbreak, the Department of Plant Protection and Quarantine may allow the use of unregistered pesticides for a short period of time. The Agricultural Pesticides Committee may prohibit the use of any pesticide which is dangerous for human and animal health or the environment.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Pesticides,Agricultural development,Authorization/permit,Fertilizers/nutrients,Inspection,Institution,Monitoring,Solid waste,Transport/storage,Protection of environment,Basic legislation,Sustainable use

Policy: Land Reform (Scotland) Act 2016 (2016 asp 18).
Policy_Content: This Act brings about a comprehensive reform of the law relating to land rights and land planning and management in Scotland. It contains provisions that aim to: ensure the development of an effective system of land governance and on-going commitment to land reform in Scotland; address barriers to furthering sustainable development in relation to land and improve the transparency and accountability of land ownership; and demonstrate commitment to effectively manage land and rights in land for the common good, through modernising and improving specific aspects of land ownership and rights over land.  Fundamental principles of the Act are equality, social justice and sustainability. The Act establishes the office of the Scottish Land Commission and the office of the Tenant Farming Commissioner. It amends the Agricultural Holdings Act and Act provides with respect to a right to buy land to further sustainable development, including land for local food growing. The Act aims at development of the tenanted agricultural sector, both as a route into farming, and in order to provide security for farms businesses and to provide greater flexibility for businesses to expand and grow through the sector through the let-in and out of land. It provides also for specific matters such as rights of (agricultural) tenants, entry in the valuation roll of shootings and deer forests, common good land, guidance in engaging communities in decisions relating to land and community involvement in local deer management.  The Act imposes a duty on the Scottish Ministers to review the legislation governing small landholdings.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Forestry, Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Agricultural development,Sustainable development,Sustainable use,Food security,Private forest,Framework law,Basic legislation,Land reform,Land tenure,Policy/planning,Institution,Lease,Agricultural land,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Servitude,Land-use planning,Land valuation,Non-governmental entity,Ownership,Private land,Cultural heritage,Common property,Community management,Smallholders/peasants,Management/conservation,Protection of species
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Statute Law (Miscellaneous Amendments) Act, 2016. (No. 7 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act makes miscellaneous and minor amendment to, amongst others, the Land Adjudication Act (Cap. 284), the County Governments Act, 2012, the Agriculture, Fisheries and Food Authority Act, 2013, the Crops Act, 2013 and the Kenya Agricultural and Livestock Research Act, 2013. The  Land Adjudication Act is amended by replacing the expression  "Trust Land" with "community land" and "county council" with "county government". In the Fisheries and Food Authority Act, 2013 in the definition of "Authority" the word "Fisheries" is deleted. Various other amendments are made to that Act in relation to the Authority, prohibition of export of some new produce, and levies. To the Crops Act the following amendments are made: In the definition of "Authority" delete the word "Fisheries"; in section 8 delete the word biodiversity appearing immediately after the words "the National" and substitute therefor the word "Biosafety"; in section 9 delete the words "Authority with the approval of National Assembly" and substitute therefor the words "Cabinet Secretary".

Policy: Ley Nº 5/2016 - Modifica la Ley Nº 1/1996, Ley de Gestión de Emergencias.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley modifica el objeto de la Ley de Gestión de Emergencias, en el sentido de ordenar y coordinar las actuaciones de las administraciones públicas de la Comunidad Autónoma del País Vasco en la prevención y gestión de emergencias, destinadas a la protección de las personas, los bienes y el patrimonio colectivo ante situaciones de riesgos colectivos graves, catástrofe y calamidad pública, así como en otros casos de urgencia o emergencias que pudieran requerir de la participación o coordinación de distintos servicios y operativos. Asimismo, se añade un artículo sobre los derechos y deberes en materia de protección civil de todas las personas residentes en la Comunidad Autónoma, y se modifican aspectos tales como el refuerzo de la concertación e interrelación de las actuaciones de las distintas instituciones y servicios, la actualización de los sistemas de comunicaciones, el refuerzo de la formación de los servicios del Sistema Vasco de Atención de Emergencias y Protección Civil, o la estandarización de procedimientos de actuación, así como en cuanto a la necesidad de integrar la iniciativa privada y la iniciativa social con la actividad del sector público.

Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force ten days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: European Union Habitats (Farranamanagh Lough Special Area of Conservation 002189) Regulations 2016 (S.I. No. 198 of 2016).
Policy_Content: These Regulations designate a coastal area as a Special Protection Area in accordance with Article 4 of Habitats Directive for protection purposes set out in Schedule 3 (coastal lagoons). The Minister shall, in accordance with the Regulations of 2011, establish and publish such particular conservation objectives as he or she, from time to time, considers necessary for the Special Area of Conservation with regard to the natural habitat type and animal and plant species specified in Schedule 3. Schedule 4 lists activities that require the consent of the Minister because of their potential to cause disturbance or damage to the natural habitat types and animal and plant species specified in Schedule 3. They include: introduction, or re-introduction, of plants or animals not found in the area (consent is not required for the planting of crops on established reseeded grassland or cultivated land); planting of trees or multi-annual bioenergy crops; application of pesticides, including herbicides; application of fertilizer near water; increase in stock density; certain changes in agricultural practice; harvesting marine invertebrate species in intertidal areas; certain waterworks Operations or activities other than those listed at Schedule 4 to these Regulations, such as effluent discharge, construction work, aquaculture, fishing or forestry, require a licence or permission from the appropriate consent authority.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries, Forestry, Land & soil, Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Agricultural development,Farming,Marine fisheries,Mariculture,Timber extraction/logging,Forest management/forest conservation,Coastal zone management,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Effluent waste water/discharge,Sustainable development,Pollution control,Management/conservation,Protected area,Protection of habitats,Wetlands,Authorization/permit,Offences/penalties

Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté  interdit d'importer et de commercialiser des sacs plastiques non biodégradables, non produits en République de Djibouti à partir du 1er mai 2016.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 87/16 approving the Regulation of the National Integrated System for Maritime Traffic Control (SNICTM/VTS).
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree approves the Regulation of the National Integrated System for Maritime Traffic Control (SNICTM/VTS). This Regulation, consisting of 53 articles, divided into six Chapters and 3 Annexes, aims at contributing to national maritime safety, prevention of accidents and marine pollution. It establishes the organs and their competencies, the criteria and co-ordination procedures, operational and technical requirements of equipment and assistance allocated to monitoring services of the national maritime traffic, certification and recognition of international certificates. In addition, it also establishes offences, penalties and fees to be applied to all the maritime traffic control activity that develops in areas under national jurisdiction, in ports and inland waters, the general framework of maritime safety and the safety of life at sea.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Presidential Decree enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Punjab Flood Plain Regulation Act, 2016 (No. XXVII).
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 20 sections, aims to regulate any construction in the flood plains in the Punjab. It regulates in particular construction in flood plains for flood mitigation and development of water resources; and to deal with ancillary matters. In addition, the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, containing detail specifications of the land, declare any land as flood plain if the land falls under any of the following categories: (a) natural course of a river, area of a lake or wetland; (b) low plain which is adjacent to a river and is likely to flooding; (c) area which is likely to be inundated due to the operation of a breaching section; (d)   pond area of a barrage or dam; and (e) area likely to be used for construction of a dam or a barrage.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Indian Ocean, South Asian Seas, Southern Asia
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force at once.

Policy: Regulation no. 301 date 20.4.2016 amending and supplementing Regulation No. 320 date 21.4.2011 of Council of Ministers approving the procedures and criteria of bidding and the review schedules of the mineral permits applications.
Policy_Content: Regulation 301 of 2016 amends article 7.19 of regulation 320 of 2011 on the rules of procedure to be followed by the Bids Evaluation Committee during the bids opening and evaluation and supplements 7.19 with additional rules on the complaint process. According to the supplement the complaint should be electronically submitted after the relevant fees have been paid. No review will be initiated if the fees are not paid. The fee is refundable in case the complaint is accepted or transferred to state budget if the complaint is rejected.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Décret n° 2-15-807 du 12 rejeb 1437 (20 avril 2016) pris pour l’application des dispositions de la loi n° 33-13 relative aux mines portant sur la procédure d'octroi des titres miniers.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe les conditions de la procédure d'octroi des titres miniers. Il s’agit notamment des capacités techniques et financières; de l'autorisation d'exploration et du permis de recherche; la licence d'exploitation de mines (subordonnée à une étude d'impact sur l’environnement); la renonciation et révocation des titres miniers, la rénonciation et de révocation des titres minier, l’attribution du permis de recherche ou de fa licence d’exploitation; des obligations relatives aux titres miniers; de la commission provinciale en charge de l’évaluation de l’indemnité due au titre de l'occupation temporaire du terrain; et des conditions d'agrément des personnes physiques et morale.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, North Atlantic, Northern Africa

Policy: Décret n° 2-16-135 du 12 rejeb 1437 (20 avril 2016) relatif à l’exonération des terres collectives situées dans les périmètres d'irrigation des droits relatifs à l’immatriculation.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret exonère des droits de conservation foncière, toutes les formalités relatives à l’immatriculation des terres collectives situées en totalité ou en partie dans les périmètres d'irrigation, soumises aux dispositions du dahir n° 1-69-30 du 10 joumada 1389 (25 juillet 1969) relatif aux terres collectives situées dans les périmètres d'irrigation et ce, jusqu'à l’inscription sur les titres fonciers des lots attribués aux ayants droits dans le cadre dudit dahir.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, North Atlantic, Northern Africa

Policy: Order No. 40 of the State Forestry Administration laying down the Measures for the administration of forest seed production and operation license.
Policy_Content: These Measures, consisting of 27 articles, aim to regulate the administration of forest seed production and business operation licenses.  In order to engage in forest tree production and seed business operation, entities and individuals shall obtain forest seed production and business operation license issued by the competent forestry authorities of the people's government at or above the county level. The Measures provide for the conditions, procedures and requirements to be satisfied for the application, examination, issuance, administration and supervision of forest seed production and business operation licenses.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: The Measures shall enter into force as of June 1, 2016.

Policy: Resolución Nº 141-2016-PRODUCE ─ Modifica la Guía para la presentación de reportes de monitoreo en acuicultura.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución modifica la Guía para la presentación de reportes de monitoreo en acuicultura, respecto a la exclusión de los parámetros sobre metales pesados (arsénico, cromo, cadmio, plomo y mercurio), aceites y grasas, pesticidas, detergentes, y coliformes fecales, al ser ya monitoreados por el Organismo Nacional de Sanidad Pesquera (SANIPES); asimismo, respecto a las estaciones de monitoreo en la zona de impacto debido a que la variación en la concentración de los parámetros es leve, para evaluar el estado ambiental de la zona marina aledaña a las áreas de desarrollo de la actividad acuícola.
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Sea
Keyword: Marine pollution,Aquaculture,Mariculture,Data collection/reporting,EIA,Hygiene/sanitary procedures,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Residues

Policy: Ley Nº 30423 - Ley que establece medidas para fortalecer la Autoridad de Salud de nivel nacional con el fin de garantizar la prevención, control de riesgos y enfermedades de la población.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto fortalecer la Autoridad de Salud de nivel nacional, con el fin de garantizar la prevención, control de riesgos y enfermedades de la población, en cumplimiento de su rol conductor de la política nacional de salud. Dispone que la Autoridad de Salud de nivel nacional, como ente rector del sistema de salud y en el marco del proceso de descentralización, está facultada para: 1) realizar el seguimiento, fortalecimiento y mejoramiento continuo del ejercicio de las funciones transferidas a los gobiernos regionales, principalmente de los temas relacionados a la gestión de salud pública; 2) emitir informes de monitoreo y supervisión conteniendo disposiciones de obligatoria implementación por parte de la autoridad sanitaria regional y/o local, ante riesgos de salud pública originados por incumplimiento de sus funciones o por factores exógenos; 3) intervenir para implementar medidas de respuesta efectivas e inmediatas de carácter temporal, con el propósito de anticipar, mitigar y dar respuesta ante situaciones que pongan en riesgo la salud de las personas.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition
Keyword: Institution,Public health,Environmental security,Capacity building,Monitoring,Hygiene/sanitary procedures,Nutrition,Food additives,Food quality control/food safety
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Governor’s Decree No. 105 validating the Regulation on protection zone of nature monument of regional significance “Mount Tarki-Tau”.
Policy_Content: The scope of creation of protection zone of nature monument of regional significance “Mount Tarki-Tau” shall be top prevent adverse effects and negative impact thereupon and ensuring conservation of wild fauna and wild flora on the aforesaid territory. Land plots shall not be subject to expropriation and shall be used by landowners and land tenants in compliance with protection regime. The following tasks are assigned to the protected zone of the nature monument: (a) reduction of the negative impact of economic activity on natural complexes adjacent to the natural monument area; and (b) protection of rare and endangered wild fauna and wild flora species, conservation of natural complexes. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of protection zone of nature monument: (a) destruction of soil cover; (b) exploration and mining; (c) activities entailing a decrease in water content and deterioration of hydrological and hydrochemical regime of springs; (d) timber extraction (except for timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs), clear cutting of the forest; (e) burning of vegetation; (f) commercial, artisanal and sport hunting, collection of protected and endangered plant species; (g) construction of industrial enterprises and high health risk facilities; (h) placement of cattle burial grounds, domestic and non-domestic waste disposal, radioactive, chemical, explosive, toxic, poisonous and hazardous substances disposal; (i) pollution and littering of the territory, organization of landfill and other waste dumps, sewage and waste water discharge; (j) application of pesticides, with the exception of inhabited areas; (k) vehicle traffic outside public roads and parking off-road and outside specially equipped places, with the exception of inhabited areas; and (l) destruction and damage of warning notices and information signs, putting inscriptions and signs on trees, boulders, rock outcrops.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Governor’s Decree enters into force on the date of signature.

Policy: Resolution No 189 of 2016 of Georgian Government on Rules for Handling Radioactive Waste
Policy_Content: The Resolution regulates handling of radioactive waste. It consists of 12 articles: Scope of regulation (1); Purposes of the Resolution (2); Definition of terms (3); Creation and classification of radioactive waste (4); Principles and main rules for handling radioactive waste (5); Unified system and main stages of handling radioactive waste (6); Handling radioactive waste in its place of origination (7); Transportation of radioactive waste (8); Processing and conditioning of radioactive waste (9); Storing radioactive waste in storage or landfill of such waste (10); Readiness for radiation accidents and disasters, and corresponding action plan (11); and Decommission of nuclear and radiation objects (12).  The rules apply at all stages of handling radioactive waste for the protection of the personnel involved in the activities and the environment.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Radiation,Waste disposal,Waste non-domestic sources,Waste prevention,Disasters,Waste management
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, Eastern Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Western Asia

The Measures consist of 24 Articles divided into 5 Chapters: General Provisions; Collection; Administration on Use; Legal Liabilities; Supplementary Provisions.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Loi n° 2016/004 du 18 Avril 2016 régissant le commerce extérieur au Cameroun.
Policy_Content: La présente loi définit les règles particulières applicables à l’exercice du commerce extérieur au Cameroun.  Elle régit notamment les importations et les exportations des marchandises; la commercialisation des produits d’importation subventionnés dont les quantités accrues causent ou menacent de causer un dommage grave à la branche de production nationale concernée; et la pratique du dumping. Par ailleurs, elle fixe le régime des importations et des exportations; le contrôle des importations et des exportations.

Policy: Law No.9 of 2016 with respect to Standards and Metrology.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 22 articles aims at ensuring the health and safety of the consumers and protection of the environment by making sure that goods, products and services comply with technical regulations. It establishes that the competent authority is the only authorized reference for standardization and quality control of production, the development of national standards, and the issuance of national technical regulations, through the following main tasks (i) adopt a national system of standards and specifications in accordance with international practices; (ii) ensure the quality of goods in accordance with the standard specifications; and (iii) raise the production efficiency, improve the quality of national products, and identify standard means of work and production to achieve economic growth.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition

Policy: Regulation on Extra-Territorial Cultivation.
Policy_Content: The Regulation, which consists of 8 articles, aims to determine responsibilities of various Ministries and Organizations about extra-territorial cultivation. The Ministry of Agriculture is responsible to facilitate the extra-territorial cultivation for applicants through providing them with adequate information, consultation and the guarantee to purchase the final product or contract farming. The eligibility of the applicants should be approved by the Ministry of Agriculture. The Ministry of Foreign Affairs also is obliged to facilitate these extra-territorial cultivations through drafting bilateral agreements with target countries, providing necessary information about agricultural regulations of the target country, legal protection form the applicants and facilitation of the consular affairs. The Ministry of Economy and Finance may cooperate with private sectors in implementation of the large-scale project of extra-territorial cultivation. Iran Central bank is obliged to provide needed currency credit to the eligible applicants. Furthermore, the Ministry of Labour and Social Welfare is obliged to protect the rights of Iranian workforce in the target countries.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Estatuto Orgánico de los Fideicomisos Instituidos en Relación con la Agricultura.
Policy_Content: Las presentes disposiciones establecen el Estatuto Orgánico de los Fideicomisos Instituidos en Relación con la Agricultura (FIRA), el cual rige la estructura orgánica, objetivos, funciones, niveles de responsabilidad y relaciones de dependencia y coordinación de las distintas unidades administrativas  de FIRA. Dichos fideicomisos son públicos, siendo su fideicomitente la Secretaría de Hacienda y Crédito Público y Fiduciario el Banco de México; su misión es otorgar crédito, servicio de garantías, apoyos o subsidios, capacitación, asistencia técnica y transferencia de tecnología a los sectores agropecuario, rural, forestal y pesquero del país, de forma directa o a través de los intermediarios financieros autorizados. Los fideicomisos que integran los FIRA son: 1) Fondo de Garantía y Fomento para la Agricultura, Ganadería y Avicultura (FONDO); 2) Fondo Especial para Financiamientos Agropecuarios (FEFA); 3) Fondo Especial de Asistencia Técnica y Garantía para Créditos Agropecuarios (FEGA); 4) Fondo de Garantía y Fomento para las Actividades Pesqueras (FOPESCA).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Fisheries, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 29 - Reglamento para el cumplimiento de las providencias judiciales que reconozcan y ordenen de manera general la atención a los segundos ocupantes dentro del marco de la acción de restitución.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo tiene como objetivo establecer el reglamento para el cumplimiento de las providencias judiciales que reconozcan y ordenen de manera general la atención a los segundos ocupantes dentro del marco de la acción de restitución. Estas medidas podrán consistir en el acceso a tierras y/o proyectos productivos, la priorización para el ingreso a los programas de vivienda y remisión para la formalización de la propiedad, cuando sea el caso, a quienes se encuentren ocupando un predio objeto de restitución de tierras, con el fin de facilitar la restitución de tierras de manera oportuna, efectiva, sostenible y duradera en contextos sociales que promuevan la reconciliación social y la paz. La instancia ejecutora de las providencias judiciales ejecutoriadas que ordenan medidas de atención a segundos ocupantes será la Unidad Administrativa Especial de Gestión de Restitución de Tierras Despojadas, a través de las dependencias y áreas relacionadas con el objeto del presente Acuerdo y en el Manual Técnico Operativo del Fondo Adscrito a esta.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Ley Nº 11 - Crea el Programa Nacional de Buenas Prácticas y Trazabilidad Agrícola (BPTA).
Policy_Content: La presente Ley crea en el Ministerio de Desarrollo Agropecuario el Programa Nacional de Buenas Prácticas y Trazabilidad Agrícola (Programa BPTA), el cual establece los lineamientos y directrices de buenas prácticas y trazabilidad agrícola en la producción primaria de alimentos de origen vegetal para consumo humano y animal, que contribuyan a garantizar alimentos inocuos para el consumo nacional y de exportación incorporando prácticas sostenibles en el ámbito social, económico y ambiental. El Programa de BPTA se aplicará en el territorio nacional para el cumplimiento de las buenas prácticas y trazabilidad agrícola en la producción de alimentos de origen vegetal para el consumo humano y animal, en aquellas actividades de la producción primaria hasta la cosecha, transporte y empaque, incluyendo las etapas de producción.

Policy: Loi n° 2016.014 relative à la lutte contre la corruption.
Policy_Content: Cette loi, composée par 49 articles organisés en 6 chapitres, a pour objet l'incrimination de la corruption dans toutes ses formes et la facilitation et l'appui de la coopération internationale pour la lutte contre la corruption et le recouvrement d’avoirs mal acquis. La loi individue les incriminations et les sanctions selon les différents types de corruption: la corruption d'agents publics nationaux; corruption d'agents publics étrangers et de fonctionnaires d'organisations internationales publiques; la corruption dans les marchés publics; les avantages injustifiés dans les marchés publics; la corruption dans le secteur privé; la corruption accomplie au cours des élections; la surfacturation et dépenses fictives; le détournement, soustraction, destruction ou dissipation, par d'autres moyens, de biens par un agent public; la concussion; l'exonération et les franchises illégales et autres formes de corruption. La loi prévoit aussi les sanctions pour la non-dénonciation des infractions, la participation et le tentative et la responsabilité des personnes morales. Le troisième chapitre s'occupe des procédures prévues pour la lutte contre la corruption, des autorités d'enquête et d'investigation et des moyens dont l'officier de police où le procureur disposent pou mener la lutte contre la corruption. La loi s'occupe aussi des juridictions compétentes sur la corruption (chapitre 4) et de la coopération internationale et du recouvrement d'avoirs (chapitre 5). Le chapitre 6 porte des dispositions finales.
Subject: General
Keyword: Governance,Basic legislation,Enforcement/compliance,Inspection,Institution,International relations/cooperation,Jurisdictional competence,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Offences/penalties,Procedural matters
Geographical_area: Africa, Least Developed Countries, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, North Atlantic, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy: Arrêté Ministériel n° 027/MIN/AFF.FONC/2016 du 15 avril 2016 portant fixation des règles et procédures applicables aux opérations de numérisation du cadastre foncier et de sécurisation des titres fonciers et immobiliers en République démocratique du Congo.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté fixe les opérations de numérisation du cadastre foncier et de sécurisation des titres fonciers et immobiliers en République démocratique du Congo portent notamment sur: la sécurisation par apposition des scellés à bulles ou toute autre technologie fiable sur chaque titre foncier et immobilier; l’édition modernisée des titres fonciers et immobiliers; la production d’une carte électronique sécurisée du titulaire du titre foncier;  la numérisation du cadastre foncier et la mise en place d’un fichier électronique y afférent; la mise en place d’une base nationale des données du cadastre foncier numérisé, logée dans un serveur national installé sur le territoire national, doté d’un accès électronique sécurisée à toutes les informations relatives aux titres de propriété émis en République démocratique du Congo; la formation des cadres et agents de l’administration foncière commis à l’utilisation des outils informatiques qui seront mis à leur disposition par les partenaires privés de manière à garantir le bon déroulement du processus de sécurisation des titres fonciers et immobiliers en République démocratique du Congo.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, South Atlantic

Policy: Commission Decision (EU) 2016/611 on the reference document on best environmental management practice, sector environmental performance indicators and benchmarks of excellence for the tourism sector under Regulation (EC) No. 1221/2009 on the voluntary participation by organisations in a Community eco- management and audit scheme (EMAS).
Policy_Content: This Decision is adopted pursuant to Regulation (EC) No. 1221/2009, which establishes an obligation for the Commission to develop sectoral reference documents for specific economic sectors in consultation with Member States and other stakeholders. These sectoral reference documents are necessary to help organizations to better focus on the most important environmental aspects in a given sector and allow evaluating, reporting and improving the organizations' environmental performance. They must include best environmental management practice, environmental performance indicators and, where appropriate, benchmarks of excellence and rating systems identifying environmental performance levels in those sectors. The Annex to this Decision sets out the sectoral reference document on best environmental management practice, sector environmental performance indicators, and benchmarks of excellence for the tourism sector.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Law of the R.I. No. 7/2016 on the Protection and Empowerment of Fishermen, Fish Raisers and Salt Farmers.
Policy_Content: The Law, consisting of 78 articles divided into ten Chapters, provides for the protection and empowerment of fishermen, fish raisers and salt farmers. It establishes the requirements to be satisfied in order to benefit from financial assistance to perform fisheries, aquaculture and salt exploitation activities. The Law aims at providing to achieve the following issues: infrastructures and facilities to develop related business; sustainable development; improve capability of fishermen, fish raisers and salt farmers; strengthen institutional framework and develop the principles of environmental conservation; develop financing system; protect the above mentioned workers against the risk of natural disaster, climate change and contamination, etc. The scope of this Law is covers: planning; protection; empowerment; funding and financing; supervision and public participation.

Policy: Whistleblowers Centre Act, 2016.
Policy_Content: This Act seeks to prevent corruption and other malpractices ('abuse')in private and public organizations in the Netherlands. It requires any employer who usually has at least fifty people in its employment to draw up a procedure for dealing with a report of a suspected abuse within the organisation (whistle blowers regulation). It also establishes the Whistle blowers Centre as an autonomous administrative authority. The Centre has an Advisory Department and an Investigation Department. An employee may: a) report a suspected abuse to the Investigation Department for the purposes of an investigation, or b) request the Investigation Department to institute an investigation into the manner in which the employer has acted in relation to him following a report of a suspected abuse. The Act specifically deals with employers is within the public sector. ‘Suspected abuse’ in this Act means an employee’s suspicion of an abuse in the organisation at which he works or has worked or in another organisation if he has come into contact with that organisation through his work, in so far as: (1) the suspicion is based on reasonable grounds resulting from the knowledge gained by the employee in the service of his employer or from the knowledge obtained by the employee through his work at another business or organisation, and (2) a public interest is at stake since the suspected abuse concerns a breach of statutory regulations, a risk to public health, public safety or the environment, or an improper act or omission that jeopardises the proper functioning of the public service or an undertaking.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Migori County Trade and Markets Act, 2016 (No. 3 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act establishes the Migori County Directorate of Trade and Markets and provides for the regulation of markets and in particular the sale of meat and other "marketable commodities" including poultry, eggs, fresh meat, fish, vegetables and fruit. The County Directorate shall be headed by a Director of Trade and Markets and shall, among other things: encourage and assist in the promotion of the county's produce and products; advise the County Executive Committee on a variety of matters regarding trade in farm produce; administer laws relating to fair trading and consumer protection. There shall be a market division within the Directorate. The Directorate shall establish, maintain, manage and regulate public markets for the sale of marketable commodities. No person shall sell any meat except in a public market or in such shops as are licensed by the Directorate and no person shall sell any marketable commodities in any part of any public place within the limits of a prescribed area.
