Policy: Order No. 14n of the Federal Agency of Scientific Organizations validating the Regulation on the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution the Central Siberian Botanical Garden of the Siberian Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences as protected natural area of federal significance.
Policy_Content: This Order validates the Regulation on the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution the Central Siberian Botanical Garden of the Siberian Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences as protected natural area of federal significance (located in Novosibirsk region) as protected natural area of federal significance, defines tasks, scientific profile of the institution as botanical. The main purpose of the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution the Central Siberian Botanical Garden of the Siberian Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences shall be performance of fundamental research and applied developments in the field of biodiversity of the flora of Siberia, its structural and dynamic organization; development of the concept of biodiversity conservation at various levels of its organization; preservation and enrichment of the gene pool of natural flora by methods of acclimatization, introduction and breeding of plants; rational use of plant resources. The main tasks of the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution the Central Siberian Botanical Garden of the Siberian Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences shall be as follows: (a) study of adaptive strategies, phytocenotic, ecological and chorological features of the vegetation cover of Siberia; (b) identification of taxonomic diversity of higher vascular plants, algae, lichens and fungi of Siberia, solving the problems of taxonomy, phylogeny and evolution of polymorphic taxa; (c) development of theoretical foundations and methods for preserving plant gene pool; (d) introduction of rare and economically valuable plant species in botanical gardens of Siberia; (d) development of effective methods for the introduction and selection of edible, medicinal and decorative plants in Siberia; (e) creation of special collections of plants in order to preserve biodiversity and enrichment of flora of Siberia, preservation of natural environment and natural landscapes; (f) development of methods for environmental education; (g) popularization and propaganda of bioecological knowledge; (h) promoting the development of dendrolandscape and phytodesigner culture, medicinal and other plant growing in the region; (i) preservation in artificial conditions of collections of living plants (especially rare and endangered species) and other botanical species of great scientific, educational, economic and cultural value; (j)  research; and (k) conducting educational, pedagogical and scientific work in the fields of botany and nature protection, plant growing and selection, decorative gardening and landscape architecture.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry
Keyword: Institution,Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Research,Education,Forest management/forest conservation,Genetic resources
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Order No. 12n of the Federal Agency of Scientific Organizations validating the Regulation on the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution the Botanical Garden of the Ural Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences as protected natural area of federal significance.
Policy_Content: This Order validates the Regulation on the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution the Botanical Garden of the Ural Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences as protected natural area of federal significance (located in Ekaterinburg), defines tasks, scientific profile of the institution as botanical. The main purpose of the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution the Botanical Garden of the Ural Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences shall be performance of fundamental and applied research in the field of botany, plant ecology, forestry, plant taxonomy, plant protection, conservation of nature. The main tasks of the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution the Botanical Garden of the Ural Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences shall be as follows: (a) development of scientific foundations and methods of plant introduction, scientific substantiation for the introduction in cultivation of new promising plants for various economic purposes; (b) development of effective methods for the preservation and reproduction of the gene pool of the Ural flora and flora of adjacent territories, including substantiation for the development of the system of protected natural areas and protection of rare and endangered plant species; and (c) development of scientific foundations and technologies for the use of forest renewable biological resources ensuring their sustainable reproduction.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry
Keyword: Institution,Protected area,Research,Forest management/forest conservation,Forest species,Genetic resources
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Order No. 13n of the Federal Agency of Scientific Organizations validating the Regulation on the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution Mountain Botanical Garden of the Dagestan Scientific Center of the Russian Academy of Sciences as protected natural area of federal significance.
Policy_Content: This Order validates the Regulation on the on the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution Mountain Botanical Garden of the Dagestan Scientific Center of the Russian Academy of Sciences as protected natural area of federal significance (located in Dagestan region, city of Makhachkala) defines tasks, scientific profile, the particulars of legal status, organizational structure, applicable special protection regime. The main purpose of the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution Mountain Botanical Garden of the Dagestan Scientific Center of the Russian Academy of Sciences shall be performance of fundamental, exploratory and applied scientific research in the field of botany, ecology, forestry, nature conservation. Scientific profile of the aforesaid institution shall be botanical. Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution Mountain Botanical Garden of the Dagestan Scientific Center of the Russian Academy of Sciences shall perform the following tasks: (a) plant introduction in the mountainous conditions of the North Caucasus; (b) study of aboriginal and adventive flora and plant resources of the North Caucasus; (c) identification, conservation and use of genetic resources of natural and cultural flora; (d) study of population and evolutionary biology, ecophysiology, biochemistry and plant genetics; (e) creation of special collections of live plants and seed banks, as well as exhibitions in order to preserve biodiversity and enrich flora; (f) innovative activity, replication and implementation of scientific technical developments, inventions and rationalization proposals; and (g) expert examination of scientific and technical programs, projects, research and development work, scientific and educational-methodical developments related to the profile of the institution.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Decree No. 156 “On regional state supervision in the sphere of protection of the population and territory against natural and technological disasters”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes the modalities of organization and performance of regional state supervision in the sphere of protection of the population and territory against natural and technological disasters. The authorized state institution within the framework of supervision shall act as follows: (a) perform inspection of sites subject to state supervision; (b) enforce acting legislation and (or) remove identified offences; (c) carry out administrative proceedings related to identified offences; and (d) perform other actions envisaged by legislation.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Five-Year Socio-Economic Development Plan 2016 - 2020.
Policy_Content: The Five Year Socio-Economic Development Plan is a planning instrument with a multi-sectoral approach relating to the period 2016-2020, whose overall objectives are: To ensure macroeconomic stability, strive to achieve economic growth rate higher than that of the previous 5 years. To accelerate the implementation of strategic breakthroughs, economic restructuring associated with growth model innovation and improving productivity, efficiency and competitiveness. To promote cultural development, practice of democracy, social progress and justice, ensure social security, enhance social welfare and improve people's lives. To actively respond to climate change, effectively manage resources and protect the environment. To strengthen national defense and security, stay resolute and persistent in the struggle to safeguard the national independence, sovereignty, unity and territorial integrity and assure political security, social order and safety. To raise the efficiency of external affairs and international integration. To maintain peace and stability, create favorable environment and conditions for the construction and defense of the country. To improve the status of our country in the international arena. To strive to make Viet Nam basically become a modern-oriented industrialized country.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Forestry, Water

Policy: Regulation on monitoring and implementation of flood management plans.
Policy_Content: This Regulation sets forth procedures and principles of monitoring and implementation of flood management plans, as well as flood risk assessment. The objective of this Regulation is to mitigate the adverse impacts of flood on public health, environment, soil, natural asset, natural protected area, cultural heritage and social and economic activities. This Regulation includes provisions on mitigation measures, control, monitoring, risk assessment and management plans of flood.

Policy: Telangana (Agricultural Produce and Livestock) Markets (Amendments) Act, 2016
Policy_Content: This Act amends the Telangana (Agricultural Produce and Livestock) Markets Act of 1966. It seeks to add certain missing definitions and provides more powers to the market committee. It also lays down provisions on warehouses and cold storage of agricultural produce and livestock, establishes provisions on the licensing of traders, commission agents, processors, direct purchase centres, private markets, etc. and sets down laws on contract farming including the registration of contract farming agreements.

Policy: Beaches By-law, 2015.
Policy_Content: This By-law of the City of eThekwini (Durban) concerns the management and beached with the area of jurisdiction of the City. The objects of this By-law are to – create an effective system for the managing and controlling of public access to beaches and beach areas; provide measures to regulate conduct on beaches and beach areas and to prohibit certain activities or conduct on beaches and beach areas; provide measures to control and regulate access to and the use of public amenities on the beach and beach areas; provide penalties for the breach of its provisions; and provide for related matters. The Municipality may take all reasonable measures within its powers, and to the extent allowed by law, to protect the natural environment of the coastal area within its jurisdiction. there is a general prohibition to pollute or damage the coastal area or to damage wildlife. Fishing is permitted only in specified places and may only take place between such hours as may be specified and in accordance with such conditions as specified. No person may do seine netting or fish for commercial purposes in any beach without a written permission issued by the relevant department of government dealing with fisheries or any other empowered statutory entity.

Policy: Resolution No. 14 of 2016 of Government of Adjara on Rules for Mixed Governmental Commission on Relief Efforts for Natural Disasters and Rules for Differentiation, Assistance Criteria and Damage Control of Survivor Households within Boundaries of Adjara
Policy_Content: This Resolution adopts the rules for the Mixed Governmental Commission on Relief Efforts for Natural Disasters (Annex 1) and the rules for differentiation, assistance criteria and damage control of survivor households within boundaries of Adjara (Annex 2). The Annex 1 consists of 16 articles, and the Annex 2 consists of 12 articles: General provisions (1); Differentiation of disaster survivor households (2); Definition of terms (3); Local commission (4); Mayor’s office (5); Authority of the Department (6); Authority of the Ministry (7); Authority of the Commission (8); Active assistance (9); Granting residential spaces in the social house (10); Management and coordination (11); and Amendments and additions to these rules (12). The Resolution also adopts the chart for social assessment of a disaster survivor household (Annex 3).

Policy: Environmental Better Regulation Act (Northern Ireland) 2016 (2016 Chapter 13).
Policy_Content: This Act amends existing legislation so as to provide for a better environment in Northern Ireland. It enables provision to be made for or in connection with protecting and improving the environment, including (but not limited to) the following— (a) regulating environmental activities; (b) implementing EU obligations of the United Kingdom relating to protecting and improving the environment; (c) implementing international obligations of the United Kingdom relating to protecting and improving the environment. The Department of the Environment, by Regulations, may make provision for, or in connection with, any of the matters specified in Schedule 1. The Department may also amend, repeal or revoke any statutory provision under which it has any function to the extent necessary to remove from it any of the following that it considers to be unnecessary or inappropriate— (a) a power of entry or associated power; (b) an offence connected with the exercise of such a specified power. The Water and Sewerage Services (Northern Ireland) Order 2006 is amended with respect to enforcement authorities, regulations relating to wholesomeness of water, appointment and powers of inspectors and publication of certain information and advice.

Policy: Regional Law No. 163-ZRT “On industrial policy”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations originating between subjects operating in the sphere of industry, regional and state bodies and local self-government in the process of formation and implementation of industrial policy. The tasks of industrial policy shall be as follows: (a) formation and development of modern industry; (b) stimulation of industrial activity; (c) increase of industrial production output; (d) promotion of innovations and research in industry; (e) application of best available industrial technologies and methods; and ensuring technological independence of the regional economy. Particular attention shall be paid to the development of engineering, energy and transport sectors of the regional industry.

Policy: Regional Law No. 38-OZ “On public control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the modalities of organization and performance of public control as a form of public participation. It shall not be applicable to elections and referendum. Regional executive bodies shall have the following plenary powers: (a) formation of advisory councils at the regional executive bodies; (b) examination of final documents drafted by public control bodies; and (c) consideration of proposals, recommendations and conclusions contained in the final documents. Public control shall be performed by public inspections and public control groups. Public control can initiate public hearings, obtain results of inspections performed by regional and municipal executive bodies and participate at joint supervisory (control) arrangements.

Policy: Statute of the National Oil Company.
Policy_Content: The Statute consisting of 84 articles aims to regulate general principles regarding the National Oil Company. This Company has an independent legal personality but affiliated to the Oil Ministry. The Company has been established for unlimited period of time and its central office is located in Tehran. The Company’s main activities include management and operation of the upstream activities of the oil industry and related industries as well as domestic and foreign trade of oil. Thus, exploration and extradition of oil resources, their sustainable use and sustainable development, contracting with individuals, companies, foreign governments and trans-national organizations, establishment and protection of pipelines, machines and equipment of oil industry, storage and transportation of oil, promoting the company’s productivity to the global standards, performing the related research and educational programs, providing sea transit and aviation services as well as cultural and social activities to protect environment are other responsibilities of the Oil Company. Structurally, the Company consists of a General Assembly, a Board of Directors, a CEO, an Independent Auditor and a legal inspector. The General Assembly has two annual meeting and a number of extraordinary meetings if needed and the Minister of Oil is its head.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Persian Gulf, Southern Asia

Policy_Content: El presente documento tiene por objeto la actualización de los Lineamientos de la política económica y social del partido y la Revolución. Esta actualización se refiere al período 2016-2021. El documento contiene en total 274 lineamientos, organizados en las siguientes partes: I) Modelo de gestión económica; II) Políticas macroeconómicas; III) Política económica externa; IV) Política inversionista; V) Política de ciencia, tecnología, innovación y medio ambiente; VI) Política social; VII) Política agroindustrial; VIII) Política industrial y energética; IX) Política para el turismo; X) Política para el transporte; XI) Política para las construcciones, viviendas y recursos hidráulicos; XII) Política para el comercio; XIII) Perfeccionamiento de sistemas y órganos de dirección.

Policy: Zambia National Policy on Climate Change 2016.
Policy_Content: The Zambia National Policy on Climate Change is a cross-sectoral policy enacted in 2016, whose overall objective is to provide a framework for coordinating climate change programmes in order to ensure climate resilient and low carbon development pathways for sustainable development towards the attainment of Zambia's Vision 2030.  The policy is guided by the principle of 'sustainable climate change response' according to which all climate change actions shall be environmentally sustainable and positively contribute to national economic growth and social development objectives, including poverty alleviation, access to natural resources and basic amenities, gender equality and equity and infrastructure development.

Policy: Risk Management Strategy.
Policy_Content: This Risk Management Strategy for the Ministry of Agriculture is a nationwide sectoral document aiming at (i) ensuring the preparedness of the Ministry in case of emergencies and (ii) reducing the consequences of disasters on the population and on the sector, which is one of the largest productive sectors of the Kingdom. Risk management is broadly intended as the optimal use of available resources in light of the risks in a way that ensures the achievement of national and strategic goals of the Ministry. The document has the following three main strategic goals (1) Institutionalization of risk management at the Ministry through (i) adding to the Ministry’s Strategic Plan a Risk Management Plan and include it in the budget; (ii) spreading awareness of importance of risk management; and (iii) building a culture of risk management; (2) Prediction of risks and crises through (i) identification of potential risks; (ii) estimation of the likelihood of occurrence; (iii) study of their causal factors and consequent effects; and (iv) estimation of the necessary cost to avoid them and minimize the effects; and (3) Effective and efficient risks and crises management through (i) providing plans to address potential risks; (ii) defining tasks and responsibilities for risk management; (iii) training in best practices in risk management; and (iv) building mechanisms for monitoring and evaluation in risk management and implement them.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, General
Geographical_area: Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Red Sea  Gulf of Aden, Western Asia

Policy: Zimbabwe Climate Policy
Policy_Content: The Policy acknowledges that climate change is a serious global challenge and that the impacts are felt throughout all socio-economic sectors. Zimbabwe is heavily dependent on rainfed agriculture and climate sensitive resources. The increasing frequency and severity of droughts and floods, the shift in onset and cessation of the rainfall and increasing intensity of mid-season dry spells in the last 50 years have been identified in the Zimbabwe Initial National Communications (1996) as a major consequence of climate change. The Policy essentially acknowledges that the livelihoods of vulnerable people who are highly dependent on climate sensitive sectors like agriculture, are likely to be impacted by climate change in various ways. The principles underpinning the Policy include; 1. Base Climate related decisions or actions on sound data based, modelling, robust scientific findings including Indigenous Knowledge System and rigorous analysis but also on integrated, participatory approach; 2. Ensure Zimbabwe’s resilience to climate related challenges by cross-sectional engagement inclusive of public-private sector involvement in the implementation; 3. Adopt of low carbon development pathway that incorporate national developmental aspirations, vision and national programmes; 4. Build resilience to climate challenges through adaptation programmes shall is pursued concurrently with climate change mitigation programmes 5. Ensure that the climate policy be wholly owned by all Zimbabweans and be gender sensitive 6. Address implications of the past, current and future climate. 7. Guide climate adaptation and climate change mitigation investment programmes in Zimbabwe’s priority areas. 8. Inform the National Climate Change Response Strategies and Action Plans. The vision of the Policy is a climate resilient and low carbon country by climate-proofing all the socio-economic development sectors of Zimbabwe to address the national challenge of reducing Zimbabwe’s vulnerability to climate and climate related disasters, while developing in a low carbon pathway. On the other hand, the purpose of the Policy is to guide climate change management in the country, enhance the national adaptive captive, scale up mitigation actions, facilitate domestication of global policies and ensure compliance to the global mechanisms. The specific goals of the Policy include; 1. Develop and strengthen capacity in Weather, Climate Research and Modelling. 2. Promote technology transfer, capacity building and information sharing. 3. Reduce vulnerability to climate variability and climate related disasters by strengthening adaptive capacity. 4. Accelerating mitigation measures by adopting and developing low carbon development pathways. 5. Strengthen education and awareness to climate variability and change. 6. Search for solutions to financial resource allocation, mobilisation and management. 7. Foster collaboration among national and international institutions in climate related issues. 8. Strengthen governance structures for the climate policy to increase Zimbabwe’s resilience to climate change and climate variability. The Policy provides that implementation shall be provided n the National Climate Change Response Strategy (NCCRS) document, the Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs), the Meteorological Services Act and any other climate related documents.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Water
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries

Policy: Agriculture Sector Strategic Plan 2015/16-2019/20.
Policy_Content: The Agriculture Sector Strategic Plan is a strategic instrument, relating to the period 2015-2020, whose overall objective is to transform the sector from subsistence farming to commercial agriculture. The envisaged transformation will help create employment opportunities, especially for the young and for women, and increase household incomes, while ensuring household food security along the entire commodity value chain. The overall development and growth of the sector is anchored on four strategic objectives or priorities: 1) To increase production and productivity of agricultural commodities and enterprises; 2) To increase access to critical farm inputs; 3) To improve access to markets and value addition and strengthen the quality of agricultural commodities; and 4) To strengthen the agricultural services institutions and the enabling environment.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Water

Policy: Malawi National Trade Policy.
Policy_Content: The Malawi National Trade Policy 2016-2021 is a cross-sectoral policy developed to provide a framework for formulation, implementation and coordination of trade related policies. The policy has identified five priority areas - market access, business environment, narrow productive base, high entry cost for small scale producers and traders, and implementation gap - to developing the trade sector.  The goal of the National Trade Policy is to make Malawi a globally competitive export- oriented economy, generating higher and sustainable livelihoods through trade. It aims to achieve this goal by driving structural transformation of the productive sector and supporting and managing domestic market structure and integration in regional and global markets through value chains with the ambition of increasing exports.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: National Development Strategy 2016 – 2035.
Policy_Content: The National Development Strategy is a national policy with a multi-sectoral approach. The timeframe of the Plan is 20 years between 2016 and 2035. The overall vision of the National Development Strategy is to achieve an improvement in the social and economic livelihoods of all Solomon Islanders through the achievement of long-term objectives such as (i) economic growth, (ii) poverty alleviation and improved food security, (iii) resilient and environmentally sustainable development, and (iv) provision of adequate, accessible and quality social services, basic needs, infrastructure and utilities for all Solomon Islanders.

Policy: Regulation on the classification of microorganisms and organisms used in the closed use of GMMs and closed use of GMOs.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Environment, which is composed of three paragraphs and two Annexes, establishes: (1) classification of microorganisms used in the closed use of GMM which is specified in Annex 1; (2) classification of organisms used in the closed use of GMO which is specified in Annex 2. Closed use of GMOs means genetically modifying organisms or cultivating GMO, storing them, transporting, destroying, removing or using in another way where protection measures are used to effectively reduce contact of GMO with humans or the environment and ensure the high level of their protection.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries

Policy: Announcement (2013 No. 51) of the General Administration of Quality Supervision, Inspection and Quarantine on Approving the Implementation the Protection of Geographical Indication Products for Champagne.
Policy_Content: The General Administration of Quality Supervision, Inspection and Quarantine, in accordance with the Provisions on the Protection of Geographical Indication Products and related rules, has organized the technical review on Champagne, and now approves the implementation of the protection of Geographical Indication products on Champagne within the territory of the People's Republic of China. The quality technical requirements to be satisfied by Champagne are listed in the Annex.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 077-2016-EF ─ Política Nacional de Promoción de la Inversión Privada en Asociaciones Público Privadas y Proyectos en Activos.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo aprueba Política Nacional de Promoción de la Inversión Privada en Asociaciones Público Privadas y Proyectos en Activos, que tiene como objetivo fomentar la participación del sector privado en las modalidades de Asociación Público Privada y Proyectos en Activos para el desarrollo de proyectos que contribuyan de manera eficiente al cierre de la brecha de infraestructura pública existente en el país, mejoren el alcance y la calidad de los servicios públicos, y dinamicen la economía nacional, la generación de empleo productivo y la competitividad. Asimismo, busca promover la sinergia entre los diversos proyectos de Asociación Público Privada y Proyectos en Activos, bajo una lógica de portafolio, y asegurar que los procesos de promoción sean realizados bajo condiciones de competencia, sin discriminación de ninguna índole a los postores, y en estricto cumplimiento de lo establecido en los distintos Tratados suscritos por el Estado peruano.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 227 validating the Rules for inspection by International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA).
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the Rules for inspection by International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) of nuclear sites located on the territory of the Republic of Kazakhstan. Policy: Resolución Nº 70 - Crea la Mesa de Diálogo entre el Ministerio de Agricultura y Desarrollo Rural y la Asociación Nacional de Usuarios Campesinos de Colombia (ANUC).
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución crea la Mesa de Diálogo entre el Ministerio de Agricultura y Desarrollo Rural y la Asociación Nacional de Usuarios Campesinos de Colombia (ANUC), como un espacio de participación de la ANUC en las decisiones que afecten a los miembros de ésta en el marco del diseño e implementación de la política agropecuaria y de desarrollo rural. Las funciones de la Mesa de Diálogo son: 1) Participar en el diseño de los programas misionales del Sector Agropecuario, Pesquero y de Desarrollo Rural que afecten a los miembros de la ANUC; 2) Presentar recomendaciones frente a la política pública del Sector Agropecuario, Pesquero y de Desarrollo Rural, especialmente en temas de gestión de los bienes públicos rurales, desarrollo de capacidades productivas y generación de ingresos, productividad y competitividad agrícola; 3) Apoyar el impulso de acciones para materializar las medidas contempladas en el Plan de Reparación Colectiva de la ANUC.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

El Protocolo de mediación tiene por objeto buscar alternativas de solución y espacios de diálogo entre los mineros no regularizados, que vienen adelantando actividades mineras tradicionales dentro de un título minero, y el beneficiario de éste, para lograr conforme a lo establecido en la normatividad vigente, que dichos mineros puedan trabajar bajo el amparo del título.

Policy: Law on Organic Food
Policy_Content: The purpose of this law is to regulate all aspects on organic agriculture, production of organic food, feed and fertilizer, their certification, trade, import, use of organic logo and advertisement. This law shall apply to agricultural originated organic food, unprocessed raw materials and products, natural plant originated organic food, organic feed, organic fertilizer and seed and seedlings. This law shall not apply to produce food from raw materials of wild animals, and regulate activities of the public food. The following principles shall be adhered in organic production: (a) protect health and safety soil, water, air, plants, animal and human existence; (b) organic production should conserve sustainability of nature and ecology and has no harm to the ecosystem; (c) should be based on fair competiveness of market and adhere fairness and gracious; (d) to enterprise using responsible method and technology orienting to conserve organic and characteristics of the nature and to protect environment, health and wellness of the present and future generation; and (e) Food and feed is considered as organic if 90 or above percent of ingredients are organic. Organic food manufacturing can have no conversion period. Organic food producer shall meet the following requirements: (a) get certified organic production process and organic products biennially; (b) responsible for expenses for certification; (c) in case of use of forest resources and natural plants, it shall be harvested from field where no disinfectant other than defined in 8.3 in this law is applied in last three years, and determined by central state administration body for environment and food; and (d) forest resources and natural plants are used in compliance with law on Forestry and law on natural plant.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Keyword: Ecological production/organic production,Public health,Certification,Internal trade,International trade,Enforcement/compliance,Basic legislation
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Eastern Asia, Landlocked Developing Countries
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on 1 January 2017.

Policy: Resolución Nº 2 - Lineamientos para la aplicación de los incentivos y beneficios de la Ley orgánica de incentivos para asociaciones público-privadas y la inversión extranjera, a los proyectos presentados al amparo del Decreto Nº 582 de 2015.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución expide los Lineamientos para la aplicación de los incentivos y beneficios de la Ley orgánica de incentivos para asociaciones público-privadas y la inversión extranjera, a los proyectos presentados al amparo del Decreto Nº 582 de 2015. Se dispone que los proyectos que se hayan tramitado al amparo del Decreto Nº 582, bajo cualquier modalidad de Asociación Público-Privada, en las formas contractuales reconocidas por la Ley, podrán ser susceptibles de acogerse a los incentivos y beneficios establecidos en la Ley Orgánica de Incentivos para Asociaciones Público–Privadas y la Inversión Extranjera (Ley APP), siempre que cumplan con los requisitos y procedimientos establecidos en la Ley APP, los presentes Lineamientos para su aplicación, y que el contrato respectivo no haya sido todavía suscrito.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Public private partnership (PPP),Business/industry/corporations,Fiscal and market measures,Non-governmental entity,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Public participation,Subsidy/incentive

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 67 - La Autoridad Agraria Nacional delega y desconcentra atribuciones otorgadas en la Ley Orgánica de Tierras Rurales y Territorios Ancestrales para sustanciar y resolver las solicitudes de saneamiento, peticiones, reclamos y recursos en materia de tierras rurales.
Policy_Content: El presente Reglamento General para la aplicación de la Ley Orgánica de Tierras Rurales y Territorios Ancestrales, de Tierras Rurales y Territorios Ancestrales, tiene por objeto regular la aplicación de la Ley Orgánica de Tierras Rurales y Territorios Ancestrales, de conformidad con los principios, finalidades, lineamientos de la política agraria de tierras y los derechos vinculados a la propiedad de la tierra rural y territorios ancestrales. La Autoridad Agraria Nacional en sus respectivas jurisdicciones racional, zonal y provincial, es el Ministerio de Agricultura, Ganadería, Acuacultura y Pesca (MAGAP) en sus niveles administrativos nacional y desconcentrados. Corresponde a la Autoridad Agraria Nacional organizar y administrar el Registro de tierras rurales.

Policy: Délibération n° 118 du 7 avril 2016 relative au régime d’autorisation des usines hydrauliques utilisant l’énergie des cours d’eau et des lacs.
Policy_Content: La présente délibération fixe le régime d’autorisation des usines hydrauliques utilisant l’énergie des cours d’eau et des lacs. Ainsi, nul ne peut disposer de l’énergie des cours d’eau et des lacs sans concession ou autorisation de la Nouvelle-Calédonie. Elle précise la forme et instruction des demandes d’autorisation ; la délivrance de l’autorisation ; les dispositions diverses; les contrôles et sanction ; et les dispositions finales et transitoires.

Policy: Kilifi County Disaster Management Act, 2016 (No. 15 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act designs and establishes the Kilifi county disaster management structure and provides with respect to disaster prevention and mitigation in the Kilifi County. It establishes the County Disaster Council and the County Disaster Management Unit, defines functions and powers of the Council and the Unit, and provides with respect to the administration of the funds of the  County Disaster Management Fund, which is established also under this Act. The Act sets out the measures to be taken by the County Government for purposes of disaster management. The County Disaster Council shall be mainly responsible for planning and policy and shall administer the Fund, whereas Unit shall also be involved in disaster policy and provide administrative support to the County Disaster Council. The Unit shall also coordinate the response agencies and the community generally to implement and participate in disaster risk reduction activities and programs.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa

Policy: Arrêté du 7 avril 2016 relatif au déclenchement des procédures préfectorales en cas d'épisodes de pollution de l'air ambiant.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté fixe le déclenchement des procédures préfectorales en cas d'épisodes de pollution de l'air ambiant. En effet, l’épisodes de pollution de l'air ambiant est une période au cours de laquelle la concentration dans l'air ambiant d'un ou plusieurs polluants atmosphériques est supérieure au seuil d'information et de recommandation ou au seuil d'alerte définis à l' article R. 221-1 du code de l'environnement, dans les conditions prévues à l'article 2.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Geothermal Energy Resources Regulations 2016.
Policy_Content: These Regulations, consisting of 39 sections divided into eight Parts, aim to the following issues: (a) to provide for the elimination and minimisation, so far as is practicable, of risks to public safety, the environment, land, property or infrastructure involved in undertaking geothermal energy operations; and (b) to prescribe requirements for operation plans; and (c) to prescribe various administrative matters, fees and other requirements authorised by the Act. These Regulations are made under section 169 of the Geothermal Energy Resources Act 2005. The Regulations are divided as follows: Preliminary (Part 1); Exempt operations (Part 2); Extraction licences (Part 3); Development plans (Part 4); Operation plan (Part 5); Reporting (Part 6); Geothermal energy register (Part 7); Administrative matters and fees (Part 8).
Subject: Energy, Mineral resources
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: These Regulations enter into force on 4 April 2016.

Policy: Marsabit County Planning Act, 2016 (No. 1 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act provides rules for physical planning, including Integrated Urban Areas and Town Development Planning, in Marsabit County. County plans shall be made in accordance with provisions of Part XI of the County Governments Act, 2012. This Act prescribes content of county physical development plan and creates a county planning unit which within the county government and a county planning unit. The functions of the county planning unit shall include - coordination of integrated development planning within the county; ensure integrated planning within the county; ensuring linkages between county plans and the national planning framework; and ensure meaningful engagement of citizens in the planning process; hearing and determining appeals lodged by persons aggrieved by the decision of any sub county planning unit; determining and resolving planning matters referred to it by any of the sub county planning units; advising the county executive.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa

Policy: Regulation 271 date 6.4.2016 amending and supplementing Regulation 408 date 13.5.2015 of the Council of Ministers approving the territory development regulation.
Policy_Content: This Regulation 271 of 2016 amends various articles of Regulation 408 of 2015. It also supplements it by introducing ‘the electronic permits system’ as the basis of all state data on requests and permits. The electronic system is part of the integrated register for territory development and manages the interaction of all subjects involved in this process including the applicant, the authorities responsible for issuing the permit and other institutions obligated to give information or approval on the permits. Any subject applying for the permit shall do so through the electronic database. All institutions that shall give information or opinion or examine the applications shall also respond and approve through the electronic system.  The system will serve as the single point of coordination between the permit applications as well as their review and approval process. The electronic system will start functioning on 20 April 2016.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Regulation No. 267 date 6.4.2016 removing from forestry fund the forest economies of ‘Zall-Devoll’ and ‘Mollas’ of Elbasani district.
Policy_Content: This Regulation removes from the forestry fund an area of 90 ha that belonged to the forestry economies of ‘Zall Devoll’ and ‘Mollas’ of Elbasani region according to the map attached to the regulation. The area will be used by ‘Delia Group’ Ltd for the construction of hydropowers ‘Thane’ and ‘Mollas’. Delia Group Ltd is required to pay for the forestry area and its infrastructure full amounts according to the Regulation 391 date 21.6.2006 of the Council of Ministers laying down tariffs in the forestry and pasture sector. The company should also rehabilitate and reforestate a forestry area equal to the one removed from the fund.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Forest service/forest officers,Public forest,Business/industry/corporations,Special fund,Afforestation/reforestation
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Resolution CONAMA No. 474 amending Resolution CONAMA No. 411 on inspection procedures related to industries that consume or process natural forest products and by-products, as well as setting the related standards and volume yield coefficients, including vegetal coal and saw mill wastes.
Policy_Content: This Resolution amends Resolution CONAMA No. 411/2009. Amendments deal with the following matters: conversion of forest products through industrial processing or semi-mechanized process shall be informed in the National System of Control of the Origin of Forest Products (Sinaflor) or in the integrated state electronic system, respecting the maximum limits of coefficient of volumetric timber set out in Annex II of this Resolution. Wood waste generated in the conversion of raw products to processed products will be reduced by at least 10%, referring to the losses in the form of sawdust. Any losses resulting from the conversion between processed products must be reported in the DOF System or in the integrated state electronic system according to the volume obtained from the operation. In addition, amended Annexes deal with: New Volumetric Efficiency Coefficient; Studies for Determination of the Greater Coefficient of Volumetric Commercial Timber Logging in Sawn Wood.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Resolution enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Order No. 191 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on the national park “Meshchera”.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes that the location of the national park “Meshchera” shall be Vladimir region of the Russian Federation. National park “Meshchera” shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of natural complexes, unique and reference natural sites and objects; (b) conservation of historical and cultural heritage; (c) environmental education of the population; (d) promotion of regulated tourism and recreation; (e) development and introduction of scientific methods of nature protection and environmental education; (f) implementation of state environmental monitoring; and (g) restoration of disturbed natural and historical-cultural complexes and objects. On the territory of the national park, shall be prohibited any activity that can damage natural complexes and objects of flora and fauna, cultural and historical objects and which contradicts the purposes and tasks of the national park, including: On the territory of the national park, shall be prohibited any activity that can damage natural complexes and objects of flora and fauna, cultural and historical objects and which contradicts the purposes and tasks of the national park, including: (a) exploration and mining; (b) disturbance of the soil cover and geological outcrops; (c) activities entailing changes in the hydrological regime; (d) allotment of land parcels for horticulture and smallholding; (e) construction of main roads, pipelines, power transmission lines and other communications, as well as construction and operation of economic and residential facilities, except for tourism industry facilities, museums and information centers, facilities related to the functioning of the national park and the functioning of settlement located within its boundaries; (f) logging (except for timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs); (g) procurement of soft resin; (h) commercial hunting and commercial fisheries; (i) procurement of edible non-timber forest resources (with the exception of procurement by citizens of such resources for their own personal needs); (j) disturbance of natural habitats of wild fauna and wild flora species; (k) biological collections, except for research purposes, envisaged by thematic and research plans of the Institution; (l) introduction of living organisms in order to acclimatize them; (m) passage and grazing of domestic animals; (n) water logging; (o) organization of mass sports and entertainment events, organization of tourist camps and making bonfires outside the specially designated places for such purpose; (p) unauthorized conduct of archaeological excavations, collection and removal of objects of historical and cultural value; (q) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, including hunting firearms and hunting gear; (r) blasting operations; (s) burning of vegetation (with the exception of fire-fighting measures implemented in coordination with the Institution); (t) clear cutting of forest species and shrubbery, with the exception of sanitary felling, felling associated with extinguishing forest fires, including the creation of fire breaks, and felling associated with the construction, reconstruction and operation of line facilities carried out in accordance with this Regulations; (u) waste disposal of domestic and non-domestic waste, radioactive waste, chemical, explosive, toxic, poisonous and hazardous substances; (v) washing vehicles on the banks of waterbodies; (w) movement and parking of motorized vehicles outside public roads and specially designated places (except for cases related to the functioning of the national park); (x) destruction and damage of posts, barriers, stands, boundary poles and other information signs, developed ecological paths and recreation areas, buildings on the territory of the national park, as well as property of the Institution, inscriptions and signs on boulders, outcrops and historical and cultural objects; (y) stay with dogs (except for service dogs, and hunting dogs for artisanal and sport hunting) and keeping unleashed dogs outside the cages or other structures that limit the zone of their movement, and training of dogs; and (z) ploughing up of the territory (except for forest fire fighting purposes).
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 167 validating the Regulation on State Interdepartmental Commission on Environmental Education.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes that State Interdepartmental Commission on Environmental Education was constituted with a view of coordination of activities of the executive bodies, ministries and departments, as well as organizations concerned related to environmental education of the population of the Republic of Tajikistan. The Commission shall perform the following tasks: (a) - implementation of the state policy in the field of environmental education of the population, development of programs for its implementation and monitoring of the implementation thereof; (b) coordination of activities of local executive bodies of state power, other competent bodies of the Republic of Tajikistan, organizations and institutions, public associations for environmental education of the population; (c) preparation and submission of draft resolutions on issues of environmental education; (d) organization of methodological assistance to educational institutions and public associations on environmental education of the population; and (e) - consideration of proposals for creating a system of information support for environmental education and dissemination of environmental knowledge among various strata of the population.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Law No. 10.510 establishing the State Programme for Sustainable Rural Development and creating the Special State Support Fund Programme for Sustainable Rural Development.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 13 articles, establishes the State Programme for Sustainable Rural Development and creates the Special State Support Fund Programme for Sustainable Rural Development. The objective of this State Programme is to implement public policies for sustainable rural development aimed at improving the quality of life in rural areas. These actions include assistance, training and promotion of productive and infrastructure projects, in order to disseminate sustainable practices, improving water supply, environmental suitability of rural properties and communities as well as the conservation of water and soil resources.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Water
Keyword: Agricultural development,Policy/planning,Sustainable use,Special fund,Irrigation,Sustainable development,Capacity building
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Resolución Nº 027-2016-OSINFOR ─ Directiva para la aplicación de la conservación de bosques húmedos como mecanismo de compensación del pago de multas impuestas por el Organismo de Supervisión de los Recursos Forestales y de Fauna Silvestre (OSINFOR) a comunidades nativas y campesinas.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba la Directiva para la aplicación de la conservación de bosques húmedos como mecanismo de compensación del pago de multas impuestas por el Organismo de Supervisión de los Recursos Forestales y de Fauna Silvestre (OSINFOR) a comunidades nativas y campesinas. El objetivo de la Directiva consiste en establecer el procedimiento y condiciones para acceder a la conservación de bosques húmedos como mecanismo de compensación del pago de multas impuestas por el OSINFOR a comunidades nativas y campesinas por la comisión de infracciones a la legislación forestal y de fauna silvestre, con la finalidad de facilitar a los administrados el cumplimiento del pago de las obligaciones por concepto de multas impuestas por el OSINFOR.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Build Operate Transfer Projects Act 2016 (No. 1 of 2016).
Policy_Content: The Act makes provision for projects implemented under Build Operate Transfer (BOT) agreements in Mauritius. The Public-Private Partnership Act and (subject to certain exceptions) the Public Procurement Act shall not, apply to any BOT project under this Act. There shall be, within the Procurement Policy Office, a BOT Projects Unit which shall deal with BOT projects. The Unit, shall, among other things, formulate policies, including directives, procedures and guidelines on BOT projects and maintain a register of BOT projects.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Water
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Notification No. 2016/16 on supporting young farmers’ projects within the scope of rural development.
Policy_Content: This Notification aims at (i) ensuring agricultural sustainability, (ii) supporting young entrepreneurs, (iii) increasing incomes, (iv) creating alternative sources of income and (v) contributing to rural youth employment. This Notification shall apply to young farmers’ projects on production, processing, packaging and storage of vegetation, animal, medicinal and aromatic plants. The General Directorate, Provincial Directorate and District Directorate under the Ministry of Food, Agriculture and Livestock shall be responsible of the implementation of National Rural Development Strategy 2014-2020 and accordingly shall provide agricultural support grants to young farmers.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Agricultural development,Business/industry/corporations,Farming,Financial agricultural measures,Processing/handling,Institution,Smallholders/peasants,Policy/planning,Poverty,Rural employment,Rural youth,Subsidy/incentive,Sustainable development,Packaging/labelling,Plant production,Transport/storage
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia

Policy: Movable Property (Security Interests) Act, 2016 (No. 3 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act provides with respect to interests in movable property created by agreement that secures payment or other performance of an obligation regardless of the form of the transaction, type of movable property, status of the debtor or secured creditor or the nature of the secured obligation, including— (a) a security interest in intangible or tangible assets, a lien, charge, financial lease, right under a hire-purchase agreement, pledge, security trust deed, trust receipt, consignment, lease, assignment or other interest in movable property that secures payment or performance of an obligation;(b) the creation, perfection and priority of a security interest in proceeds where this Act is applicable to the creation, perfection and priority of the security interest in the original collateral from which the proceeds arose; and (c) a security interest created by a consumer or acquired by a secured creditor without affecting the consumers rights as provided in the Competition and Consumer Protection Act, 2010. It also concerns an interest established on a farm product and security interest created in negotiable document (including a warehouse receipt as defined by the Agricultural Credits Act, 2010) For purposes of determining whether a security interest in a farm product exits, it does not matter whether the farm product is stored, kept, growing or grown, as the case may be, on any other land or premises. A perfected security interest in a farm product is not extinguished or prejudicially affected by a subsequent sale, lease, mortgage or other encumbrance of, or upon, the land on which the farm product is stored, kept, growing or grown, as the case may be.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Nyeri County Co-operative Societies Act, 2016 (No. 4 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the constitution and registration of co-operative societies and promotion and development of the co-operative movement in Nyeri County. It defines the functions of the Executive Committee Member with respect to control and development of cooperative societies in the County. The Act also concerns the administration of societies and their dissolution, etc. The overriding objectives of this Act is to provide a comprehensive, harmonized, efficient and effective legal and regulatory framework for development and regulation of the co-operative sector in the County by — (a) enabling the formation, registration and operation of cooperatives; (b) promoting co-operative philosophy, principles, practices and objectives; (c) protecting the interests of co-operatives, their members and the public in the operations and activities of co-operatives; (d) ensuring directors and officials of co-operatives are accountable for their actions and decisions to the members of co-operatives.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Agricultural development,Cooperative/producer organization,Registration,Contract/agreement,Institution,Contract farming,Special fund,Court/tribunal,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa

Policy: Order No. 194 of the Ministry of Natural Resources validating the Regulation on the national park “Sailyugemskij”.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes that the location of the national park “Sailyugemskij” shall be Altai region of the Russian Federation. National park “Sailyugemskij” shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of natural complexes, unique and reference natural sites and objects; (b) conservation of historical and cultural heritage; (c) environmental education of the population; (d) promotion of regulated tourism and recreation; (e) development and introduction of scientific methods of nature protection and environmental education; (f) implementation of state environmental monitoring; and (g) restoration of disturbed natural and historical-cultural complexes and objects. On the territory of the national park, shall be prohibited any activity that can damage natural complexes and objects of flora and fauna, cultural and historical objects and which contradicts the purposes and tasks of the national park, including: (a) exploration and mining; (b) disturbance of the soil cover and geological outcrops; (c) activities entailing changes in the hydrological regime; (d) allotment of land parcels for horticulture and smallholding; (e) construction of main roads, pipelines, power transmission lines and other communications, as well as construction and operation of economic and residential facilities, except for tourism industry facilities, museums and information centers, facilities related to the functioning of the national park and the functioning of settlement located within its boundaries; (f) logging (except for timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs); (g) procurement of soft resin; (h) commercial, sports and artisanal hunting, commercial fisheries; (i) procurement of edible non-timber forest resources (with the exception of procurement by citizens of such resources for their own personal needs); (j) disturbance of natural habitats of wild fauna and wild flora species; (k) biological collections, except for research purposes, envisaged by thematic and research plans of the Institution; (l) introduction of living organisms in order to acclimatize them; (m) passage and grazing of domestic animals; (n) water logging; (o) organization of mass sports and entertainment events, organization of tourist camps and making bonfires outside the specially designated places for such purpose; (p) unauthorized conduct of archaeological excavations, collection and removal of objects of historical and cultural value; (q) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, including hunting firearms and hunting gear; (r) blasting operations; (s) burning of vegetation (with the exception of fire-fighting measures implemented in coordination with the Institution); (t) clear cutting of forest species and shrubbery, with the exception of sanitary felling, felling associated with extinguishing forest fires, including the creation of fire breaks, and felling associated with the construction, reconstruction and operation of line facilities carried out in accordance with this Regulations; (u) waste disposal of domestic and non-domestic waste, radioactive waste, chemical, explosive, toxic, poisonous and hazardous substances; (v) washing vehicles on the banks of waterbodies; (w) movement and parking of motorized vehicles outside public roads and specially designated places (except for cases related to the functioning of the national park); (x) destruction and damage of posts, barriers, stands, boundary poles and other information signs, developed ecological paths and recreation areas, buildings on the territory of the national park, as well as property of the Institution, inscriptions and signs on boulders, outcrops and historical and cultural objects; and (y) keeping unleashed dogs; (z) ploughing up of the territory, haymaking (except for forest fire fighting purposes); and application of chemicals, fertilizers, nutrients and plant protection means.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Order No. 79 of the Ministry of Agriculture and Food industry validating the Requirements for the application of the System of conservative agriculture.
Policy_Content: These Requirements are designed to facilitate the implementation process of the Systems of conservative agriculture. The System of conservative agriculture is a technology used when growing field plants with complete or partial lack of soil cultivation, provided that the soil surface retains a minimum of 30% of the residues of previous agricultural crops, the agrotechnical measure is aimed at: (a) soil fertility conservation by reducing the process of soil erosion (the fertile soil layer) caused by wind and water; (b) conservation of water in the soil as a result of the movement of water losses from the soil through the process of evaporation. Depending on the treatment (mobilization) of the soil, shall be classified the following systems of conservative agriculture: (a) zero tillage (No-till); (b) minimum tillage (Mini-till); and (c) soil cultivation by strips (Strip-till). When carrying out agricultural work, agricultural machinery and equipment for which specific requirements are listed in the framework of the Conservative Agriculture System according to the table in Annex shall be used.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries

Policy: Regional Law No. 28-RZ “On industrial policy”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations originating between subjects operating in the sphere of industry, regional and state bodies and local self-government in the process of formation and implementation of industrial policy. The tasks of industrial policy shall be as follows: (a) formation and development of modern industry; (b) stimulation of industrial activity; (c) introduction of ecofrienfly processes and resource saving technologies; (d) increase of industrial production output; (e) reduction of disaster risks; and ensuring technological independence of the regional economy.

Policy: Act V of 2016: Environment and Planning Review Tribunal Act.
Policy_Content: This Act sets up an independent and impartial tribunal, to be known as the Environment and Planning Review Tribunal, for the purpose of reviewing the decisions of the Planning Authority and the decisions of the Environment and Resources Authority, and for the purpose of exercising any other jurisdiction and function conferred on the Tribunal.

Policy: Biosecurity (Notifiable Organisms) Order 2016.
Policy_Content: This Order declares certain organisms to be notifiable organisms for the purposes of the Biosecurity Act 1993. Organisms listed in the Order may be invasive plants or may affect amphibians, crustaceans, marine or freshwater environments, molluscs, livestock, birds, fish, forestry, horticulture, etc.

Policy: Biosecurity (Process for Assignment of Responsibility for Decision on Harmful Organism or Pathway) Regulations 2016.
Policy_Content: These regulations, consisting of 17 sections and one Schedule, set out the process for the Minister responsible for the administration of the Biosecurity Act 1993 to assign responsibility for a decision on the appropriate response to an issue relating to a harmful organism or pathway. The process involves: an application requesting that the Minister assign responsibility for the decision; the Director-General giving the Minister initial advice on the merits of the application; the Minister making an initial decision on whether to consider the application; the Director-General consulting with parties potentially affected by the assignment of responsibility; the Director-General giving the Minister final advice on whether to assign responsibility for the decision and, if so, to whom; the Minister making final decisions on whether to assign responsibility for the decision and, if so, to whom; the Minister notifying the applicant, the parties to whom the Minister assigns responsibility, and the public of the final decisions made. If the responsible Minister is satisfied that the issue to which an application relates needs to be addressed urgently: the process is shortened; the Minister may assign interim responsibility for the decision to a department or regional council until the final decision is made.
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen., Fisheries, Forestry, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: These regulations enter into force on 5 May 2016.

Policy: Decreto Nº 26-2016-PCM ─ Crea el Instituto Hondureño de Economía Social (IHDES).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto crea el Instituto Hondureño de Economía Social (IHDES), como un ente desconcentrado de la Secretaría de Desarrollo Económico(SDE), que tendrá por objeto diseñar e implementar políticas públicas para fomentar el Sector Social de la Economía, fortaleciendo, organizando, impulsando y consolidando ese Sector, que constituye un pilar del desarrollo económico del país, por medio de la participación, investigación, adopción y transferencia de tecnología, capacitación, formación y apoyo a proyectos productivos del Sector Social de la Economía.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Resolución Nº 10 - Normativa Técnica Sanitaria para el control y vigilancia sanitaria de los productos de uso y consumo humano que podrían considerarse falsificados, adulterados o alterados.
Policy_Content: La presente Normativa Técnica Sanitaria tiene como finalidad el control y vigilancia sanitaria de los productos de uso y consumo humano que son regulados por la Agencia Nacional de Regulación, Control y Vigilancia Sanitaria (ARCSA), y que se podrían considerar falsificados, adulterados o alterados. Las presentes disposiciones establecidas se aplican a las personas naturales o jurídicas, nacionales o extranjeras que elaboran, fabrican, envasan, almacenan, exportan, importan, donan, distribuyen, transportan, comercializan, expenden o dispensan, en todo el territorio nacional productos de uso y consumo humano sujetos a control y vigilancia sanitaria.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Décret n° 100/57 du 4 avril 2016 portant missions, organisation et fonctionnement du ministère des droits de la personne humaine, des affaires sociales et du genre.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe les missions, l’organisation et le fonctionnement du ministère des droits de la personne humaine, des affaires sociales et du genre. Le ministère des droits de la personne humaine, des affaires sociales et du genre a pour mission, entre autres, de: élaborer et coordonner les stratégies de mobilisation pour le secours des sinistrés en cas de catastrophes naturelle en collaboration avec les autres ministères concernés; promouvoir l'équité dans la distribution des ressources nationales en faveur des groupes sociaux vulnérables; coordonner les interventions dans les différents secteurs d'action en faveur des personnes nécessiteuses et vulnérables, les structures et les activités de promotion et de protection des droits de la personne humaine, ainsi que dans les secteurs de promotion de l’égalité des genres; et Contribuer à l’élaboration, à l’application et au respect des lois, pactes, conventions et plates-formes d'action qui protègent les droits de la personne en général, les droits des personnes vulnérables, des femmes, des enfants et des personnes âgées en particulier ainsi qu'à l’égalité du genre. Pour réaliser sa mission, le Ministère des Droits de la Personne Humaine, des Affaires Sociales et du Genre dispose des services de l’Administration Centrale, des services décentralisés rattachés, des administrations personnalisées, des commissions, des organes consultatifs, des programmes et des projets placés sous sa tutelle. Ces administrations, commissions et organes spécialisés sont régis par des textes spécifiques.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Governance,Disasters,Risk assessment/management,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Poverty,Equity
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Development Plannning Act.
Policy_Content: The Development Planning Act sets out the legislative framework governing sustainable land use planning and management of development in Malta. Further it sets out the institutional framework that shall be in charge of related matters. The text of the Act is composed of ten Parts, as follows: I) Preliminary ; II) Duty to Promote a Comprehensive Sustainable, Land Use Planning System; III) Establishment and Scope of the Authority; IV) Common provisions; V) Provisions related to the Executive Council; Establishment and Scope of the Executive Council; Plans and Policies; Spatial Strategy for Environment and Development; Subsidiary Plans and Policies; Orders; The Development Planning Fund; VI) Policy Advisory Committees ; The Standing Committee on the Environment and Development Planning ; The Users’ Committee; The Building Regulation Committee ; VII) Provisions related to the Planning Board The Planning Board; Requirement of Permission; Revocation or Modification of Permission ; Charges and Contributions; VIII) Power to make Regulations General; Planning and Development Regulations; Registration of Contractors; Building Regulations; Miscellaneous Provisions in relation to Building Regulations ; Building Control Regulations; Amendment of the Code of Police Laws; IX) Monitoring and Enforcement; X) Offences.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil

Policy: Government Fees Amendment Regulations 2016 (BR 28/2016).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Government Fees Regulations 1976 by revoking and replacing the Schedule to those Regulations. The Schedule sets out fees to be charged under various Acts including: the Agriculture Act 1930, the Bermuda National Parks Act 1986, the Care and Protection of Animals Act 1975, the Development and Planning Act 1974, the Fisheries Act 1972, the Land Title Registration Act 2011, the Marine Board Act 1962, the Public Health Act 1949, the Water Resources Act and the Veterinary Practitioners Act 2008. As for the Water Resources Act fees are prescribed for: considering an application for a new water right under section 11; issuing a well-digger’s licence under section 23; lodging any notice of appeal to the Minister under section 31.

Las actuaciones objeto de ayuda se enmarcan en el Programa Nacional de Desarrollo Rural 2014-2020, financiado por el Ministerio de Agricultura, Alimentación y Medio Ambiente (MAGRAMA) y el Fondo Europeo Agrícola de Desarrollo Rural (FEADER) y regulado por el Reglamento (UE) relativo a la ayuda al desarrollo rural a través del Fondo Europeo Agrícola de Desarrollo Rural (FEADER).

Policy: Resolución Nº 067-2016-SERFOR ─ Lineamientos para el otorgamiento de la autorización de Institución Científica Nacional Depositaria de Material Biológico.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba los Lineamientos para el otorgamiento de la autorización de Institución Científica Nacional Depositaria de Material Biológico, para lo cual el Servicio Nacional Forestal y de Fauna Silvestre (SERFOR) implementará el registro de Instituciones Científicas Nacionales Depositarias de Material Biológico, las mismas que deben presentar una solicitud que contenga información sobre las condiciones técnicas que posee para custodiar el material biológico de flora y/o fauna silvestre depositado. Dichas instituciones son responsables de la custodia del material biológico depositado, ingresos y mantenimiento actualizada de la información de las colecciones, debiendo informar al SERFOR cualquier eventualidad o situación que afecte la conservación de las mismas.

Policy: Resolución Nº 065-2016-SERFOR ─ Lineamientos para la elaboración de la Declaración de Manejo para permisos de aprovechamiento forestal en comunidades nativas y comunidades campesinas.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba los Lineamientos para la elaboración de la Declaración de Manejo para permisos de aprovechamiento forestal en comunidades nativas y comunidades campesinas, en las que se consideran criterios como la intensidad del aprovechamiento, la extensión del área, el nivel de impacto de las operaciones, la caracterización del recurso, el nivel de mecanización y la continuidad de intervención, aplicando el Nivel bajo a operaciones que, como en este caso, se realizan en áreas pequeñas o con bajas intensidades de aprovechamiento de productos maderables y productos diferentes de la madera, que no generan impactos ambientales significativos.
Subject: Forestry
