Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 016-2016-SA ─ Política Sectorial de Salud Intercultural.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba la Política Sectorial de Salud Intercultural, que tiene por tiene por objeto regular las acciones de salud intercultural en el ámbito nacional, a fin de lograr la atención de salud como un derecho humano, que favorezca la inclusión, igualdad de oportunidades entre hombres y mujeres, garantizando el ejercicio del derecho a la salud de los pueblos indígenas u originarios, andinos y amazónicos y de la población afroperuana. Se crea la Comisión Multisectorial de Naturaleza Permanente, adscrita al Ministerio de Salud, encargada de emitir el informe técnico que contenga el Plan Sectorial de Salud Intercultural 2016-2021, así como realizar el seguimiento de la implementación de la Política Sectorial de Salud Intercultural y formular los mecanismos para su efectivo cumplimiento, con la finalidad de crear un espacio de coordinación y cooperación intersectorial permanente que permita el efectivo cumplimiento de las líneas de acción trazadas.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Policy/planning,Cultural heritage,Indigenous peoples,Social protection,Local government,Community management
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Small Claims Court Act, 2016 (No. 2 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act concerns establishment and jurisdiction of  small claims courts in Kenya and procedures of such courts. Pursuant to Article 6(3) of the Constitution, the Chief Justice shall, by notice in the Gazette, designate any Court station as a Small Claims Court with such geographical jurisdiction as may be specified in the notice. The Court shall be presided over by an   Adjudicator.  A claim shall not be brought before the Court if it is upon a dispute over a title to or possession of land, or employment and labour relations. In exercise of its jurisdiction under this Act the Court may, with the consent of the parties, adopt and implement any other appropriate means of dispute resolution.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa

Policy: Décret n° 2016-043/PR du 1er avril 2016 portant réglementation de la délivrance des actes d’urbanisme.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret détermine la procédure de délivrance des actes d’urbanisme. Ces actes sont constitués des décisions des autorités publiques compétentes qui autorisent la réalisation d’opérations immobilières (certificat d’urbanisme, du permis de construire, de la déclaration de travaux et du certificat de conformité) qui consacrent des règles d’urbanisme, de construction, d’hygiène, de protection de l’environnement, de l’habitat et de sécurité incendie.  En outre, Il organise un régime de répression des violations du règlement d’urbanisme. Il s’agit notamment des constructions ou de travaux non autorisés, de la non-conformité des ouvrages ou des travaux au dossier de permis de construire qui sont passibles des sanctions administratives d’une part et, d’autre part, des peines d’amende qui varient de 50 000 à 200 000 FCFA.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Ley Nº 30421 - Ley Marco de Telesalud.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley Marco de Telesalud, tiene el objeto de establecer los lineamientos generales para la implementación y desarrollo de la telesalud como una estrategia de prestación de servicios de salud, a fin de mejorar su eficiencia y calidad e incrementar su cobertura mediante el uso de tecnologías de la información y de la comunicación (TIC) en el sistema nacional de salud. El ámbito de la presente Ley comprende a todos los establecimientos de salud y servicios médicos de apoyo, públicos, privados y mixtos del sector salud. El Ministerio de Salud, en su calidad de ente rector del sector salud y de acuerdo a sus funciones, formula, planea, dirige, coordina, ejecuta, supervisa y evalúa la política nacional y sectorial de telesalud. Bajo dicho marco elabora el Plan Nacional de Telesalud. Asimismo, define los estándares de calidad de la provisión de los servicios de telesalud.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: National Strategy on Waste Management 2016-2030 and Action Plan 2016-2020
Policy_Content: The National Strategy on Waste Management 2016-2030 and Action Plan 2016-2020 is a national sectoral strategy and an action plan of Georgia. Its main objective is to strive to become a country prioritizing waste prevention and recycling.

Policy: Plan d'Action National des Energies Renouvelables de la Côte d'Ivoire (PANER) 2016-2020/2030
Policy_Content: La Politique des Energies Renouvelables de la CEDEAO (PERC) et la Politique en matière d’Efficacité Energétique de la CEDEAO (PEEC) ont été adoptées par les Etats membres de la CEDEAO en octobre 2012 et par les Chefs d'Etats de la CEDEAO le 18 juillet 2013. La PERC prévoit le développement des Plans d'Action Nationaux en matière d’Energies Renouvelables (PANER) par les quinze Etats membres de la CEDEAO à la fin de 2014. Les PANERs, dont la mise en oeuvre sera quinquenal, contribueront à la réussite des cibles établies par la PERC régionale pour 2020 et 2030. Le PERC prévoit 3 champs d'objectifs: objectifs pour les énergies renouvelables raccordés au réseau; objectifs pour les énergies renouvelables hors réseau; et d’énergie renouvelable pour les usages domestiques.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Energy, Forestry
Keyword: Agro-forestry,Energy conservation/energy production,Renewable energy,Fuelwood,Bioenergy,Biofuel,International agreement-implementation,Sustainable use,Forest management/forest conservation

Policy: Decreto Nº 543/2016 - Porcentaje obligatorio de Bioetanol.
Policy_Content: Mediante este Decreto se dispone incrementar a doce por ciento en volumen el porcentaje obligatorio de bioetanol en su mezcla con las naftas de uso automotor a comercializarse en todo el territorio nacional en el marco de las Leyes Nº 26.093 y 26.334, distribuyéndose el volumen de bioetanol equivalente a dicho incremento exclusivamente entre las empresas del sector sucro alcoholero del Noroeste Argentino.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.

Policy: Regional Law No. 10-4346 “On industrial policy”.
Policy_Content: Industrial production shall pertaining to the sphere of competence of this Regional Law shall be economic activities related to mining, energy generation, including natural gas extraction and supply, water abstraction, water supply and sewerage, waste management and recycling, and pollution control. This Regional Law regulates relations originating between subjects operating in the sphere of industry, regional and state bodies and local self-government in the process of formation and implementation of industrial policy. The tasks of industrial policy shall be as follows: (a) formation and development of modern industry; (b) stimulation of industrial activity; (c) introduction of ecofrienfly processes and resource saving technologies; (d) increase of industrial production output; (e) reduction of disaster risks; and ensuring technological independence of the regional economy.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen., Mineral resources, Water
Keyword: Ecofriendly products/ecofriendly processes,Energy conservation/energy production,Hydropower generation,Business/industry/corporations,Natural gas,Waste management,Recycling/reuse,Pollution control,Mining,Water abstraction,Water supply,Sewerage,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution

Policy: Regional Law No. 23-oz “On industrial policy”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations originating between subjects and organizations in the industrial sphere. Regional Government shall be responsible for conduct of innovative industrial policy, including research, ensuring public financial support and subsidies in the industrial sphere, in particular to engineering activity with specific purpose of improvement of environmental security of industrial processes, also through utilization of best available ecofriendly processes and technologies.

Policy: Decree No. 8.701 amending the National Council of Aquaculture and Fisheries (CONAPE).
Policy_Content: This Decree amends composition, duties and responsibilities of the National Council of Aquaculture and Fisheries (CONAPE). Amendments deal with administrative and legal proceedings of the above mentioned National Council (CONAPE), as a collegiate body of advisory nature, part of the basic structure of the Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock and Supply, created by Law 10.683 of 28 May 2003, entitled to propose public policy formulation, in order to promote the articulation and discussion of the different levels of government with organized civil society, for the development and promotion of the activities related to aquaculture and fisheries sector.

Article 7 shall be amended to add the following wording: “Transfer of plots of public or municipal land in ownership or tenancy for farming shall be performed in accordance with the modalities set forth by Land Code”.

Policy: Air Quality (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2016 (S.S.I No. 162 of 2016).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Air Quality (Scotland) Regulations in 2000 the table in the Schedule to the 2000 Regulations (the air quality objective table). The principal Regulations prescribe the relevant period for the purpose of Part 4 of the Environment Act 1995 and set the air quality objectives to be achieved. Part 4 requires local authorities in Scotland to review air quality within their areas. Such reviews must be accompanied by an assessment of whether air quality objectives are being achieved or are likely to be achieved within the relevant period.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 66 - Instructivo para la sustitución del spray oil producido por PETROECUADOR EP por el aceite agrícola o spray oil importado en el Ecuador.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo Interministerial emite el Instructivo para la sustitución del spray oil producido por PETROECUADOR EP por el aceite agrícola o spray oil importado en el Ecuador, cuyo objeto es regular las actividades de elaboración, importación, almacenamiento y comercialización de aceite agrícola o spray oil (que contenga hidrocarburos), para el control de la Sigatoka negra, que afecta a las musáceas en el territorio nacional. El Aceite Agrícola (Spray Oil) es u derivado del petróleo de características definidas que se utiliza en la agricultura para combatir las plagas que atacan plantaciones.

Policy: Procedimiento para la elaboración del Estudio de Posibilidad, Viabilidad y Utilidad (PVU) para la inscripción de un organismo cooperativo ante el Ministerio de Trabajo y Seguridad Social (MTSS).
Policy_Content: El Departamento de Promoción Cooperativa del Instituto Nacional de Fomento Cooperativo (INFOCOOP), aprueba el Procedimiento para la elaboración del Estudio de Posibilidad, Viabilidad y Utilidad (PVU) o estudio de factibilidad para la inscripción de un organismo cooperativo ante el Ministerio de Trabajo y Seguridad Social (MTSS), al fin de agilizar los trámites que deben cumplir las Asociaciones Cooperativas en formación para su inscripción y la autorización de la personería jurídica ante el MTSS. Policy_Content: This Notification aims at promoting producers to join the program regarding conservation of agricultural land in order to ensure environmental protection, soil conservation, water quality standards, sustainable use of natural resources, erosion prevention and mitigation of negative impacts on agriculture.

Policy: Kisii County Trade Credit Scheme Regulations, 2016 (L.N. No. 5 of 2015).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made under the Kisii County Trade Credit Scheme Act, 2015, provide for the procedure for receipt, processing and approval of applications for loans and granting of loans to applicants and set out the criteria for granting loans under the Act. The beneficiaries of the county trade credit scheme shall include- (a) county Small and medium enterprises (SMEs); (b) producer business groups; (c) agribusiness ventures; (d) entrepreneurs and start-ups; and (e) any other person who qualifies under the Act. The beneficiaries of the Scheme must be a member of the county trade credit Scheme.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa

Policy: Anti-corruption Act.
Policy_Content: This Act establish the national Anti-Corruption Commission and provides for related procedures, general functions and specific powers, all aimed for investigation, detection and prevention of different types of corrupt practices. This Commission shall be a self-governing, neutral and independent body and shall not be subject to the direction or control of any person or authority. Main functions of the Commission are specified in article 5.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Small Island Developing States
Entry into force notes: Published on 4 April 2016.

Policy: Regulation (2016: 349) on the Forest Agency's planning, monitoring and evaluation of supervision.
Policy_Content: This Regulation concerns planning, monitoring and evaluation of supervision by the National Forest Agency pursuant to the Forestry Law (1979: 429), the Law (2014: 1005) on timber measurement and the Law (2014: 1009) on trade in timber and timber products. As far as the Agency's supervision duties pursuant to the Environmental Code are concerned, provisions of the Environmental Supervision Regulation (2011: 13) shall apply. The  Agency shall make every three years an assessment of the supervisory needs for the Agency's area of responsibility. It shall also, for each financial year, establish a comprehensive supervisory plan that covers the Agency's area of responsibility. The Agency shall describe in the overall supervisory plan how the authority has balanced the distribution of resources within and between different areas of responsibility and how the resources have been adapted according to the existing supervisory needs.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Cabinet Resolution No. 886 of 2016.
Policy_Content: This Resolution consisting of 4 articles aims at preventing electricity theft and theft of water by illegal means in new urban communities or in areas located on agricultural lands. It establishes that the electricity companies, drinking water and sanitation companies, and other facilities-based entities shall take the necessary measures. To this end, the aforementioned companies have the right to use whatever technical means, i.e. installing temporary code meters, or the implementation of administrative rulings and decisions and without any legal rights for violators.
Subject: Energy, Water
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa, Red Sea  Gulf of Aden
Entry into force notes: This Resolution enters into force the day after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Regional Law No. 655-z “On municipal land control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the modalities of performance of municipal land control by local government. Municipal land control shall be conducted in the form of ordinary and extraordinary inspections of legal persona and individual entrepreneurs. The subject of inspection shall be checking data and information contained in the documentation related to land tenure. The scope of inspection shall be to control compliance by land tenant with compulsory legislative requirements related to land tenure. Municipal land control shall be performed in accordance with the annual plans. The outcome of municipal land control shall be legalized in the form of inspection certificate.

Policy: Federal Law No. 74-FZ amending Federal Law No.170-FZ of 1995 on use of nuclear energy.

Policy: Regulation No. 248 date 30.3.2016 removing and reducing the volume of certain forestry areas in the regions of Korca, Berat, and Fier from the public forestry and pasture fund.
Policy_Content: A public forestry area of 11.557 ha will be removed from the public forestry fund and will be used by the TAP AG company for the construction of the TAP Gas pipelines and specifically its 4A, 4B, and 5A sectors. This area will no longer be part of the National Cadastre of Forests and Pastures and a detailed map consisting of the removed and reduced areas is attached to the regulation. TAP AG is required to rehabilitate these areas according to the requirements of the environmental permits and fund the reforestation of 11.094  ha as designated by the Ministry of Environment.

Policy_Content: A public forestry area of 76.09 ha located at Fushe-Kruje, part of the forestry economy of “Kraste-Kruje” and composed of forestry parcels of 84a, 85a, 85b, 86/a, 87b, 88a, 89a dhe 94a will be removed from the public forestry fund and will be transferred to the ‘Victoria Invest’ Ltd for the exploitation of lime stones. The seventy six hectares will no longer be part of the National Cadastre of Forests and Pastures. Victoria Invest is required to rehabilitate these areas according to the requirements of the environmental permits and fund the reforestration of 228.26 ha as designated by the Ministry of Environment.

Policy: Resolution No. 271-r of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the National Action Plan for combating land degradation and desertification.
Policy_Content: This Resolution assigns to the competent governmental agencies elaboration and approval of legislative acts related to conservation of soil and improvement of soil fertility, indicators of soil quality, data and information collection related to land degradation, reform of the system of environmental monitoring, rates of afforestation for planting of protection forests with a view of soil protection against desertification and elaboration of water basin management system with drought management plans. The Ministry of Economy and other state executive bodies concerned shall be responsible for the development of draft resolutions of the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine on rates of qualitative condition of soils, on amendments to the procedure for collection, use, dissemination of information on desertification and land degradation and on establishment of the coordination council for combating land degradation and desertification. Resolution envisaged performance of the following arrangements: (a) landscaping of arable land by removing from this category slopes, land of water protection zones, erosion-hazardous and other types of land unsuitable for plowing; (b) acceleration of works on conservation of degraded, technogenic polluted and unproductive land, reclamation of disturbed lands; and (c) soil and agrochemical inspection and agrochemical certification of agricultural land plots.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Land & soil
Keyword: Policy/planning,Desertification,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Soil pollution/quality,Drainage/land reclamation,Certification,Monitoring,Access-to-information,Protection forest,Data collection/reporting

Policy: Regional Decree No. 65 “On municipal land control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes the modalities of performance of municipal land control by local government. Municipal land control shall be conducted in the form of ordinary and extraordinary inspections of legal persona and individual entrepreneurs. The subject of inspection shall be checking data and information contained in the documentation related to land tenure. The scope of inspection shall be to control compliance by land tenant with compulsory legislative requirements related to land tenure. Municipal land control shall be performed in accordance with the annual plans. The outcome of municipal land control shall be legalized in the form of inspection certificate.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Loi portant réorganisation de l’Administration de l’environnement.
Policy_Content: La présente loi porte réorganisation de l’Administration de l’environnement. Notamment, il est institué une Administration de l’environnement ayant pour mission de promouvoir de façon intégrée et d’assurer durablement et à un niveau élevé la protection de l’environnement et la qualité de vie de l’homme dans son environnement. L’article 2 établit que dans les limites fixées par les lois, l’administration a les attributions suivantes dans le domaine environnemental: 1) la sensibilisation, la formation, l’information et le conseil en matière d’environnement des différents acteurs de la société; 2) la promotion et la gestion des mécanismes à participation volontaire; 3) la détermination, le recensement, la description l’évaluation et le suivi de l’évolution de l’état de l’environnement et de l’impact des activités de l’homme sur l’environnement; 4) la conception, la promotion et la mise en œuvre de stratégies, de concepts, de plans et de programmes; 5) l’exécution de travaux de recherche, de projets et d’analyses; 6) la participation à l’élaboration des prescriptions légales, réglementaires et administratives; 7) la surveillance et le contrôle de l’application des prescriptions légales, réglementaires et administratives et l’exercice de la police y relative; 8) l’élaboration et la promotion des conditions d’exploitation des établissements et d’exécution d’activités en relation avec l’environnement en tenant compte des meilleures techniques et pratiques disponibles; 9) la mise en œuvre des textes législatifs et réglementaires nationaux et communautaires, y compris les procédures d’autorisation, de notification, d’agrément ou d’enregistrement; 10) la mise en œuvre d´action de prévention et de réparation de dommages à l´environnement, le cas échéant, en collaboration avec d’autres instances nationales et internationales compétentes en la matière; 11) la promotion de la qualité des différentes procédures, analyses et inventaires. Elle agit sans préjudice des attributions d’autres organes de l’Etat et des communes. Le texte comprend 9 articles.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Resolución Nº 34 - Plan Energético Nacional (PEN), 2015-2050, "Panamá el futuro que queremos".
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba el Plan Energético Nacional (PEN), 2015-2050, "Panamá el futuro que queremos". El PEN es un instrumento de planificación de la política energética del país, cuyos ejes a largo plazo se enmarcan en el acceso universal y reducción de la pobreza energética, la descarbonización de la matriz energética, la eficiencia energética, la sobriedad del consumo y la seguridad energética. El PEN traza los lineamientos generales y conceptuales del futuro energético en un ambiente de mercado, el cual ha sido consultado ampliamente con actores del sector público, sector privado y la sociedad civil, en el que se establecen acciones de política energética que el Estado debe adoptar, y que será implementado por el Gobierno de Panamá.
Subject: Energy
Keyword: Institution,Policy/planning,Energy conservation/energy production,Internal trade,Renewable energy,Environmental planning,Climate change,Oil

Policy: Resolución Nº 35 - Contribuciones Nacionalmente Determinadas (NDC) a la mitigación del cambio climático de la República de Panamá ante la Convención Marco de Naciones Unidas sobre el Cambio Climático (CMNUCC).
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba las Contribuciones Nacionalmente Determinadas (NDC) a la mitigación del cambio climático de la República de Panamá ante la Convención Marco de Naciones Unidas sobre el Cambio Climático (CMNUCC), que en detalle son: 1) Al 2050 el 30 por ciento de la capacidad instalada de la matriz eléctrica deberá provenir de tipos de fuentes de energía renovables no convencionales; 2) Al 2050 se incrementará la capacidad de absorción de carbono del sector Uso de Suelo, Cambio de Uso de Suelo y Silvicultura en un 10 por ciento con respecto al escenario tendencial de referencia como contribución unilateral y un incremento en la capacidad de absorción de carbono en un 80 por ciento con respecto al escenario tendencial de referencia como contribución apoyada, es decir, si se recibe apoyo financiero, fortalecimiento de capacidades, transferencia de tecnologías; 3) Se establecerá el Centro Internacional de Implementación para la Reducción de Emisiones por Deforestación y Degradación de los Bosques (ICIREDD); 4) Se donará al Fondo Verde del Clima (GCF) un monto de un millón de balboas.
Subject: Air & atmosphere

Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Ministerial Resolution No.20/2016 issuing the Regulations on Climate Change management.
Policy_Content: This Regulation consisting of 17 articles and 4 Annexes aims at entrusting the General Directorate of Climate Change at the Ministry of Environment and Climate Affairs to apply the provisions to the projects, listed in the attached Appendix B, which could effect on the environment and climate change. Main tasks of the Directorate are: (i) develop and implement regulations and decisions on climate change adaptation and mitigation; (ii) setting standards to be met; (iii) setting instructions; (iv) issue permits; (v) carry out emission reduction measures. The licensee is obligated to take the necessary mitigation measures (such as using highly efficient, less energy-consuming, and low-emission technologies during the design and operation of the project or facility; submitting a plan for afforestation of the project or facility area by selecting trees and plants appropriate to the local environmental conditions; using renewable energy sources) and adaptation measures (take into account the expected negative effects of climate changes on the project site, facility, or work area; take appropriate measures to reduce the effects of high temperatures, and apply water use efficiency requirements during periods of drought and scarcity of water resources) measures. The owner of any project, facility or work area listed in Appendix B shall obtain the license. The license lasts two years, possible to be renewed. The licensee is obliged to submit an annual report on GHG emissions. Existing projects shall be in accordance with the provisions of these Regulations within a period not exceeding 3 years. Annex 1 lists the Greenhouse gases; Annex 2 deals with the establishments and projects subject to licensing procedures; Annex 3 specifies the ranges of greenhouse gases; and Annex 4 indicates the financial fees for licenses.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Energy, Environment gen., Water, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Climate change,Authorization/permit,Emissions,Energy conservation/energy production,Renewable energy,Hazardous substances,Sustainable use,Water shortage/drought
Geographical_area: Indian Ocean, Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This Resolution enters into force the day after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Busia County Public Health Act, 2016 (No. 6 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act concerns the protection of public health in Busia County and lays down rules relative to, among other things, licensing and control of undertakings that sell food to the public, water supply, quality of drinking water, sanitation, protection of health from noxious articles (including animals) and protection of health generally. The Act requires a County Board of Health to be established. The function of the Board shall be to advise the Executive Committee Member upon all matters affecting public health, including, among other things, veterinary services and waste management. There shall be established a sub-county health in each sub-county.

Policy: Resolución Nº 045-2016-CONCYTEC ─ Reglamento del Registro Nacional Científico, Tecnológico y de Innovación Tecnológica (RENACYT).
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba el Reglamento del Registro Nacional Científico, Tecnológico y de Innovación Tecnológica (RENACYT), que tiene como objeto regular el proceso de inscripción en el RENACYT, de las personas naturales y jurídicas relacionadas con la ciencia, tecnología o innovación tecnológica (CTI), dentro del territorio nacional, así como de nacionales residentes en territorio extranjero. RENACYT hace parte del Sistema Nacional de Ciencia, Tecnología e Innovación Tecnológica (SINACYT), que es el conjunto de personas naturales y jurídicas del país dedicadas a la ciencia, tecnología e innovación tecnológica (CTI) y a su promoción. El Consejo Nacional de Ciencia, Tecnología e Innovación Tecnológica (CONCYTEC), es el organismo rector del SINACYT, encargado de normar, dirigir, orientar, fomentar, coordinar, supervisar y evaluar las acciones del Estado en el ámbito de la ciencia, tecnología e innovación tecnológica. Su presidente dirige el SINACYT y es el responsable de la Política Nacional de CTI.

Policy: Gujrat Waste to Energy Policy, 2016
Policy_Content: This Policy was created to handle the management of municipal solid waste and convert it into renewable energy. Policy: Kaduna Master Plan Law, 2016
Policy_Content: This Law is enacted to boost sustainable economic development of Kaduna State in it national, regional, state and city perspectives, enhance social development relating to poverty reduction, social well being, cohesion and equity, improve land administration which hinges on reform of physical planning and community participation in planning processes, etc. The Law gives the government the right to remove, modify, restructure or reconstruct any existing structure, building or facility so as to make it conform to the master plan. The Law vests power in the Kaduna State Urban Planning and Development Agency to ensure compliance with the master plan. The Master Plan is provided for in the schedule to the Law and the Law provides for the revision of the Master Plan every ten years.

Policy: Law “On protection, export and import of the objects of cultural heritage”.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates relations in the sphere of identification, conservation, management, promotion, public protection, import and export of the objects of cultural heritage thus ensuring the right of Turkmen people to conservation and development of its national identity. Objects of historical and cultural heritage shall be considered those created fifty and more years ago. The Cabinet of Ministers shall set forth rules and regulations concerning ownership, management and disposal of the object of historical and cultural heritage. The competent authority shall keep and update public register of the objects of historical and cultural heritage and shall enforce legislation dealing therewith. Identified objects of historical and cultural heritage shall be subject to mandatory public expertise.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Law “On protection of the atmospheric air”.
Policy_Content: This Law sets forth legal and organizational grounds for protection of the atmospheric air against emissions of pollutants and ensuring environmental security and prevention of negative impact of economic activities on human health and environments. Atmospheric air protection shall be based upon the following principles: (a) ensuring the right to favourable environment and public health protection; (b) public management and regulation of emissions; (c) introduction of eco-friendly and resource saving technologies and processes with a view of reduction of emissions to the atmospheric air; (d) rate setting for emissions; and (e) availability of and access to reliable information related to air quality.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Basic legislation,Ecofriendly products/ecofriendly processes,Emissions,Public health,Access-to-information,Pollution control,Environmental security
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Law No. 364-V “On ethics and official conduct of public servants.”
Policy_Content: This Law is aimed at increasing the requirements for moral and business qualities of a civil servant and establishes general ethical standards and rules of conduct for a civil servant for worthy implementation of his professional activity. Requirements for anti-corruption behavior of state employees shall be as follows: (a) civil servants should not allow actions (inaction), making it difficult for individuals and legal entities to exercise their rights and legitimate interests; (b) civil servants should not use their official powers and related opportunities to benefit from property or services of a non-property nature, other property rights; (c) civil servants in the performance of their official duties should not allow the personal interest of a civil servant, which leads or may lead to a conflict of interest. Civil servants should take measures to prevent conflicts of interest. In the event of a conflict of interest, a civil servant is obliged to take measures to prevent and resolve it, provided for legislation of Turkmenistan. A civil servant is obliged to resist manifestations of corruption, not to commit corruption-related offenses or acts, associated with corruption or creating conditions for corruption. State employees are obliged to notify executive management of the state body in which they work, the prosecutor's office or other state bodies about all cases of appeal to them by any persons in order to induce them to commit corruption-related offenses. Civil servants must suppress offenses related to corruption by other civil servants. A civil servant with reliable information about offense of corruption, must take the necessary measures to prevent and terminate such an offense, also by informing his/her immediate supervisor in writing, and also authorized state bodies. The head of a state body is obliged to take action on applications of a civil servant on corruption-related offenses, cases of persuading him/her to commit such offenses, also by organizing inspections and sending these appeals to authorized government bodies. The head of the state body is obliged to take measures to protect a civil servant reporting credible cases of corruption offenses, inducing him/her to commit such offenses, from persecution, infringing on his rights and legal interests. Upon presentation to a civil servant of an unjustified accusations of corruption, he/she has the right to take measures to refute it. State employee, endowed with organizational administrative powers in relation to other state employees is obliged to take measures to prevent corruption.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Law No. 363-V “On public service.”
Policy_Content: This Law defines the legal and organizational framework of civil service in Turkmenistan, conditions and procedure for implementation by citizens of Turkmenistan the right to civil service. Civil service is professional activity, carried out by civil servants for the execution of official powers aimed at the implementation of the tasks of state power. The civil service is responsible for the preparation of proposals regarding the implementation of public policy in the relevant areas, development or examination of draft regulatory legal acts, provision of administrative services, implementation of state control, state property management, personnel management of state bodies or their apparatus and other tasks directly related to the implementation of the powers of a state body. The concepts of "corruption", "offense related to corruption", "conflict of interest" and "personal interest of the state employee "in this Law are used in the meanings defined in the Law of Turkmenistan "On Combating Corruption". Civil servants in the performance of their official powers must comply with the requirements of the legislation of Turkmenistan in the field anti-corruption; monitor compliance with the legislation of Turkmenistan in the field anti-corruption, as well as prohibitions, restrictions and obligations, related to staying in the public service; and are subject to other requirements, prohibitions and restrictions established by the Law of Turkmenistan "On combating corruption ”.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Law amending Law "On state registration of rights to immovable property and transactions related thereto".
Policy_Content: Article 54 shall be amended to add the following wording: “For the state registration of the right to immovable property of persons,  owners, managers, leaseholders of immovable property establishing the title to such property as they own, dispose of, or which they rent, shall be considered: (a) decisions of head of local government on granting a land plot in ownership, lease, documents for the right to use land plots issued by State commissions on land issues in Turkmenistan; (b) state act on the right of ownership of the land plot, state act on the right to use the land, certificate on the right to lease of land; (c) resolution of head of local government (other documents issued in accordance with the legislation of Turkmenistan on the acceptance for use of residential housing facility or building (other real estate object); (d) inventory of immovable property prepared by the technical inventory body; (e) other documents issued in accordance with the legislation of Turkmenistan which was in force at the time of the origin of the right. If the above documents have been drawn up earlier, but actually are not available (lost, damaged and other cases), duplicates of these documents shall be issued; in the absence of the possibility of issuing duplicates, the new documents must be issued and registered by the institutions, after which relevant acts are issued in accordance with the legislation of Turkmenistan.”
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Law amending Law “On daihan (peasant) farm”.
Policy_Content: Article 4 shall be amended to add the following wording: “Daihan farm autonomously determines the direction of its activities, as well as solves other issues related to farming. The direction and volumes of production of the farm producing the products on the terms of lease shall be established by the lessor on the basis of the contract. When growing crops on the basis of the state order, the farm shall enjoy the privileges provided by the state. The products produced in excess of the contractual obligations of the daihan farm, including the lease farm, remains at its disposal and is sold autonomously at free prices.”

Policy: Ordonnance n° 2016-354 du 25 mars 2016 relative à l'articulation des procédures d'autorisation d'urbanisme avec diverses procédures relevant du code de l'environnement.
Policy_Content: Cette ordonnance s’inscrit dans le chantier de simplification des procédures administratives entrepris par le Gouvernement pour faciliter la vie des entreprises. Elle comporte deux parties.  La première renforce la coordination des procédures d’urbanisme, qui relèvent le plus souvent des collectivités territoriales, avec les autorisations environnementales, qui elles relèvent de l’Etat. Cette coordination permet aux maîtres d’ouvrage d’obtenir leur permis de construire pendant la durée d’instruction de la ou des autorisations environnementales (loi sur l’eau, dérogation espèces protégés…). Les travaux ne peuvent cependant être engagés que lorsque l’ensemble des autorisations ont été délivrées. L’ordonnance raccourcit les délais d’instruction des autorisations nécessaires à un même projet, et complète le décret du 9 juillet 2015 qui avait ramené, pour la grande majorité des cas, le délai de délivrance du permis à un maximum de 5 mois.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Environmental Permitting (England and Wales) (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations 2016 (S.I. No. 475 of 2016).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Environmental Permitting (England and Wales) Regulations 2010 (EPRs) in order to extend the requirement for an environmental permit to flood risk activities. The amendments: provide for relevant definitions; provide for exempt flood risk activities; make provision for permit applications to be granted subject to conditions relating to ongoing maintenance or access requirements by the regulator; extend to flood risk activities current flexibilities in the EPRs concerning the grant by the regulator of a permit covering various activities by a single operator; extend the current provisions in the EPRs on variation, transfer and surrender of environmental permits so that they provide for flood risk activities; make provision for appeals in relation to permits authorising flood risk activities; extend the current provisions in the EPRs on enforcement and offences relating to permits so that they provide for flood risk activities; grant power to arrange for steps to be taken to remove a risk of serious flooding, detrimental impact on drainage or harm to the environment.
Subject: Environment gen., Water

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 004-2016-PRODUCE ─ Reglamento del Decreto Legislativo Nº 1228, Ley de Centros de Innovación Productiva y Transferencia Tecnológica (CITE).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo tiene por objeto reglamentar la Ley de Centros de Innovación Productiva y Transferencia Tecnológica (CITE), desarrollando disposiciones que permitan mejorar la productividad y competitividad en sus respectivas cadenas productivas y de valor. Los CITE tienen por objeto contribuir a la mejora de la productividad y competitividad de las empresas, y los sectores productivos a través de actividades de capacitación y asistencia técnica; asesoría especializada para la adopción de nuevas tecnologías; transferencia tecnológica; investigación, desarrollo e innovación productiva y servicios tecnológicos, difusión de información; interrelación de actores estratégicos y generación de sinergias, bajo un enfoque de demanda, generando mayor valor en la transformación de los recursos, mejorando la oferta, productividad y calidad de los productos tanto para el mercado nacional como para el mercado externo, propiciando la diversificación productiva.

Policy: Order No. 94 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology of the Russian Federation validating the Regulation on the state nature reserve “Azas”.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that the state nature reserve “Azas” shall be located on the territory of the Republic of Tuva. It shall perform the following functions: (a) the protection of natural areas in order to conserve biological diversity and maintain in a natural state protected natural complexes and objects; (b) the organization and performance of scientific research, including keeping and updating of the Annals of Nature; (c) performance of state environmental monitoring; (d) environmental education and development of cognitive tourism; and (e) assistance in the training of scientific personnel and specialists in the field of environmental protection. On the territory of the reserve, any activity shall be prohibited any activity that contradicts the objectives of the state nature reserve and the regime for its special protection, including: (a) commercial, artisanal and sport hunting and fisheries;  (b) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, and hunting gear; (с) exploration of minerals and mining; (d) soil disturbance; (e) activities that entail changes in the hydrological regime of land; (f) procurement of soft resin; (g) clear cutting of forests; (h) timber extraction and harvesting of non-timber products; (i) transit passage and grazing of cattle; (j) plowing of land, with the exception of measures for forest firefighting; (k) haymaking, except for ensuring fire safety; (l) explosive works; (m) burning of vegetation and grassland fires, except for case of extinguishing forest fires; (n) water logging; (o) introduction of alien species; (p) transit and stay of motor vehicles; (q) stay with dogs, except for service dogs; (r) flight of aircraft and helicopters below 2000 meters above the territory of the reserve; and (s) disturbance and feeding of wild fauna species by the visitors.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Order No. 95 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology of the Russian Federation validating the Regulation on the state nature biosphere reserve “Darwin”.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that the state nature biosphere reserve “Darwin” shall be located in Yaroslavl region. It shall perform the following tasks: (a) the protection of natural areas in order to conserve biological diversity and maintain in a natural state protected natural complexes and objects; (b) the organization and performance of scientific research, including keeping and updating of the Annals of Nature; (c) performance of state environmental monitoring; (d) environmental education and development of cognitive tourism; and (e) assistance in the training of scientific personnel and specialists in the field of environmental protection. On the territory of the state nature biosphere reserve “Darwin” shall be prohibited the following activities: (a) commercial, artisanal and sport hunting; (b) commercial fisheries, and artisanal and sport fishing except for some exceptional cases; (c) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, and hunting gear; (d) exploration of minerals and mining; (e) soil disturbance; (f) activities that entail changes in the hydrological regime of land; (g) procurement of soft resin; (h) clear cutting of forests; (i) timber extraction and harvesting of non-timber products; (j) transit passage and grazing of cattle; (k) plowing of land, with the exception of measures for forest firefighting; (l) haymaking, except for ensuring fire safety; (m) explosive works; (n) burning of vegetation and grassland fires, except for case of extinguishing forest fires; (o) water logging; (p) introduction of alien species; (q) transit and stay of motor vehicles; (r) stay with dogs, except for service dogs; (s) flight of aircraft and helicopters below 2000 meters above the territory of the reserve; and (t) disturbance and feeding of wild fauna species by the visitors.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Resolution No. 138 of 2016 of Georgian Government on Rules for Carrying Out Public Safety Work, Types of Services and Fees Thereof by Emergency Management Agency
Policy_Content: This Resolution provides the rules for carrying out public safety work, types of services and fees thereof by the Emergency Management Agency of Georgia organized as a legal entity under public law within the system of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Georgia. It consists of five articles: General provisions (1); Definition of terms (2); Rules and terms for the payment of fees (3); Types, deadlines and fees for the services provided by the Agency (4); and Rules for refunding of paid fees (5). The services provided by the Agency include services in fire safety, prevention of and responding to disasters, responding to fires, and rescue services in waters.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 003-2016-PRODUCE ─ Reglamento del Decreto Legislativo Nº 1195, Ley general de Acuicultura.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo aprueba el Reglamento que tiene por objeto regular las disposiciones, criterios, procesos y procedimientos contenidos en la Ley General de Acuicultura, a fin de fomentar, desarrollar y regular la acuicultura, en sus diversas fases productivas en ambientes marinos, estuarinos y continentales, así como normar, orientar, promover y regular las actividades de acuicultura, fijando las condiciones, requisitos, derechos y obligaciones para su desarrollo sostenible en el territorio nacional. El presente Reglamento es de obligatorio cumplimiento a toda persona natural o jurídica, pública o privada, que realicen actividades de acuicultura en el territorio nacional; así como, actividades de poblamiento y repoblamiento en lo que corresponda.

Policy: Resolution No. 40/2016 approving the National Plan for Gender Equality 2015-2018 (NPGE).
Policy_Content: This Resolution approves the National Plan for Gender Equality 2015-2018 (NPGE). The National Plan, according to the Strategy for Growth and Poverty Reduction (PRSP III), provides the State of Cape Verde with a reference framework for the formulation and implementation of policies, programmes and strategic actions which contribute to the promotion of equal rights, effective and visible participation of women in all areas of social life contributing to their empowerment. The Plan, among other objectives, analyses the conceptual framework for gender equality, the demographic context, socio-economic and cultural development, the degree of gender prioritisation in national strategic planning, as well as the vision, objectives and principles of action, the results and the strategic measures, the institutional framework of intervention, coordination and partnership, as well as monitoring and evaluation and budget estimate.

Policy: Décret n°100/ 056 du 23 mars 2016 portant modification du décret n°100/ 193 du 29 juin 2012 portant création, composition, et fonctionnement du comité interministériel d’orientation et de pilotage de la politique nationale de décentralisation et du comité technique de suivi.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret qui modifie le décret n°100/193 du 29 juin 2012 portant création, composition, et fonctionnement du comité interministériel d’orientation et de pilotage de la politique nationale de décentralisation et du comité technique de suivi. Il crée un comité interministériel d’orientation et de pilotage de la politique nationale de décentralisation et du comité technique de suivi, et fixe sa composition, et son fonctionnement. Les missions assignées au CIOPD sont les suivantes: suivre l’état d'avancement du processus de décentralisation; définir les orientations stratégiques qui s'imposent pour la réalisation des objectifs tracés par la politique de décentralisation; veiller à la cohérence entre les politiques sectorielles et les objectifs de décentralisation jusqu'au transfert effectif des compétences et des ressources aux Communes; proposer toutes les mesures jugées adéquates pour l’amélioration de la mise en a:uvre du processus de la décentralisation; veiller à la cohérence entre la politique nationale de la décentralisation et les autres politiques sectorielles; analyser les rapports du Secrétariat Exécutif Permanent et y faire suite.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Environment and Planning Act.
Policy_Content: This Act reforms environmental law with special emphasis on planning. It seeks to modernise, harmonise and simplify current rules on land use planning, environmental protection, nature conservation, construction of buildings, protection of cultural heritage, water management, urban and rural redevelopment, development of major public and private works and mining and earth removal and integrate these rules into one legal framework.  Sustainable development is the key objective of the Act. It provides better means of integrated policy, greater usability and substantial simplification of environmental law. The Act introduces a new system creating a policy cycle in which continuous care for quality of the physical environment forms the focus and which creates scope for development. With this Act and the associated implementation regulations, the government aims to achieve four improvement goals: improving the transparency, predictability and ease of use of environmental law; achieving a coherent approach towards the physical environment in policy, decision-making and regulations; more administrative discretion by means of an active and flexible approach in order to achieve objectives for the physical living environment; improving and speeding up the decision-making with regard to projects in the physical environment.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil, Sea, Water

Policy: Law on Electricity and Drinking Water.
Policy_Content: This Act prohibits the production for distribution of electricity or drinking water, except for own use and in case of emergency, without an authorization of the Minister (The Minister for Economic Affairs and Climate for electricity and the minister of Infrastructure and Environment for drinking water). The authorization can be given to an operator for maximum 15 years and may be changed, or suspended by the Minister. The Act sets out the duties and obligations of producers and distributors of electricity or water. Authorizations may be changed when requirements of supply of water or electricity change and may be cancelled in case that a producer does not meet the conditions sets out in this Act or made under this Act.  A distributor of electricity or water must be appointed by the Minister. This appointment can also be changed or cancelled. Our Minister of Infrastructure and the Environment determines the main points and principles of the policy for the implementation of this Act for drinking water. This includes at least the production and distribution of drinking water and the security of a reliable and sustainable public drinking water supply. The act requires further regulation of measures in case drinking water does not meet quality standards as mentioned in this Act. The Act also provides for enforcement ad dispute resolution. The Authority for Consumers and Markets shall be the general supervisory body for purposes of this Act.
Subject: Energy, Water
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Order No. 6n of the Federal Agency of Scientific Organizations validating the Regulation on the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution the Polar-Alpine Botanical Garden-Institute named after N.A. Avrorin of the Kola Scientific Center of the Russian Academy of Sciences as protected natural area of federal significance.
Policy_Content: This Order validates the Regulation on the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution the Polar-Alpine Botanical Garden-Institute named after N.A. Avrorin of the Kola Scientific Center of the Russian Academy of Sciences (located in Murmansk region) as protected natural area of federal significance, defines tasks, scientific profile, the particulars of legal status, organizational structure, applicable special protection regime as protected natural area of federal significance. The main purpose of Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution the Polar-Alpine Botanical Garden-Institute named after N.A. Avrorin of the Kola Scientific Center of the Russian Academy of Sciences shall be performance of fundamental, exploratory and applied scientific research in the field of botany, ecology, forestry, nature conservation. Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution the Polar-Alpine Botanical Garden-Institute named after N.A. Avrorin of the Kola Scientific Center of the Russian Academy of Sciences shall perform the following tasks: (a) comprehensive study of plant and soil resources in the Arctic with the purpose of solving problems of their rational use, enrichment and protection; (b) development of theoretical foundations for the introduction and acclimatization of plants in the North; (c) development of theoretical foundations of greenery and landscape design in the North, including specialized educational, recreational and rehabilitation forms; (d) development of phytorehabilitation technology based on phyto-ecological and garden therapy; (e) development of technology for decorative and agricultural crop production, including biological plant protection in the North; (f) preservation of the diversity of native flora and introduced plants in northern conditions; (g) studying the mechanisms of stress and adaptation of plants and other components biota in northern conditions, including under anthropogenic impact on environment; (h) study of the genesis of northern soils, development of theoretical foundations for increasing their fertility; and (i) a comprehensive study of the sustainable interaction of biotic components of ecosystems in specific conditions of high latitudes.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Forestry
Keyword: Institution,Crops/grasses,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Research,Protected area,EIA,Education,Forest management/forest conservation,Recreational forest
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Order No. 7n of the Federal Agency of Scientific Organizations validating the Regulation on the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution "Stavropol Botanical Garden named after V.V. Skripchinsky" as protected natural area of federal significance.
Policy_Content: This Order validates the Regulation on the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution "Stavropol Botanical Garden named after V.V. Skripchinsky (located in Stavropol region) as protected natural area of federal significance, defines tasks, scientific profile, the particulars of legal status, organizational structure, applicable special protection regime as protected natural area of federal significance. The main purpose of the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution "Stavropol Botanical Garden named after VV Skripchinsky shall be performance of fundamental, exploratory and applied scientific research in the field of botany, ecology, forestry, nature conservation. Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution the Federal State Budgetary Scientific Institution "Stavropol Botanical Garden named after V.V. Skripchinsky shall perform the following tasks: (a) study of adaptive strategies, phytocenotic, ecological and chorological features of the vegetation cover of Stavropol region; (b) development of theoretical foundations and methods for preserving plant gene pool; (c) introduction of rare and economically valuable plant species in botanical gardens of Northern Caucasus; (d) development of effective methods for the introduction and selection of decorative plants in the climate of Northern Caucasus; (e) creation of special collections of plants in order to preserve biodiversity and enrichment of flora, preservation of natural environment and natural landscapes, preservation of the unique steppe massif of Stavropol steppes; (f) development of methods for environmental education; (g) popularization and propaganda of bioecological knowledge; (h) promoting the development of dendrolandscape and phytodesigner culture, medicinal and other plant growing in the region; (i) preservation in artificial conditions of collections of living plants (especially rare and endangered species) and other botanical species of great scientific, educational, economic and cultural value; (j)  research; and (k) conducting educational, pedagogical and scientific work in the fields of botany and nature protection, plant growing and selection, decorative gardening and landscape architecture.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Governor’s Decree No. 127 validating the Regulation on regional state supervision in the field of protection and use of protected natural areas of regional significance.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the procedure for the performance by the competent regional executive body regional state supervision in the field of protection and management of protected natural areas of regional significance. Regional state supervision is aimed at preventing, identification and suppression of violations by legal entities, managers thereof and other officials, individual entrepreneurs, their authorized representatives and natural persons, of requirements in the field of protection and use of protected natural territories established in accordance with the legislation of the Russian Federation, federal laws and other regulatory legal acts of the Russian Federation adopted in accordance with them, regional laws and other regulatory legal acts, through the organization and performance of inspections of these persons and control measures for special protected natural areas and in their protective zones, the adoption measures stipulated by the legislation of the Russian Federation for suppression and (or) elimination of the consequences of revealed violations, as well as systematic monitoring of compliance with mandatory requirements, analysis and forecasting of the status of compliance with mandatory requirements in the process of performance by legal entities, individual entrepreneurs and citizens of their activities. In particular, state supervision shall regard protection regime of protected natural areas and land tenure. Regional state supervision shall be performed by the Regional Ministry of Natural Resources.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Governor’s Decree enters into force the day after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Historic Environment (Wales) Act 2016 (2016 anaw 4).
Policy_Content: This Act makes amendments to the Ancient Monuments and Archaeological Areas Act 1979 and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 so as to provide for the protection of ancient monuments and historic buildings in Wales. It also provides for the establishment, constitution and functions of the Advisory Panel for the Welsh Historic Environment. The Welsh Ministers may enter into an agreement under this section (a “heritage partnership agreement”) with the owner of— (a) a scheduled monument situated in Wales; or (b) any land adjoining or in the vicinity of such a scheduled monument (“associated land”). Monuments may also be found in territorial waters.
Subject: Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Environment (Wales) Act 2016 (2016 anaw 3).
Policy_Content: This Act makes provision with respect to a wide variety of matters regarding the environment in Wales including: the sustainable management of natural resources (includes animals, plants and other organisms, air, water and soil) climate change and targets for reducing emissions of greenhouse gases from Wales;  collection and disposal of waste; shellfish fisheries; marine licensing; land drainage. It amends the Natural Resources Body for Wales (Establishment) Order 2012 so that sustainable management of natural resources becomes the core purpose of the Natural Resources Body for Wales and inserts sections 26B – 26D into the Flood and Water Management Act 2010 so as to, among other things, require the Welsh Ministers to establish the Flood and Coastal Erosion Committee. The Flood and Coastal Erosion Committee replaces Flood Risk Management Wales, the regional flood and coastal committee in Wales established under section 22 of the Flood and Water Management Act 2010.
