Policy: Public Private Partnership Policy (PPP) March 2016.
Policy_Content: The main objective of this Policy is to build a sustainable PPP market in Bhutan. Specifically it aims to: Facilitate and promote a structured, institutionalized and predictable approach to PPPs – establishing uniform procedures across various sectors, as follows: Ensure transparency in the structuring, procurement and implementation of PPP projects - ensuring fair and equal access in the award of PPP projects; Promote priority projects that are affordable to the Government and end-users and represent Value for Money; Encourage innovation in the provision of infrastructure and related service delivery; Clearly articulate accountability for outcomes. vi. Support the development of viable and feasible projects as PPPs that offer reasonable returns to the private sector, while protecting the Government from fiscal risks. The Royal Government will manage the fiscal risks, created by assuming certain responsibilities and obligations under PPP Agreements, within the Royal Government’s overall financial and budgetary framework; adding and improving capacities where needed.

Policy: National Strategy for Rural Water Supply, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH), WASH in Schools  and  WASH in Health Facilities.
Policy_Content: This National Strategy for Rural Water Supply, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH), in Schools and WASH in Health Facilities and the associated Investment Plan set out a roadmap to meet the needs of rural populations for water and sanitation services, eliminate open defecation and improve hygiene practices. The Strategy also addresses water, sanitation and hygiene in schools encompassing high schools, health facilities and township hospitals. The Strategy and the Investment Plan will contribute towards the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals for Myanmar by 2030. One major change in approach proposed by the Strategy is a move from providing water supply and sanitation systems through time-bound projects for infrastructure, to operation of WASH as services without time limit. The emphasis is on operation, sustainability and recurrent cost financing of services that people want and can afford to pay for. Principles and factors that are taken into account in the Strategy include, among other things, sustainability, monitoring and management of information, disaster risk reduction and climate change, cost sharing for water supply, decentralization and de-concentration of service provision and management, accountability and transparency, and mainstreaming gender.

Policy: Regulation on the manner of performing activities through cooperation services with agricultural associations for irrigation of agricultural surfaces with the use of irrigation systems on the basis of a previously concluded agreement with a competent subject for performance of water economic activity.
Policy_Content: This Regulation determines the manner of performing activities through cooperation as regards the performance of services by agricultural cooperative for irrigation of agricultural land through the use of irrigation systems based on previously concluded agreement with a competent entity for performing water management activity.  The contract with a competent entity for performing water management activity is concluded for the use and maintenance of a specific hydro-reclamation unit. For irrigation of the hydro-ameliorative unit, the Agricultural Cooperative performs the following tasks: procurement of irrigation water; distribution of water for irrigation of members and non-members of the cooperative within a hydraulic unit on the basis of an agreement; maintenance of irrigation infrastructure; determining the amount of the irrigation fee and its collection.

Policy: Fiji Livestock Sector Strategy 2016.
Policy_Content: The Livestock Sector Strategy is a national policy with a cross-sectoral approach. The goals of this Strategy are: (I) sustainable growth, expansion and diversification of the livestock sector; (II) promotion of innovation within the sector; (III) close public-private collaboration amongst stakeholders; (IV) development of the livestock sector to meet the needs of the present and future generations; and (V) maximization the economic return of the livestock sector in Fiji’s economy.

Policy: Strategic Plan for Agricultural Development 2017-2020, emanating from the Quarter-century Strategy.
Policy_Content: This Strategic Plan for Agricultural Development is a nationwide inter-sectoral document aiming at promoting efforts to modernize agriculture and develop its productive and competitive capacity, as well as develop and maintain natural resources and preserve the environment for the current and future generations in an integrated framework. The main goal of the Strategic Plan is to transform the agricultural sector into a dynamic sector capable of sustainable growth at a rate of not less than 6% annually, and that enables the use of agricultural resources to achieve food security and provide a decent life for workers in the agricultural sector, by moving from a focus on production only to a comprehensive view of the value-added chain. To achieve the aforementioned overall goal a number of strategic objectives are set out, they are (i) increase in production and productivity; (ii) food security; (iii) increase in exports and replacing imports; (iv) poverty reduction by increasing farm income and generating employment; (v) developmental balance; and (vi) protection of natural resources.

Policy: Decreto Nº 950 - Reglamento a la Ley del Sistema Nacional de Registro de Datos Públicos.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto aprueba el Reglamento a la Ley del Sistema Nacional de Registro de Datos Públicos, que tiene por objeto desarrollar y aplicar las disposiciones previstas en la Ley Orgánica del Sistema Nacional de Registro de Datos Públicos, que crea y establece las normas de funcionamiento y operación del Sistema Nacional de Registro de Datos Públicos, y es de cumplimiento obligatorio para las instituciones públicas y privadas que actualmente o en el futuro administren registros o bases de datos públicos sobre las personas naturales o jurídicas, sus bienes o patrimonio y los usuarios de los registros o bases de datos públicos del país y los que consten en los consulados del Ecuador en el extranjero. Policy: National REDD+ Consultation and Participation Plan, 2016.
Policy_Content: The Plan is made on the background that the current trend of climate change leads to significant economic loss in countries whose economy is mainly dependent on climate sensitive activities, particularly agriculture. The overall objective of this Plan is to provide a framework and platform for multilevel dialogue among all stakeholders to ensure ownership, transparency, effective and informed consultation and participation of the relevant stakeholders in the process of REDD+ Programme in Ethiopia. The specific objectives of the consultation and participation plan are to: i)	Guide dialogue and access to information among stakeholders (governments-all levels, communities, civil societies/NGOs, implementing agencies) to ensure their engagement in the programme from the design to implementation and monitoring phases; ii)	Ensure that REDD+ activities and implementation frameworks are informed by local stakeholder’s views and contributions by providing opportunity through which the voices and experiences of key stakeholders are captured and incorporated in decision making at all levels;  iii)	Ensure transparency in all aspects including in costs, risks and equitable access and share of benefits by all stakeholders and sectors at all levels; iv)	Improve the quality of decision-making process by capturing the experience of civil society organizations, and the initiatives of other similar groups; v)	Integrate the contribution of REDD+ to the national development priorities by guiding development of regulatory frameworks that are socially inclusive, transparent and support improvements in forest governance; and  vi)	 Comply with the international laws on human rights and other relevant policies on social and environmental safeguards. Furthermore, the design and implementation of the Plan is guided by the following core principles; i.	Inclusiveness: target a broad audience of stakeholders both at national, regional (state) and local levels including those which are directly or indirectly affected by REDD+ activities (various social groups such as disadvantaged groups, women and youth); ii.	Transparency: all aspects of the Programme at all stages shall be discussed and communicated in a transparent manner to all stakeholders at all levels. The outcomes of all consultations and participation shall be properly recorded and reported, disclosed to the public timely in culturally appropriate form and languages. All stakeholders shall have full and equal access to all information about the programme; iii.	Participatory: the programme shall involve stakeholders in a truly participatory manner. It shall incorporate voices and concerns of all stakeholders at all stages of decision making processes from design to  the implementation phase of the programme taking into consideration the existing participatory platforms, on-going interventions and earlier C&P initiatives conducted during R-PP formulation (if any); iv.	Consensus building: the process shall facilitate dialogue and two-way exchange of information taking into consideration all the views of community level stakeholders, their existing institutional structures, and cultural diversity, with the ultimate aim of building consensus and broad community support for the programme; v.	Flexibility: the program implementation should learn by doing, and be flexible enough to incorporate new ideas, approaches and stakeholders as they emerge and found necessary to include; vi.	Effective communication: Information shall be tailor made for specific audience/stakeholders and shall follow a robust communication strategy, with a clear feedback mechanism; and vii.	Grievance and conflict resolution: the programme shall have mechanisms for stakeholders to reflect their concerns and grievances at any time and be heard. Any conflict arising in the process of implementing the programme shall also be resolved and redressed immediately using an established and transparent system. The Plan also understands that stakeholder engagement is crucial for the sustainability of policy, strategy, program and project design and implementation. The Plan identifies the stakeholders and their roles, and some of these stakeholders include, sectoral government institutions at various levels, private sector, academic research, communities, etc.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry

Policy: Plan for people’s health protection, care and promotion 2016-2020.
Policy_Content: The overall objectives of the Plan for people’s health protection, care and promotion 2016-2020 aims: to reduce mortality rates caused by diseases and epidemics; to contribute to improving people’s life expectancy and core health indicators; to enhance performance of the health system, to create a solid foundation for the development of an equitable, effective, quality and sustainable health system. Its specific objectives are: implement universal health coverage (UHC), ensuring access to basic and quality health care services; prevent occurrence of major epidemics; to gradually control health hazards related to the environment, food safety, lifestyle and behaviors of people; improve quality and effectiveness of service delivery network; ensure collaboration, linkage and integration among levels of care, among health care services (PHC); reduce overcrowding in hospitals; promote the leading roles of intensive health facilities in the transfer of techniques and support to the entire service delivery network; modernize and develop traditional medicine, and combine traditional medicine with modern medicine; maintain a reasonably low fertility rate; meet the needs for family planning services of the people; increase access to quality reproductive health care services; develop health care in poor, mountainous, remote areas and to have preferential treatment in health care for poor people and beneficiaries of social policies, etc.

Policy: Onshore Hydraulic Fracturing (Protected Areas) Regulations 2016 (S.I. No. 384 of 2016).
Policy_Content: These Regulations are made under sections 4B Petroleum Act 1998. They define the terms “protected groundwater source areas” and “other protected areas” for the purposes of section 4A of the Petroleum Act 1998 In these Regulations, “groundwater” has the same meaning as in the Environmental Permitting (England and Wales) Regulations 2010. Sections 4A and 4B of the 1998 Act are inserted by the Infrastructure Act 2015 (c.7) and set out certain requirements and safeguards in relation to onshore hydraulic fracturing in England and Wales. Column one of the table in section 4A sets out conditions which must be met before the Secretary of State may issue a hydraulic fracturing consent. Specifically, conditions 5 and 6 provide that associated hydraulic fracturing is not to take place in “protected groundwater source areas” or “other protected areas”.

Policy: Law No. 15.725 establishing standards and guidelines for the control of air quality within the State of Pernambuco.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 26 articles and two Annexes, establishes standards and guidelines for the control of air quality within the State of Pernambuco, prescribing that any form of emission of atmospheric pollutants above the limits stipulated in the legislation is prohibited. It establishes as a principle that potentially polluting activities released in the air must adopt the use of technologies, inputs and energy sources that avoid the generation of atmospheric pollutants, minimizing emissions compared with conventional processes. The release into the atmosphere of any type and form of matter or energy that may cause air pollution, under the terms of the law, is prohibited. Open burning of solid, liquid or other combustible materials is prohibited, provided that they cause degradation of the environmental quality, except with prior authorization from a state environmental agency, or in emergency health situations defined by the Health Department or by the Secretariat of Agriculture and Agrarian Reform. The installation and use of incinerators of any kind in residential or building buildings, as well as in residential areas, is prohibited. The installation of incinerators in other areas is subject to environmental licensing.

Policy: Food and Agricultural Products Classification Act ([SBC 2016] Chapter 1).
Policy_Content: The present Act establishes that by the beginning of 2018, producers, processors and handlers of organic food and beverage products, including farm gate sales, farmers markets and retail stores, will require documentation verifying their products have accredited organic certification. The transition time to September 2018 allows non-certified producers who wish to continue to market their products as “organic” time to complete the certification process. The text consists of 60 sections divided into 7 Parts as follows: Interpretation and application (1); Programmes and protected labels (2); Compliance and enforcement (3); Ministerial powers (4); Contraventions (5); Regulations (6); Transitional Provision, Repeals and Consequential and Related Amendments (7).

Policy: Decreto Nº 326 - Ley de la Juventud del Estado de Aguascalientes.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto establecer, fomentar y garantizar el ejercicio de los derechos de los jóvenes así como definir las políticas públicas dirigidas a la juventud. Entre los derechos reconocidos, se establece que los jóvenes tienen derecho a un sano desarrollo integral. En las acciones que se ejecuten dentro de este marco se dará atención prioritaria a los jóvenes que sufran alguna clase de pobreza según los lineamientos y criterios establecidos por el Consejo Nacional de Evaluación de la Política de Desarrollo Social. Otra de las acciones contempladas se refiere a promover entre los jóvenes, por medio del sistema educativo estatal, el respeto y la preservación del medio ambiente aprovechando de manera racional los recursos naturales.

Policy: National Integrated Water Resource Management Plan (NWIRMP).
Policy_Content: The overall goal of the Plan is to establish the framework and priorities for the implementation of integrated water resources management in Bhutan. The Plan is based on a comprehensive assessment of the current situation and future prospects in light of growing water demands and the threats arising from climate change. It establishes the principles and mechanisms under which agencies involved in the water sector together with river basin stakeholders, can coordinate their respective plans and activities, as well as collectively monitor progress toward attainment of Integrated Water Resource Management (IWRM) objectives. Therefore, the Plan serves as foundation for water resource stakeholders to work together to achieve a common goal of ensuring Bhutan’s water security. Water security, as explained in the Plan, is the capacity to provide sufficient and sustainable quantity and quality of water for all types of water needs and services, and to protect people from water-related disasters. Indicators of water security have been formulated for five key dimensions of water security: household water security, urban water security, economic water security, environmental water security, and security from adverse effects of climate change and natural disasters. These indicators are to be used as a means to coordinate agency plans, and to assess progress in achieving the objectives of IWRM.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Water

Policy: Regulation on the National Social Security Fund.
Policy_Content: This Regulation is enacted in accordance with the Social Insurance Law of the People's Republic of China, aiming at regulating the management and operation of the national social security fund, strengthening the supervision of the national social security fund, and realizing fund maintenance and appreciation under the premise of ensuring safety. The Regulation consists of 5 Chapters: General Provisions; Management and Operation of the National Social Security Fund; Supervision of the National Social Security Fund; Legal Liabilities; Supplementary Provisions.

Policy: Cantonal Forestry Law
Policy_Content: Obwalden’s cantonal forestry law is an implementation of Switzerland’s federal forestry ordinance and federal forestry law. It contains sections on purpose of the law and explains the functions of various councils and departments involved (cantonal council, government council, construction and spatial development department and office for forest and landscape). Further covered are the subjects on protection of the forest area (for instance through deforestation), as well as protection of the forest area from natural catastrophes. The law includes further maintenance and use of the forest, forest financing, organizational procedures as well as prosecution and restoration.

Policy: Kilifi County Micro Finance Fund Act, 2016 (No. 12 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Act establishes the Kilifi County Micro Finance Fund and the Kilifi County Micro Finance Fund Board and defines the purpose of the Fund and functions and powers the Board. The Fund shall provide seed capital for micro and small enterprises within Kilifi, for their business development and linkages to market and in accordance with article 207 (4) (b) of the Constitution and section 16 of the Public Finance Management Act. There shall be established a Micro Finance Fund Committee in every Sub-County. Those committees shall receive, verify, reject or approve applications for financing.

Policy: Regional Law No. 3800/1038-V-OZ “On industrial policy”.
Policy_Content: Industrial production shall pertaining to the sphere of competence of this Regional Law shall be economic activities related to mining, energy generation, including natural gas extraction and supply, water abstraction, water supply and sewerage, waste management and recycling, and pollution control. This Regional Law regulates relations originating between subjects operating in the sphere of industry, regional and state bodies and local self-government in the process of formation and implementation of industrial policy. The tasks of industrial policy shall be as follows: (a) formation and development of modern industry; (b) stimulation of industrial activity; (c) introduction of ecofrienfly processes and resource saving technologies; (d) increase of industrial production output; (e) reduction of disaster risks; and ensuring technological independence of the regional economy.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen., Mineral resources, Water

Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree authorizes performance of activities causing negative environmental impact until 1 January 2020 in the absence of complex environmental permits but in accordance with separate permits for emissions to the atmospheric air, special water management permits and permits for non-domestic waste storage and disposal issued prior to 1 January 2016 .

Policy: Resolución Nº 054-2016-OS ─ Condiciones Generales del Servicio de Distribución de Gas Natural y de la Aplicación de las Tarifas al Usuario Final.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba la Condiciones Generales del Servicio de Distribución de Gas Natural y de la Aplicación de las Tarifas al Usuario Final, que tiene por objeto principal establecer las condiciones generales de aplicación de las tarifas del servicio de gas natural al consumidor final, poniendo énfasis en los criterios generales a los cuales deben ir adecuándose la aplicación tarifaria y la prestación del servicio en dichas concesiones, a efectos de tener homogeneidad. Asimismo, busca brindar información exhaustiva al consumidor respecto a la prestación del servicio, consolidando lo regulado en diversas normas y contratos de concesión. La prestación del servicio de distribución es la relación que existe entre el Consumidor y el Concesionario.

Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates some issues in the sphere of protection of the population and territory against natural and technological disasters. The main purposes shall be set forth as follows: (a) prevention of the outbreak of natural and technological disasters; (b) reduction of damages in case of the outbreak of natural and technological disasters; and (c) mitigation of the consequences of natural and technological disasters. Policy: Regulation No. 180 date 9.3.2016 determining the minimum quantities of biofuels and other renewable fuels to be used in the transportation sector during the year 2016.
Policy_Content: The Regulation sets forth the minimum quantities of biofuels and other renewable fuels to be used in the transportation sector during 2016. The wholesale companies that possess type A licensing are obligated to offer renewable fuels and biofuels at a minimum of 10% of the total amount of their fuel supply. The state entity responsible for enforcement is the Industrial and Technical State Inspectorate. Penalties used in case of infringements are those stipulated by article 25 of Law 8450 of 1999 regulating processing, transporting and trading of oil, gas and their by-products.

La metodología de codificación es aplicable a los títulos habilitantes y a los actos administrativos que se otorguen a partir de su entrada en vigencia o a aquellos que, habiendo sido otorgados con anterioridad a la presente metodología, tramiten su renovación. La metodología de codificación de títulos habilitantes y actos administrativos es única y tiene vigencia a nivel nacional, siendo de obligatorio cumplimiento.

Policy: Law No. 5.624 providing for tree planting against the sale of a new car within the Federal District.
Policy_Content: This Law provides for tree planting against the sale of a new car within the Federal District. It establishes the obligation for all concessionaires and automobile stores to plant tree saplings for each car sold within the Federal District. The Brasília Environmental Institute (IBRAM) will indicate the nearest conservation area for complying with the provisions above established. Expenses for the execution of these provisions are borne by the concessionaires and the car sales stores.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.

Policy: Ley N° 786, de 09 de marzo de 2016 - Ley de Plan de Desarrollo Económico y Social 2016 - 2020.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto aprobar el Plan de Desarrollo Económico y Social 2016-2020, establecer la obligatoriedad de su aplicación y los mecanismos de coordinación, evaluación y seguimiento. Se aprueba así el Plan de Desarrollo Económico y Social 2016-2020, en el Marco del DesarrolloIntegral para Vivir Bien, cuyo contenido se formula a partir de los trece (13) pilares de la Agenda Patriótica del Bicentenario 2025, que se constituye en el Plan General de Desarrollo establecido en el numeral 9 del Artículo 316 de la Constitución Política del Estado. El documento designa al Ministerio de Planificación del Desarrollo como responsable de la coordinación, evaluación y seguimiento del Plan, siendo éste de ejecución y aplicación obligatoria para el Tribunal Constitutional Plurinacional, Universidades Públicas, Instituciones de Control y Defensa de la Sociedad y del Estado y  Órganos legislativo, ejecutivo, judicial y electoral. Además, los Planes Sectoriales, Multisectoriales, Estratégicos Ministeriales, Estratégicos Institucionales, de Empresas Públicas y otros en el marco de la Ley N° 777 del Sistema de Planificación Integral del Estado deberán ser elaborados o adecuados al Plan de Desarrollo Económico y Social 2016-2020, en un plazo máximo de ciento veinte (120) días.

Policy: Assessment of Energy Performance of Non-domestic Buildings (Scotland) Regulations 2016 (S.S.I. No. 146 of 2010).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made under section 63 of the Climate Change (Scotland) Act 2009 make provision for the assessment of the energy performance of non-domestic buildings and of the emission of greenhouse gases from such buildings. They also provide for the circumstances in which the owners of non-domestic buildings are required to take steps to improve the energy performance of such buildings and reduce such emissions. The Regulations provide for the making of an action plan containing a programme for the implementation of measures to— (a) improve the energy performance of the building or building unit; (b) reduce emissions of greenhouse gases produced by or otherwise associated with that building or building unit.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Energy

Policy: Air Pollution Act (Marketing, Sale, Distribution and Burning of Specified Fuels) (Amendment) Regulations 2016 (S.I. No. 128 of 2016).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Air Pollution Act (Marketing, Sale, Distribution and Burning of Specified Fuels) Regulations 2012 to provide for the identification of ‘low smoke’ biomass blend fuels and; the marking to be applied to packaging of these fuels and; the records to be kept by suppliers of biomass products. They also provide for the verification of low smoke biomass products and other low smoke solid fuel products, permitted for sale in Low Smoke Zones, through a requirement to hold a Certificate of Conformity.

Policy: Decree No. 20.627 creating the Environmental Regularization Programme for Rural Properties of the State of Rondônia (PRA).
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 9 Chapters, creates the Environmental Regularization Programme for Rural Properties of the State of Rondônia (PRA). It establishes the above mentioned Environmental Programme referred to in art. 59 of the Federal Law 126.51 of 25 May 2012, aiming to promote environmental regularization of rural properties with environmental degradation relating to the Permanent Preservation, Legal Reserves and Restricted Use Areas. PRA instruments are the following: Rural Environmental Registry - CAR; Commitment Agreement Term; Rehabilitation Project for Degraded Areas - PRADA; and  Environmental Reserve Quota - CRA.

Policy: Decreto Nº 7 - Establece tabla de costos para el año 2016, que fija los valores de las actividades que se bonificarán en el marco del sistema de incentivo para sustentabilidad agroambiental de los suelos agropecuarios.
Policy_Content: Este Decreto contiene la Tabla de Costos que establece, para el año 2016, los valores de las actividades que se bonificarán en el marco del Sistema de Incentivos para la Sustentabilidad Agroambiental de los Suelos Agropecuarios, las especificaciones técnicas generales y los niveles mínimos técnicos de las prácticas que correspondan. Se contemplan las siguientes prácticas de recuperación y mantención: a) incorporación de fertilizantes de base fosforada; b) incorporación de elementos químicos esenciales; c) establecimiento de una cubierta vegetal en suelos descubiertos o con cobertura deteriorada; d) empleo de métodos de intervención del suelo, entre otros rotación de cultivos, orientados a evitar su pérdida y erosión, y a favorecer su conservación ; e) eliminación, limpieza o confinamiento de impedimentos físicos.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 5-2016 ─ Plan de Manejo del Parque Nacional Azul Meámbar (PANACAM), para el período 2016-2027.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo aprueba el Plan de Manejo del Parque Nacional Azul Meámbar (PANACAM), para el período 2016-2027. El Parque PANACAM tiene una superficie de 31,339.08 hectáreas. El Plan de Manejo tiene como visión ser un modelo de conservación y manejo, garantizando la biodiversidad, salud de los ecosistemas, calidad y cantidad de agua, atractivos naturales turísticos y un desarrollo económico sostenible de las poblaciones, contribuyendo a mejorar la calidad de vida de las personas e integridad ecológica del área y uno de los principales aportadores del recurso hídrico para la generación de energía a nivel nacional y consumo humano local.

Policy: Decreto Nº 2.265 - Crea la Comisión Presidencial de Desarrollo Ecosocialista y Salvaguarda de los Derechos de los Pueblos Indígenas en la Actividad Minera.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto crea, con carácter permanente, la Comisión Presidencial de Desarrollo Ecosocialista y Salvaguarda de los Derechos de los Pueblos Indígenas en la Actividad Minera, que tendrá por objeto asesorar al Presidente de la República y demás órganos del Ejecutivo Nacional en la toma de decisiones estratégicas vinculadas con la preservación de las áreas de especial importancia ecológica y de las aguas, para el desarrollo armónico de la actividad minera, garantizando que el aprovechamiento de las potencialidades de los recursos minerales se efectúe sin lesionar la diversidad biológica de esos territorios, integrando y articulando la cultura, tradiciones y costumbres ancestrales de los actores que hacen vida en estos espacios, con especial atención a los pueblos y comunidades indígenas.

Policy: Order No. 342 on Denmark-Germany cooperation for the protection of waterbodies.
Policy_Content: This Order sets out rules on the cooperation between Danish and German (Schleswig-Holstein) water planning authorities on the protection of surface and groundwater in the international river basin district. These are defined as river basins and include the cross-border catchment areas for the watercourses Vidå, Kruså, Meden Å and Jardelund Grøft as well as the coastal area south of Vidås estuary in the Wadden Sea. The aim of such cooperation between the two countries is to establish significant water management plans and policies for the protection from groundwater pollution and deterioration.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Pollution control,Environmental planning,Groundwater,Surface water,International relations/cooperation,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution

Policy: Decreto Nº 3 - Reglamenta el otorgamiento de subsidios estatales.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto reglamenta el otorgamiento de los Subsidios Estatales, entendiéndose como subsidio la cantidad de dinero que otorga el Estado a las organizaciones sin fines de lucro debidamente inscritas y reconocidas, así como también a las personas naturales. Los subsidios se otorgan para la ejecución de programas y/o proyectos sociales. Para los efectos del presente Decreto entiéndase al Ministerio de Desarrollo Social como Ente Rector. E Agente Responsable de la Ejecución del Proyecto (AREP), es el agente social cuyos proyectos resulten elegidos de acuerdo a las normas legales aplicables y que suscriba el instrumento jurídico correspondiente. Se crea la Oficina Nacional de Administración de Subsidios Estatales (ONASE), adscrita al Despacho Superior del Ministerio de Desarrollo Social, como ente rector de los subsidios estatales. Se crea el Fondo Especial de Subsidio, de carácter reembolsable al Tesoro Nacional, sometido a la fiscalización y control de la Contraloría General de la República, el cual permitirá a los Subsidiados cobrar los subsidios otorgados en el Departamento de Tesorería del Ente Rector. La ONASE determinará el monto mínimo y máximo que podrá otorgarse a todo proyecto y el tiempo en que podrá otorgarse a todo proyecto que pretenda desarrollar cada uno de los actores sociales.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Less favoured areas,Institution,Social protection,Poverty,Subsidy/incentive,Non-governmental entity,Community management,Special fund

Policy: Unauthorised Deposit of Waste (Fixed Penalties) Regulations 2016 (S.I. No. 334 of 2016).
Policy_Content: These Regulation amend, for England, Part 2 of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 so as to insert a new section (33ZA) on fixed penalty notices for contravention of section 33(1)(a) of the Act. The new section allows a waste collection authority in England to issue a fixed penalty notice for a contravention of section 33(1)(a) of the Act. Section 33(1)(a) prohibits a person from depositing controlled waste or extractive waste in or on any land unless in accordance with an environmental permit.

Policy: Resolución Nº 052-2016-MIDIS ─ Manual de Metodología para la Reevaluación de la Clasificación Socioeconómica.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba el Manual denominado Metodología para la Reevaluación de la Clasificación Socioeconómica, disponiendo que será de aplicación únicamente para las nuevas reevaluaciones de clasificación socioeconómica, así como a aquellas que se encuentren en trámite.

Policy: Décret n°2016-0131 P-RM du 7 mars 2016 fixant les attributions spécifiques des membres du gouvernement.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe les attributions spécifiques des membres du Gouvernement. Les ministres exercent, chacun, leurs attributions spécifiques en concertation avec les ministres qui en sont concernés ou intéressés. Ces concertations doivent être menées avant la saisine du Secrétariat général du Gouvernement des projets de texte ou de documents de politique nationale. Le ministre de l’Aménagement du Territoire et de la Population prépare et met en œuvre la politique nationale dans les domaines de l’aménagement du territoire, de la population et des statistiques.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Energy, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Fisheries, Forestry, Land & soil, Mineral resources, Cultivated plants, Water, Wild species & ecosystems, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Resolución Nº 40.245 - Reglamento técnico para cilindros y tanques estacionarios utilizados en la prestación del servicio público domiciliario de gas licuado de petróleo (GLP) y sus procesos de mantenimiento.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución expide el reglamento técnico que deben cumplir los cilindros y tanques estacionarios utilizados en la prestación del servicio público domiciliario de gas licuado de petróleo (GLP) que se fabriquen o importen para ser usados en Colombia, y sus procesos de mantenimiento, en orden a que sus condiciones de operación garanticen la calidad y la seguridad de los usuarios y de la comunidad en general.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Resolución Nº 40.246 - Reglamento técnico aplicable al recibo, almacenamiento y distribución de Gas Licuado de Petróleo (GLP).
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución dicta el reglamento técnico aplicable al recibo, almacenamiento y distribución de Gas Licuado de Petróleo (GLP), que tiene por objeto establecer normas de carácter técnico para el desarrollo seguro de las actividades de recibo, almacenamiento y distribución de GLP, mediante la operación de las instalaciones destinadas para ello. Las disposiciones son de obligatorio cumplimiento para: las plantas de almacenamiento, las plantas de almacenamiento de respaldo, los almacenamientos conectados a redes de distribución, los tanques estacionarios de GLP utilizados en la prestación del servicio público domiciliario de GLP, los almacenamientos de plantas de aire propanado, y las instalaciones de entrega de GLP. No se aplica a los almacenamientos dentro de plantas de procesamiento de gas natural, refinerías, plantas petroquímicas e instalaciones similares.
Subject: Energy
Keyword: Energy conservation/energy production,Natural gas,Transport/storage,Internal trade,Environmental standards,Authorization/permit

Policy: Resolución Nº 40.248 - Reglamento técnico aplicable a los depósitos, expendios y puntos de venta de cilindros de Gas Licuado de Petroleo (GLP).
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución expide el reglamento técnico aplicable a los depósitos, expendios y puntos de venta de cilindros de Gas Licuado de Petroleo (GLP), que tiene por objeto establecer normas de carácter técnico para el desarrollo seguro de las actividades requeridas para el montaje, puesta en servicio y operación de los depósitos, expendios y puntos de venta de cilindros de GLP utilizados para la prestación del servicio público domiciliario de GLP. Las disposiciones son de obligatorio cumplimiento para todos los depósitos, expendios y puntos de venta de cilindros de GLP utilizados en la prestación del servicio público domiciliario de GLP en Colombia.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Resolución Nº 40.247 - Reglamento técnico para plantas de envasado de Gas Licuado de Petróleo (GLP).
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución expide el reglamento técnico para plantas de envasado de Gas Licuado de Petróleo (GLP), que tiene por objeto establecer normas de carácter técnico para el desarrollo seguro de las actividades de envasado de GLP en cilindros utilizados en la prestación del servicio público domiciliario y/o en el cargue de cisternas destinadas a servir tanques estacionarios. Las disposiciones son de obligatorio cumplimiento para todas las plantas de envasado de GLP. En las plantas de envasado de GLP se podrán realizar las actividades de envasado de cilindros marcados, operación de la planta de envasado y entrega del producto a granel a través de carrotanques y cisternas, cuando esta cuente con un certificado de conformidad expedido por un organismo de certificación acreditado ante el Organismo Nacional de Acreditación de Colombia (ONAC), conforme a lo establecido por el Subsistema Nacional de la Calidad (SNCA).

Policy: Resolución Nº 113 - Criterios y lineamientos generales de la Gestión Socio - Predial en los proyectos que requieran la adquisición de predios para la ejecución de obras de mitigación de riesgo o de adaptación al cambio climático a cargo del Fondo Adaptación.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución tiene por objeto establecer los criterios y lineamientos generales de la gestión socio-predial para todos aquellos proyectos a cargo del Fondo Adaptación que requieran la adquisición o afectación de predios para la ejecución de obras de mitigación de riesgo o de adaptación al cambio climático, según criterios y estándares internacionales, constitucionales y legales. Rige para aquellos proyectos financiados por el Fondo Adaptación tendientes a la atención de las afectaciones producidas por el Fenómeno de La Niña 2010 - 2011 y aquellas dirigidas a la ejecución de obras para lograr la reducción del riesgo y la adaptación al cambio climático, que conlleve para todos los casos la adquisición o afectación de predios.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Keyword: Climate change,Monitoring,Flood,Risk assessment/management,Special fund,Environmental security,Land tenure,Expropriation

Policy: Radiation Safety Act 2016 (No. 6 of 2016).
Policy_Content: The purposes of this Act are to: establish a framework to protect the health and safety of people and protect the environment from the harmful effects of ionising radiation; enable New Zealand to meet its international obligations relating to radiation protection, radiation safety and security, and nuclear non-proliferation, including (but not limited to) its obligations under the Convention on the Physical Protection of Nuclear Material done at New York and Vienna on 3 March 1980; the International Convention for the Suppression of Acts of Nuclear Terrorism done at New York on 14 September 2005; the Agreement between New Zealand and the International Atomic Energy Agency for the Application of Safeguards in Connection with the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons done at Vienna on 29 February 1972; and the Protocols to the agreement described in subparagraph (iii).
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force  on 7 March 2017. Section 98 enters into force on 8 March 2016.

Policy: Resolución Nº 003-DIRECTORIO-ARCH-2016 ─ Modifica el Reglamento para autorización de actividades de comercialización de gas licuado de petróleo (GLP) y el Reglamento para autorización de actividades de comercialización de derivados del petróleo o derivados del petróleo y sus mezclas con biocombustibles, excepto el gas licuado de petróleo (GLP).

Tout employeur de quelque nature qu'il soit et quel que soit son statut juridique, est soumis aux dispositions du présent décret. Policy: Infrastructure Planning (Onshore Wind Generating Stations) Order 2016 (S.I. No. 306 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Order amends the Planning Act 2008 to provide  that no onshore generating stations which generate electricity from wind are to be consented under the regime specified in the Act, unless a specific saving provided for in this Order applies to the particular application for “development consent” made under the Act.

Policy: Règlement grand-ducal modifiant le règlement grand-ducal modifié du 15 décembre 2011 relatif à la production, la rémunération et la commercialisation de biogaz.
Policy_Content: Le présent règlement modifie le règlement grand-ducal modifié du 15 décembre 2011 relatif à la production, la rémunération et la commercialisation de biogaz. Notamment, on modifie, entre autres, l’article 12, paragraphe 5, comme suit: “L’autorité de régulation peut préciser les modalités de calcul des paramètres référenciés sous les paragraphes 2 à 4. Le producteur de biogaz doit documenter régulièrement et au moins tous les trois ans le respect des paramètres référenciés sous les paragraphes 2 à 4.” Le texte comprend 4 articles.

Policy: Public Law No. 19-67.
Policy_Content: This Act amends Title 55 of the Code of the Federated States of Micronesia with respect to the Trust Fund of the FSM. It provides for restructuring of the Fund and divides the Fund into Account A and Account B. The purpose of the Account A and Account B portion of the Fund is to create a disciplined approach to ensure the protection of the Fund’s Real Value into perpetuity while providing a sustainable source to supplement the needs of the General Fund. All contributions to the Fund shall be deposited in Account A. Account B shall serve as a back-up account for Account A.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Micronesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Regional Law No. 3 “On regulation of some legal relations concerning environmental protection and ensuring environmental security.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates some issues of environmental protection and environmental security with a view of ensuring constitutional right of citizens to favorable environment.  Basic principles of environmental protection and environmental security shall be as follows: (a) conservation and rehabilitation of environment, rational management and reproduction of natural resources; (b) prevention of negative environmental impact of economic activities; (c) compensation of environmental damages; (d) conservation of biological diversity; (e) environmental monitoring; (f) introduction of ecofriendly processes and technologies; (g) waste prevention; and (h) formation and improvement of ecological education of the population.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Future Market Act 2016.
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 124 sections divided into eleven Parts, establishes all necessary requirements to perform any activity related to marketing, including licensing for authorized activities to be conducted with this purpose. Future market means any market, place, or any service or facility which, offers, promises or invite to sell, purchase or exchange futures contracts regularly made on a centralized basis, in the acceptance or making offers to sell, purchase or exchange futures contracts. No person shall establish, operate or assist in a future market except if in accordance with a future exchange licence granted by the Commission under section 5. The Act is divided as follows: Preliminary (Part I); Future Exchanges (Part II); Clearing Houses (Part III); Regulated activities (Part IV); Conduct of regulated activities (Part V); Accounts, Capital Requirements and Audit of Regulated Person (Part VI); Insider Trading (Part VII); Other Market Abuses (Part VIII); Supervision and Investigation (Part IX); Powers of Intervention by Commission in Relation to Licensed Persons (Part X); Discipline of Licensed Persons and Miscellaneous (Part XI).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Inspection,Internal trade,International trade,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Procedural matters

Policy: Regional Law No. 922-OZ “On the arrangements for the implementation of the Federal Law No. 488-FZ "On industrial policy".
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that Regional Government shall have the following competence in the sphere of industrial policy: (a) elaboration and realization of scientific research and innovation programs and projects including those executed by scientific research organizations financed by the regional budget; (b) promotion of inter-regional and international cooperation in the sphere of industry; and (c) establishment of the modalities of conclusion of special investment contracts. Policy: Succession (Scotland) Act 2016 (2016 asp 7).
Policy_Content: This Act provides rules concerning how property passes on a person‘s death. This includes reforms which relate to the rectification of wills; the effect of divorce, dissolution or annulment on a will or special destination; and the revival of a revoked will. It concerns, among other things,  survivorship, the provision of new rules where there is uncertainty about the order of death, forfeiture, estate administration, protections for trustees and executors in certain circumstances and for persons acquiring title in good faith.

Policy: Energy Efficiency Law (2016)
Policy_Content: The Law determines principles for energy efficiency in Latvia. Its purpose is rational use and management of the energy resources to promote sustainable development of the national economy and restrict climate changes. The Law prescribes energy efficiency planning and monitoring requirements; tasks of the ministry responsible for the achievement of the energy efficiency targets; action of the State and local governments for the achievement of the energy efficiency targets; tasks of the obligated party; requirements for energy auditing; efficiency conditions for energy production, transmission and distribution; measures for the development of the energy efficiency services market; and responsibility for the non-fulfilment of the requirements of this Law.
Subject: Energy
Keyword: Energy conservation/energy production,Sustainable development,Climate change,Policy/planning,Monitoring,Procedural matters,Local government,Inspection,Enforcement/compliance,Environmental audit,Liability/compensation

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 8 - Normativa para la emisión de certificados de origen y verificación de mercancías de exportación.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo expide la Normativa para la emisión de certificados de origen y verificación de mercancías de exportación. El certificado de origen constituye un documento físico o electrónico a ser presentado en la Aduana de destino, el mismo que estará basado en los formularios definidos en los acuerdos comerciales suscritos por el Ecuador o aquellos formatos determinados por los países que conceden preferencias arancelarias unilateralmente. Los certificados de origen preferenciales se regirán por las normas de origen de los Acuerdos o esquemas comerciales vigentes. Los certificados de origen no preferenciales se regulan conforme el Acuerdo de Normas de Origen de la OMC y su ámbito de aplicación comprende el tratamiento de la nación más favorecida, los derechos antidumping y compensatorios, las medidas de salvaguardia, las prescripciones en materia de marcas de origen, las compras del sector público, los cupos arancelarios y las restricciones y prohibiciones de importación. También se otorgarán por razones como: protección al consumidor, normas técnicas, sanitarias y fitosanitarias y los embargos comerciales.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Order No. 151 of the Minister of National Economy validating standard state service “Acquisition of rights to land pertaining to state ownership and not requiring holding of tenders (competitive tenders, auctions)".
Policy_Content: Standard state service “Acquisition of rights to land pertaining to state ownership and not requiring holding of tenders (competitive tenders, auctions)" shall be performed by local government in two steps: (a) determination of the possibility of use the requested land plot in compliance with the declared specific use, drafting a land plot selection act and issuance of the conclusion of the land commission; and (b) decision-making related to allotment of a plot of land for land tenure. The applicant must submit the following documentation: (a) application in accordance with the form contained in the Annex 1; (b) personal identification document; and (c) validated land management project.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Order enters into force 21 calendar days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Loi n°1/2 du 03 mars 2016 portant reforme de la fiscalité communale au Burundi.
Policy_Content: La présente loi régit la reforme de la fiscalité communale au Burundi communale au Burundi. Elle détermine les impôts, les taxes et contributions prélevées au profil du budget des communes. Les impôts, les taxes et contributions portent, entre autres, l’impôt sur le gros bétail; la vente de bétail; l’abattage; et le foncier.

Policy: Regulation on the certification of persons performing certain activities related to ozone depleting substances and certain fluorinated greenhouse gases.
Policy_Content: This Regulation prescribes the necessary conditions, minimum requirements and procedure for obtaining the certificate (A) for employees of legal entities and/or entrepreneurs who perform activities of installation, maintenance or servicing and checking the discharge of refrigeration and air conditioning equipment and heat pumps that contain or rely on ozone depleting substances or fluorinated greenhouse gases, including activities of collecting ozone depleting substances or fluorinated greenhouse gases from refrigeration and air conditioning equipment and heat pumps, as well as the exclusion from the use of such equipment and systems.

Policy: Planning (General Development Procedure) (Amendment) Order (Northern Ireland) 2016 (S.R. No. 115 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Order amends the Planning (General Development Procedure) Order (Northern Ireland) 2015 by substituting a new schedule 3 to take account of the restructuring of Government Departments as a consequence of the Departments Act 2016 and the Departments (Transfer of Functions) Order (Northern Ireland) 2016. This reflects the consequent revised roles and responsibilities of planning authorities and statutory consultees in the development management process of the planning system. Consultation also regards, among other things, water pollution

Policy: Waste Management Licensing (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015 (S.R. No. 95 of 2016).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend: the Waste Management Licensing Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003, the Waste and Contaminated Land (Northern Ireland) Order 1997, the Hazardous Waste Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2005, the Waste Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2011, the Pollution Prevention and Control (Industrial Emissions) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2013, the Marine Licensing (Exempted Activities) Order (Northern Ireland) 2011 and the Producer Responsibility Obligations (Packaging Waste) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2007, to bring into effect the changes introduced by Commission Directive (EU) 2015/1127 amending Annex II of Directive 2008/98/EC of the European Parliament and the Council on waste. The purpose of Directive 2015/1127 is to apply a climate correction factor to the R1 formula on the recovery of energy from waste.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Energy, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Planning (Hazardous Substances) (No.2) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2016 (S.I. No. 116 of 2016).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Planning (Hazardous Substances) (No.2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015 as a consequence of the commencement of the Departments (Transfer of Functions) Order (Northern Ireland) 2016. They provide that before determining an application for hazardous substance consent, the council must consult with the Department of Agriculture, Environment and Rural Affairs (previously the Department of the Environment) and that where an application is made by a council to the Department for hazardous substance consent, the Department for Infrastructure will have to consult with the Department of Agriculture, Environment and Rural Affairs.

Policy: Regional Law No. 10-Z “On organization of collection and shipping point for timber”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the modalities of organization and functioning of collection and shipping point for timber, and establishes the requirements for acceptance, registration and transportation of timber. Incoming, processing and shipping timber shall be subject to compulsory registration and shall be recorded in registration log. Each collection and shipping point must issue monthly declarations related to accepted, processed and shipped timber. At the moment of timber delivery to collection and shipping point for timber copies of the following documents must be submitted: (a) forest parcel lease contract; (b) forest declaration; and (c) timber inspection act.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Décret n°2016-0112 P-RM  2 mars 2016 fixant l’organisation et les modalités de fonctionnement de la Chambre des Mines du Mali.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe l’organisation et les modalités de fonctionnement de la Chambre des Mines du Mali. Les membres de la Chambre des Mines du Mali sont les sociétés minières en phase d’exploration, de recherche, de prospection et d’exploitation, les sous-traitants miniers et toutes personnes physiques ou morales se livrant habituellement à des activités minières et inscrites au registre de la Chambre des Mines. L’inscription au registre de la Chambre des Mines est subordonnée au paiement des frais d’enregistrement dont les montants sont fixés par Arrêté du Ministre chargé des Mines.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy_Content: El presente Resolución modifica la que tiene por objeto establecer los términos y condiciones para la determinación de los precios base de liquidación de regalías y compensaciones producto de la explotación de minerales no metálicos y minerales radioactivos, en relación a las clasificaciones internacionales de actividades económicas y productos, para lo cual se adoptará la Clasificación Industrial Internacional de todas las Actividades Económicas (CIIU) Revisión 4 homologada con la Clasificación Central de Productos (CPC) Revisión 2, adaptadas para Colombia.

Policy: Order No. 62 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on state nature reserve of federal significance “Remdovsky”.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that on state nature reserve of federal significance “Remdovsky” shall be classified as biological (zoological) protected area constituted for an indefinite time period. Nature reserve shall be located in the Pskov region. It shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of natural complexes (landscapes); (b) conservation, restoration and reproduction of wild fauna; (c) conservation and protection of natural habitats and migration routes of wild fauna species; (d) scientific research; (e) performance of ecological monitoring; and (f) ecological education and cognitive tourism. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature reserve: (a) commercial, coastal artisanal and sport fishing and industrial fisheries (except for specially authorized areas); (b) commercial, artisanal and sport hunting; (c) exploration of subsoil and mining; (d) collection of bird eggs and down; (e) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, including hunting firearms and hunting gear;  (f) stay with dogs, except for service dogs, keeping unleashed dogs outside the cages or other structures that limit the zone of their movement, and training of dogs; (g) disturbance of wild fauna species; (h) allotment of land parcels for horticulture and smallholding; (i) construction of main roads, pipelines, power transmission lines and other communications, as well as construction and operation of economic and residential facilities, except for tourism industry facilities, museums and information centers, facilities related to the functioning of the nature reserve; (j) timber extraction (except for timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs in specially allotted areas); (k) procurement of soft resin; (l) procurement of edible non-timber forest resources (with the exception of procurement by citizens of such resources for their own personal needs; (m) clear cutting of forest species and shrubbery, with the exception of sanitary felling, felling associated with extinguishing forest fires, including the creation of fire breaks, and felling associated with the construction, reconstruction and operation of line facilities carried out in accordance with this Regulation; (n) blasting operations (except for operations related to prevention of natural disasters and mitigation of the consequences thereof); (o) burning of vegetation (with the exception of fire-fighting measures; (p) waste disposal of domestic and non-domestic waste, radioactive waste, chemical, explosive, toxic, poisonous and hazardous substances; (q) washing vehicles on the banks of waterbodies; (r) movement and parking of motorized vehicles outside public roads and specially designated places (except for cases related to the functioning of the nature reserve); (s) application of chemicals, mineral fertilizers, plant protection means and nutrients; (t)  destruction and damage of posts, barriers, stands, boundary poles and other information signs, developed ecological paths and recreation areas, buildings on the territory of the national park, as well as property of the nature reserve, inscriptions and signs on boulders, outcrops and historical and cultural objects; (u) ploughing up of the territory (except for forest fire fighting purposes); (v) application of chemicals, mineral fertilizers, plant protection means and nutrients; (w) passage and parking of vessels and other floating facilities outside the waterways of general use and specially designated places for this (except for cases related to the  functioning of the nature reserve); (x) haymaking outside specially designated areas; and (z) grazing and passage of cattle outside specially designated areas.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Protection of habitats,Monitoring,Research,Education,Tourism,Management/conservation,Wild fauna,Migratory species
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

(f) timber extraction (except for timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs in specially allotted areas); (g) procurement of soft resin; (h) procurement of edible non-timber forest resources (with the exception of procurement by citizens of such resources for their own personal needs); (i) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, including hunting firearms and hunting gear; (j) blasting operations (except for operations related to prevention of natural disasters and mitigation of the consequences thereof); (k) burning of vegetation (with the exception of fire-fighting measures; (l) waste disposal of domestic and non-domestic waste, radioactive waste, chemical, explosive, toxic, poisonous and hazardous substances; (m) washing vehicles on the banks of waterbodies; (n) movement and parking of motorized vehicles outside public roads and specially designated places (except for cases related to the functioning of the nature reserve); (o) destruction and damage of posts, barriers, stands, boundary poles and other information signs, developed ecological paths and recreation areas, buildings on the territory of the national park, as well as property of the nature reserve, inscriptions and signs on boulders, outcrops and historical and cultural objects; (p) ploughing up of the territory (except for forest fire fighting purposes); (r) application of chemicals, mineral fertilizers, plant protection means and nutrients; (s) stay with dogs, except for service dogs, keeping unleashed dogs outside the cages or other structures that limit the zone of their movement, and training of dogs;  and (t) disturbance of wild fauna species.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Loi n° 91-14 relative au commerce extérieur.
Policy_Content: La présente loi fixe le régime général du commerce extérieur ainsi que les conditions dans lesquelles les opérations d'importation et d'exportation sont réalisées dans le respect des engagements internationaux du Royaume du Maroc Elle fixe, également, les mesures de protection de la production nationale. A cet effet, elle prévoit le cadre général des importations et des exportations des marchandises et des services; les formalités des opérations d'importation et d'exportation; les mécanismes de protection de la production nationale (Dispositions relatives à la protection de la production nationale, et Mesures particulières aux produits agricoles); les règles des négociations commerciales internationales. Elle prévoit aussi les formalités du commerce extérieur (Registre des importateurs et des exportateurs, documents d'importation et d'exportation, et gestion des contingents tarifaires).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, North Atlantic, Northern Africa

Policy: Renewable Heat Incentive Scheme and Domestic Renewable Heat Incentive Scheme (Amendment) Regulations 2016 (S.I. No. 257 of 2016).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Renewable Heat Incentive Scheme Regulations 2011 with respect to, among other things: addition of definitions of “consumer prices index” and “environmental quality assurance scheme”; tariff calculations; a sustainability audit report in case of use of only sustainable biogas or sustainable solid biomass; references to the Renewables Obligation Order 2015. The Domestic Renewable Heat Incentive Scheme Regulations 2014 are amended with respect to tariff calculations, calculation of any grant funding deduction, and other funding requirements.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Energy
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Pollution control,Renewable energy,Subsidy/incentive,Ecofriendly products/ecofriendly processes,Bioenergy,Biofuel

Policy: Acuerdo por el que se delegan a los Jefes de la Unidad de Gestión Industrial y la Unidad de Supervisión, Inspección y Vigilancia Industrial de la Agencia Nacional de Seguridad Industrial y de Protección al Medio Ambiente del Sector Hidrocarburos, las facultades y atribuciones que se indican.
Policy_Content: Por el presente Acuerdo se delegan determinadas funciones relacionadas con la protección del medio ambiente en el sector de los hidrocarburos. La Agencia Nacional de Seguridad Industrial y de Protección al Medio Ambiente del Sector Hidrocarburos funcionará como órgano administrativo desconcentrado de la Secretaría del ramo en materia de Medio Ambiente, con las atribuciones necesarias para regular y supervisar, en materia de seguridad industrial, operativa y protección al medio ambiente, las instalaciones y actividades del sector hidrocarburos, incluyendo las actividades de desmantelamiento y abandono de instalaciones, así como el control integral de residuos.
Subject: Environment gen., Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy: Agricultural Advisory Panel for Wales (Establishment) Order 2016 (W.S.I. No.  255 (W. 89) of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the Agricultural Advisory Panel for Wales. The Panel is an independent advisory body to the Welsh Ministers and its functions are to promote careers in agriculture, to prepare agricultural wages orders in draft, consult on such orders and submit them to the Welsh Ministers and to advise the Welsh Ministers on such other matters relating to the agricultural sector in Wales. The Order also creates a duty on the Panel to establish a permanent “Skills, Development and Training Subcommittee” to advise the Panel, amongst other things, on skills development, training and career progression opportunities for agricultural workers and any other related matters.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Decree-Law No. 14/2016 approving the Regulation on the preparation and implementation process of the Plans for the Management of Coastal Zones and the Adjacent Sea (POOC_M).
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 7 Chapters and three Annexes, regulates the preparation and implementation process of the Plans for the Management of Coastal Zones and the Adjacent Sea (POOC_M). This Plans are territorial management tools containing a set of actions for the coastal zone management, which interventions are planned for the terrestrial areas, referred as 'onshore', and areas called as 'adjacent sea areas'. In addition, it specifies their territorial areas, boundaries, area of interventions and management regime, including special areas and other classification of zones, such as: Special Tourism zones, Risk Areas and Protected Areas Conservation of Nature and Biodiversity Areas, etc. Annexes list planning principles to be observed for settlement, use and transformation of the onshore coastal areas; studies for onshore coastal areas and adjacent sea areas plans; necessary material and documents for POOC_M and their preparation process, models, offences and penalties.
Subject: Land & soil, Sea, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Land-use planning,Environmental planning,Public land,Right of use,Protected area,Coastal zone management,Marine protected areas,Marine area
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Atlantic Ocean Islands, North Atlantic, Sahel, Small Island Developing States, Western Africa
Entry into force notes: This Decree-Law enters into force 60 days after its publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 3/2016-OZ “On some issues related to organization of public control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the modalities of organization and performance of public control as a form of public participation. It shall not be applicable to elections and referendum. Regional executive bodies shall have the following plenary powers: (a) formation of advisory councils at the regional executive bodies; (b) examination of final documents drafted by public control bodies; and (c) consideration of proposals, recommendations and conclusions contained in the final documents. Public control shall be performed by the Public (Civic) Chambers, advisory councils at the regional executive bodies and local government, public inspections and public control groups. Public control can initiate public hearings, obtain results of inspections performed by regional and municipal executive bodies and participate at joint supervisory (control) arrangements.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Land & soil, Water
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force ten days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 86-P “On the modalities of performance of municipal land control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes the modalities of performance of municipal land control by local government. Municipal land control shall be conducted in the form of ordinary and extraordinary inspections of legal persons and individual entrepreneurs. The subject of inspection shall be checking data and information contained in the documentation related to land tenure, to ensure availability and conservation of landmarks. The scope of inspection shall be to control compliance by land tenant with compulsory legislative requirements related to land tenure with a view of prevention and suppression of unauthorized transactions with land. Municipal land control shall be performed in accordance with the annual plans. The outcome of municipal land control shall be legalized in the form of inspection certificate. In case of improper execution of duties during performance of municipal land control public official shall be liable to prosecution in accordance with acting legislation of the Russian Federation.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Decree enters into force ten days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Resolución Nº 042-2016-OS ─ Condiciones de Seguridad de Criticidad Alta en Grifos y Estaciones de Servicio de combustibles líquidos.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba el Listado de condiciones inseguras de criticidad alta en grifos y estaciones de servicio de combustibles líquidos que ameritarán la aplicación inmediata de medidas de seguridad de cierre total o parcial del establecimiento. La Medida de Seguridad de Cierre Total del Establecimiento implicará la suspensión de la inscripción en el Registro de Hidrocarburos y la Medida de Seguridad de Cierre Parcial del Establecimiento implicará la suspensión de uso de la parte de la instalación afectada.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Regional Law No. 58 “On metropolitan agglomerations”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the issues of sustainable development of the regional territory with a view of improvement of life quality of the population and sets forth the basis for organization and promotion of agglomerations. Agglomeration shall be intended urban land united for improvement of recreational and other ties for the purpose of creation of qualitative living space. State bodies shall elaborate and put into practice strategies for socio-economic development of agglomerations aimed at complex development of the territory and promotion of tourism.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 513 “On protected areas”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of constitution, protection and management of regional protected areas with a view of conservation of unique and typical ecosystems, wild fauna and wild flora species, genetic fund thereof, study of natural processes in the biosphere and control over changes thereof, and ecological education of the population. Protected areas shall be classified as regional and local, distributed in the following categories: (a) regional – natural parks; state nature reserves; nature monuments; dendrological parks and botanical gardens; wetlands; and aisles/wayside trees; and (b) urban parks and recreational areas. Regional and local protected areas shall be subject to zoning.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Resolución Nº 108 - Guía Procedimental y de Parámetros Técnicos para la determinación de Bienes Equivalentes y cálculo de la Unidad Agrícola Familiar Predial, para materializar las órdenes judiciales proferidas a los segundos ocupantes.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución adopta la Guía Procedimental y de Parámetros Técnicos para la determinación de Bienes Equivalentes y cálculo de la Unidad Agrícola Familiar Predial, para materializar las órdenes judiciales proferidas a los segundos ocupantes. La Guía tiene como objeto definir y desarrollar la metodología y procedimientos para establecer la equivalencia medioambiental, socioproductiva y económica de la que trata el Acuerdo Nº 21 de 2015, tomando como referencia los atributos componentes naturales (medioambientales), productivos y sociales (socioproductivos) y económicos (valor del avalúo) que poseen los predios objeto de atención a segundos ocupantes.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Institution,Land tenure,Ownership,Land valuation,Dispute settlement,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Expropriation
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Cabinet Regulation No. 131 of 2016 on Industrial Accident Risk Assessment Procedures and Risk Reduction Measures
Policy_Content: The Regulation prescribes the procedures for the risk assessment of industrial accidents related to dangerous chemical substances and dangerous mixtures and risk reduction measures, also substances and mixtures (depending on the quantity and degree of hazard thereof) to which such procedures and measures apply. It further lays down, among others, general requirements for preparation, submission and examination of industrial accident prevention documentation; procedures for the submission and assessment of industrial accident prevention programme and safety report; procedures for adjustment and supplementation of industrial accident prevention programme and safety report; procedures for development, submission, assessment and adjustment of civil protection plan of the establishment; procedures for development and adjustment of civil protection plan of the off-establishment; assessment of domino effect and requirements for establishments that may cause domino effect or be affected by such effect; requirements for determination of safety distances and territory use restrictions around establishments; availability of information and informing of the public regarding safety and precaution measures; and action and measures in the case of an industrial accident or threats thereof and after the industrial accident.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Cabinet Regulation No. 133 of 2016 on Marine Diving in Restricted Areas
Policy_Content: The Regulation prescribes the provisions for issuing a diving permit; the procedures for the issuance, refusal and cancellation of a permit for diving in a restricted area; the procedures for maintaining the register of issued permits; terms and conditions for using the issued permits; the amount and procedures for paying the State fee for the issuance of a permit for diving at ship wreck or sunken objects sites that are or may be hazardous to marine environment or cultural and historical values. According to the document, a natural person is entitled to dive in a restricted area other than bordering on the sea coastline, from a duly registered watercraft that is equipped with an automatic identification system.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea
Keyword: Marine pollution,Marine protected areas,Authorization/permit,Public health,Royalties/fees,Hazardous waste,Marine area
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe
